Ratings.comment: Great teacher, super enthusiastic.
Super nice guy! Very easy to talk to and makes sure you do as well as you can.

Worst professor I have ever had in college. Not only is she extremely rude, but she makes what should be an easy GE class miserable and way harder than it needs to be and she treats it like a high school class. Do not take any class with her.

She does not teach the class anything, and she only thinks about her opinion. You have weekly insights every week about the class and its almost impossible to get anything above a 44/50 on them. She will not tell you what you did wrong and you have to figure it out yourself. Horrible teacher.

Susan is very straightforward with her expectations of the class. If you take this class, make sure you like reading novels. Other than that, it is very easy. Attendance is your whole grade so make sure you go to class. If you attend and don't show up late, expect a good grade. If you fail to do so, you will end up on her bad side and not do well.

This class has no tests/quizzes. It is very easy to get an A if you learn what she likes. Make sure to show up to class and turn in all assignments and she will like you. Most of the time you are in a group talking the entire period but we left early almost all the time and she gave random days off. She was nice if she liked you.

A lot of students do not like this professor, but for her to respect you, respect her... go to class and be on time!! Her expectations are very reasonable and she even rewards the class by giving random days off and extra credit. There are no quizzes or tests, I loved her sense of humor, and ended with a high A. Literally show up and you're fine!
Very condescending and rude. If you get on her bad side, she will consistently go out of her way to embarrass you in front of the class. Gives horrible feedback as well.
Openly rude to students

Professor Hanson really encouraged group discussion, to the point where we were left to our discussion groups for the entire 80-minute class period. This was incredibly boring but easy. I liked Professor Hanson, but she's pretty particular, so do not get on her bad side! Turn in your assignments on time and go to class! It's an easy A.

This is a literature class, so be ready to read. It is nothing crazy, but reading and insights each week. Front-loaded class with easier work at the end. No exams, quizzes, or essays. She is not compassionate about when u miss/skip class (short passage aggressive email back). Class is well developed and you learn a lot about yourself as a reader.

Susan Hanson is a fair teacher. Don't skip this class. Notes aren't mandatory, but they help. You will spend a significant amount of time discussing assignments and watching material for assignments, so take lots of notes. I only spent about 1-3 hrs a week on assignments because of my notes. Heads up, the material is a little boring.

Professor Hanson is kind of a tough grader, you just have to understand what the assignment is asking. Class did not have any exams. Lots of small writing assignments, but as long as you do you your work you will get a good grade. Not textbook but there are required books that you have to read

Mrs. Hanson was a pretty good professor who you could tell really cared about students but at the same time has high expectations for students. The class is seminar style which means there are not tests or anything just weekly short papers. I really enjoyed it

She expects a lot but does not teach a lot so the trade-off is bad. She likes when you ask questions and involves yourself in the class. She will grade harshly but if you ask to re-do an assignment, she lets you.

I found that she was extremely rude, if somebody offered an answer that was not exactly her opinion, she would very publicly embarrass and invalidate them. With papers, I felt like nothing I wrote was ever good enough and she graded with overly harsh comments. She also made a lot of insensitive and tone deaf comments to people. Avoid at all costs!!

There is a lot of mixed reviews about this class. Personally, I am not a huge fan of reading so this class was difficult for me BUT I loved everything we read. It is super interesting material. She is a tough grader but she is patient in the beginning and lets you know what she wants. You need effort in this class, its worth it. But not an easy A.

She assigned us books to read and then a paper to write about it. I wrote specific examples from the books all semester and she claimed I never read a book. For the last paper I wrote two pages full of work and examples from the text. She graded it so I didnt pass the class and claimed I didnt read. She said blackface in first day of class.

Professor Hanson is very rude and inconsiderate. She does not care about opinion, and if you state yours and she does not agree, you are WRONG and she will tell you (and the entire class). Hanson is also very inconsistent, she makes mistakes about assignments and does not reward students for doing the work she incorrectly assigns. DoNotTakeClass!!!

I see a lot of bad reviews but for my class, she was very patient. She graded leniently in the first half of the class so we could get a feel for the writing before really grading. She showed genuine interest in us understanding the course content and taught with enthusiasm.

Hanson is inconsistent. Course was focused on week long lessons/assignments that would hardly be discussed. The course format was changed several times with little reason. If you provide insights that are not the exact ones she is looking for, you will get a bad grade. She will leave rude comments on your work. Do not take her courses.

Her instructions are awful, not clear at all. She gets mad if you ask specific questions. You have to go to class, it is where she gives help and sometimes answers to work. Bunch of work every week, but only one essay for the final, no tests or quizzes though which is nice.

She was honestly my least favorite professor that I've had. She was rude to students and often would argue with them about their opinions during class. I spent the most time on this class than I did for any other class. I definitely would not recommend it for a GE class at all.

She can be very condescending when talking to students & sometimes treats us as if we know nothing. This course requires so much reading & a lot of the time her instructions aren't very clear. She encourages participation but doesn't really make it a comfortable environment. Class can drag on, but it fulfills 2 GE requirements so it's not the worst

She is ridiculously unapproachable and rude. The class is completely unrelated to humanities and is a waste of time. She is extremely unclear in her directions and if you ask questions she treats you like you are an idiot. The worst prof i've had and the worst class. If you need a lit credit DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. It is not an easy A.

The class itself is very interesting if you like to read and actually do what is assigned. There are a lot of readings and discussion posts due for the week but it's not that hard. It's obvious that she cares about her students and jus want to watch them improve throughout the semester, but if you're not putting in effort she will call you out.

there are so many readings each week and she also changed her strategies for doing discussion so frequently and not very clearly. The workload makes you wonder if the class is just a GE class. Not recommended! My roommate is taking the class as well but with a different professor and she said their professor as way less workload.

This teacher is difficult as well as rude. She will call you out in front of the class and make you feel humiliated. Although work is not terribly hard, she makes you feel dumb if your answer is not completely correct. She gives a lot of work, over 50 pages of reading a week plus two elongated discussion post. Do not take her if at all possible.

The class was very reading and homework heavy but that is expected with a literature GE. Do the readings, put effort into the homework, participate in the class and you will get an A. There are no midterms, exams, finals, or "essays". There are a few books you have to buy and read over the semester but they are actually quite interesting

Susan is kind of closed-minded but besides that her class is whatever. a lot of homework and I don't recommend the class as a GE if you have other hard classes. But if you show up to class and do homework you will get an A. You also get to talk and stuff the whole time so it's not really boring at all. She is an easy grader and no midterms.

Take a different GE if you can. Very reading and writing heavy. Assignments not explained well. Prof is a pretty easy grader. She can be funny but often it's a dig at students (get ready for public humiliation when you're on your phone or you're visibly tired!).

awful professor. If you don't agree with her, you won't pass. She claims that everyone's opinions are different and that everyone reads the material different but if you dont read it like she does, she'll say you're wrong. Nothing is good enough for her. She thinks her class is more important than major classes. Just save yourself and don't take it

Hardest class hands down I have taken at Ohio State, and I am in engineering. More homework than any other class I've ever taken, made 1172 look like a cake walk. If you are looking for an easy GE, look somewhere else. And if you are a freshman reading this and are enrolled, drop for your own sake. Don't end up like me.

Great professor, very insightful . Please actually think outside the box, you wont get away with cliche surface level work . Phenomenal reading material, extremely interesting ,thought provoking . Way too much hw for GE . Don't take this with 18 credit hours, you'll hate it, however if learning is your top goal, this class is one of the best for it

Lots and lots and lots of reading - but it's a lit ge class so that makes sense. Overall an amazing class. Make sure you speak up at least once per week. Do the homework and you'll get an A. Also the final paper isn't really that hard. No midterms.

I am not a fan of disrespectful professors. It's alright to have a differing opinion from your students but to publically humiliate or to denounce a student for interpreting universal concepts different from you is horrible. The one thing I will give her is she is very organized; everything is on Carmen. She is blunt and can be funny at times.

It's Susan Hanson's way or no way at all, really. However, as long as you at least attempt the work you'll probably get a good grade. It also helps if you participate and she likes/agrees with you. The units are pretty well organized but it does feel repetitive at times. I'm sure there is an easier GE out there if you have the option.

She was very disrespectful towards everyone else's opinions and didn't agree with anyone else. It was her way for everything and that was it. She also was horrible at explaining what she wanted for each assignment which made it even more frustrating when we got yelled at for doing something wrong.

I had her for her film and literature class. She was very nice but she called kids out a lot if they didnt participate. If you would speak up, a lot of the time she wouldnt agree with you and would say stuff like, well no... The class was easy and the work load was light. Beginning of the semester was super boring but the films got better later

The absolute worst. She only wants to hear her own opinion repeated the entire class. Very unclear in what her expectations are and very quick to take off points. Terrible person and an even worse professor. Avoid her at all costs

Susan is an amazing professor, very knowledgeable and pretty open with new stuff. As a international student as well as a freshman, the work load is heavy but not too bad. As long as she could see your efforts, you are going to be fine. It is usually a reading for every class and a reflection 300-800 words accompanying it. So get ready to read!

From day one I knew class with Professor Hanson was going to be interesting. While she can be harsh at times I believe she genuinely wants each student to succeed. The key to this class is to follow the instructions she gives as closely as possible and to participate in class! She is definitely blunt but overall a good professor.

I absolutely loved her war class. Only one exam, heavy on completion homework but if you do your work and show up to talk you'll do fine. Super funny and knowledgeable about her subject. Incredibly interesting material to go with everything else.
I disagree with the other reviews. She's so sweet and very funny, like a little southern grandma. It's barely any work you just have to show up and participate to get a good grade.

DO NOT TAKE "EXPERIENCE OF WAR" WITH SUSAN HANSON. Absolute nightmare being in her class. Very unfair, doesn't care about your opinion, judgmental. I did more work for her GE class than my actual major classes. She thinks her class is more important than any other class you have. You have homework and readings EVERY night. AVOID HER AND HER CLASS.

Susan's class requires a reading and journal written for EVERY class period. She thinks her class is the most important thing on the planet. The class is a 'discussion' class when it really is her way or the highway. This makes the class very tough to sit through when she is constantly asking for opinions and  then telling you that you're wrong.

Horribly unstructured. If you don't come up with what she is thinking you are completely wrong. she says she is "fair," completely untrue. do not recommend this class to anyone, extremely facetious. Least favorite teacher

I have taken professor Hanson's literature course "Experience of War". It is one of the most though provoking classes I have taken. The material was exceedingly interesting. It is unfortunate that such a class is taught by a professor who offers a bare minimum of guidance, poor feedback, and is not successful in clear communication with students.

Mrs. Hanson is an excellent professor.  Her class is easy if you show up everyday, participate a little and do all the readings.  You will get an A on every exam if you read. For all of her papers if you get a bad grade she allows you to come into her office and she will tell you exactly what you did wrong and then allows you to resubmit the paper.

A good professor and pretty clear on expectations. There are no tests other than the final, but be prepared to do a significant amount of homework and reading for each class. Participation matters a lot, and if you are shy about sharing opinions this is not a class for you. Cares about students and if you enjoy learning about war take this class!

The content is interesting, but this is not a professor you want if you're shy about sharing opinions in class. She  can be very aggressive about disagreeing with students (even when she asks for your own take on a text) and isn't shy about her personal opinions of students. I really enjoy the readings and the content, but dread the actual class.

Obviously this is a lit class, so be prepared to read a lot.  The material is very interesting.  As long as you read the assignments when you are supposed to read them, you should be fine.  The reports are pretty difficult to get the hang of.

Susan Hanson's class is very interesting and well organized. Assignments consist mostly of readings. However, there is an occasional paper. Susan's expectations are that you have completed the reading for class and expects participation. I would highly suggest you go to a couple of her office hours because they are extremely helpful.

Mrs. Hanson is honestly an extraordinary professor. In times of conflict she is willing to sympathize and understand and offer a fair solution. She is extremely passionate in what she reached and what she wants her students to understand. If you are willing to do the work you will be fine. You get out what you put in.
She was an awesome professor, but you need to do the work. If you read and give your best effort you will be fine!
Class is easy if you attend class and read the material! She's a tough but fair grader. Be prepared to participate if you want to do well. I really enjoyed the material, glad I took her class!

The texts and topics covered in the class a really interesting. Susan brings a lot of experience and insight about the topic to class and the discussions are really engaging and helpful. Go to office hours so she can get to know you and participate in class. She can be a bit of a difficult grader, but she lets you make up some of the papers.

Really interesting woman. The best way to do well in this class is connect with her, go meet with her once at her office and the 3-1 page papers required will be a breeze. Just go to class and smile and act like you read the reading and you'll do fine.

Susan does a great job of covering a wide variety of material and keeping the class interesting. You really have to read and do the work if you want an A. If you have questions she is more than willing to help you out during office hours (which I highly recommend!) Overall great course and great person!

Participation is very important. Prof. Hanson will help you if you are struggling, go to her office hours and ask questions. She can be unclear at the beginning, so if you don't understand something ask her. But beware, if you ask/say something stupid she will call you out on it
Great teacher.  If you want a good grade do two things do the readings and go to class.

Is incredibly unclear about assignments, and it seems that your grade on papers directly correlates to the amount of time you spend with her out of class. I didn't learn a single thing all year, she doesn't teach.

Susan is a great professor and person. The class itself was very interesting and gave a different view on war and it's effect on those who experience it. The 3, 1 page papers are strait forward and easy.The exams are somewhat difficult but an A is easily manageable if you read everything and go to class. I got an A with minimal effort.

She really respects you if you have or had some connection to the military, but if not, GOOD LUCK. You learn a lot about war. She is funny and likes to gossip & talk about tv, but is a TOUGH grader. She knows if you're full of crap. You read a new book each week. Easy reads.

the books we read were mostly interesting and Susan is a very funny lady, but she is also very rude.  She has no qualms about calling people out or of eluding to peoples lack of intelligence. Tough grader, loves gossip, and slightly full of herself

took her spring 08. this lady was awful.tests consisted of knowing specific quotes from long and boring stories. too much reading & none of it is interesting. problem is she is the best cs 100 prof. otherwise i'd say avoid her like the plague. i wanted to punch her in the face when she screwed up my final grade and wouldn't change it. shes retarded

really entertaining and easy going. class was enjoyable, but the only criticism is she came off like a very easy going teacher but the assignments were graded somewhat hard. harder than expected at least. i got a b+ without reading much but from being in the class you would expect it to be an easy a

Great teacher.  She knew we were all there for the GEC credit and structured the class accordingly.  Very easy to understand in terms of what she was looking for from her students and very easy going.  Also, a very fair grader.

Professor Hanson was a wonderful teacher. She made learning fun and I looked forward to going to her class. She was very humorous and we always had a good laugh. I would definitely take her again if I could.
I hated this class. Susan was very unclear about unassignments but allowed revisions on all of our papers, so it wasn't hard to get a decent grade.

She was fun to be in class with and almost always let us leave early, but very confusing when it came to assignments. Make sure you ask a million questions! Also, come to class prepared. It means you'll discuss what you need, and then you can leave!
not very clear about assignments

Professor Hanson cracks me up.  She's got a great sense of humor and makes class enjoyable.   She takes care of what we need to cover in class and we leave--we don't have to stay the whole time.  She will really help you write better.
She was a really good teacher and really challenged the class.  If you dont pay attention you will be lost and take advantage of 1 on 1 time.  She grades tough but lets you write revisions.
awesome english teacher, 367.05 is a great 2nd writing class.... if you suck at writing she'll help
Great teacher! She was wonderful. She was very helpful and wanted you to understand why things were. One of the best English professors I have had.

your not going to know whats going on in this class or even what youve learned when its all said and done. ask lots of questions and be clear on whats being asked of you. the good news is you are able to revise.
SHE SLAYS!!! amazing teacher, enjoyed her class so much!

Mollie is extremely kind and truly cares for her students!!! Assignments are not difficult and are fun ways to interact with the text and hear what classmates have to say about what you're reading. She responds quickly and is always willing to help you if you need it.

Natalie Tyler is an awesome Professor. She has high expectations but gives students room for error meaning the best of teaching style: space to learn & grow from one's own mistakes. I felt entirely welcome and a part of the class because of her personality. She also is an expert of Jane Austen and has true passion for the subject matter.

It's pretty easy to get a good grade. There are hardly any quizzes, just a few papers. At times she can get very critical on papers. Don't use generic words like "this". There is no final either. Classes were boring. Lots of regurgitation of information. Participation counts, she keeps tallies.

Dr. Tyler was very nice and understanding. Anytime someone speaks up in class she agrees with anything they say. The only issue I have with her is that sometimes during our presentations she would keep interjecting her own opinions. Other than that she is a great teacher who gives good feedback and is nice. This class is really easy to get an A in.

Dr. Tyler was very dry and very boring. She also taught her opinion as fact on some occasions. I would not suggest this course to anyone. I love reading and writing, but this classed bored me because of the way she presented it. Almost laughingly easy to receive an A. No final exam, or midterm for that matter.

Honestly not as bad as everyone made her out to be. She droned on and on about unrelated topics and flat out insulted some classic writers, but if you know a thing or two about poetry and can sit through boring lectures, you're headed for an easy A.

This was my first genuinely bad experience with a professor. She is incredibly critical with papers, and not in a good way. She generally doesn't handle problems well and thinks lowly of students who make even a simple mistake.

Hands down the worst class I have ever taken in my life, high school included.  I would rather chew nails that take another class from this horror of a human being.  I can't even express how much people should NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!  I am not only dumber because of her class, but feel that i have been robbed of two months of my life.

I took the class back in 2007 and she was and still is the worst professor to date. Took Intro to Poetry with her and everything about her screamed old lady with a thousand cats. She actually called me "stupid" for after emailing her about my paper. I reported her to the Dean of Faculty.

I am willing to bet that Natalie herself wrote the "positive" comments on 4/26/04, 8/23/07 and 11/21/07 maybe others. What a mean lady. If you enjoy sucking up you'll do fine. Took a great writer (Jane Austen) and reduced it to sexual innuendos and carriages. Don't bring up modern feminist theory or differ from popular critical opinion. Skip it.

Natalie is a strange one. The class was definitely easy if you show up, do your work, and SPEAK UP. She flipped out about people deeming the final exam exemption unfair. So plan on taking the final from now on. Overall, I thought that she was very fair and easy yet not the most exciting person you'll ever meet. I would take her class again.

Natalie is a very nice professor. She will gladly help you in any way possible. She loves to speak with the students one on one or email. Likes intellectual comments in class. Participation is a must. Easy to work with and I would gladly take any of her classes anytime. I saw absolutely no preference to gender.
never take a class with this woman. she is horrible and worthless.

About to graduate and she is still the WORST professor I ever had at OSU Is the only prof to ever make me cry over her criticism--was not constructive AT ALL it was just flat out mean! and she told me to change my major to get out of eng-Outdated syllabus, unfair grading and no guidelines for papers! The thought of her still teaching makes me sick!
really enjoyed this class. Easy assignments. Dr. Tyler was really nice and willing to give constructive feedback.
No Comments

Stay on her good side or you are doomed. Boring, pretentious, mean. Who knows how she determines her grades? Condescending. Contradicts herself. Doesn't engage the class. She eats up male attention. Her discussions are not coherent. She doesnt teach. I feel stupider from taking her class. She patronizes and puts down for fun. DONOTTAKEHERCLASS!!!!!
Very helpful with writing; many comments.  If you are interested you will probably get a good grade.  Go to her office hours and she will help you with paper topics and ideas.

I entered the course with extreme interest (English major, WS minor) and left early out since I could not stand this woman.  Not only did she seem completely incoherent, consistent busy work was the "core" of the class.  She was also very hypocritical; her own power trip culminated in the second day of class, claiming no students who were late coul

A complete waste of time.  I don't think I learned anything except how to sleep with my eyes open.  Has no idea how to initiate discussions and I swore she had the ability to stop time during her class.  She will tell you that she will not ask obscure questions on the exams, but she totally does.

This teacher doesn't have a clue what she's talking about. She's so far behind on our syllabus she had to adjust it and take out a book that we have all already bought. She says she's trying to save us money by giving us a coursepack, but wastes our money by not using a book we've bought.  What a jerk.

i strongly believe this prof. comes to class everyday completely stoned.  her lectures consists of disconnected, fragmented thoughts.  she typically agrees with almost everyone in her class even if their statements are the opposite of what she just said.  i've also seen her take joy in berating students in class.
Dull and pretentious but an easy A.  I wouldn't take an "important" (i.e. writing) class from her, but poetry was tolerable enough.

Awful. This teacher really enjoys treating adults like they are five. She prides herself on her infinite "knowledge" but really she teaches the exact same thing to every class. If she likes you, you'll get good grades, but you mess up once and you'll fail. She also loves to degrade you in front of the class. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS SHE IS TERRIBLE!

Can't sustain a thought very long. Unable to work VCR or use a telephone. Will treat you like you're five years old as a group. However, if you can suit your writing style to her personal tastes (don't worry about academic standards) you'll get an A.
Take her class, easy A. If you go to class and pay attention to what she says about the readings, she is giving you every answer to the midterms.  Papers are easy.

This class was supposed to be about analyzing literature, which we did, but I think it especially helped my writing skills. She's a tough grader but definitely fair and she tells you exactly what she's looking for in the syllabus. Great for developing future writing skills.

do not take this woman even if your life depends on it.  is incapable of giving constructive criticism, help of any kind, or holding a thought for longer than 30 seconds.  she seems to almost get excited about failing people and looks for reasons to do so.
Horrible Woman!
Just go to class, write the papers and you'll get an A.  Guaranteed.
No Comments

Oh. My. God. Sitting through this class can be painful. In my class, she turned everything into a sexual reference, and it was disturbing. The upside is that she grades easily and the papers are a breeze. Take it only if you can turn your brain off for about an hour.

Without a syllabus, guidelines for the class were unclear, and very few people paid attention.  Several people had problems with grades because she "lost" or "forgot" assignments.  Overall it was pretty boring.
good stuff. easy class, great teacher.
Fantastic prof and very flexible.  Understanding and helpful.  Sometimes overanalyzes the poetry but she makes it informative and worth the time.
very nurturing and helps in making the class easy to get through and allows for a lot of options within the course.  excellent help with writing growth.
Good sense of humor.  Syllabus is very clear.  Grading criteria not a mystery.  Mixes intelligence with fun.  Will work with students to improve your grade.  Good writing tips.
ok
Good teacher and looks out for students best intrest.  (Do your work + go to class)= an A in the class.
Not a hard professor, as long as you can write coherently, but the class is insanely boring and the material we read was below college reading level.

An absolutely awful teacher.  Confusing, boring and uninformed.  Many times during the course, a student would ask a question and Tyler would stand at the front blinking bovine- like before saying "I have no idea."  Avoid anything she's involved
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Prasad is an amazing, engaging professor. I looked forward to all of her classes and, if given the chance, I would take another class with her. She has a great passion and depth-of-knowledge in her field, that broadcasts in her lectures, and she went to great lengths to address the questions the class brought up during discussion and our essays

Most of the people in the class are averaging 1s or 2s out of 3 points for the discussion posts that make up a large portion of the final grade. This is ironic considering all the fairy tales that we have read in class are make-believe and people's opinions and interpretations of factless literature are being graded as if there is a correct answer.

Took her Sci Fi and Fantasy last year, and had the time of my life! Classes were engaging, assignments were fun, and the course  while intellectually demanding  was a breeze. Very conscientious about her students  and if youre shy, or otherwise incapable of participating in class, just let her know beforehand... she will help you!

Dr. Chavez is by far one of my favorite professors I've ever had. She is extremely caring and will accommodate students however she can. We had due dates for discussion posts, but she had build-in extensions as well. This class was super easy but also very interesting!

Overall 10/10 course. She is so sweet. Everything is organized and you basically do the same thing every week which is class discussions. Really interesting movies and she honestly deserves more because some days we just wouldn't talk.

This first year English class was pretty fun! There is one final paper and one final presentation and the rest of your grades are just check ins and reflections. Mercedes let us write our paper over whatever we wanted so it was very easy to become passionate about your work. I loved this class!

An amazing professor! Looked forward to going to class every time, it was so refreshing to have a professor that genuinely cares about their students. Also, because this class deals with documentaries she picked fun and interesting films to keep us engaged! Definitely take this course.
love her! Best professor ever.
One of the nicest professors I've had so far in college. Genuinely interested in helping students learn and succeed. Really enjoyed the class and professor!

While attendance was optional, I wouldn't skip if you can help it. Elise is amazing and very understanding, but don't abuse her kindness. The class is heavy in peer feedback (which is graded), so attendance is recommended. If you enjoy writing, this course provides great opportunities for learning and growth. You will be in a class of writers.

I took this class because it was a pre-requi. course for other GE courses but I am glad that I took this class. If you are an international student or a person who needs to take EDUTL 1902, she is the perfect choice for you. Her class is not that hard and she supports you to get a better grade if you are struggling.

Lit Adolescents is very easy to pass and a really fun course. Your grade is mostly readings logs every two weeks of 1 novel & 2 picture books of choice. There are one or two projects/papers that will need more effort but they aren't difficult. Professor Niese is super nice and values your thoughts and opinions! Overall easy and enjoyable.

Professor Niese is so nice! Her class was completely asynchronous and consisted of reading logs and the occasional discussion post. Assignments aren't hard at all. Just turn them in on time you should end the class with an A. You typically read 3 books of your choice each week, some being children's literature and that's it. I would recommend!

Hannah is incredibly sweet. In this class, we focused on one big project that we gradually did throughout the semester. Altogether, we wrote 3 papers, had 9 process posts (very easy), and a symposium presentation at the end. Super easy-going, not a tough grader, and gives extensions if you need them. They genuinely care and want you to succeed.
Professor Washuta is wonderful; she's incredibly insightful and helpful. Her grading is tough, admittedly, but it's worth it because the knowledge you glean from her is expansive. Highly recommend.
If you are looking for someone that appreciates your hard work

Clancy is the best instructor that I have ever had. She has very realistic expectations and understands that students have additional coursework outside of her class. She is kind, enthusiastic, and intelligent. Clancy made me excited to come to class and write.

Professor Lowell is very nice but a VERY tough grader and you do not receive any extra credit. He does not accept ANY late work or excuses. He is very strict when it comes to his class. Overall, if you aren't a straight A student and you aren't very good with reading or writing I don't recommend him.
Follow the syllabus and you'll do great. Read the given material and class will be easy to follow. The feedback he gives on assignments helps significantly and tells you your weak points.
He is the best professor I have ever had. I wish I could have him for 1020!

Took this class twice with other teachers before and haaaated it, but I loved, loved, loved his class.  No quizes or tests, just papers and I did so much better with his help.  Wish I could take 1020 with him :(

Professor Lowell is awesome! I took both of his English classes at Cuyahoga Community College and I would definitely recommend this teacher. Professor Lowell gives pop quizzes, but gives feedback and takes his time with letting the students write their papers. Complete the assignments, and show up to class.

Jeffrey Lowell has such a passion for teaching, he is one of the most caring teachers i have ever had the pleasure to meet. I secretly wish the word count was more because i would write a page on how awesome he is. He gives great feedback on essays, responds to emails quickly, and grades papers super fast. WARNING: DO NOT SKIP HIS CLASS!
Very glad I had him my first semester back.  Very highly recommend this professor.
He made a required class actually very interesting.  Very good teacher!

Sometimes a paper confused me at first but I talked to him after class and it would be clear and the conferences always helped a lot.  I liked that he tried to get to know us too.  He asks a lot but worth it!!
Totally changed my writing for the better. Epic pirate beard. Epic teacher.   Would take again 10/10.

He is an AMAZING teacher.. best English teacher I have had! I had him at Tri-C during my junior year of high school- gives amazing feedback and is very helpful. very organized and on top of his game for grading papers. expect to participate and be active in his class; it helps on his papers a lot!  Would so recommend taking his class. hes amazing!
Loved his class.  Wish I could have taken 1010 with him!!!

So I had him at Tri-C and now I'm at CSU.  My program has us do a lot of research and write-ups and I felt REALLY prepared thanks to his class and psych.  Yeah he makes you write, but it's an English class!  He'll help you a lot if you need it (love the conferences) and get you ready for what's next, which is exactly what I wanted.
too many papers and not enough time. 2 pages every week plus the 5 page paper or 10 page paper. I don't recommend taking him unless you got too much time on your hands.
Pretty good teacher. All papers are due online before class though which I didn't really like.  Other than that he helps you understand the subject and gives pretty good feedback.

He makes class interesting, very energetic, and creates a good learning atmosphere. There is a lot to read, and you have to write a 2 page essay every week, but it is easy and prepares you for the bigger essays. Is always helpful in-class, during office hours, and through email. I have learned a lot in his class, he is truly an awesome teacher.
Amazing professor!  Soooo helpful, and lots of energy! Not to mention, he's easy on the eyes.
I had him for 2 semesters and he is awesome! I definitely became a better writer and learned in his class. He is outgoing, nice and helpful. I would definately recommend him.
I had him at Tri-C and he wa awesome.....and cute!
One of the 3 best profs I ever had at OSU.  Take this class with him and you will actually learn something.
He made me a better writer. MR. LOWELL ROCKS!

He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the field and amazingly helpful with your papers but grades fairly. He's approachable and always willing to help you with anything in class or office hours.
Exceptional teacher!  I really enjoyed his class and think my writing improved a lot.
Amazingly caring, brilliant and humble.

Granted I took Professor Aldamas class during COVID-19, but even then I very much enjoyed his class. He struck the perfect balance between weekly assignments and a generally laid-back, discussion-centric lecture style. He was always understanding and caring about what was happening in our lives and flexible should anything happen outside of school
Great teacher would absolutely take again!
Great professor, super knowledgable, interesting discussions, and really accommodating to COVID-19. We had to write one reflection per week on the material and that was it.

The most accommodating professor for COVID-19 that Ive had this semester. He always has extra credit options and structures assignments as to reduce stress. He really wants to have a genuine conversation with the class instead of just telling us what to think. His classes have been my favorite so far at OSU!
Professor Aldama was extremely knowledgeable and chose great movies to analyze and relate to the Latinx community.
i love this man
A prof so good, he has me doing my Borat impression. Very Nice!
great class. Really easy visual arts credit if you're not an artistic person.

Professor Fredrick Aldama is the first-ever professor to actually care about his students. Since the class is very large, due take your time to introduce yourself at any point during the semester. Professor Aldama made my first-year at OSU very memorable. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND ANY CLASS THAT HE TEACHES. - NMW

Professor Aldama is the best film professor I've ever had the privilege of learning from. He is amazingly wise and very approachable. Every lecture was filled with useful film advice and tips. 10/10 would recommend!

This class is fantastic, and he does a great job making his lectures informative and fun. You can tell that he cares about his students and the subject. However, your final grade is only made up of three papers, attendance, and quizzes, so going to class is critical. Overall, this is a great course if you're interested in film

Dr. Aldama is so funny! He makes an effort to know all of his 150± students' names. He goes easy on the grading of your paper if he knows you do well in the course. Try your best and make an effort to get to know him!
If you show that you want to learn he help you. The papers are more about learn then grading. Vary interesting if you want to learn a little about film.

Amazing professor! Very charismatic. Lectures are very informative and funny. As long as you put in the work, you will pass the class with an A. I agree with most everything he says, but Joaquin Phoenix tops Heath Ledger for me ;) .
Honestly an all around awesome class. I had the opportunity to learn so much about movies and the intricacy that they come with. Would take this class again, it made me appreciate the art of film.

Few lecture heavy courses find a good way to keep students engaged with the material. This course and especially this professor never cease to do so. Students that never spoke once in the first few lectures when asked questions were active contributors to discussion by the end. Professor Aldama does a near flawless job encouraging student growth.

Professor Aldama is passionate about what he does. This passion shows through in the way he engages with course content and student ideas in a classroom space. Aldama pushes students to think outside the box about intersectionality through the comic book medium. This class definitely changed the way that I view movies and read comics.

I have had this professor for two classes and would take a class with him again without question. He really cares about his students and about the subject matter. Everyones opinions is valued. Even in giant lectures he tries to get to know his students.

Professor Aldama's class is amazing. I was originally taking the class to receive credits for my minor and I ended up declaring an English major. His lectures are amazing and you can see the true passion he has for the subject. Not to mention his many outside resources to help engage students like his podcast and Sõl-Con.

His explanations of analyzing movies and/or concepts in lecture are very specific and beneficial so that when you have to do the papers, you can effectively formulate your thesis and create a substantial argument! Makes the class fun or enjoyable even though it is kind of lecture heavy.

Dr Aldama is an amazing professor. If you listen during lectures you will definitely pass the class. the papers are fairly graded and He really tries to make the lectures more like a discussion which is really nice as well. Overall amazing class!
My fav professor so far! Very passionate and super dope

I would recommend taking one of his courses to ANYONE. No matter what major you are, every person can find something to be excited about in class. He's a very easygoing guy and loves all participation. He gives great feedback on the papers you write, and I always enjoyed writing about Marvel! One of my favorite English professors! Also offers EC!

Super nice guy and he is super passionate about what he really he teaches. The course load was a lot but it was all interesting comics and superhero movies so it was fun. I would definitely take a class from him again.

Dr. Aldama genuinely cares about his students and gives very engaging lectures that facilitate extremely productive class discussions. The movies he chooses are refreshingly very diverse in their content. The reading/paper load is very manageable and standard for any 2000 level English class. 10/10 would take a class with this professor again!

Professor Aldama is one of those rare professors that lets you know right away that he cares about the material he's teaching, and he especially cares about how that material is passed on to his students. His lectures are so riveting in that they engage both film fans and the average person. Regardless of who you are, you'll enjoy his class!

Dr. Aldama is a wonderful professor. His lectures are long and can be boring sometimes but he really tries to make them enjoyable. The class is graded on only 3 papers but as long as you include everything in your paper you can pass with a B. He gives multiple extra credit opportunities too.

Prof. ALDAMA IS A GREAT PROFESSOR, the class was excellent overall, and hes very personable and relatable. This is the best class I have taken at OSU so far. The assignments and movies are fun to do and watch respectively.
Aldama wants you to get an A. Besides the hard work you have to put in for the three papers, the class is pretty light but still enjoyable and he chooses very good movies to watch and talk about

Professor Aldama is super excited about the material and makes lecture fun. Outside of class he is easy to talk to and genuinely cares about getting to know his students. The grade consists of attendance, homework quizzes (open book and mad easy to get 100%), and 3 papers that are easy As as long as you meet all the requirements. Take the class!

I highly recommend any student at The Ohio State University to take a class with Professor Aldama. Not only is he extremely kind, passionate and knowledgeable about film and the material he teaches, but he is able to teach class in a way that you can apply what you learn not only to cinema but to other art forms as well as insight in to the self.

You have to go to lecture for TopHat credit that uses your location to assure you're on site, decent amount of your grade. Prof. Aldama is one of the most passionate profs on campus, by far my favorite. Also brought/skyped in some directors for class that give you connections/internship/experience opportunities. Take it. Fun, easy and enjoyable.
very understanding, and eager to see his students succeed!!

Took Intro to Film with Prof. Aldama and it was EASILY my favorite class of the semester. You won't fail by skipping class, but you should go to the lectures anyways because he's an amazing and engaging lecturer, even with over 100 students. I learned so much, and go to office hours to get to know him personally! AWESOME dude.
Great professor, show up to class and try on the papers and you will do well

One of the best professors I have ever had. He actually cares about the students and works hard to make the lectures interesting and interactive. Need to read the book in order to fully understand the lectures and do well on the papers (a large percentage of the grade). I would recommend this class to anyone.

Cannot express how much this professor cares about his students. GET TO KNOW HIM. He is incredibly helpful if you know him and talk to him regularly, but it's hard for him to help you if he doesn't know who you are. I enjoyed this class so much, the content was relevant and interesting, and the class was very enjoyable. Can't recommend him enough.

Dr. Aldama is absolutely the best professor at OSU. This is the only class Ive ever had where the professor, material and lectures are all extremely enjoyable. Not only are the lectures interesting and fun to go to, you also learn a lot about all of the topics covered. Dr. Aldama is so great and I recommend everyone to take one of his classes.

Professor Aldama is one of the best professors I have had so far at OSU. His passion for film is inspiring and he really cares for his students. The lectures and recitation are fun and very interesting. 10/10 would recommend!

Professor Aldama truly cares about his students and teaching them the art of film and cares more about actually understanding concepts over constant worrying about tests and quizzes, definitely recommend this class and teacher!

He is a really nice professor! If you want to have an A for this course, you just need to attend and ask him for the paper before submitting. He will let you know, "If you study hard, you will earn a great grade". Just ask more and do more for your paper! He will not make you feel bad!

I would definetly recommand my friends who's interested in films to take this course. The professor is so nice and caring, I got a lot help from him! Everything in this class is interesting, and all we have to do is to write three film analyze papers focusing on what we learned.

Hes a very knowledgeable, fun, and genuine professor. You watch a ton of movies in his class (19 to be specific). He cares about the students and makes you think in a challenging, but not miserably challenging way.

This was an excellent class! The professor shows genuine excitement and passion for the course, and the material is interesting and relevant. It will really open your eyes to the intricacies of film-making and how it relates to society in general. Discussions are interesting, and the professor shows that he cares about his students.

The introduction to film class is a great combination of being interesting and an easy A class. Professor Aldama is clearly very knowledgable but isn't judgmental if you don't know anything about film. I highly recommend this class. Especially if you're in a STEM major and want a GE outside of your field.
Dr. Aldama is one the best professors I've had at Ohio State. Really cares about his students and the subject matter he is teaching. I highly recommend taking any course offered by him.

I took this class for a general education course. It was a great class and the professor is great. He is really interested in what he teaches and it shows when he talks in class. There are 3 essays to write, but other than that there is no homework. As long as you show up and do the few essays, you should get an A.
Very fun and easy class! Just be sure to understand all of the requirements for the essays.

Professor Aldama was one of the best professors I have had the pleasure of taking their class. The class is mandatory participation, but you wont want to miss it anyways. The films and comics were an interesting topic to begin with, and the subjects we covered in class made it that more entertaining. Hes also very kind and understanding!

The class addresses controversial topics within films and comic books so be ready to get a bit out of your comfort zone, however you will always be able to voice your opinion regarding your political and social views. The content is really fun, a lot of great movies and comics and the class lets you explore and question views on these topics.

Professor Aldama is without question one of the finest professors I've ever had the pleasure of learning from. He's passionate about improving his students, dedicated to the quality of his classes, and eminently knowledgeable about his subject. An absolute gem, I'd take a class with him even if it was outside of my degree program.

Dr. Aldama is an outstanding professor. Using pop culture, he provides accessible, thought-provoking materials representing many perspectives. He expertly coaxes students beyond the boundaries of their current knowledge. The course materials, guest speakers, lecture and discussion topics show his commitment to the subject matter and the students.

Very few words can describe just how extraordinary and exceptionally brilliant Dr. Aldama is. Without question, there are genuinely few other instructors at The Ohio State University who are as passionately driven to teach and connect with students as him. I've taken 3 of his undergrad courses, and yet I'm still eager to learn even more from him.

Dr. Aldama is an amazing professor and person. He has made his English class extremely fun and interesting because of the topics covered and the materials that are analyzed. Throughout the semester there was several extra credit opportunities given for attending events on campus. I would recommend this class to everyone.

Professor Aldama is fantastic. Not only did we get to read/watch list of fun and intriguing literature and films, but he encouraged us to unpack the underlying issues in the text. Hes fantastic at guiding conversation and getting his students to think about the bigger picture, without dragging down the class. I WANTED to go to lecture.

Awesome class!! We covered a lot of important topics regarding superhero films and comics, including where they should be celebrated and critiqued. The class is called "Film & Comics: Race, Class, Sexuality, and Differently Abled" so be aware of the course content. We had GREAT, intelligent discussions and I actually enjoyed writing the papers.

Dr. Aldama is an excellent professor and knows his craft. I found his course on film and comics with an examination on gender, race, and differently-abled to be helpful on seeing different viewpoints on how media is formed for a perceived audience. I would take this professor again and I recommend anyone to take his courses.

Aldama is the best professor that I've ever had! Class is accessible to student's needs, lectures are dynamic & enjoyable. I'm taking more classes with him because he's that great. Students who disagree are usually not open-minded or have skewed views of what classes should be like. Easy A if you show up & engage which he makes easy to do. 5/5!!!

I can truthfully say that this class was one of the most interesting, entertaining, intriguing, and eye-opening ones I have ever taken. I had never even considered picking up a comic prior to my enrollment in this course, and although I was skeptical at first, it turned out to be one of my best decisions. This class is fun, enlightening, and 10/10.

Dr. Aldama is an amazing professor! He is so considerate and understanding of you as a student both in and outside of the classroom. His lectures are very interesting and the material provided keeps you intrigued! He also gives a good amount of extra credit that consists of fun events on campus! The class was great and I would overall recommend it!

The class was great and the content was very interesting to learn about! Dr. Aldama is a great professor and cares about his students even outside of classroom. He gives out a good amount of extra credit if you go to certain events on campus. He made me appreciate comics and film on a whole new level!

Honestly, this is very easy A class. He is very knowledgable. No quiz, no midterms, no finals. Just three papers, 25% each, and 25% just on attendance, which you might consider not to skip the class. He is very genuine and kind, and give many extra credits. Someone you can negotiate if you have problem, which might be rare since he is easy grader.

I highly recommend taking this class! Every class is focused on a new film or comic and Aldama provides a classroom where it is a safe environment to discuss and analyze new mediums! I entered every class and was able to put everything aside to enjoy a very thorough inspirational discussion!
prof aldama is a great teacher, very smart and passionate about topic. class is lecture and essay based. would definitely take again!
He is a great professor, really enjoyed taking his class. Pretty straight forward, 3 essays, attendance grade and extra credit. Should be an easy A if you attend class and participate.

Awesome teacher! Loves what hes teaching and cares about his students. Dr. Aldama is very open to opinions he doesnt agree with so its very easy to feel comfortable and get involved in class discussions. Would definitely take this class again!

Professor Aldama is an extremely passionate, knowledgeable instructor. I looked forward to going to his lectures, and all the course material we viewed was superb. His syllabus is straightforward. there were no surprises. One of the best, if not THE best teacher Ive ever had at OSU.

Dr. Aldama is a standout professor, he cares about his student and strives to make the class accessible to anyone interested in taking it. You don't need to have extensive knowledge of film coming in, he does a great job of explaining and relating different nuances of the genre. His grading policy is very fair, and showing up to class is important.

Dr. Aldama made my first semester at Ohio State tremendous experience. He displays great enthusiasm and creativity.  I learned about the deeper meaning of film and what the director is trying to present to each audience.  I recommend his class to any major for that matter due to the valuable skills you will enhance  or pick up.

I am a CSE Major and this Film Studies class was a breath of fresh air. The topics we covered were amazingly interesting and Dr. Aldama's lectures  got me thinking  in a unique way. The lectures were full of humor as well. He is passionate about his subject matter and cares deeply about students as individuals. Take his Class!!

I took Dr. Aldama's Intro to Film class--incredible experience, he is that extremely rare professor that is both cool and challenges you intellectually/morally. Deeply expanded my appreciation of film from social and technical angles. Grades papers fairly--nicely actually--take this class even if you're not majoring in something related, Art GE

I was new to studying film before this semester and I had some doubts about how I would perform, but Doctor Aldama's intriguing lectures, diligent feedback and charismatic passion made it feel natural. If you ever have the chance to take one of Doctor Aldama's classes, DO IT. He's an amazing professor and I couldn't recommend him highly enough.

I believe that Dr. Aldama has been one of the most influential professors that I have had in my first year at Ohio State.  He has done a wonderful job of broadening my knowledge of film studies.  It is evident that he is an expert in his field, and that he is wonderful at expressing his love for film to his students.

Dr. Aldama goes above and beyond as a professor in his lectures (which were held in a theatre at Gateway), and in his relationship with students. This class had the perfect balance of film theory, exposure to major works in the history of cinema, and engagement. Highly recommended that anyone with in movies and entertainment culture.

Dr. Aldama is one of the most passionate teachers at Ohio State that I have come across. He knows what he's talking about when it comes to film and always keeps class interesting. Would recommend taking any class with Aldama teaching it.

Hands down one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. Dr. Aldama genuinely cares about his students and takes time before, after, and during class to ask us how we are doing. Lecture material is interesting and the class overall was great. 10/10 would recommend this course to anyone.

Not only a great professor but a great guy 2. Aldama did an amazing job at guiding you to see things from a different perspective, something all successful college classes should do. My only regret is that I didn't start talking to him before/after class sooner. This 'Gen Ed' was the most enjoyable I've ever taken! Discussions were always engaging.

Dr. Aldama is an incredible professor. The lectures were interesting and kept students involved. Dr. Aldama genuinely cares about his students and their learning experience. As long as you attend class and do the work it'll be am enjoyable experience. I look forward to taking more of his classes!

Dr. Aldama was a great professor, my favorite at Ohio State.  He keeps class interesting and exciting and has a great sense of humor.  There are no quizzes only 3 essays.  I highly recommend this class with Dr. Aldama.  If you attend every class and takes notes this is an easy A.

He is awesome! I took his Comic Book class and his lectures were easily understandable and you don't even need any knowledge about comics. He is very good about being open for questions and talking about anything you need.  Very understanding and accommodating- I would definitely take another one of his classes

Professor Aldama is one of the most caring professors I have ever encountered on this campus. His lectures are really cool because they help to open your mind to a new viewpoint of media. There are various texts to read but most of them are comics and film studies. AMAZING PROFESSOR, take any class you can with him!!!

From the very first day Professor Aldama's lectures were amazing. His class truly keeps you interested and engaged. If you participate a lot in class (meaning discussion-not just showing up) it will show in your final grade. Be sure to make enough time to read and watch the movies. This class was awesome!

Awesome professor, and one of the most enjoyable classes I've taken in my time at OSU. Does a great job at taking moral, ethical, and social issues and showing how these topics/ideas are portrayed and interpreted through narrative, art and film. Do the readings, watch the films, and PARTICIPATE and you'll have an open forum to discuss anything.

Participation matters for sure, so stay on top of reading requirements (especially theory readings). Really passionate about teaching and loves to connect with students individually even when class is 70 students large.

Approaches fiction and entertainment media from a number of different vantage points and disciplines (sociological, psychological, cognitive, race/gender, etc. ). Intends for the class to question the influence of art on society and vice versa. Attentive to his students, great feedback on papers, always willing to talk, and incredible energy!

Every class included an open, spirited discussion on the films viewed followed by close analyses of sequences from the respective films viewed. Attention was constantly on the art of film-making and on their various sociopolitical meanings. As with the 4 other courses Ive taken with Aldama, if ranked on a 1-10 scale, this ones an 11+.
Great professor. Super knowledgable and top of his field in Latinx Studies. He was super helpful, super insightful. I would definitely take a class with him again.

This professor was electric! Engaging, contemporary, witty, sharp as a tact. Everyone in class loved his lectures, and his reading assignments were awesome. We actually looked forward to reading the text, actually looked forward towards class, eager to talk about the text we read. Knock out class, knock out professor!

Professor Aldama is a spectacular teacher of film. He taught his course in a way that stimulates all aspects of academic thinking  while drawing upon his vast pool of knowledge on the subject. Lectures were engaging and enjoyable if you bothered to show up, and he didn't waste time and energy with petty quizzes.

This is a MUST TAKE class for students interested in film or comics. Class teaches how comics & Film are structured (narrative, images, colors, style,text,drawings, flow). Comics (Sin City, Superman, Scott Pilgrim, Iron Man, Wanted, Incredible Hulk, Persepolis) How film directors like Nolan and Rodriguez turn a comic into a film. Great Professor!!

Professor Aldama was an inspirational professor, he is a true professional of his field. Class meetings were bi-weekly and discussion-based. Therefore, attendance and participation were expected but class material was evenly distributed and interesting. Highly recommend taking one of his classes, it was an excellent analytical writing experience!

I went into this course contemplating if i'd want to pursue a career in storytelling. I thought people who did were born creative and smart, but this class exposed me to how fiction is formed by diverse people. I'll now go after a career in storytelling. The class  is student-friendly. You think,show your creativity without pressure. + environment!

I really enjoyed Professor Aldama's class! I had no interest in comics going into this class, and I finished with such an appreciation for the medium. Lecture was primarily driven by discussion between the students and the professor. There was a paper due every week, but they were informal and easy as long as you did the assigned homework.

Professor Aldama is a very friendly and caring guy as well as an intellectually challenging professor. He sees the big picture and is concerned with preparing students not only to receive a good grade in the class, but for their college careers and further pursuits in life. He is an expert in the field of Mex-Cin and is so helpful!

This was an exelent class on Mexican Film Studies. Dr. Professor Frederick Aldama is an exceptional presenter of this material and an expert in the field. His classes are very engaging and fun to attend. Classes held in the Gateway Film Center. The way film classes should be taught. Great choice of films. Highly recommend this professor and class.

A very friendly and caring person. But after a semester of reading his book of truisms and participating in pointless discussions (when he didn't cancel class), post-structuralism begins to look pretty fascinating once again. Aldama is an interesting guy but not an intellectually stimulating professor.

The class overall was good. Getting into the world of Mexican film was probably one of my more enjoyable classes at OSU. That said, while he is helpful and insightful in discussions, he grades pretty hard. I spent a lot of time on the papers and still got a C in the class, though I felt like I did a lot better work than that.

Professor Aldama is very personable and friendly. He puts forth a good effort to make his class interesting. He didn't moderate our class discussions well, and they seemed to have little direction. I didn't learn much from the class.
cool guy, if you're interested in narratology def. check him out.

Professor Aldama is wonderfully brilliant. He is kind and interested in his students. Very soft spoken and has the most interesting reading/video selections of any English Professor I've ever experienced.
He was absolutely wonderful. He relates to his students very well. He respects everyone and listens to all opinions.

He is very personable and friendly to students, and he is very helpful and flexible.  He talks pretty quietly so sometimes it's hard to pay attention.  Somewhat tough grader on papers.  Overall, the class is interesting and Prof Aldama is a good professor

Dr. Aldama played a pivotal role in shaping my career. His approach,cognitive narratology,is a breath of fresh air after the obsure rant that clutters postcolonial studies. My only issue with the course was that we did not cover all the texts as thoroughly as we should have. However, he is very approachable, encouraging and flexible. Take his class
He made me interested in cognitive sciences, and he is muy caliente!! (code-switching)

Professor Williams is fantastic!! Shes very passionate about what she teaches and she does it expertly. Shes really funny and willing to joke around with her students. She gives great feedback on essays, and shes flexible with extensions and deadlines! Most importantly shes AMAZING at wii sports (specifically bowling and tennis)!

Professor Williams is a great choice if you feel confident in writing analytical papers. Class was mostly lectures but a few trips to the library which was really interesting. No midterm/final test but papers and virtual participation. She isn't an easy A but will grade fairly and I had no problems, super nice and loves what she does!

Professor Lawson's class was very interesting and fun (if you enjoy creative writing). She is very kind and understanding, and the classroom environment is non-judgmental. You'll often get good constructive feedback on the work you turn in, either from her or classmates.
She was very easy and graded easy
He is really understanding. He will work with you but he still won't just give you an A. He makes me think of concepts that I would've never thought of before.
Not a complete walk in the park, but Michael gives amazing feedback and will help you in any way he can. One of my favorite classes and would love to take more with him.

I am positive that Michael will be one of the most engaging and enjoyable professors that I will ever have. He has a very new, non traditional way of teaching to make class feel like a discussion rather than a lecture. Each class offered new ways of thinking and viewing the world. He gave challenging readings but always gave good explanations
He totally changed the way I read stories. And he gives AMAZING lectures.
Loved this class.

Michael is by far one of the best instructors that I have ever had, I even ended up looking forward to attending class. He makes lectures very engaging, and he gives extensive and very helpful feedback on all the papers. He is also willing to help students at anytime.

One of the best instructors I have ever had. Michael made my first semester at OSU so much more fun. He is always willing to help you inside and outside the classroom and always makes himself available to you at any time. I learned so much from this course that will follow me throughout life.

This class isn't a cakewalk but he will help you any way he can. He will answer emails at midnight and meet with you outside his hours to help you. Lectures are profound and he will push you to WANT to succeed. He destroys the teacher-student paradigm - you will be treated with the respect of a peer. He is truly a one of a kind instructor.
Best english teacher at Ohio State.  The lectures are amazing.  I actually enjoyed going to class.

Francis is a sweetheart. There isn't a ton of work each week which is nice. He does offer a wide variety of reading material. He gave us a week off for mental health which was greatly appreciated. I had to take an extension because of health reasons and he was extremely generous and understanding. If you need to take an English class, take his.
I really respect Dr. Donoghue. He gave great feedback on essays and genuinely wants his students to succeed. Would take again!

Professor Donoghue is by far the best professor I have had here at OSU. He is caring and always encourages us to take care of our mental health. His class is generally simple with discussion posts, and there are only three papers due this semester. I have nothing but amazing things to say about Professor Donoghue. A real gem!

We had a lot of book reading assignments, and ONE page written assignments that were a pass/fail. In the case that no one failed. Class consisted of sitting in a circle and talking about what you read and what it meant to you. My class basically spoke for 30 mins. It always got awkwardly silent so wed get to leave early. Class is worth taking.

Advise from A+ student DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS unless you want to fail. Professor Donoghue is unorganized, he never gives us instructions paper what you writ about/ he never explains either. His grader named Abigail is hell shes absolutely grades very harsh. No matter what you do you will never get A because you have a third-wheel

prof donoghue himself is a cool guy, he would basically talk the entire class so class was easy. but he has heath problems, so he had a grader who was super tough & unfair in terms of the course level. would have taken a different class if i had known

You need to buy a lot of printed books for the course. He did not allow us to use e-books, and not tell us how to write until almost the end of the semester! It is impossible to get a good grade unless you revise your paper over and over again! It is the worst course I've ever taken! It is no a good course for basic writing! I rewrote but. wcnm

He has been with the university for a while. He has some health problems, so he has a grader who is somewhat tough but it is manageable if you take time writing the 4 paper assignments he gives. He loves discussion and is funny, caring, understanding. Class was super easy if you just show up and participate. Very wise, respected prof.

Professor Donoghue had to stop teaching my class halfway through the semester, but while he was around, he was a wondeful instructor. He provided helpful insight and analysis in our discussions and truly understood how to make us get the most out of out of discussions/seminars. The stories in the book were available online; dont waste your money.

Frank was an amazing professor.  He is very genuinely interested about the subjects he teaches. He is definitely a little odd, but past that I had an awesome time in his class. He takes attendance every class, but is very understanding if you have to miss. Doesn't allow cell phones in class at all, if he catches you on it you fail the course.

This is my second semester with Frank, and he continues to astound me. I have been dealing with some very tough things in my life, and he's been really great about helping me through everything. He has very strict rules about attendance, and about cell phones, but when you have a valid excuse, he can be one of the most understanding professors.

I took a conspiracy theory class with him this semester and I really enjoyed it. He may seem odd at first, but he's very intelligent and passionate about teaching. It would have been a much more fun class if my peers spoke up more in discussions. He has you read one article a week, and there's only one graded assignment. A very interesting course!

This was a conspiracy theory elective class and as long as you showed up, you passed the class. There was only one graded assignment the entire semester. He wasn't very organized, but he answered all of his own questions which was nice.

One of my favorite teachers at OSU.  Very passionate about English and all the books you'll read and highly engaging.  I would reccomend him if you have the option to take a course with him.  Always show up to class, be prepared, and you'll do fine.

Classes can be boring, but I have found that as long as you read, show up, and listen to his discussions in class you will be good to go. He is willing to look over papers and is very good at keeping up with his emails. He is very smart and is passionate about English.

We had a lot of short papers (2-3 pages), but our final paper had to be 10 pages! He really enjoys talking about books and we spent the first week just getting to know everyone in the class. He likes to create a close group so that our discussions never become stagnate.  He is a little slow, but I recommend taking him if you have the option!

There is a lot of reading and you need to do it to pass the class. The tests are easy if you actually do the reading and pay attention in class. He is very kind and helpful, if you are going to miss class email him and he is more likely to excuse it, as I had to do multiple times. He is a stickler about phones and computers but it is a lit class.

On day 3 of class he handed me a piece of paper saying i should drop the course because i wasn't talking. I spoke with him and cleared things up. Then he tried to fail me because I did not talk enough in class. He grades/judges you based on how much you talk in class. It's complete insanity I had A's on all quizzes and attended all classes.

Not open to any ideas that are not presented in class. Forward thinkers should avoid this prof. Rewards you if you spew back his ideas. Thinks only of his ideas and uses the class time for himself. I started the class excited and very involved in the conversation, by the end not many people talked aside from those who didnt have ideas of their own.

I took "Gambling in Fiction & Film" from Prof. Donoghue and enjoyed it immensely. For one, the material is interesting and fun, and the papers were easy. However, be warned, Donoghue tends to drive things into the ground, which turns the material a bit stale. Even so, I thought he was challenging, humorous, and open to our viewpoints. Recommended.

I thought this guy was really nice and funny.  Class got a little boring sometimes, but usually he kept the discussion going pretty well.  Participate in class a lot and you'll get a good grade.  I'm not really sure what the other reviewers are talking about - he's really nice and approachable.  Take his class - it's an easy A.

Instead of encouraging students to think like scholars, this professor makes the classroom into his own private stage from which he spouts forth his own agendas, promptly killing any intelligent ideas or productive debates.  If this professor were less self-absored and more interested in TEACHING, the class may have actually been useful.

Repays class participation almost directly with higher grades (not only in a "participation" percentage of the final grade but also in how he grades the papers).  He is kind of hard to approach at first, but he's actually a really nice guy who if you take the time to talk about the papers, he will help you immensely.
Total jackass! Stubborn interpretations. Grades on how much you regurgitate!
Couldn't ask for a better English teacher, highly recommend taking his course.

Professor Williams was easily one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is extremely easy to communicate with, and I (and my peers) actually enjoy waking up at 8 AM to go to his class. This class is heavily sports-focused, which is no problem for me, but if you don't like sports, I'd still recommend taking his class, you will enjoy it. :)

Professor Williams has been, by far my favorite professor Ive had here at OSU!   His class is super interesting and informative. There are a good amount of essays but it is an English class so thats expected. I would definitely take his class again!

Professor Williams was great, super understanding about extending deadlines if needed. Really personable and gives clear directions during lectures. I would definitely take this class again if I could and I recommend having him as your professor. Lectures aren't boring and he gives in class time to work on your papers.

Mr. Williams gave me arguably my best classroom experience so far in college. He does a great job at making a class as bland as English fun for students, and he goes out of his way to interact with his class. However, his passion for sports becoming linked into the curriculum is great for some students like me, but can also be annoying for others.
Great Professor, very understandable

Mr. Williams was a great professor. He could control the classroom and made the class very interesting. There was a decent amount of discussion between peers and throughout the entire class. Everyone's opinion was respected. The class was overall very informational and engaging.

Ms. Mason is one of my all time favorite professors. She always maintained a great atmosphere and make the class fun. Lots of writing but I never felt too rushed and always got great feedback. Grading is very clearly outlined and easy to follow. 10/10

Amazing teacher and as long as you put in some effort, you will get a good grade. There are a lot of assignments, including discussion posts and weekly journals, but they aren't difficult. She is very flexible and will provide extra days to get assignments done if you are busy or sick.
He assigns A LOT of work so if you are looking for an easy class to take do not take this class. Tough grader. Also you have to pay for the book for this class.
