Currently in the class-Professor Hashlamon genuinely cares about his students. Class participation is encouraged but he doesn't make you speak in front of the class if you're uncomfortable doing so. His instructions are clear and he is a fair grader. I highly recommend taking his class (Also- he co-wrote the required book so it's free for students)

Professor McCabe by far have been my favorite course this semester. He is truly kind and is easy to work with. All you have to do for this course is show up to class and complete the assignments he assigns and don't bs it and you'll pass!

Hardest English course I've taken. I suppose he read the rmp ratings and began grading harder, as I thought I'd have an easy course in store-NOT THE CASE! Averages were a solid 85, but I had to work hard to receive an A. He's a cool guy and dedicated to his teaching, but if you don't like English, pick another professor.
Classes were always fun to be a part of. Gets everyone involved with in class discussion. Also leaves really good feedback on papers to help improve on your writing.
HUGE LIB, but nice guy and good professor

Professor Kelly is a very liberally opinionated teacher and definitely expresses his beliefs. At the beginning of the class he makes sure that everyone knows that all options will be respected. However, he is very educated and obviously has more knowledge on these topics than his students so debating with him is a lost cause.

Prof. Kelly is an absolute gem of a professor. Lectures are always stimulating and relevant. Participate in his class and you will love every second of it. He's super passionate about teaching and always sends you home with so much to think about. Even on the laziest days, I never missed a class. I absolutely loved him - DEFINITELY recommend!!

Liberal topics were a lot of what the class discussions focused on, but he was open to varying opinions. Overall, a professor very concerned about the well-being of his students inside and outside the classroom.

Professor Kelly is an absolutely fantastic professor to work with. He makes class interesting by molding the course plan in such a way that it connects to real world issues and it really helps you see things from a new perspective. He puts in a lot of effort into providing good feedback and is very approachable. Never enjoyed English more!

He was a great professor, who wants you do well. He gives you chances for extra credit all semester, which is really helpful. Also he is not afraid to give his opinion on many current events, but also wants to hear what everyone has to say. Overall, he is a very passionate teacher who obviously loves what he does and cares about his students.

Dope professor who uses real world connections to bring topics into your own social horizon. Professor Kelly cares about teaching and his students success. He makes you think but in a good way that widens ones perspectives. 10/10 would recommend. Class isn't hard as long as you pay attention to what he asks of you.
definitely a very liberal professor, but accepting of all beliefs.
Nice and easy to talk to

Stephanie is very nice even though her class is boring. If you take this class, make the most of it. I regret having not made the most of it because Im lost on what I want to major in. Also, its an easy A if you just show up. Its annoying and boring but the class really will help you prepare for the next four years. She is great If you reach out

Stephanie is my honors exploration survey instructor. Exploration is really helpful if you have no idea of a major or needs some time to think about it. The recitations are tedious sometimes but I don't regret taking exploration because most other people end up changing their major anyway. She is super helpful with questions and scheduling.

The class is super annoying and most everyone hates coming to it but it's mandatory. My advice is to avoid the exploration program as best as you can... lots of other departments seem to be much more helpful and help you develop a plan for the next 4 years in college. Stephanie can be really boring and annoying and is really hard to get help from

Stephanie was my exploration instructor. She is a little quirky but a big help. I went in to several advising meetings with her and she really helped me work on my strengths, interests, etc. to find the right major for me. She is always open to help and basically did all my scheduling for me. The class is helpful if you make the best of it.

Good advisor, this class is just annoying to have to go to. The material itself is useful for learning how to schedule and such, and the conversations we had that had nothing to do with the material were pretty interesting. SO overall, good advisor, dumb class.

She's not a bad teacher, it's just a really stupid class. Given there is some material you need to know from the class (i.e. how to schedule and information on majors) there is not ten weeks worth of valuable information. Just be prepared for boredom. She'll try to spice it up the best she can.

Our class came up with a theory that the exploration program purposely gives you useless and annoying advisors to get you to decare a major to get away from them. Still is was an incredibly easy A, she is nice, just very hard to get ahold of outside class. Brought in doughnuts one week, many left over, I had 4. Counts toward GPA too, so thats good.

The class was the worst thing I have had to go to. She made me feel like I was in high school careers all over again. My advice: don't go into college in the exploration program. The teachers and advisors are not very helpful. If you ask them if you need a class all you'll get in response is "Maybe, maybe not, it just depends on your major" duh.

This class is mandatory so there is not a lot you can do to avoid it, except avoid being in the exploration program.  Be prepared for a lot of rhetorical questions that she expects answered (such as "How many careers are in the world?"); also be prepared for the frustration that will ensue when no one can answer the question correctly.
class is extremely boring, but even though stephanie is always really busy, she is pretty helpfull if you need it.
I have the utmost hate for this class.  Prof. Elliott is not bad, she just teaches a pointless class. This class just feels like high school to me.
The class that she teaches is pointless, but it's not her fault. She's pretty annoying, though.
No Comments

Professor Fink is one of my favorite profs at UWEC. I had him for an intro to religions class and later took Islam with him because I enjoyed his class. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. If you do the readings and engage in class you will do great. I looked forward to his lectures and truly learned a lot.

Professor Fink is a very bright man. He knows what he is talking about and really likes it and likes to share with his students. He is a tough grader, but is so willing to work with you to improve your work. He is a great, calm teacher, and while definitely a hard professor, he is willing to help and you will learn.

This was the worst grade I'd gotten in my major in four years.  His constructive criticism on the final was "This is a disappointment."  He continually tried to get us to look into his research on Thoreau from 1992.  Maybe this is what happens when I prof. enters the realm of administration?
I really don't recommend him for this class.  He seemed kind of out of touch, and his grading criteria was far from clear. His feedback was more belittling than constructive.

There was a point in time when I thought it might be more enjoyable to stab my eyes out with a highlighter and try to eat my coffee cup than continue with one of his papers.  He often graded harshly and ambiguously, and I'm honestly not sure if he knew how to distinguish a hook from a thesis. He was helpful in office hours. But often arrogant.
Worst instructor I've ever had. Extremely boring. it's a struggle to stay awake.

i really enjoyed this class and Prof Fink was great. sometimes his responses seemed a little condescending but he always listened to students' opinions. his feedback on papers was great and he was really helpful in office hours. he grades on attendance which was the only downfall

my fav in the eng dept. very helpful if you need it. i think his tests were pretty simple but then i'm a prodigy. i challenged him once when he questioned thoreau's true anti-consumerist conviction. i said "i disagree, sorry..[blah, blah]" and he just smiled and said "well. alright." i liked that. gives you an idea of his disposition in general.

Prof. Fink taught an interesting class, but I felt that truly engaging the students was not his primary goal, as he much preferred to just talk to himself. That being said, I for some reason really enjoyed the class, and would take another by him. Three 6-8 page essays, no final. Not a bad option at all as a teacher, and he was great in office hour
I really enjoyed this class!

He made what I thought to be an interesting period of literature kind of boring. He's passionate about American Literature. That's obvious. But he can't seem to make a connection to his students during lecture. I felt like sleeping every day.

I'm not sure why anyone is saying he is great. It seems as though there is someone with a crush on him.. I can't remember him ever saying we could contact him at home and I didn't think his class was interesting in the least. I fought to stay awake in class and his grading was pretty tough. Grammar/structure is more important than content for him.

Nice man, but he is the ultimate worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He has zero personality and he is very arrogant. Difficult grader, is not very willing to explain his grading. I would not recommend this professor to ANYONE.
Amazing.  Always helpful one-on-one in any situation.  Something very very attractive about him... none of these people are lying!

Prof. Fink is a wonderful, perspicuous, non-pedantic instructor who, despite some serious personal issues throughout the quarter, conducted great classroom discussions and taught in a way encouraging students to think for themselves and use their critical, analytical minds.  Clearly intelligent, and a very smooth speaker. Great English prof.

He's a great Prof.  He can be a tough grader at times, but he will always listen to your ideas and go over things you don't understand.  He doesn't mind when students call him at home, and actually encourages it.  One of the most helpful Profs I've had at OSU by far.  He is also very attractive and handsome.
Some of you find him enjoyable??  He droned on and on with zero enthusiasm or passion for his subject.  My least favorite professor at OSU.
No Comments

Great teacher.  I talked with today about an assignment and even though he had many personal issues weighing down on him, he took time out to make me feel like I was the only student he was teaching.  God speed, Fink, god speed.

Fink was just OK. He's not really good at communicating what he wants, like, he tries to act all casual and easy-going, but then he's really strict about grading. Still, he is pretty good looking...in an old man kind of way.
No Comments
WOW. Best prof I've had at OSU. Amazing teacher and definitely the hottest. Very Richard Gere-esque, with the persian rug and classical music...only teacher that ever made me which I was a **** ;)
Great professor, very interesting class

Very engaging class, biographical info. of authors used a lot, reasonable assignments, very nice and interested in teaching/helping with classwork- on top of that, it doesn't hurt that he's very attractive.

Professor Fink has to be one of the best teachers in the English dept.  He is great at making students feel comfortable in class and generating discussion.  It is difficult to recieve an A, but Professor Fink grades fairly and is willing to help students outside of class.
Great class, great lectures, interresting material...........IN CLASS PAPER FOR THE FINAL!!! DAMN 3.6 GPA senior C in this class...that hurt me. Take a pass fail in this class if you can.
Spectacular teacher
Best prof I've ever had. He knows everything and can relay clearly all you need to know...
Good teacher
terribly helpful, laidback, fun
One of the best professors I've had anywhere.  Clear, well-organized, always prepared for class, and he shows a real interest in teaching.

Absolutely excellent. He was the most eloquent speaker, and talked as though he was in the middle of writing a New York Times Bestseller. He never had to refer to notes - you could tell he knows his stuff. AND he looks like Richard Gere to boot.

Professor Fink is very interested in the material that he teaches, and although there was low attendence at lectures, I felt that his insight was interesting. Even if a bunch of slackers didn't care enough to go to class.
Put me to sleep every time and I'm an english major.
Assigns interesting readings and discusses them with clarity and energy.  Pleasant lecturer with a good sense of humor.  Somehow kinda reminds me of Richard Gere, only smarter.
On fire!
Very clear, well organized class and well moderated discussion. Generally funny and pleasant.
Best Professor at OSU.  Total class act.
tough on grammar
Difficult, but grades fairly
Very caring, kind professor would love to take an other course of his sometime soon

Professor Adeeko does not go in-depth with literary analysis or provide historical context for books we are assigned to read. Discussions really a bit general and basic and I do not learn a lot from this class even though I do all the readings. His politics are also interesting and he allows the class-discussion to go off-topic often.

Well versed, loves what he does but Will not accept other than his way. Very hard grader. I will not take his class again nor will I recommend it at all. The class was suppose to be about World Lit but all we learned was about African Lit. That's where he is from. Three Essay, discussion board and on the final essay, you must do a presentation.

Great professor that knows his stuff. I surprisingly enjoyed the class. The reading was a little heavy but if you did all of it the class was a cake walk. If you are willing to read a couple times a week I would definitely recommend.
I hate this class because it has too many book and you will hate yourself.Also you will not understand where this class is going. you better find another class.
If you read and go to class, you're golden. The books we read were interesting, so it wasn't hard to get the reading done.

I enjoyed Mr. Adeeko's class a lot. Very intellectual discussions and he makes you think, but keeps you interested as well. You are free to express any opinions that you have and he genuinely loves his area of study! Learned a great deal in this class and would definitely recommend it to anyone that is considering taking it!!

Adeeko is a great professor. He really makes his students think, and expects class participation. Earning a good grade involves alot of hard work. Unlike what some are used to from high school, you have to analyze and actually think about the literature.

While he was a tough grader, I felt he was a very interesting person who was perfect for this specific course. Do not be intimidated by all of his negative feedback. Do the readings and the papers and you will be fine. Also, if you speak with him in person outside of class he's actually very down-to-earth and willing to listen.

This class was difficult because Professor Adeeko did not accept other viewpoints than his own. The readings were tremendous, at times over 200 pages of a novel was assigned for barely a two day period. His grading is erratic, and seems to give the best grades on papers which agree with his opinions. Grades are based on 3 papers and group project.

Professor Adeeko has an interesting background that provided a valuable asset to this postcolonial lit. course. The final grade was based entirely on 3 papers and class attendance. He is a tough grader, and I had to work for the A- I got.

He is often late to class.  His lectures don't really matter because your entire grade is basically based on 2 papers, which is rough because he is a tough grader.  I would not recommend his class. His class is like a part  time job when you consider how much reading he wants you to have done for each lecture.

this instructor is scholarly and articulate in his presentation of the course material, but unfortunately  tends to come off as being a bit pretentious in lecture and can be a tough critic of papers esp. for an intro class. doesnt respond often to emails. take this instructor for an upper-level course, it might be better
Lindsay will help you out throughout the course but expect to do the needed work to complete the capstone.
Really demanding and unclear. Terrible professor.

Class readings were usually interesting and our group discussions were always good. She let the class form their own opinions yet guided us when we got stuck. Required reading: two novels, one graphic novel, and 24 short stories. Grades for class participation, 3 papers, midterm, and final. Good class if you want a moderate challenge.

Very enthusiatic about her classes. Extremely helpful, she will lterally make time for you no matter what in order to meet. Topics for papers can be a bit unclear but she will help you figure it out. She's quirky and fun, as well as gives you chocolate. Good GTA overall, especially for a GEC course.

Kristin is a great professor! She is a little tough on grading considering this was an elementary level class but despite that Kristin is always happy to help students and her main goal is to see her students succeed. I would highly recommend her to anyone wanting to learn ASL for the first time.

I cannot say enough good things about Kristin! Her course material is very inclusive & useful. What you learn you, you will be able to use outside of class. I found the class to be very easy & enjoyed every moment of it. But, if you choose not to try, you won't get a good grade. OSU is very lucky to have her as a professor.
great professor. super caring, really made me love ASL as a language.

I really liked Kristin and you can tell she cares for her students! I took the class virtually for pandemic reasons and she worked tirelessly to cater the class to her students. She gave a lot of outside work, but it wasn't all necessary and you learn what works/doesn't work for your personal learning style. Definitely a solid teacher :)

Kristin is a great instructor. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I recommend going to all classes if possible because the time in class is invaluable practice. There are lots of little assignments, so you have to stay organized and on top of them or you'll miss easy points. I hope I have her again for another ASL class! I highly recommend her.

The ASL department has amazing instructors, and Kristin is no exception! ASL 2 moved pretty quickly, but Kristin was helpful, understanding, and provided A BUNCH of resources. I looked forward to this class everyday and if you have Kristin you're in luck.

Kristin was the best! She grades everything so fast. Her classes were interesting and although ASL 1102 moved fast, I never felt like I was falling behind. She is super chill and I felt like if I needed to, I could've gone to her for help. I'd take every ASL class with her if I could.
Kristin is very clear and really makes sure that we're prepared for the exams. Plus, she's lowkey hilarious and doesn't even know it.

Kristin is seriously one of the best professors I've had at OSU. She is extremely nice, a super fast grader (it's insane how fast she grades), super fair, and an all around great teacher. She keeps every class fresh and exciting and you never want to miss class because she makes it very beneficial. Wish she taught ASL 1103. She rocks!

Kristin is by far one of the best professors I've ever had. She genuinely cares about her students, classes, & has a clear passion for ASL. I honestly wish she was my professor next semester. Fun, easy to get along with, & I learned a lot. Most prompt teacher I've had - gets grades posted immediately. Grades FAIRLY. Do your best & you'll love her.
Kristin was awesome! She gave me a new way of viewing deaf culture and a love for the community. I now really want to be an interpreter. I highly recommend taking this class :)

Kristin a great teacher! She's really interesting and makes learning sign language a lot of fun. She will always take time out of class to make sure everyone understands what is being said before continuing on.
Best professor I've had at OSU. She is always willing to help and dedicates time to make sure you understand new material. Definitely would take her again.
Is one of the best teachers i have ever had, i dont know if all the sign language teachers are as fun and nice but she was great, Highly recommend taking her class

Very good instructor! She loves teaching ASL to her students. Her exams are pretty much easy busy just remember to study everything in the books and cultural stuff she goes over in class. She's very helpful and she wants you to improve and get better with signing in a positive manner.
This teacher was great. She was extremely helpful, very prompt with grading, and was able to make the class fun and exciting. I'm just sad I can't continue to have her for the rest of the sequence!
Kristin is a great overall teach (and great looking). She goes over new material very slow, and reviews often to make sure you remember. I would highly recommend.
Kristin is a very good teacher-willing to answer any questions and help as much as possible for midterms or finals.  My advice: don't miss a class and take notes on what she teaches.
No Comments

Literally such an amazing guy. My class was asynchronous but this class was amazing and so easy. We never had any homework other than just having to write our final paper which we submitted in parts. He is so caring and generous and truly took so much stress off my back. He kept telling me not to stress that we are all new to this. So recommend.

This class had 4 1200 word papers and discussion posts instead of tests and was co-taught by Dr. Kern. Dr. McHale gave really interesting lectures and was happy to answer any questions. He gives good feedback on the papers and is very accessible outside of class.

Professor McHale is an incredible lecturer. Since I took this class in AU20, I didn't see his lecture in person or synchronously and I didn't get to interact with him at all but I still respected him and loved his lectures. He organizes the course material flawlessly and makes you as invested in the literature as he is. Amazing class.

Took 3372 sci fi lit for my lit GE. Totally loved this class. Each week, you read 2 short stories, then watch the associated lectures & write a couple discussion posts. There's a total of 5 2-page reaction papers throughout the semester & a 5 pg final paper. Great selection of stories & Prof McHale gives interesting lectures. McHale's a cool guy

If you have the option to take narrative theory with Dr. McHale, I would advise you to take advantage of it. He is incredibly knowledgeable about this topic, and his lectures are always a lot of fun. A lot of the material is daunting, but he does an amazing job of making it all make sense.

Professor McHale is one of my favorite professors at OSU. He is extremely knowledgeable and a truly great professor. The course is well planned out. If you're looking for an easy Literature GE, I wouldn't recommend this course unless you enjoy English. You have to stay on top of the readings to do well, and each exam is worth 30% of your grade.
Awesome lectures, reasonable workload, quizzes make sense if you pay attention and actually read what is assigned. You'll read a wide array of enjoyable literature --- just stay on top of it.

Professor McHale is great! Very straight forward, well designed course. However, there arent many grades in the course: 2 exams, a weekly quiz, and a few homework assignments. Each point corresponds to 1 percentage point in the course; so, if you tank a couple quizzes, you could be down a letter grade. Great class though!

Brian is passionate about what he teaches and it shows in her teaching. The most interesting english class I've taken thus far. 12 easy weekly quizzes (3pt/each), and 2 lowest dropped. Midterm and Final (30pts/each) and 5 weekly discussion questions (2pts/each). Has clear grading policy and if you pay attention in lecture, you'll get an A.

Most interesting english class I've taken. Goes through material quickly, but lectures are very clear and easy to follow. Has a straightforward testing and grading approach; he understands that not everyone is an english major. Reading the pieces before class and paying attention in lectures will definitely get you an A in the class.

Ugh. I can tell he's very intelligent but I HATE the set up of the class. It's so broad, and they way he sets up questions and grades is DUMB. The questions are super broad but he wants super specific answers. There's no papers, just tests, and it's 30 questions for 30% of your grade, so miss a question and it goes down. Def wouldn't recommend.

I've taken multiple classes with Prof. McHale because he's very knowledgeable and encourages discussion on the texts used for class. I found his lectures entertaining and he knows a lot of literary history to provide context for discussions. His classes are what you would expect from a discussion based lit course. You get the grade you work for.
Brian McHale is a truly great professor. Ohio State is lucky to have him and I count myself fortunate to have studied with him as an undergrad. Changed my life.

I had him for 20th Century Poetry. He's extremely knowledgeable and included art and history in all of his lessons to provide context. Classes were well balanced between lectures, small group discussion, and whole class discussion. He was always willing to consider individual interpretations of the reading and the work load was reasonable.

Absolutely one of the best professors at OSU. Leading expert in narrative theory/literary criticism but always very approachable and very fun. Simplifies abstract concepts of narratology but in a way that is deeply respectful towards intellectual contributions of students. 10/10, would recommend

His narrative theory class if great.  Pretty difficult, a lot of reading a few longer papers, but I honestly believe I learned more from this class than almost any other her at OSU. If you're an English Major, you NEED to take this class

Would not recommend taking this class if you're looking for an easy literature GE. Lectures are very dull and boring but mandatory. Attendance sheets are passed out at each class and recitation. Perfect class for someone who is an English major and loves to read old works of literature. There is a lot of readings every week & weekly quizzes.

Brian is a legend. He's a Rhodes Scholar, so his brilliance speaks for itself. He is passionate, helpful, and very clear. He knows this class is not all English majors, so he does more than enough to make it accessible. If you  need the Literature GEC, take this class!
Keep up with reading and study the powerpoint lectures before a quiz and you will pass class easy.

I loved this class! Great readings, great analysis in class, very reasonable work load, easy quizzes each week. You MUST study & read to pass. Lectures were very well-organized. TAs & McHale were all very available to ask questions. McHale is very passionate about lit & it makes the class VERY enjoyable. Highly recommended!!

Really difficult class about literary theory and criticism, but Professor McHale always worked hard to help everyone understand. Really kind, great professor. Don't hesitate to step outside your comfort zone and take a class with him.
McHale's classes allowed me to grow into a better thinker, writer, and person. Take anything he's teaching.

Professor McHale is a great professor, one of the best English instructors here at Ohio State. The texts he selected for the course were interesting and engaging. The workload is very manageable; only 3 short written reflections, one of which is developed into a longer final paper. I would definitely recommend Professor McHale!

McHale is the man.  Completely approachable for any level student, easy guy to talk to, and he evaluates students based on their willingness to make an effort in class, and without much criticism.  Class is loosely guided but in a way that helps students grasp alternate viewpoints and possibilities... but he knows what's really up. Great teacher.

Professor McHale is the postmodern critic par excellence and the Don Juan of postmodern theorists. This ravishing man is, quite simply, the sine qua non of 21st century intellects; he is the alpha and omega of narratology -- a god beside whom all others are merely mortal.  To attend a McHale seminar is to witness the apex of human consciousness.

Professor McHale is the postmodern critic par excellence and the Don Juan of postmodernist theorists. This ravishing man is, quite simply, the sine qua non of 21st century intellects; he is the alpha and omega of narratology -- a god beside whom all others are merely mortal.  To attend a McHale seminar is to witness the apex of human consciousness.

Very sociable personality, though he can get caught in his own world every once in awhile. Class was lacking in structure at times (often just becoming an open forum, rather than a real discussion/ debate); but, McHale was still able to keep material very interesting.
Can be difficult and a little intimidating. He will tell you when you're wrong, but he isn't unfair or mean about it. You'll learn a lot from him!

McHale is one of the most boring teachers ever.  I feel like am attending a book club meeting.  Everyone just talks about what they think of parts of texts (which is good) but he seems to lack any structure or purposeful element in his lecture.  The good thing is that the books are pretty good and their are only 4 assignments for the qtr.

Great teacher, easy grader; even though the material was difficult (critical theory) he provided resources to help and understood that we wouldn't be top critics at our first stab. Definatly recommend him!

Dr. McHale was an very good professor.  He led discussions well and was very nice and accommodating if you had to miss class.  He clearly is extremely intelligent and had a lot of interesting things to say about the books we were reading.  Class was stimulating and assignments were fairly easy, and he graded fairly.  And he's very well dressed. ;)

A very interesting professor; leads class discussions about the books and tries not to stay too long on one little nuance. He's a bit elitist, but nothing that would interfere with the class. I'd take another course from him.

Nice guy but his grading is arbitrary. Some people wrote papers without reading the material and received better grades than me, and I actually did all of the work. If you ask for clarification on the papers he'll answer nebulously. Interesting ideas, but you just regurgitate narrative theory, not critically analyze lit. Would not recommend
VERY boring and often looses his key points in rambling lectures.  vague grader. very disappointing.
McHale is totally sweet. He's such a great instructor, and his class made me really consider every piece of literature that we read. I loved his methods of getting us to engage with the text.

McHale enjoys uncanny skill at drawing the best from classroom discussion.  He is superbly prepared but waits for student engagement to make his points.  A slight tendancy to over-interpret is not surprising considering his agile, fine-tuned intellect. He is widely read both in the canon and in popular culture:  a literary theorist for all seasons.
Great teacher, excellent person. Take any class he's teaching
Twentieth Century American Lit. like no other class. I thought I knew all 20th century American writers until I took this seminar, count on McHale to teach you something you never heard about.

He's one of the reasons I'd applied to OSU- a prolific and brilliant scholar--and signed up expecting to be dazzled. We read some fantastic (whacky) stuff & he is really very amiable despite his stature. But some of us felt he could have chipped in much more. Students can learn from each other, but complete laissez-faire has its limitations.

Perfect reading assignments, unique class organization, extremely knowledgable lecture, paper assignments that aided subject comprehension, excellent class discussions, and a zero-tolerance attendence policy - the man means business.  I highly recommend McHale, in my opinion the best teacher in the english department at OSU.
This was the easiest class I had in a long time. Very easy to please.
No Comments
One of the best Professors I ever had, very knowledgable. Very helful with research papers and reading ideas
Takes over class discussions with long digressions, hard to understand his grading - sometimes he's lenient, sometimes he's very strict.
Nice guy, but SO BORING. Uses the entire class time to analyze works in a way that have NOTHING TO DO WITH THE CLASS.

Professor was amazing, the class focuses around immigration and you write a fiction and non-fiction paper for the midterms and one final project paper. He had super interesting lectures and I loved going to his class. Even my roommate loved to sit in on his lectures, which speaks volumes on how good he is.

The class centers around a class theme that dictates your semester-long paper. He is mainly interested in African culture and literature which you discuss and read throughout the semester. He's a nice guy but classes often feel useless because only about 10 or 15 minutes of helpful material is actually covered. Attendance is mandatory.

She was very kind and left helpful feedback for posts and drafts for projects! The first half of the class involved discussion posts and the second was for the project where we wrote our story drafts. The class was very manageable, and the textbook she includes has very useful writing tips. The short stories chosen were interesting and diverse!
Really loved this class, very inclusive and overall great prof
Pretty good class, learned a lot and it was a small size.

Professor Richards was by far my favorite professor this semester. He grades easy, as long as you try and is very understanding of your problems. Attendance does matter in this class because most of the class is student lead and full of discussion. He makes the class very enjoyable and is a great teacher.

I took Nathan Richard's class for my second year writing credit and really enjoyed it. Make sure to participate in class because it is graded, but he is overall a very forgiving grader who wants to see you succeed.

All of the concepts required for the course were outlined in weekly outlines of the material that we would be covering. Usually 1-3 readings (sometimes movies/podcasts/small books) per week, most of which were fairly interesting. He does check if you read the material with weekly comprehension quizzes, so you can't really skip them.

So bad. You basically teach yourself. Had another professor lecture over the same content and it was much better comparatively. Worst professor Ive ever had. He makes no sense. Doesnt teach anything just rambles about nonsense that doesnt matter.
Seth is an extremely chill professor, in all senses of the word. While you can pretty much sneeze and get an A in the class, it is extremely boring. I used this class as a study hall.

The lectures are SO SO SO SO boring. Seth is a nice guy, but he doesn't reply to emails. His lecture slides are stuffed with information which he doesn't present in an easy way at all. However, the class was pretty easy with 2 exams, 3 papers, and 20% of the grade for attendance and participation. I used it as a study hall.
Seth is one of the best instructors I have had, including the ones at OSU and Ohio Northern University. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, do it.

I took Seth for a Religious and Diversity writing class. Overall he's a really nice guy and the class is not difficult. He assigns extremely long readings that you discuss in class the next day, but really wasn't necessary to read them. Not many assignments and he's a pretty easy grader. Class was boring but it's religion so not really his fault

Lee is an amazing professor and I truly enjoyed his class. He is very intelligent and insightful when it comes to publishing. Although he is a nice guy, I would have preferred more structure for class. Grading criteria for work was unclear and his feedback could be more in depth. This was not a major issue, though.

Prof Martin talks a LOT. The first few weeks were easily ninety minutes straight of listening to him talk about nothing relating to what we were working on. Once we got to workshops, he would get easily sidetracked. Feedback he gave was next to nothing. I learned more from my classmates than I did from him.
Brilliant writer, heartbreaking, and such a nice guy!
Not a smart guy. Makes corny jokes and brings windup toys to class. Champions mediocre work. Runs class like a Sunday school. Yuck.

A great instructor, and a genuinely cool human being.  I learned a lot from him; his comments on my stories were always helpful, and he always seemed to know exactly what I was trying to do with my writing.
Very good teacher. He will definitely improve your writing. But you do have to work for it!
I've been taking this guy's classes for three years, and I wish I could take them for three more. He's the gold standard.
Very good teacha!
Easily the best teacher I've ever had.
Just amazing.  So gentle and yet he can tell you exactly what your story is about when writing.  He really pushes you to be a better writer.
Very smart, very eloquent.  Great teacher.  You have to do your work for the grade.

The material was really well organized and the assignments weren't too much. The professor really enjoys spirited conversation about the readings and encourages everyone to think critically and build off of each other. You HAVE to participate in class A LOT to get a good grade though. I learned a lot from her and it wasn't boring at all.

She gives a lot of readings & expects you to read every little bit, but the actual course is interesting. I took her for English 4592. I thought she was going to be a lot stricter on participation grades but if you show up & look interested, she will give you an A. Her lectures were also interesting & it's clear she knows what she's talking about.

I took her Literary Locations class for Austen and Hardy. She is very knowledgeable about the subject and her lectures were very engaging. She isn't afraid to challenge your ideas and make you think about your arguments. The reading was manageable and the assignments were straightforward. Meeting with her outside of class definitely helps.

I took Professor Warhol's class as required for all English majors, and don't know why we had an entire class period devoted to trans and gender politics. She required us to read 50-70 pages and provide a 250 word response between each class. In addition, we were expected to take a midterm and final, while also writing papers. I dropped her class

Robyn was a very interesting professor and you could tell she loves what she does which makes the class more enjoyable. You will be reading ALOT. but alot of the poems and novels are interesting. You have 2 assignments due every week on the reading (its not that bad). You have 2 exams but they are easy if you read the material. Take her!

Great teacher. Books are required and assigns readings out of them. Each week she posts questions on the readings and assigns a page response for homework. Attendance is taken by a sign in sheet and powerpoints are very useful. However, she does gives tests. Midterm and Final are T F and matching a passage with its author, year, and what is happeni

Professor Warhol's Austen and Hardy literary locations class was the most intellectually stimulating environment I've been in during college. She asks thought provoking questions and encourages class discussion to push her students to think for themselves. As long as you do the reading you'll be fine. Wonderful educator and person.

Professor Warhol genuinely cares about what she's teaching, and that shows. Attendance is extremely important to both lectures and recitations. Lots of reading, but manageable. Does the class backwards.

She's pretty great, very nice and genuinely cares about her subject. She does throw a fit if a student gets up and leaves during class (only if they didn't talk to her beforehand). Her lectures are genuinely quite interesting and thorough. The reading assignments can be a bit on the longer side ( the longest is only 50 pages) but it's enjoyable.

The class is structured great, but the professor is awful. Warhol will call out a student for getting up during class for "interrupting", when really she is the one interrupting the class. There is a writing assignment due before every class but they only grade 4 randomly. The readings are various in length, from half a page to a novel excerpt.....

Prof Natasha is a very kind instructor. I took 1901 in last semester, she graded every assignments reasonable and always gave feedbacks to every assignments. In addition, the difficulty of the course is not very hard.
This class is one hundred percent nonsense. You learn nothing useful to your career. He is also arrogant in front of the class and made it not fun.
Class sucks and is useless unless your an English major.
Such a dumb class. His grading is very subjective and even though I followed all his guidelines he constantly took points of my assignments.
Very arrogant professor. His whole class is just about writing nonsense.
His entire class was just to write about cars, which was total nonsense. Knit picks on stuff and always enjoys taking points off.

Arielles class is easy, as this was an intro English course. We had very few assignments per week and most were graded off completion. She is very lenient in grading and will excuse bad grammar as long as your writing makes sense and you have an original thought. Overall very nice and loved the class!

This class was relatively simple in terms of what was asked... write a few papers and create a few presentations. However, this professor really does not help assist you when looking for things to correct on papers. She gives really poor feedback after taking weeks to grade them. She left a one sentence feedback on a paper I had to revise.

I throughly enjoyed Professor Luthras class. I would highly recommend taking freshman English with him. This class wasnt like your typical high school English class where all you do is read long texts and write essays. In class, we debated and discussed relevant topics to our current society. We were also able to be creative with our projects.

Professor Luthra is very sincere and makes sure that all students feel heard and are given attention. The one thing that really stood out in his class was his willingness to go beyond regular hours to meet up with students and clarify their doubts. It was a challenging class but he made it easy to navigate. He genuinely cares for your success! :):)

I loved this class! It is very participation-centered, so you get out of it what you put into it. Sometimes the assignments can be a bit difficult to interpret, but Professor Luthra is very caring and works hard to help students! He is very understanding and works to make the class accessible for all students.

Will assign a lot of work and reading and loves to do group work so be ready to work in groups. The assignments are sometimes hard to understand but he will help you as much as you need and he is very caring for his students and makes it known. A challenging class but his strong efforts make up for it.
AWESOME professor! He's down to earth and loved by the class, and he gives great feedback to help you improve as a writer.

I took this class AU20 during the pandemic and professor Williams managed to become my favorite professor. We have to read a book a week but they are easy reads and very interesting. He is lenient and will give you more time to finish the book if needed. Class conversations were always so fun and kept me engaged. I couldnt recommend this more.

We had to read a book a weak, which was a lot but they were easy reads and you could get by only reading half the book. There were two discussion posts due a week and four essays due for the entire semester. Overall not a lot of work and fairly easy. Loved this class!!! Would take Prof. Williams again. Tip: don't buy the books, borrow thru library.
don't need to read as long as you show up to lecture. Not too much work, pretty easy grader. Cool guy

Loved this man. There were quizzes every Friday, but if you read and/or went to lectures, they are not bad. I thought he was fair with the amount of reading he gave at a time and with grading papers. He was very funny and an overall, really cool guy. He did wear the same green shirt every day which I thought was funny. Solid lit GE option!

I took this class to fulfill a literature GE and it was the most demanding GE I have taken. It was a lot of reading (three 400 + page books). Didn't do all the reading, but you need to go to class if you don't read. The midterm and final were curved by 15 points each. We had 5 online quizzes & one 3 page paper. Overall not bad and Hank was great!

He was decent. Very knowledgeable, but not very engaging. We had weekly quizzes (dropped the lowest grade), no midterm, two papers (three pages), and a final group project. Got by without reading some of the books, but only because I took notes during lecture. Decent choice for honors lit GE. Unrelated but he wore the same outfit every day...?

He is a great professor. CLAS 1101 is a relatively typical class in terms of difficulty. It wasn't easy, but it was still very manageable. If you are considering taking this course, I would recommend it, especially if you don't mind reading ancient literature.

great professor, easy class. he made the material interesting and wasn't a pain to listen to. i literally didn't read any of the books and still got an A. going to lecture is important for attendance points and keeping up with the material if you don't read the books (do one or the other).
He was a really funny professor, made lectures endurable. Just show up and pay attention to lecture and you'll do amazing

Lectures aren't mandatory but he takes random attendance. You MUST read to pass. Any information in the books is fair game even if he doesn't go over it in class. Exams are pretty straight forward as long as you read and go to lecture occasionally. Stay on top of readings. He also offers a ton of extra credit. Plus, he's really cute and funny.

He was super fun at first and made class interesting, but he seems very disorganized and isn't always clear on what he wants on assignments. The first exam was hard but the rest were pretty easy. I don't even know how to rank him lol I'd definitely say attend lecture he says if you attend and pay attention you should get an easy A

I loved Hank! He's such a funny guy, kept the class interesting, and is SUPER hot. You definitely need to attend lectures because he gives random attendance quizzes, but they're super easy - usually 1 short answer. Each paper only needed to be a page long, and the grading was super fair. Just show up to class, read the books, and you're set!
Great professor who really cares about his students. Actually helpful when it comes to English.

I loved his class. He is very enthusiastic about English which makes class more fun. You do discussion posts 3 times a week that take prob 20 mins and work on a paper all term. He didn't seem to care if people were missing from class as long as they turned in assignments but I also didn't see their grade book so they could've gotten points off.

As a Gen Ed, I found this class and professor to be fun and easy. If you take the time to complete and try in the class you'll do great. He's a very easygoing and approachable teacher. Highly recommend

Professor Leavitt was a great professor. He always made students feel comfortable and challenged them without ever being too harsh. He is very funny and tried to create relationships with his students. Out of all the classes I have taken so far at Ohio State, this one felt most like a community. Overall, would defiantly take his class again!

He's a great professor and we only have 3 discussion posts that are 200 words each week. The class only has one essay to write that you keep adding to over the semester. Overall, I loved this class because it was small and he actually cares about his students.

Professor Leavitt was my favorite teacher my first semester at Ohio State. He may make you play uncomfortable get to know you games, but he is super funny and understanding. Our class was very interactive and I actually really enjoyed going every week! If I could take a class that he teaches again I 100% would.

She is a nice person, however, if you do not agree with her politically fake it. If you contribute to class discussions and relate to her opinions and agree with her you will do fine. She is a very easy grader and nice. If you need an extension on anything she will grant it. Just be aware of her beliefs and don't argue about them.

Dr. Kafantaris is the most intelligent professor I've ever met. She is so smart and well spoken. Her class is an easy A as long as you do the few assignments. She doesn't take off points for late work and attendance isn't part of your grade. She cares so deeply about every single student and leaves really helpful and genuine feedback on everything.
The worst teacher i have ever met? I ma so confused why the grade of final part is so low but high grades of parts before. It is the collection of all of them??? NEVER take her class again........

Show up to class, participate in discussions and write sensible papers. It will be easy because her feedback is good and peer reviews help a lot. Papers might seem overwhelming but they're broken up into easily doable pieces. Also, you'll never read the book after the first 3 lectures so don't buy it because she has additional copies.

Mira was a great professor and anyone who says otherwise is just stupid. If you show up and do the assignments the way she wants you to (which is usually pretty clearly explained) then you will get an A no doubt. The final paper can be intimidating but if you work on it bit by bit and make sure that you include everything she wants you'll be fine

As an older student I've taken a lot of courses by a lot of professors. If I were you, I would not, I repeat NOT take this english class by her. She was always an easy grader towards me. I showed up and did my work, but there were a couple of times where she was very disrespectful towards other students. Don't plan to show up late or ask for help.
Dr. Kafantaris is the best teacher ever. Her grading is super fair, and easy A. She's a good teacher and loves her students. She is very considerate and gives amazing feedback when needed.

Professor Kafantaris made it very clear from the beginning of the term what was expected of us. No cellphones during class and print out the readings before you get to class. Follow those two rules, put a little effort into the essays (which are not even that long), and you'll do well. Her grading is fair and you can tell she loves what she does.

I honestly did not like her that much in the 1st few weeks however now that its towards the end of the semester& I've gotten to know her a little more, I really did enjoyed her class. She's nice, however if you ask her to give you opinions on your paper or ask for help she'll say" i can't, its not fair to other students" which I do not understand.

I love her. She is very supportive and gives good feedback. If you pay attention in class and take notes, you'll definitely know what she wants and expects from you. She has a 'no handphones in class' rule and expects students to print out the reading materials before class. If you follow them, you're good. She grades fairly too.

Helpful professor if you take advantage of the feedback she offers. Do the reading, pay attention in class, participate in discussion. If the work is put in the grade will follow. She is very fair, but expects that you do your reading and have access to the reading in class (for discussion).

Like other people said, I tried my best and got a C- on my paper.  She is not very nice either. Just because I didn't print out the reading material (that we didn't even use in class) she told me to walk out of the class. She's not very clear on what she want from students either and everyone is required to talk in that class for participation.

I think I should have write this earlier, so less students would suffer from her class. The course topic is boring and much harder comparing with ALL of the other instructors. She often couldn't express her opinion clearly. If you do something wrong, don't expect any help from her. Instead, you can feel disrespect from her face. Better NOT take it.
Tough grader. I tried my best but I got C for my papers.

At first she is a little hard to read and intimidating. But as the semester went on I really enjoyed her class. There are no tests, just a few assignments here and there and a big project at the end. Honestly, I have grown to just adore her. She is well educated, but can be funny and treats you like an adult. I would definitely take her again!

Professor Honeycutt is really nice and is always willing to help students in class and during office hours. He lectures are very organized and straightforward. There is a textbook but students only read it if they need outside help with their essays. Overall, this class is really simple if you do your assignments and attend lecture.

While I took this class purely to fulfil a GE credit, I found myself really enjoying the easy going nature of the professor and the class. It is easy to tell how much professor Thomas cares about her students and the subject matter. Plus we all loved spending class time with her pup Cascade!
I loved having Nikki as a professor! She makes class fun and engaging and is a very caring professor. She has experience in the subject and truly wants her students to succeed!

Professor Ko is a great poetry professor! I enjoyed her enthusiasm in class each day, her efficiency in teaching different styles of poetry, and her experience in the craft. Her class is very fun and knowledgeable!

BEST PROF EVER. She understands you have a lot going on as a student and she is super flexible with deadlines and gives open-ended assignments so you can do stuff you are passionate about and have fun with it. She grades very fairly, so do the work and the readings and you are set! It's a really fun class, not overwhelming at all!

Assignments are easily laid out and she doesn't grade too harshly. Easy to reach and responsive to any questions anyone may have. Come to class with at least one question about any readings, though, and be ready to participate at least a little bit. Deadlines are very negotiable, so don't be afraid to ask for extensions.

Morgan cares about her students so much, SHE WANTS YOU TO SUCCEED! As long as you show up and thoughtfully complete your assignments, you're golden! If you are having difficulties with the assignments or deadlines just communicate with her and she will be understanding!
I love Hannah so much she is so kind and caring about her students and will really take the time to answer questions and listen to any opinion.

Hannah is amazing! She works really hard to make sure all assignments have a good description with no room for confusion. She also is super accessible outside of class and will make sure you get the extra help if you need it. The class is based around 1 paper and 1 presentation but she breaks it down into separate stages, making it very manageable.

Prof Chen was very kind. The online lecture was a bit stale- not much student participation. He was very knowledgable, just wasn't the most entertaining (definitely because it was online)- If WGSST is your major, I think you'll find it very interesting! Easy class with not many assignments. He's super understanding as well- just communicate!

Professor Chen was incredibly caring and kind professor. But, the class was so boring and very much dead. It might have been better as an in person class. Just do the readings when the assignments come out and you'll be okay. Super easy class, especially for a gen ed.

I really enjoyed this Intro To Queer Studies class. Professor Chen is incredibly smart and very informed. There was a lot that I didn't pick up since it was my first exposure to a class like this one, but also there was a lot I also learned. They definitely choose a lot of texts that are critical to queer history and queer thought for the class.

Professor Chen seems like a nice person. But the lextures are dry and hard to pay attention to. Its also the end of the semester and I havent gotten any grades back. I have no idea how Im doing in the class before I approach the final. The amount of reading in this class is also over the top, in my opinion. Be aware of that- so. much. reading.

Dr. Chen is a very smart, intellectual person, but not the greatest instructor. The lectures are too fast-paced and the slides are often a giant wall of text that is impossible to get notes from. Don't take this class if you're not interested in the topic, it is often a dry course and not an easy A.

Dr. Chen is bloody brilliant, but sometimes he gets lost in jargon that baffles even the smartest people in class. Chen's course(s) will challenge your ethics, morals, and, frankly, your understanding of reality in order to conceptualize new forms of "being". How's that for a college class? Top-notch. Be sure to read in order to keep up.

Professor Laamanen was pretty chill. The lectures were pretty clear cut and he cared about the topics of film. He was kind and understanding of all of his students. The homework was pretty easy and we didn't have too many overall assignments.

Professor Laamanen is heaven-sent! He's the best English teacher I've ever had. He doesn't judge you and instead, he offers words of encouragement when you're struggling. Don't ever hesitate to ask him anything!

In short, this man was a godsend. Never have I had a more caring, optimistic, and understanding professor than Carl. His class was always something to look forward to. Extremely lenient when it comes to choosing how you want to approach assignments, and very generous when grading. There when you need him and his feedback is useful. Superb prof.

An amazing professor I would definitely recommend. He makes everyone feel comfortable in the class and is very understanding of late work. Makes the class fun by giving you writing topics you enjoy. Grades easy as long as you follow directions.

I took English 2367 with prof Laamanen at CSCC and loved his class! He makes every one of his assignments clear and easy to understand. I loved how we chose what we wrote about as long as it fit the criteria of the prompt. I took his class during the start of COVID and he made it super easy to adapt to the online version of the class!
Outstanding professor who knows him material. He gives the right amount of homework and is very clear on his expectations.
She is really a good instructor. She gives credits easily and is always willing to help. If you take her classes seriously, you will get good grades.
Do not take her class!
Do not take her class! Unless you do not want to get high scores.

She doesnt know how to be a instructor. This is the only reason I have bad impression about my freshman year. If you are in a small class, be careful. She grades your work partly by personal impression. If you got an low grade, dont send her email you wont get any reply.  Relax, it will not gonna kill you! This was her words. God.
If you do not want to fail 1902, just drop this professor's class
choose someone else. true words

Professor Hewitt is truly one of my favorite professors at OSU. She is brilliant and very funny. Furthermore, she cares about how she teaches and regularly asks for student feedback and is open to changing class methods if students are not learning well with the class structure.

Beth is one of the smartest people Ive ever met. She knows her subject material inside and out, and she encourages the class to have great discussions. Her passion is infectious. She assigns lots of reading, but isnt a tough grader on non-essays. She extends deadlines to make things easier for her students. Shes so awesome. Take her class!!!!!!

Prof Hewitt was a great professor. She genuinely wanted to teach us. The course was more work than probably needed, but the material was intriguing. I took the course in SP20 so COVID made us have to transition lectures online, but she was able to do it fairly well & graded a little easier for the remaining weeks.

Easily one of the best professors I have had (so far) at OSU. Dr. Hewitt is very funny and very helpful if the material from the novels seems hard to understand. I had no problem approaching her outside of class with any questions and she was extremely helpful and very friendly to all of her students. Would definitely recommend her.
Beth is a brilliant, compassionate, and glorious land mermaid. She knows her subject matter so well and truly educates her students. She also has a lot of great anecdotes.

Elizabeth Hewitt could possibly be my favorite professor at Ohio State. She is so funny and really makes class interesting (since it lecture based, she does talk a lot). She encourages discussion and wants everyone to be engaged. If you like to sit on your phone a lot, don't take her class - she hates that. Lowest quiz grade is dropped as well!

Way, way too much effort required. She's a good lecturer and really digs into the material, but her expectations for the students are kinda unreasonable for a 3 credit-hour course. Hewitt expects you to read everything, write on every thing you read about, and extensively participate every week online and in class AND submit a journal every week.

Beth knows her subject matter extremely well, and she cares about the intellectual development of her students. She's easily one of the best profs at Ohio State. If you attend class and keep up with the reading, an A should be manageable.
She is very good at discussions. The downside is a lot of reading in short periods of time.

I've been in higher ed. 7 years and I can unequivocally say Beth is the best professor I've ever had. She's a fantastic discussion leader, an excellent close reader, and an absolutely hilarious person. If you're not into quirky, though, you might dislike her. One of her interests is the history of office supplies, if that tells you anything.

Hewitt is a very intelligent professor. I highly recommend her, but not for slackers. Very specific about how to succeed and holds students to it. Cares for her students and will always meet outside class. Funny. Well worth taking classes from.
Go to class. Take notes and pay attention. Try. It's as simple as that. She's AMAZING. Best class/professor I've had at OSU.

Prof. Hewitt is among the best at OSU. She wants her students to succeed: if you show some dedication, she'll more than meet you halfway. She was incredibly understanding of some family issues I experienced throughout the semester and remarkably generous with her time. She also made me love Melville. If you're an English major, take her classes!
Professor Hewitt is awesome, and she will help you out if you ask. Her lectures are dynamic, and she really cared about us as students.
Quite simply, she's awesome!
Would not recommend.
Really strict on grades, same couple of kids talk in discussion, only ever one "correct" interpretation of works- hers. oftentimes unclear about what is required as assignments. wouldn't recommend

I love Professor Hewitt! This is the second class I've taken with her, and in my opinion, she's the best at OSU.  Attend class, but some effort into the assignments, and do the reading.  She'll do just about anything for students who show a little effort.  And I'm pretty sure she's a genius.

Prof. Hewitt was a wonderful instructor! She is very passionate about this subject and she makes the subject interesting. If you do the assigned reading, you'll be fine. Highest Recommendation for her!

No quizzes in this class- but iscussions every day.  She is seriously awesome though.  As a teacher and as a person.  She really loves what she teaches.  LOTS of reading, but she picks great books (-Middlemarch..) to read during the semester.  Discussions were always lively and we had fun.  I am really going to miss her class!

Professor Hewitt is great at what she does.  She makes herself readily available to help her students. Lectures are somewhat boring but thorough (you could probably pass solely by taking good notes). She gives great feedback on papers. The only downside is that you WILL have quizzes...almost weekly. Don't get discouraged, though; TAKE HER CLASSES!

Professor Hewitt was unique in that she really helped us as students. She grades papers with a strict sense of duty, but she gives the chance for a rewrite. I took a class you would take as a jr. or senor, so at this level, you should be working for your grade. Expect to learn, but expect to work. For serious students.

She gives no good feedback on papers, you never know what you are actually supposed to write about. She is harsh with participation and annoyingly tedious with how she gives you the points. Her lectures make no sense to what you read and sometimes she doesn't even know what she is talking about. Avoid her if you can.

Be prepared to work for your grade. Be prepared to sit through long, boring lectures for your grade. Be prepared to take weekly quizzes in your off-time. Be prepared to get graded harshly, with everything you write put under scrutiny. Sound bad? Well be prepared to have a teacher who pushes and encourages you as well, and is always willing to help.

Definitely a charismatic teacher with some funny quirks. Be prepared to work for your grade and to sit through the MOST BORING AND DULL lectures though. Class consisted entirely of 2 papers and a final exam. However Beth is very eager to help and open to suggestions and discussion on what she wants from you. She's very encouraging. Would recommend.

Hewitt's class seemed to me a case of a great professor plagued by unenjoyable literature. I found two of our novels absolutely dreadful, and some of the supplementary readings were boring as well. However, she is so excited about the material and has a great sense of humor. She definitely knows her stuff and is also supportive and helpful.
Awesome professor. Knows her stuff. Very interesting. Would definitely take more of her classes.
This is what I thought college professors are suppose to be like, challenging and willing to help their students succeed. Class act. Love her. Can't wait to take more of her classes.
A really difficult teacher to figure out. She says one thing but when it comes to brass tacks she means another. Expectations too high (and so so vague) concerning papers. Avoid if you can.

I loved having Dr. Hewitt as an instructor.  She was tough but her class will make you feel like you really learned something by the quarter's end.  Her lectures are intellectually engaging and delivered with a quirky sense of humor.  Go to class, do the reading, and participate (she loves this) and she will do everything she can to help you out.
Prof. Hewitt is lovely! Her classes are interesting and the material we read was diverse and engaging. She grades a little tough, but fair. She's very helpful and an awesome professor!

Hewitt was an awesome professor! I took H398 because it was mandatory, but the books she chose, on the whole, were really awesome (graphic novels, anyone?). She was insightful, helpful, and pretty hilarious whether she meant to be or not.Despite her unfortunate love of Melville, my friend and I have dubbed her "Goddess Beth Hewitt" :)

She's one of my favorite professors I've ever had. The books she chose were a struggle, but the discussion was so helpful. She's incredibly intelligent (sometimes I felt like I needed a dictionary when she spoke) and funny. Though the reading was challenging, she didn't grade hard and gave choices in paper topics. I would definately take her again!

Yes, a lot of comments on papers, so I knew how to improve.  Harder than some of my professors, and I didn't like some of the books chosen for class, but there was a lot of choice with regard to doing the assignments.  Participate in class- this is essential- and she will give you the benefit of the doubt.

Hewitt is incredibly insightful; her guided discussions are enlightening and her extensive feedback on papers made me aware of how to become a better writer. Her class is challenging at times, but she's always willing to help and the end result of the class is definitely worth the work. She's amazing.
I loved Prof. Hewitt.  Clear, understanding prof, interesting curriculum, nice person.
Prof. Hewitt is extremely intelligent and knows her subject matter well. She is a difficult teacher, but is very fair and very worth it.
Prof. Hewitt is very accomodating in terms of due dates and office hours. She grades fairly easily, and her lectures are interesting. Loved her reading selections as well.

Professor Hewitt taught me more than anyone in my years at a student ANYWHERE. She's really helpful, grades pretty easily, doesn't expect too much, is leniant with due dates, but a stickler for attendence. If you want to be actually educated TAKE HER
Hard tests, but grades very fair.  Very clear as far as expectations and in lecture.

Professor Cook is an amazing professor! My class was completely asynchronous and whenever I would email her a question she would get back to me very quickly and give me a thorough answer. She is very caring and whats her students to succeed. I would 1000% want her as my professor again.

Professor Cook is a great professor at Ohio State. My class was completely asynchronous but she always responded to my questions quickly and thoroughly. She was always ready to set up a zoom call for me as well. If you follow the directions you will get a great grade! I would 1000% want her as my professor again.

She's a really good teacher and I learned much of writing from her. I could hardly follow at the beginning of the semester so I emailed her frenquently about everything. She replies fast and that really helps. It's really easy to get high score as long as you read the requirement and her feedback. You don't need textbook, I never open that at all.
Class was interesting and it was nice to get to choose our research/paper topic. Accessible quickly over email/office hours, which is important for an asynchronous class. Very manageable workload.
Course was asynchronous so never really interacted with her, but she was easy and accessible when needed.

Lauren was a very kind professor who seemed to have a lot of knowledge about the topic. I struggled a lot with writing the papers though, and felt that her feedback was essentially "look at the instructions," after clearly explaining that I had already done so. I wouldn't recommend adding this class if you have a heavy courseload already.

Very well laid out asynchronous course! Weekly work involved readings and participating in an open-ended discussion board. Papers and writing assignments given offered a lot of freedom and had a nice progression towards a final paper. Fantastic feedback given for every assignment, and always willing to open up a dialogue. Really cares.
Professor Cook genuinely cared about my success in her class. She always gave extensive feedback and was extremely responsive to emails. It was a joy to take her class!

Lauren Cook is such an amazing professor. You can tell that she genuinely cares about her students and will go out of her way to respond to emails and do the best she can to help out struggling students. She gives amazing feedback and is one of the few professors I have had that actually cares. Take her class if you can.

I made this account just to review Ms. Cook since she was so helpful and caring. The class itself is very easy. You basically just build on a paper the whole semester, but I still struggled conceptually. Lauren offered great grading feedback and went out of her way to respond quickly and thoroughly over email. I would recommend you take no one else

Absolutely one of the best professors in the English department! I put off taking this class for my degree but he made it bearable. He is extremely kind and caring. He brought donuts for our class at the end and was always super wholesome thanking people for participating and making class time interesting. The workload and grading are both fair.

A soft-spoken and funny guy, who really is an expert in medieval literature. The subject is hard to follow, but he makes it as easy as possible. Show up, listen, participate, take notes and you'll do well. He wants you to succeed.

Prof. Jones loves teaching and his subject matters. Classes can be a little dry, but he is lax on attendance, loves talking to his students, and is a very fair grader. There is alot of reading, so it is important to keep up with the work, since much of the grade is delegated to the last few weeks of class. Enjoyable class.
Dr. Jones is a very nice person. He responds to emails right away and is overall quick. Except for grading papers.
Good teacher, has a sense of humor.

Christopher Jones is a very good English professor. I had him at CSCC and he was very helpful. We did fun activities in his class and we only wrote about three papers. Not only that, but the topic for the papers made the project fun to write. He's pretty awesome.
Very helpful in class and in offic-hours.  He really wants everyone in his class to learn and be happy there, and he's got a great sense of humor!

Dr. Jones is phenomenal. He's one of the best professors I've ever had at Ohio State (and best English professor by miles). Very soft-spoken, but hilarious. He grades fairly, and his comments are engaging and thoughtful. He definitely cares about his students and he wants them to do well.

He is the best english professor I have ever had. He is very in-depth when grading essays and is funny and KIND, and understands that students are people. He would never make anybody feel bad about anything. He tells you exactly what he wants from you and is awesome. He knows what he wants his class to learn. I have gotten a lot out of this class.

Great professor. Highly recommended. He understood that the material was challenging and took the class through the difficult stuff, step by step. He sought to engage the class in conversation and deep analysis. You don't have to do too much work; mostly you just have to think hard.

Best college prof I've yet had. Take his class even if the material doesn't interest you--his enthusiasm for the texts is infectious. His dry humor is fantastically witty, if you pick up on it. Also--he's one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. An epic hero, in my book.
Pretty easy going guy. Little bit of lecture every class, but mostly class discussion. Very accommodating. Turned in a final paper late, but he only took off a minor number of points.
Prof. Jones is such a nice guy. He grades very fairly. He is very smart and full of interesting facts. He is also very helpful and funny at times.

Professor Jones is one of the most incredible professors I have had during my time at Ohio State. While he is very soft-spoken and humble in his lectures which can make it tough to focus, he is one of the most understanding, passionate professors at the University. I strongly recommend him to anyone.

I reccommend sitting in the front of the class, because he speaks very softly. You can tell he has a passion for medieval literature. He is very sweet, and I heard from another professor he is from the south. He does do this weird tongue thing however, and if you're fimiliar with Harry Potter, Marty Crouch does this exact thing!

Dr. Jones rocks--although a bit quirkey--he is very helpful--one of "the best of the best" at Ohio State--if you're a medievalist--be sure to take one of his classes--I couldn't have learned medieval latin without him! Class is hard--but that's what we're here for!  Very challenging but very rewarding!

He is extremely smart, definitely knows his stuff. The material is pretty dry, but, you can easily get through the class without reading all of it. His grading is EXTREMELY fair, and he genuinely wants to help students. He has a very strange sense of humor, telling us he would go "Medieval" on our asses. :) I'd reccomend him!

Dr. Jones... not a case of what you see is what you get.  He is quite quirky and seems very shy, but is really funny and gave lots of feedback on papers.  Very helpful, very dedicated.  Highly recommend
Understated craziness. Dr. Jones is great, I hope I get to take another one of his classes while I'm here.

This guy was a quiet riot.  He seems to be perpetually nervous, but he's really got a lot to him.  When I found out he liked Arrested Development I could totally understand his personality after that.  Class is easy if you go and think.  He truly does grade you on your work and only your work.  He has lots of good information, balances it all well.
He is the reason I became and English major and continued on to become an English teacher.  His passion for literature inspired me.  He made it clear that he cared about his students and his work.

Expects a lot from his students but gives a lot in return. Cares if students learn something in his class, not just get a good grade. Funny, caring and goes the extra mile for his students. One of the best at OSU.
Don't let his unassuming manner fool you, he's one of the funniest profs I've ever had.
Very funny and made mideival lit interesting. Hard exams but the material is covered in class.

Expect to learn writing skills through fun class/group activities rather than lengthy, boring lectures. He gives a a ton of valuable feedback and suggestions and is accessible outside of class. The amount of reading and writing was more than I'd expect for a 2000's level course, but it helped improve my writing and I feel less nervous sharing it.

Highly recommend Professor Jones. Very considerate and allows make up work, which is especially helpful because if you're new to some of the content in the course it can be challenging to understand at first. He allows for creative freedom in projects and gives detailed rubrics for all of them.
Koneval is a respected teacher. Her class is interesting and she cares about students.
Kinda monotone and a boring class but his feedback on papers is helpful and not a terribly tough grader.
Great professor and an easy class

He was a better then average teacher. He was clear about what he expected. Many assignments, but they weren't too terribly difficult to complete. The class was ok, not super interesting, but not super boring. He was flexible and forgiving about assignment deadlines and such, which is honestly rare in my college experience.
