The class was extremely disorganized. Grades super late. Lots of reading. Unclear grading scale and expectations. Takes hours to do homework, grades poorly unles above and beyond. Boring as can be. Argumentative. unprofessional, and counteractive to the learning process. Worst prof Ive ever taken at OSU. Strongly advise to schedule w/ dif prof.

Expect to get lots or 2 or 3/5 unless you go super above and beyond. Homeworkss take me hours and I still get a 3/5 every time. He grades by few things and provides no rubrics for all the essays . You read 5-8 stories a week so get ready to read- and yes you will have to write in depth on each one so you cannot just skip it. He ignores topics.

Most people hate Mr. Livingstons style of teaching and blame it on his ambiguous directions. I would say at first his comparisons and directions seem confusing & random, but if you ask him about the directions he will do his best to help you understand. He is understanding and would change due dates if he realizes the class is struggling.

Dr. Livingston is completely unclear in his instructions. His feedback on papers is also ambiguous and you are often left confused and frustrated on how you could improve your score. Did a group project, but he couldn't figure out how to put in different grades for each person in the group so they ended up not being graded. Textbook is confusing

instructions are consistently unclear and ambiguous. He cannot explain his own instructions, and everyone is the class is left feeling confused. The readings are too dense for an intro class. He can be rude or off-putting if someone brings up a topic he did not want to discuss or a viewpoint he doesn't consider to be valid.

Discussion based class which can help u think about things on your own but loose structure can be confusing/awk. But tells you prompts/what u need to know for exams. Lots of books, but easy reads (most online via sparknotes etc). Nice that hw always multiple(not too hard) essay prompts to choose from, grades fair. Have to do the work but not hard.

I loved him and his class. He is incredibly caring about all his students and remembers their names, is hilarious and somewhat of an old hippie. Still am connected with him two years after his class. Lenient grader, he just wants you to be inspired and do your best!
Show up and do the assignment and you get 100%. Dr. Moe is so caring and funny and has many wonderful stories. I wish he gave us better feedback, but he's a great dude.

The kindest, most caring prof I've ever had. He gives good feedback on completion grade papers so you're pretty much guaranteed to get an A. Wastes a lot of time in class but he's so entertaining and helpful it doesn't even matter.
The best professor I've ever had at the Ohio State. He really cares about his students and respect everyone. EASY A, literally, very easy

Mr. Moe is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He gets to know each student individually and is truly interested with how you are doing. Not only is he an amazing teacher, he also grades very easily. If you show up and do the work, you are guaranteed an A. Super funny guy and I am going to keep in touch with him.

Take this class if you want to enjoy your semester. Dr. Moe is hilarious, totally relaxed, and an easy A. He makes it clear at the beginning that if you turn in the work, you'll get a good grade. Some of the most fun I've had in a college course.
JOHN MOE IS THE BEST!!!!!!!!
He is the best professor I have ever met in my life!!! Dr. John is so caring about students and his class is a lot of fun. highly recommend taking his class
Best prof NA
Take whatever class you can with professor Moe. He is so chill and you are guaranteed an A just show up for class. Super sweet and nice.

Dr. Moe is probably the sweetest professor I've ever met. He's very relaxed in his class, and while there's a lot of writing, he makes it enjoyable. Attendance is mandatory, but he doesn't really care if you pay attention. As long as you do the work, you're pretty much guaranteed an A.

The best prof ever, the easiest A ever. Every class he told turned out to be an A. I actually like his personality more than the As he gave me. Log into your buckeyelink, drop all the other English classes and put your name in his class right now!

I LOVE Dr. Moe! Most chill class I have ever taken, and he genuinely seems to care about the kids he is teaching, and tries to form a relationship with his students. Also, very easy class, with little homework that is graded basically as a completion grade.

Dr. Moe told us on the first day of class that he only gives completion grades. We only had a few assignments and as long as you did them you got a 100.  Easy A but class lectures can get a little off topic and boring. Low-stress class. He doesn't follow the syllabus (cuts down on assignments).
There were a few books required, but we only read a few passages out of them. The grade wasn't his main focus, but the majority of the class got an A. He is hands down my favorite professor.
Class was pretty easy. I used homeworkdoer com for the papers

This man is hilarious. And genuinely the most interesting man I've ever met in my life. Very easy class, and he actually makes it enjoyable. Loves to talk, so try to communicate with him during the class. Makes lectures so much more fun.

Moe is a great teacher but a greater man; he cares more about teaching you about life than the grade. Never is there a day that he doesn't come to class with some story to inspire us all or just to make us laugh.

Dr Moe is a great person, and is out there to help students learn about life and become better people. His class was amazing, but my writing didn't particularly improve over the semester. You get an A for showing up and turning everything in, but I didn't get much criticism or advice on my writing. Great class though

The greatest man you will ever meet. If you need an english class, you must take it with Moe. He grades everything as A's if you turn it in, and genuinely wants you to learn more about life than anything else. Such a great guy and professor. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM.

Easily the best english professor I have ever had. Would spend most of lecture giving lessons on life rather than specific coursework. Anything turned in would be 100%, plan on taking him for future classes.

He is probably the best professor I've ever had or will ever have. He teaches you about life more than English. I have immense respect for the kind of person he is. Most down to earth person you will ever meet.

Dr. Moe is possibly the best professor at Ohio State.  He made the class more about learning than just going to be graded.  If you show up and turn everything in, you will receive an A in the class. He tells a lot of interesting stories and talks about useful information. You will be glad you took his class.
truly wonderful! made going to class a real pleasure! he really cares about all his students.

A really insightful and cultured guy. Full of hilarious stories from his youth and adulthood and alway keeps class interesting. A joyful class that made me want to travel the world. One of the few classes at OSU that you can just go to, enjoy it, get out of it what you want, put in the work, and get an A. Really can't say enough about Moe,great guy

Best prof I've ever had. If you need to take any class, go out of your way to take him.  Nicest teacher ever, takes time to know every student, hard to not get an A, discussion in class is actually insightful and often leans towards random fun stories.
Greatest professor I have ever had hands down. Seriously take his class.
Easiest class you will ever take. He gives everyone an 100% on every paper, guaranteed. He goes off on random tangents so little is ever actually accomplished. Moe is unbelievably nice.
Wonderful.

wonderful professor!!! he really makes an effort to know all of his students. yes, he is a bit random and confusing at times. but he is a really great guy!! he makes the class really fun to attend! the actual material kinda sucks, but listening to his stories really makes it worth going to class!!

Really friendly and not a difficult course.  Tries to genuinely interest students in material.  Gets rambly, but it makes the class laid back and fun.  ANYONE who needs this class for credit would be best off taking Moe.

There is hardly any work besides the essays, But those can sometimes be rather painful (But there are far fewer essays than the regular 110.01 English Class). The Class itself is really fun-- I usually hate English, but Dr. Moe's class was awesome.... TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
Take his class. Seriously, log on to buckeyelink right now and enroll.
He is the most laid back guy ever.  He wants you to understand literature through your own experiences.  In other words, a laid back class in which discussion is nearly the entire class.

Best teacher and person I have encountered at Ohio State I'm planning on take H367 with him sometime next year. He has so many insights about everything.Honestly I'd say take his class if you plan to go to Grad, Law or Med school because Dr. Moe literally knows 10 people at EVERY University making him an extremely valuable LOR for you in the future

I absolutely adore this professor! You will get an A without much effort, but he inspires you to write amazing papers. His experiences are fascinating. I highly recommend John Moe to anyone and everyone!

=)  John Moe is amazing.  He is the best prof I've had at Ohio State, and I miss seeing him twice a week.  Do the papers, and you get an A, and you don't even have to follow the prompt!  He doesn't care at all!  The best part is his crazy stories and tangents!  Take this man, he's awesome!
Extremely nice guy. VERY easy grader and very easy A. Goes on random tangents but they're always amusing stories. Recommend to anyone and everyone!
He tells you at the beginning of class that if you show up and do the work, you will get an A. If you are interested in getting an A without having to put in effort, this is the class to take!

Dr. Moe IS AWSEOME!! He is by far the BEST professor I have had at Ohio State. The class is not difficult. But the real appeal of having him is the stories that he tells. He will teach you about life and open your eyes to some things you've never even heard of. NICEST GUY EVER.
Very easy class, just show up, and make the papers mildly coherent, Moe is very interesting with very deverse set of experiences.  Great Professor to have.
AWESOME
Dr. Moe's class was really fun.
Out there kind of guy but still a good guy

Dr. Moe is a caring and intelligent professor, who always has a hilarious story to go along with his lessons. While we didn't get all that much accomplished, I thought the class was great fun, and well worth it. Plus, it's a guarenteed A, as long as you show up enough and write the papers. Fun times...

Awesome guy, if you ever get a chance to take a class with him, do it. Gauranteed A so long as you give minimal effort. He really cares about students, genuinely enjoys teaching, and makes class enjoyable. One of the best profs/teachers i've ever had. I can't recommend him enough.

GAURENTEED A!! participate a little in discussion and you only need the basic outline of the books assigned. NO EXAMS OR QUIZES!! write the papers it doesnt matter how good they are you will get an A on them and they (only 1-2 pgs.) Only 2 large papers to write (4-5 pgs.) and they are graded, given back to you to fix, then re-graded as your final g

John Moe is one of the nicest, most caring teachers i've had. My favorite professor yet. Guaranteed A as long as you particiapte in a little class discussion, and you attempt to write the two papers he makes your write per quarter. Will defidently try and get into another of his classes.

This is the best class I've ever taken.  He really cares about and takes an interest in his students.  His stories and tangents are great.  Honestly, the only way to not get an A in this class is to refuse to write papers.  Warning though, at least for my class, his prompts were sometimes hard to write about because they were all over the place.

Best teacher ever. He is so funny and he honestly loves teaching and talking to his students. He is so well rounded and so interested about the world. He's like a little kid. He always wears these Norwegian sweaters (i know cause all he does is talk about them) and lays out tons of papers on his desk but never actually uses them. He's great!!
An awesome class, because it was mainly discussion. A guaranteed A, and some good stories.

All you have to do for this class is go and write the essays, and you will get an A, you honestly don't even have to stay awake.  He is an awesome guy and has a genuine interest in his students.  Although he does go off into tangents, they are hilarious.  If you're in his class consider yourself lucky beyond all reason.
No Comments

easiest class possible and one of the most interesting. He does go off randomly sometimes and that gets boring. He takes attendance in class but i have a feeling that he wouldnt even notice if someone was gone (haha)! Lowest grade possible is prob a B+. just write the papers and you'll be fine.
Very random, but very nice. Got that "old grandpa" type of appeal. Cares a lot about his students, and grades very easily. I think the lowest you can get is a B+ if you complete all the work.
Great teacher, nice guy; I'd take another class from him in a heartbeat. Very interesting class.
No Comments
John Moe is awesome, one of the best teachers I've had!
No Comments
all around great teacher
Best professor ever. EXTREMELY easy A, while actually being insightful. Essays are cake. Take this class.
Definetly a great professor to take, does not believe in grades, and loves everyone's paper.  Is one of the nicest professors I've ever met.
John Moe is the best teacher I have every had. He teaches you about Life rather than english

best professor, bar-none.  he's funny, has completely random thinking patterns, and gives a damn enough to give out his home number in case you can't make it to class.  grading is based on effort, not merit, and participation, not accuracy.  wish he taught everything else!
Professor Moe is awesome. I don't think I'll have a better professor in college, so if you're privileged to have the opportunity, get in his class.

Prof. Moe is awesome! I really enjoyed taking this class. It was really easy and you really only have to write 4 essays the whole quarter. Some of the stuff we read was boring, but talking about it made it better. And we even had a field trip to the columbus Museum of Art. You can eat in class too.
this guy totally freaking rocks my socks. He is hilarious, a laugh a minute I tell  you what. He is kind of a treehugger but you just gotta understand him man.

Prof. Moe is a very random person. He often goes off on tangents talking about his time in Elbonia (or whatever that country was that he taught in), but he is a really nice guy. He gives everyone in class personal attention. The class is pretty easy too.
I love Prof Moe!!

Dr. Moe was one of the best instructors I have ever had.  To give you an idea of his personality, he has close ties to Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.  He does not believe in "grades," only in your understanding and success. Wonderful guy.

This guy is totally fun, easy to get along with and really open for pretty much any kind of discussion.  The papers he has you write are kinda weird and I thought pointless, but he was a great teacher anyway.

Wonderful man and instructor.  Assignments focus on developing a personal style and point of view/opinion rather than being boxed in by harsh, mundane structure.  A great professor to start your college education with.
much fun, I loved class, he lets u redue papers until you are satisfied w/grade
funny guy, what he wanted for his papers was kinda hard to understand

Professor Opliger was organized and worked hard to make the online class personal and engaging. She gave detailed feedback on all assignments. There were several online discussions, posts, and quizzes throughout the semester but the major assignments came at the end (building from previous work). I am not an English major and I enjoyed this class.
Bonnie was taught my recitation section leader for Intro to film last fall (2019). She was great!

Leaves very good feedback and you have lots of chances to revise your writing before submitting assignments worth large points . Very easy to reach on email and is always looking to help make the effort and listen to her feedback and youll get a A.

Definitely my favorite professor so far and I have not liked English since high school. Definitely helpful to the students with drafts of papers and it is hard to fail the class if you fix your papers based on her comments.
I guess he is the worst teacher in the school. He never reply students' emails. You just can't contact with him!! Why he puts his email address on syllabus if he never check it and reply?

Prof Pearson is really enjoyable. He incorporates a lot of media into his lectures and encourages class discussion (although participation isn't required). The most difficult assignment is a group project, but even that was fairly manageable. He isn't a very harsh grader. My only complaint is that he doesn't email back consistently.

George is a genuinely nice guy, but not the best professor. We've had 7 good sized assignments and only one is graded. We've peer reviewed each other so I don't know exactly what he wants from a paper. I've tried to excuse this because of corona but he didn't grade even before this happened. A good guy but I have no idea where I stand in his class.
He was literally the worst professor I've ever had. Doesn't reply to emails, hasn't graded work all semester and it's April. I have no idea what grade I have in the class.

Just had to write a few papers and quizzes. Had to buy a book for $40, you could probably get away with not reading, readings just add to the topics each week. He would not answer my emails, I almost felt ignored. This was especially difficult to deal with since it was a online class and I needed a answer to turn in my work and ended up with a 0.

Professor Price cared a lot about her students and wants to see them succeed. The projects were unique and the class structure always changed up, which kept it from being boring. She didn't seem to be too easy or too hard of a grader, and was always open to talk about your work and help you improve.

It was clear that Michelle wanted you to feel supported while also giving you constructive criticism to help you become a better writer. She created a great class environment that made everyone feel comfortable. Although there was a LOT of reading, it was because she's so interested in stories. She's an excellent professor.

A lot of reading, but an excellent literature class that talks about a lot of great topics. Easy A, in my opinion, you can rent most of the books from the local library. Make sure to turn the work in on time, and you should be fine.

A bit quirky but once you see past that, you can tell she's passionate about the subject and knows a ton! A reading and 2 typed questions on it are due every class. Class is heavily discussion-based, a bit of lecture, and turn in your notes on it at the end. 2 short papers and a final paper (that can be written, recorded, or filmed).

Professor Shuman was a very interesting lecture! I wasn't too happy when my advisor put me in this class, but I actually enjoyed it a lot! Easy A if you're a good writer, but do not recommend this class if you aren't. However, she said she would allow you to rewrite and improve, so she is very lenient! Never thought I would like folk writing!

This class is a minimal amount of work - four 1-2 page papers and a final 5-8 page paper, but that doesn't mean it's an easy A. Professor Shuman is very experienced, but sometimes it's not totally clear what she wants from an assignment. She allows you to redo them if you don't like your grade, but she definitely makes you work for the A.

Wonderful professor with the help of her wonderful TA, but the criteria of grading in the class don't altogether make sense and the assignments have yet to be actually graded. Most of the time she doesn't even ask us to turn them in. More of a "come with ideas" kind of thing.

This course was a 6-day trip to New York to attend the HRW Film Festival,  Fordham Human Rights Conference, and Columbia Archives. Most of the trip was paid for and the professors were friendly, knowledgeable, and made everyone comfortable. We had planned activities but also time to choose what we wanted to do--one of my best college memories!

Amy is a legend at Ohio State for a reason. She has years of experience, is funny, and extremely caring. She tends to go off topic, but her lectures are always interesting. She grades based on the amount of work put in. If you work hard, show up, and do your best, you'll get the A.

Never read a word of the books she assigned. Have to take brief notes and go to class. 3 short writing assignments, 1 term paper, and 2 ridiculously easy "exams". Shuman let us come up with our own exam questions to answer. Put in little effort and came out with a B. Take it.

Great professor. Keeps the mood in the classroom light, gives good lectures, allows for interesting conversations and relates the material well to the people in the class. She is a fair grader and very helpful when you ask questions. I highly recommend.

Wasn't at all what I was expecting. Turned out to be an interesting class and not the class I dreaded, which was reading old folklores or something. The whole class is basically learning that folklore is everything, and you'll hear every detail about her life along the way, and anyone she has ever come in contact with.

Good luck following her. She goes off on tangents and makes it impossible to know what fits where. However, she is an easy grader and you really don't need to read, as she seldom got to the reading material. She has the potential to be very inspiring, but got off topic too much for it to culminate.

Amy Shuman is NOT wierd...her class was awesome.  She showed a lot of interest in the college lifestyle, and the papers were fun to write.  I would definately say that I discovered how much I like writing in this class.  It is a very interactive class, so I found it easy to attend.
What is folklore?? Anything according to her. Get ready for lots of stories about her life, here and in Italy. Boring, dreaded that class, not fun or even slightly interesting.
very laid back and helpful if you just ask.

It was a strange class and also very easy... not at all what I expected "folklore" to be.  It was actually pretty interesting, though, and had information that is actually pertainent to daily life.  Prof Shuman was extremely nice and laid back.

The class was weird, but very easy. One midterm and a term paper. No final. Attendance does count though. She hates stress and let us out early everyday cuz two hours could be stressfull on people. WEIRD!
He loves what he teaches and his enthusiasm is contagious. English literature is not my strongest subject, but he really made it easy to do well if you participate
Worst professor I ever met and he would take off every possible point from your assignment.

He was a huge disappointment. Class was extremely unorganized, and his feedback on papers was terrible. He was not consistent with anyone's grades, and he left you feeling very confused and as if you were the worst writer ever. He was unclear about everything and seemed like he had no idea what he was even doing. Do not take his classes ever.

This was a very disorganized class. What was done in class had nothing to do with what our assignments were. His teaching style was not well put together, and his lectures were extremely boring and pointless. He would make assignments due, but would not give the prompts out until the night before, and would still expect you to complete them.

In class, he rambles a lot, and sometimes when nobody read the assignment, the class fell dead silence. The actually graded, real assignments are just 4 papers you write throughout the year. If you have a clear thesis with well constructed paragraphs, you should  be getting the A easily.

Due yourself a favor and don't take a GE class with this guy. First of all, he doesn't properly teach the material and conducts a beyond boring class. I thought I was improving from this class, yet with every assignment I was receiving a harsher grade and struggling more. Way too much for a GE english course. I highly don't recommend this professor

Gregg is a great guy and teacher, whom I highly recommend. His theme for the class was also very fun. He can at times be a bit difficult grader, but he helps to work you through everything in the end. The class also had a lot of discussions, and the students were very involved with the class.

I thoroughly enjoyed Professor Cody's class. You can really see her enthusiasm for the subject material shine through with the way she talks and lectures, which, in return, makes the material way more interesting. I found her reading quizzes to be somewhat challenging, but she is a fair grader. The essays are sparse, challenging, and interesting.

Ms. Cody is an awesome professor. She tries her best to make the material relevant and fun. She is extremely easy to talk to and is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. Her papers were a little difficult but she is very willing to help you out, and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. I highly reccomend taking a class of hers!

Ms. Cody is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is passionate about what she does and keeps her lectures lively and interesting. Her paper assignments are challenging, but are specifically meant to make you a great writer and researcher. She is super approachable and enjoys helping her students or just getting to know them. Amazing lady

He is a great teacher for English, papers were easy since he gave an outline on whats expected on each essay. He has a great personality and he is very hilarious! He wants you to succeed in class and will help you with the revision process.

Hes my favorite teacher!!!! He was hilarious and his class wasnt so easy that is was useless but it was easy enough to get an A if you tried. He gives good feedback and hes just a great teacher. Just 4 papers 1250 words each (including the final). And quizzes worth 5 points each.
This class was a great experience the teacher was fun and focused mainly on structure and the look and feel of a paper rather then content. I would recommend to anyone looking for english class.
i think Mr. Cabey is a great guy but he is horrible at interacting with his students. if you do not ask  questions in class regarding your paper dont even think about emailing him
Mr. Cabey is funny tells u exactly what to do on his papers, and if you listen you'll get an A

Worked hard in the class and met with him after a bad grade on my first paper.  Said he graded on improvement and my papers went from c to two A's yet still got a B because of my participation grade.  Although I never missed a class and spoke my opinion regularly.  He said I did not look interested because I leaned against the wall.  What a joke.

i had cabey a few years ago. since then he's probably still one of the most interesting teachers ive had. i can see how some peoples personality might conflicts with his but i shared smiliar value system so  it wasnt a problem. also,i couldnt seem to get above a B in the class, english usually comes easier than that.but ya i recommend the class
Pretty cool guy, has a different outlook.  Pretty easy class, likes you to participate.
No Comments

Awesome teacher... If you are a close minded repulican you probably won't like him. But for people like me he was awesome. He's very young and is determined he is right. So I advise that you don't try to challenge his opinion. Oh almost forgot; EXTREMLY HOT

Cabey is a great prof.  He knows what he is teaching, and really encourages people to go beyond a cliche in their paper, and also in life.  You do learn a lot about life in Cabey's teachings.  He is also very helpful, and as far as i have seen, he doesn't discriminate between chicks and guys. :)

Yes, he is tough! So what! He is a great teacher of life and english. His lessons will never be forgotten by anyone who has taken his class. Isn't that why we all go to college; to learn, to expand our minds?
he has a lot of good points and ideas. 3 papers and participation is your grade.  no contact with via email if you have questions or need help. Helps if your a hot chick.
No Comments
He's a jerk. Unless you suck up like crazy. Hes way to stuck on himself.
Warning: he will make fun of you, so if you can't handle that, pick another class.  Besides that, a great professor.  And another note: don't say anything too corny or overused.
Really funny guy... Go to class with an open mind and don't take him too seriosuly... Follow that and you'll get an A and learn something while your at it.
Only 3 papers for the quarter.  All are short.  Was easy easy english.

Munoz definitely cares about her subject. You will need a textbook because you have to read before every class. She grades participation and chooses content that she thinks students will find interesting. The class itself is pretty easy if you just pay attention during lectures and take notes. Her quizzes are a little hard but she curves.

I would most definitely take Prof. Munoz again.  She is really quiet at first, then she starts talking about Shakespeare, she lightens up and gets animated.  It's awesome. She knew that the language would be a problem so she would make certain we understood by going through the plays thoroughly.  She made it easy for the class to be engaged and mad

Loved this class! We had a tiny class and I said something once a day and got 100% participation (that matters, by the way!). I turned in all my drafts for edits early and literally did everything she said and got all A's. Only thing, definitely skim the books a little bit before class, she had 3 pop quizzes during the semester. Otherwise, take it!

Professor Munoz has been one of my favorite professors at OSU. She makes everything very clear and gives amazing feedback on paper drafts. We read multiple plays and she was happy to answer questions as well as prompt us in class discussions to make things more fluid. She's very down to earth and friendly. Definitely would take this course again.

Genuinely helpful with encouraging and specific feedback. My writing improved greatly and so did my preparation for writing papers in the future. Willing to modify syllabus slightly to fit student/class needs. Lectures were very interesting. A LOT of critical thinking in this class.

Doesn't believe in quizzes. Cancelled half of our weekly posts. Entire class is just leading up to one 5 page paper and a 5 minute presentation. Very laid back, cancelled class several times as well as extended multiple deadlines. Not a harsh grader.
great professor with little organization

this was an interesting class about utopia and dystopia. I thought the texts were interesting so I read them, but I know that other people passed without putting so much effort. He really cared about students getting the material, but if you just want to blend into the background, it's totally possible.

It was boring sometimes and you're supposed to read a couple books for the class (I got by without it and maybe thats why it was boring for me), but overall super easily graded. You have weekly response papers but they're only a paragraph long and its an easy A. So worth it.

He is the best professor I had during my tenure at OSU. I learned so much from him, and took all of his classes. Expect to be challenged and do not fool around. This is what a college class should be like. Thank you, Dr. Odlin for being a superlative teacher.

Prof. Odlin is one of the best profs at OSU. The burden is on the student to do the work and come to class. Prof. Odlin will be helpful if you do. But if the student is lazy or not interested in the material, s/he will not do well.

This guy knows so much about linguistics it's staggering. His class is tough. He is also a little different which can be off-putting, but he is very nice if you take time to talk to him. He won't give you the answers but he DOES help students. You gotta read the book & you can't miss class/sleep or you're screwed, but it's college. Time to grow up.

Odlin is a nice guy i feel like. sure he's a bit diff. but that doesn't make him bad. he's well travelled, intelligent, knows what he's preaching and is genuinely interested. i feel he gets a bad impression because students treat him disrespectfully. so what do you expect back? if the subject matter interest you I would reccomend him. hes oldschool

Completely ignorant of his students. I have gone to him asking for help in understanding his grading and he basically told me to "deal with it". Gave no explanation and didn't read my email. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Worst prof. I have had at Ohio State so far. Please people, avoid him at all costs. HOW CAN YOU GET ANYTHING OTHER THAN AN A OR AN F ON A ROUGHT DRAFT?! Because apparently, my rough draft is of C- quality...

Class is a jumbled mess. Despite teaching an English class, the man cannot spell. Material is taught very dry-ly. Has already broken school policy in the way he has treated a classmate of mine. Assignments that are told to be optional are not (material is on tests/quizzes). Worst teacher I have had at OSU.

This professor is extremely disrespectful to his students. He does not see his students as anything other than "children". He threatened my grad school application because we were having a conversation, but one where I was questioning him about his homework polciy. Avoid him at all costs! I had to take my complaint to the Dean.

His teaching style is like watching a pinball machine for two hours; he bounces back and forth between concepts, confusing your brain into submission. I attempted clarification of an ambiguous exam question, to which he rudely cut off every word I said, closing his eyes and repeated his mantra, "if you have a concern please write it on your paper."

It is clear the man is a very smart in the world of linguistics.  However, his issues far outweigh his skills.  He refuses to answer questions.  He requires busy work to be done, yet the questions are full of grammatical errors.  Make sure if you decide to take this class that you understand it is his way or no way.  He will accept nothing but what

This guy goes off on a tangent a lot.He looks unprofessional. The quizzes are 100pts for 6 multipart ?'s the midterm and final were no better. I found the grading ridiculous. Take a linguistics course it will help you about as much as this class.

I took two of Odlin's classes at the same time in 2004 (ENG 571 and 572). They were by far the most difficult classes I had during my undergrad. Most of the students dropped by the third week. I studied hard, but got Ds on most of the tests--but ended up getting Bs in both classes. I'm convinced he gives you a B if you stick it out until the end.
I didn't find Dr. Odlin to be socially hostile.  He's a little awkward, but he's definitely not mean.  And how can you not get A's on his tests and quizzes?  Didn't anyone teach you how to study?
Not only did Odlin make good use of our textbook, he also was a great additive to the curriculum.  I can safely say I learned more from his teaching than 90% of other courses.

Avoid this one.  He's very dull and tests you on obscure minutiae.  I think the class was mostly useless and Odlin could be very rude at times.  If you're interested in this kind of stuff, take a linguistics class instead.

Dr. Odlin is the worst teacher in the English department at Ohio State. I would NEVER reccomend him for any reason. His lessons are confusing and disorganized, he is socially hostile, and contradicts the textbook constantly. The only reason you should ever take a course with Dr. Odlin is if you have absolutely no other choice.

Today was midterm. He said that the phoenetic alphabet we learned the previous class would be on it, but just little. It ended up being worth 16 points.The assignment asked us to transcribe words to and from the phoenetic alphabet and standard spelling.  There are 20 phonemes for 5 vowels. I cannot memorize this AND the consonants in two days.

I enjoyed the class. The readings were very clear and helpful and the teacher was very interested in teaching. He knows a lot about this matter, and relies on his students to work hard to learn better. Very good class if you like Grammar. I recommend it!

BEWARE!!!! Just take the W if you have to. Never had writing a paper actually bring me to tears. Soooo so hard, mostly self-taught, Odlin is kinda okay - tries to crack jokes which is nice. Don't be deceived by the first week- just don't even bother with this course. Spare yourself that misery and the textbook you don't even use.

Worst class and worst professor. Very hard to understand- didn't know what to expect the entire quarter. Despite taking 4 pages of notes during class, half of the questions on the quiz's were not discussed in class.
This was the worst professor I have ever had in my time at Ohio State.  He has no interest in helping students who do not already understand the hard topic at hand.  He is just plain TERRIBLE!!!!!

His purpose is clear:  to provide an introduction to English grammar.  He succeeds impressively in his aims.  Two strengths are evident throughout his teaching:  clear exlanations and useful examples.
Considering his chosen subject matter, Odlin is a very good instructor.
Most students complain about him, only because they can't grasp the subject matter.  For those interested in English language, this is your guy.  Quirky but a good teacher.
I could go on and on about my horrible experience in this class, but I will just say, more than half the class had dropped by the end of the quarter.  Enough said.
This class is very difficult. It's lots of work. And, most peole end up dropping it. Please think twice before enrolling!! But if your committed, Dr. Odlin knows his stuff.
Prof Odlin's class is incredibly hard and half the students dropped out after a week, but at the end of the quarter I felt that I learned more than any other class I've ever taken.

If you want an easy class with an instructor in a cute outfit, this is not for you.  Take gym instead.  You must be willing to work and let go of much of the junk you have been taught about the English language.  He knows of what he speaks.
If you are taking his grammer class you should already know a lot of grammer or else you will be teaching yourself the material.

Worst professor I have ever had. Was no help when I didn't understand. I actually took this class JUST TO BETTER MYSELF, I didn't need it, and so I dropped it! Over half the class dropped because he is ridiculous. I graduated without this awful class!
He is the dorkiest, worst teacher I have ever had!
Difficult but he makes it as easy as possible
Must be willing to work, but he is always ready to help.Great web site for class
He is very knowledgeable and excited about his discussions. He was very clear.
Teaches hard subject matter. Must be willing to work.
wants students to learn but should not be teaching undergrad level.
intelligent, but forgets students not on his level. Unhelpful and punative.
Odlin is a distinguished and dedicated instructor.
Great professor and not very difficult. Always willing to work with you about assignments and offers a lot of help.

Griff is hilarious and knowledgable. Class discussion was funny and topical, and he leaves useful comments on assignments (get ready to write a lot). Discussion can be difficult if he disagrees with your assessment, but overall fine. Beware making a comment he finds interesting/controversial; he'll bring it up in every subsequent lecture.

I enjoyed this class because Professor Griffith was very funny and tried his best to make lectures interesting. However I found this class to be extremely difficult. He is an extremely tough grader and a lot of times his feedback would not make sense.

He grew on me throughout the semester. There were almost 20 reflection papers, which were annoying but overall easy and only graded for completion. He does 4 small papers compared to one ARP, and you get to chose your own topic for each theme. He relates modern day news and jokes around with the students. Overall, I recommend him for this class.

Very interesting professor with humor. Lots of homework of his class, much more than other professors. I learned a lot from his and developed my writing skills after took his class. If you want to get an A super easily, avoid him. But if you would like to improve your writing and reading skills, he will be the best choice.

His grading criteria really doesn't make any sense. What he'll say to do differently on the next paper he'll mark points off for the exact same change. He doesn't give a grade higher than a B on anything based on what seems like pride. I received a B on every single assignment, even after writing 3 separate revisions of papers.

This guy really wants to play rough by grading papers the way he wants them to be graded. You cannot get a good score unless you are an essayist. Half of the people in my class, who were freshman, ended up with a B-. Pronounced before class that someone failed a paper with a D, ridiculous.

I took my second year writing class with him. We watch documentaries and write about them. He is seriously hilarious. There are no tests and you are allowed to rewrite all your assignments. I look forward to coming to class.
Since it is an english class there are no finals, but there are a couple of papers. If you enjoy writing and working with your professor then this is a good class for you.

Great teacher if you want to learn somthing from a freshman english course. But he is such a tough grader that this class may give you the worst grade you get from all your freshman class, so if you are looking for good grade, try to avoid him.
Grif is a decent prof. makes you write analytical responses to readings everyday, super hard grader, told us he marks off for things most other professors would let slide.

Horrible man. Grades incredibly difficultly, no chance of receiving an A. Daily journals + 4 papers sounds easy, but it's not. The journals are simple, but he won't approve of the papers unless they are done exactly the way he would have written them, which they never are. Most difficult freshmen english course, please try to avoid this man

Terrible professor. Extremely arrogant, only wants to hear his own opinion about anything and very, very tough grader. By far the worst English class experience I have ever had. Don't take his classes. He is funny, but interrupts you and is allover extremely rude. Made discussion required and then dismisses your opinion. Ridiculous.

Took this class AU '09; Griffith is extremely knowledgeable, and he knows it. He is arrogant and rude and talks down to his students, who are freshmen and are beginners and don't deserve his attitude. He claimed that literature does not have multiple interpretations, when that is the very foundation of literature. Only take for an easy A, if needed

Watching a documentary about pet cemeteries was not quite what I had in mind when I signed up for the class. The papers (2 4 pg. papers and one final exam essay) were graded harshly. This is not a blow-off class. He is extremely serious about the course material.

Griff is great. He really takes the time to get to know the class- names, hobbies, majors, interests. And the discussions that he leads are always interesting. It's a bit of work, but he's always willing to help. Also, you have to write 4 papers (no final), and he lets you rewrite three of them.

I had Griffith for 367.03H, Honors Documentary in the U.S. Experience. You watch documentaries and write about them. There are four papers and around two "journal entries" a week. The grading's slightly harder than you'd expect for a humanities class, but he's a really helpful, funny guy if you aren't scared away by the imposing tweed jackets.

He was a great teacher that definitely knew what he was talking about.  He was a hard grader but gave reasons for the grades he gave.  The class was always interesting and a lot of fun but don't be too crushed if you don't get an A.
Loved this professor. May be a hard grader, but gives helpful criticisms. As long as you rewrite your essays and show improvements, you will do well. The class was just fun, loved every minute of it.

Prof Griffith challenges YOU to your OWN ability. If you work hard to pull an A at first, be prepared to maintain that level throughout. He wants you to improve your abilities and you will. Not too much work; 4 papers and daily "journals." If you get his sense of humor, you'll really enjoy the class. Not as bad as the reviews sound at all!
The class was usually pretty interesting, most days turned into current event discussions. You write 4 papers, it's not a ton of work, but he pretty much doesn't give A's. Overall good experience.

Griffith is a beast.  The whole class is you write like 4 3-page papers. Not hard. He assigns readings for every class that you don't have to read.  I just skimmed them for 5 mins and pulled a one page journal out of my ass, it wasnt hard. Then you just go to class and chill while he talks and makes jokes. And we watched a movie? Pretty chill

awful teacher. i read the comments here before i attended his first class and i thought he was on ok guy after the first day. wow i was wrong. do whatever you can that is humanly possible to avoid this teacher. take english at 5 in the morning before taking his class. hardest grader for freshman english by far, and just a weird person.
terrible prof, avoid at all costs. tough graders are ok, but graders who only concern themselves with their own opinion shouldn't be educators.

Tough grader, very opinionated. Make the revisions to papers that he suggests because he wants everything his way. Grammar isn't top priority - organization of writing is most important. He rambles through lectures and doesn't care much about what students have to say. The readings are easy and its not a lot of work, but avoid him if you need an A.

Great class!  Four papers, and readings (short stories or poems) for each lecture, which required a journal.  He gives helpful comments on how to improve papers, and as long as papers ARE improved, he gives you credit for it!  Lectures were funny and entertaining, although long, but that's just the class.  I would recommend him.
Fun class but tough grader.

Dr. Griffith is concerned only with his own opinion. During class discussions he dominates with his own ill-informed "facts," and papers must conform to his beliefs in order to get a good grade. He allows paper revisions, which is fair, but basically he wants you to write the paper HE would have written. Also makes extremely inappropriate "jokes."

the way he grades papers you pretty much have to write 7 papers.  there are four assigned papers and you can do redo's on the first 3.  he grades them so harshly though that you have to redo all 3 to get the grade that you deserve.  for the redos just do what he says and you'll probably get a B on all of them.  don't take a class with him.

I loved his class!  There is a lot of reading but it is easy, and you really don't actually HAVE to do it, just participate in the class discussions.  Journals and papers are really easy. Each class generally turns into a current events discussion.  One warning he thinks hes really funny but no one else laughs at his jokes. and he says UHH a lot :)
Very bad professor.  Pretty much impossible to get an A.  DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.

Pretty awful teacher all around.  The lecture is nothing but an open discussion in which he is kind of a bully and doesn't let you actually make a point before he interupts with sarcasm and his own views.  I would say he like's to here himself talk.  The papers are most of the grade and he doesn't help you on them and grades hard.

This class was an absolute blast.  The written assignments were challenging, but after getting a C+ on the first one, I went to his office hours for help and ended up with As on the following assignments.  He is extremely helpful and an incredible lecturer!  I would definitely recommend taking this class, although it does require a lot of reading.

A truly incredible professor. Very reasonable with the work load, knows what he is talking about, and puts it in terms that are simple and straight forward.  You really have try hard to get lower than a B- in this class. Write your journals, and turn drafts in on time and take his advice. easy A.

Had this guy last winter quarter.  Only four paper total (3-4 pagers).  Was straight-forward for what he wanted written.  First draft evaluated by group, second by him.  I always followed his comments and got good grades.  Besides that there was a really short reading + journal for the day which was a gimmie grade.

Matthew's class was the most engaging English class I've taken at OSU. I gained a new understanding of British colonialism by reading both narratives from British writers during the Victorian era and post-colonial narratives exploring the effects of British colonization. Matthew was very enthusiastic and I always looked forward to his class.

He was a great professor. He was very passionate about all of the books that we had to read, which made it a really engaging class. It was a comfortable environment, and he valued everyone's opinions and interpretations of the novels. I would definitely recommend this class and professor!

Upload his lecture video late, sometimes even no lecture. Not clear on what he wants for this semester. Almost never reply to your email. He made this class into totally torture and chaos. This is the worst class I had ever take in OSU. The department was trying hard on design this course, but he ruins it.

Chris made this the best english class I have ever had, and I've hated English since middle school. He makes the lectures engaging and fun, & seems to really care about his students. He's a cool guy that understands if you need to miss a class or turn in an assignment a little later, just have to communicate with him. Easy grader & gives feedback.

Professor Busby is full of patience. In her class, you need to read materials weekly since she manage all of resources from textbook or other website by herself. Compare to other professor, she gives much homework to finish and you need to prepare a lot for them. But she would like to help you for anytime. If you do work for papers, you can get A.
A lovely individual, extremely accessible and genuine. She cares about each and everyone of her students and goes to great lengths to ensure they know.

A lot of work--research intensive but a really useful course for educational majors and others interested in either graduate school or being a teacher. If you are taking to fulfill a credit, would not take unless you want to work in the writing center afterward (which can happen at the end of the class).

If you are taking the tutoring writing class just to fill an elective requirement, I would skip it. She assigns a ton of writing and reading each week with research papers on top of it. The workload gets to be a lot after a while so I would prepare for it. The class gets harder as the semester goes along. Not an easy A by any means.

Took his online class and he was the worst online lecturer. The Carmen page was not organized and it took so much to respond emails. He doesn't show clear grading criteria. I didn't feel he was willing to help students. Do not take his online class:(
He brings in great information that he has obtained throughout his travels and ties them into the curriculum.

Great and inspirational! I learned so much about writing. He is not one to put you down because you don't consider yourself a great writer. He is one who builds upon what you know and then helps to bridge the gap with techniques.
Took the class for credit. Grading was easy. He lets you resubmit when you get a C.

Great class to start your first year of college english with.  He is super nice and helpful and is lenient.  My writing has improved so much because his class is not based on him telling you you're a terrible writer, its based on if you try your best you get a good grade and his feedback is very helpful.

Kelsey is so sweet and definitely cared about her students. She taught the Course by inviting professionals from publishing fields in to talk to us and let us ask whatever we want, which was a great way to get real, trustworthy information. The projects were fun and she even took us on a field trip to the Short North.

Kerry is incredibly nice, so it's hard to rate her harshly. That being said, this is a first-year english class but she makes it feel much more advanced. She picks very insignificant and rather opinionated points to grade papers which makes her unnecessarily tough. Most teachers grade by basic completion, so I advise to AVOID Kerry at all costs!
Very good at teaching, although sometimes unclear on instructions. Very hard grader, but willing to give helpful feedback before the assignment is due.

She is horribly dry and boring. I have never taken a class where I would have literally rather been hit repeatedly in the head by a hammer. She provides no explanation to any questions she asks and responds with "Uh yeah, anybody else?" . She is incredibly pretentious and goes out of her way to make her students feel small. THE WORST PROF EVER.

AWFUL. She literally had NO idea what she is doing. Every question asked in class is responded to with "Um yeah." No one ever knows what she wants and what she means. I will never EVER take another class with her as the prof.

Super monotone and bland lectures. Can be funny but takes some time getting used to. The grading criteria is straightforward and there are no quizzes or tests. Participate every once in a while to earn points but you dont have to read every assigned reading.

Julie is an incredible teacher. She works simultaneously with various skill levels so that everyone gets the attention they need and benefits fully from the course. Ive never had a teacher so willingly request feedback and then adjust the class accordingly (within days of the initial feedback). One of the best treachers Ive had a class with.

Drew was knowledgeable about course material, and lectures were interesting, but he was pretty lazy about feedback and didn't seem like he cared about students much at all. Gave one big grade at the end (individual assignments not graded) and was pretty generous about that so it was fine. Eh.

You read 7 science fiction books over the semester along with several movies and short readings and you'll have a pop quiz over each book/movie. You write a few short papers and the midterm/final aren't very difficult if you listen to lectures and understand the readings. Very approachable. Don't take if you aren't willing to read/Sparknote!

I took his class online over the summer during a six week session and was nervous about there being very few grades. However, he gave feedback and graded on improvement during the six weeks unlike many professors. I followed his feedback and "improved" my writing. It was fine. Easy GE.
Learned absolutely nothing from taking his class.

Easiest A possibly, wrote 2 papers well short of required and only took 2 hours on each. She also understands turning in things late for no reason. She wants to miss class more than the student does. Met 3 times a week and she canceled 20 total classes.
He is such a gentle and heart warming teacher. very mild and smiles good. sometimes he is shy, sooooo nice to us. Grade is easy to get A if you give respect to the homework and finish it.
He's the best! Choose him!
Jackie is awesome! Super knowledgeable, super caring, easy grader.

Jackie is a really wonderful instructor, and she really genuinely cares about what she's teaching. The class is mostly based on subjective research, and because she does similar research herself she's really good about providing her experiences. If you need a class, take it with Jackie! She's a really easy grader and she's very accomadating

Gavin was pretty great overall. He asked for our feedback and adjusted the course to our suggestions as needed. This class was gradeless. Each assignment is peer reviewed with feedback from Gavin. At the end of the semester he assigns a grade based on effort/attendance/quality of projects. You will get an A if you complete every project

Gavin was pretty great! He's very laid back, and is always clear on grading criteria. As for this class, I definitely recommend it. It filled my minority lit and 2nd year writing GE, and it was only once a week. It is three hours long, however after week 3 or 4 class doesn't run past an hour or two.

One of the best teachers I've ever had. Service based class. Adjusts the class to the needs of his students. Makes himself available outside of class for extra help. Really passionate about the subject.
Amanda is very relatable and seems to care a lot about teaching students to think for themselves.
Amanda was a great teacher. Put a genuine(but not a lot of) effort into the class and you will get an A.

I loved Prof. Kimball she was the best thing that happened to me in my first semester. So funny and she really helped the class be a lot of fun. She isn't a harsh grader but she does ask that you come to her office hours for part of your grade for things to make sure you're doing everything right. I would take her class again in a heartbeat.

John was alright. Kind of dry lectures, but you will learn a lot about professional writing, and I really got a lot out of the projects we did. It's an easy A if you put the work in, but you do need to go to class everyday.
Most boring class of my college career and I'm a senior. He was an okay teacher. Really helpful if you needed it. But pretty boring to listen to.
OMG. I LIKED PROFESSOR ACKER.  YOU SHOULD TAKE THIS CLASS.  DO YOUR WORK, SPEND SOME TIME ON IT AND YOULL DO GREAT.  HE IS GREAT AT HELPING AND GOOD AT RIGHTING.

An extremely dorky teacher, but overall very nice and always willing to help. He grades relatively easy but you still have to put in some effort in order to get a good grade! Any reading he assigns you need to read, but none of them are ever over 20 pages long.
Great prof. We read a living writer and then he brought him from out of town to talk to our class about what we read. I really liked this teacher.

Pretty nice guy. This class is boring, but SUPER EASY to receive an A in if you are a decent writer. I never really needed help, but he's always willing to hold office hours. I never bought the textbook (almost all of the stories can be found somewhere online).

Bit of a dweeb, but he likes teaching and makes sure his students understand the material. He's a conservative, and doesn't do a good job of hiding it, but he doesn't let it cloud his judgments of your work too badly. Read the assigned material, do the classwork and an A will be no sweat.
He is cool. He will work with you.

Very strange, but nice and helps students with anything needed. Lectures are very tedious and elementary and are online, but attendance is mandatory unfortunately. He doesn't grade very hard and can easily pass with an A. Easy class, but boring at times.

very nice and helpful... go to his office hours... it will help your papers and grades so much. it's obvious he cares about each student. highly recommend to take him if at all possible, definately one of if not the best eng 110 teachers!
Going to class in mandatory and it is a pretty easy yet useful class if you are going out in the business world.  I would recommend this class any day.

Very understanding teacher and really cares about you doing well. Lectures are a bit boring but definitely go in for office hours and he will help you out if you need help on any paper or anything. Cool guy, take the class
Great teacher! Extremely clear, funny, and cares about you as a student. He grades generously too! Highly recommended.
He gives really good paper comments but grades to hard. Seems nice; actually cares.

Neil cares more about you developing as a writer than trying to grade you, which was really great. Most, if not all, grades were completion, and all classes were discussion-based about the assigned readings or workshop pieces. Attendance counts, but the class is enjoyable and not stressful at all. He's funny and super easygoing, which was great.
Awesome teacher, generous grader, as long as you try your best to do it, you would get a good grade.

Neil is definitely a professor I would take again. Even though at the beginning we really started off butting heads, he really showed me what it was like to have an instructor actually read your papers and give great feedback. Totally down to earth and awesome If you have the opportunity to take a class with Neil totally do it.

My dude Neil was great. Every class was interesting and discussion heavy. He grades a little tough but definitely fair. His feedback is super helpful and he really tries to get the best out of his students as he wants to be the best teacher he can be. Super fun teacher!

Neil is a redheaded hipster who is literally hilarious. He had several really funny stories and we had lots of in class discussions about the problems with society. I feel like I didnt learn a whole lot but he does give really good feedback on papers and has a different teaching style that was enjoyable.

Grayson is an awesome guy. His class was definitely one of the most entertaining ones I have been in. He talks a lot about social issues that can honestly be pretty sad, but it made me think in a new way. I looked forward to coming to class everyday and gave good comments on my papers. Cares about students, wish I could have him for second level:(

On the first day he had us leave all of our things (including phones) in the room and told us to go outside and observe things. When we came back he explained that this was not going to be a typical english class and his words rang true the entire semester. Every class has a genuinely interesting discussion and you will want to come every day.

Dan is the man. His Shakespeare class was a performance in it of itself. He really connects with his students on a personal level. He is very enthusiastic as an instructor and does a fantastic job of engaging the class. He is truly passionate about what he teaches. 2 papers, pop quizzes, a midterm, a final and participation are your grade. 5/5.

Absolutely amazing instructor, very easygoing and excited to teach the class. I loved how he came into class and actually wanted to be there, answer questions, and foster discussion. Quizzes and exams easy if you read the material, extra credit often offered. He was very accommodating to issues if they arose, and made class very enjoyable overall.

Emmalee was super sweet and was always offering to meet us outside of class to help us with our writing (or anything at all, really). She was an easy grader and gave great feedback on my writing. Class is discussion- and participation-based, and the workload was pretty light.

Absolutely the best professor in OSU ever. Course material is easy to understand and fits your personal experience so that you really have comments about the material you read, and fortunately your homework is to write down those comments and feedback appears in your head. No exams, no quiz, Professor Yanders only grades your feelings.

Jacinta is a great teacher, too. The atmosphere of the class is super laid back. The majority of the homework is watching Netflix and the writing you have to do is pretty easy. There are some readings but they're not very long. All in all one of the best/easiest classes I've taken here.

Professor Head is the best English professor I have ever had. He is very clear with his outline for the course, as per the syllabus. He grades very fairly, and if you attend class and keep up with the syllabus, you will do well. When writing papers he provides great, in detail feedback and helps you think outside of the box. Highly recommend!

Professor Head is an outstanding teacher. He is patient, concise, and answers every question. He provides constructive and thorough feedback and is accommodating to both experienced and inexperienced writers. For the first time in years, I found a professor who is devoted to helping students improve their writing and thinking about the world. Love.
The most inspirational teacher I have ever met. He offers students not only writing skills but also ways of thinking. A patient and kind person!
Zach was my favorite teacher I had. The course is a little intensive but nothing that isnt manageable. Loved this class and wish he was staying!

Zach is a great professor. He's caring, understanding of student needs, and makes the class enjoyable. There's a lot of readings, but none of them are too difficult or expansive. They are worth the effort. He's a really great guy, I'd take his class a dozen times over. Too bad he's leaving.
He's a great professor and class is fun, but the class is a lot of reading and discussion is entirely reading based (but for the most part, the reading is pretty fun even if it's not easy to digest)

Prof Harvat is a knowledgable and down to Earth professor who provides tons of insightful discussion questions about cool topics. There is a lot of homework and a ton of reading, but sometimes the "homework" is to watch a movie, still, that's 2 hours of HW and then a 15 page reading. Overall great prof, would recommend any class he teaches!!

He was my TA for Introduction to Film. I really enjoyed his recitation because he brought in other examples from other films, videos, or games. He was extremely knowledgable and gave great feedback on papers. He was willing to look at drafts if you emailed him and asked him to look at specific aspects of the paper.

Zach gives incredible feedback on papers and really has a desire to see his students improve. He pushes you to succeed but supports you along the way. Also really hilarious and makes class discussions fun and interesting. Improved my writing and thinking and changed how I think about video games. Def recommend to others
Straightforward English class focusing on literary analysis. If you have trouble, this instructor is always available for help.

Zach will make you a great writer if you seek out his help. He offers many resources to help students succeed, such as prompt email response, lots of feedback on papers, and is willing to stay after class to talk. Although I was not happy with my grade, I do believe Zach made me a better writer. Also he seems like a pretty cool dude.

Tough Grader. Not the easy A that typical english classes are taken for. An A can be earned but it will be EARNED. Great on feedback but not always clear on expectations and even when I fixed his feedback still only received an A-. First time teaching this class so could be better in the future.

Zach was really helpful and his feedback on papers was super thorough. He is really nice and will do everything he can to make sure you succeed. Also really down-to-earth and makes class fun. Not an easy grader, but will reward you if you put in the effort.
Tough but fair. If you make the effort, Zach will do everything he can to help you succeed in his class.

Zach is nice, organized, and clear. He loves teaching and is very willing to help students. Visit him during office hours and you'll find him really helpful! He's a fair grader so as long as you put the effort in this class you'll end up with a decent score. Def recommended to those who want to improve their analytical skills!

Tyler is the personification of a buttered cornbread muffin fresh out the oven. This conclusion is based on the fact that he is pretty freaking good, also southern. I think he may be a genius, plus, he goes out of his way to help his students, which is pretty cool.

Instructor was very enthusiastic and approachable. Very genuine and amusing. Picked great material for reading, gave great feedback, orchestrated very successful workshops in class. Grading very easy and very clear. If you give good feedback to other students, show up to class, and show purpose in your writing, you will ace. Taking him again!

Molly is a great instructor, and her lectures are great, though sometimes a bit dry. She has a very good eye for critique, so if you want a professor who will push you to be better, Molly is the instructor for you.
Best teacher at OSU. Enough said.

Ms. Rideout was by far the best teacher I have had for an English class throughout my life. She is very down-to-earth and really cares about your grade. She is more than willing to stay after hours to help you. She strives to make her lectures exciting and it really shows. Couldn't have asked for a better teacher to get me through this Gen-Ed class

Molly Rideout is currently (as of 2017) a graduate student but is easily my favorite teacher at OSU. Molly aimed at making every class worthwhile and engaging. She is extremely kind and is willing to speak with you one-on-one about any concerns you are having about the course. She understands what it's like being a student, and is very relatable.
Professor Rigney is brilliant. Took three of her courses during my time at Ohio State (93-98). She was the reason I majored in English.

The very best professor I had at OSU around 2001-2005. Brilliant mind and just an overall exceptional person. One of the greats among a sea of mediocrity.  Miss ya Barb. Hope you and Kim are doing well.

Snobby and arrogant. I didn't learn much in her class except that she's in love with herself and her own ideas. Inflexible. Suggested I rewrite an A- paper, which I did, spending hours and changing everything she mentioned, and she still gave me an A-, saying, "I guess I was wrong about doing a rewrite." Has pets.
I had Dr. Rigney in 2001 and 2002.  She is an amazing teacher.  I use Atwood in my own classroom because of her.  She really pushed my writing and my thinking.

I had her back in 1988 and adored her.  I remember her classes very well. She sparked in me a life-long interest in feminist poetry and the works of Margaret Atwood.  Dr. Rigney is truly a gifted professor.  Don't finish your English degree without taking one of her classes.
She is the best thing that Ohio State has ever done. Hands. Down.
She is a very good teacher.  Lectures are not really worthwhile but she still is very interesting and entertaining, even if you don't learn many useful things.
She is a wonderful teacher, that makes going to class to fun.  She is my all-time favorite professor.
She is an awesome person! She has been my favorite prof. Any help you need she'll give it to you.
made me want to become an english major and a teacher
She is the best professor I have ever had, and is a real character.
One of the coolest professors Ive ever had. I honestly didnt mind having to show up to this class.
He was a hilarious person, but he can go off on tangents and can go a little too deep into books.

This class was very small, and attendance was required. I found the lectures to be pretty pointless, but I am a science major and don't appreciate English as much a others. Very nice guy who cares about students. Grades are all writing. Grading seemed inconsistant, but he ended up impressed by the class and gave everyone A's (dont expect this tho).
Totally inspirational. Unlike so may professors at this huge school, he cares about his students.

This was my favorite class I have ever taken at Ohio state. He specializes in European Modernism so he really knows what he's saying. Lectures feel like a suspension of reality - so interesting and moving. We acted things out, wore costume, made poetry. He even had us over to his house to read James Joyce out loud with food related to the book.

Professor Knowles is unlike any professor I've ever had before. He's incredibly enthusiastic about storytelling and his lectures are practically performances. The one critique I have is that his thoughts can be quite scattered and he lacks clarity. He is approachable and willing to help his students succeed- if they put in the effort.

Seb is a great professor. He is funny and he is knowledgeable. His lectures are a performance in it of themselves and he has a passion for literature. (Specifically Oxford related) A LOT of reading so if you are not willing to put in multiple hours of reading DO NOT take this class. But all in all Seb is an A+ instructor and a great person!!!

Seb has been my favorite professor at OSU. Not only were his classes insightful and inspiring, I met with him almost every week and got A TON from our meetings. He has suggested numerous other things for me to read, talked about life, art, and philosophy with me, and generally been a friend. He requires you to work, but it is absolutely worth it.

Professor Knowles was an overall great professor. He is very passionate about what he is teaching. In the beginning of the semester, I was a little overwhelmed by how "smart" he was, but it gets less intimidating over time. He will make you work for your good grade, but he will challenge you and make you a better writer.

Are you kidding me?  This rating system does not do Prof. Knowles justice.  He is the best prof you will ever have.  No he's not easy, and you have to listen to understand his point, isn't that the point of learning???
fun, inspiring
He taught my Experience of War class. He's simply one of the best profs I have ever encountered in undergrad,grad and law school. A tremendous teacher.
Seb is one of the most entertaining professors I've ever encountered.

He was friendly and funny. He can entertain a class, but he unfortunately lacks clairity. I often had difficulty follwing his train of thought. He is a real piece of work.  First lecture he pulled out a hammer and nailed an American Flag to the wall. This was at Antwerp University in Belgium :p

Seb is the kind of literature professor a reader dreams about. He's intimidatingly intelligent, but always welcoming and funny. I found his train of thought hard to follow sometimes, but mostly because his thinking isn't as linear as most people. It's great having a teacher who will teach you to think in a different way.

An authority on early 20th C Brit Lit., he effortlessly waltzed in and out of texts and got us to reflect on stylistic and formal concerns of writers in a completely different light. If you are looking for someone who can teach you to read texts closely, he is the man. And his sense of "humour" (he's British you see) is simply delightful.

This professor was all over the place, but he was so fun and interesting that I would recommend him.  He's difficult in terms of grading, but the classes move quickly and he is always amusing because he thinks out loud and encourages us to laugh with him.  He's one of the smartest and most entertaining (without trying to be) professor I've had here
Went on the london study tour with him - great guy!

Seb's class was by far my favorite class of all time.  I was in the London Study Abroad program with him and I NEVER stopped laughing.  He's hilarious, but he is quite British, and as such his sense of humor is slightly odd, but great.  Highly recommended!

This Prof is not the norm--but he is very intelligent, and even if individual lectures may not always seem to make sense, it all comes together at the end.  Lectures were vividly told and fun.  Papers graded hard.  Not easy to talk to one on one.
One of the best professors I have had at OSU. Class is actually entertaining, and he really gets the point across.
He's very passionate about his subjects, he's hilarious and he's very intellegent.  I wish I could've taken more classes with him.
bad prof.  Unclear on expectations

I have taken three soon to be four courses with Prof. Knowles.  He is the smartest, most well read, most interesting teacher or man I have ever met. He is very challenging, however well worth the effort.

He was very negative towards me.  He was never supportive, told me I was a bad writer, and was an overall jerk to our class.  Don't take him.  I had never gotten lower than an A- on a paper and he gave me a D on my first one.  He is very strict and harsh.

This guy was one of the coolest teachers I have ever taken.  He's creative, enthusiastic, and very intelligent.  However, he is demanding that his students get involved (but he makes it fun)! Highly recommended.
very lofty, talked down to me all the time. btw, i am an A student so this is not from someone disgruntled. i have never seen a prof. so arrogant and unclear. stay away from his classes.

He is the most intelligent professor I have had.  He makes class fun to attend...I think those above probably did no work and are angry about thier grades because it would be almost impossible to dislike this professor for any other reason. Research him.
Had no interest in helping students. Not a very agreeable man.
Strange little man; very full of himself.
HE WAS AWFUL!!! VERY RUDE & BORING, NOT WILLING TO HELP AT ALL!! DONT TAKE ENG202 WITH HIM!!!
He is by far one of the best teachers I have ever had.  He uses all forms of media to entice students to want to learn Brit Lit.. He is by far the best prof. I have had in a long, long time.
I found him to be set in his ways and not very recpetive to student discussion.
Great!
Fun lectures; easy exams, and likes you to do some thinking for yourself.
Fun to listen to, not sure about how helpful it is to tests.
No Comments

Professor Hardy is an AMAZING professor. Super kind and understanding and genuinely cares about each and every student. Would definitely recommend taking her class. Class was very interesting and unique.

Professor Jacob is one of the best professor at OSU. He is very kind and warm, truly enjoys interacting with his students and is extremely accessible outside of lectures. I also took his 2260 and his grading is really not that intense, however, 4450 has long papers but he is really available if you need help. He's really nice but very knowledgable.

I originally took this class to fill a GE credit. I'm not a huge fan of poetry, but Professor Risinger made the class very enjoyable. I had taken the class in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic and he was very flexible with deadlines and was always available if you needed anything. He seemed to care about his students and the subject at hand.
Jake is such a nice, genuine guy. I had him during the coronavirus stuff and he was so supportive. The class is not difficult and he makes it fun and interesting. He is an amazing choice to fill a GE

After my creativity and voice in my writing were stamped out of me by the public school system, he inspired me to be myself again. He is so kind and insightful and genuinely entertains every student's thoughts and ideas. He had no required textbook, and only 2 writing assignments. He held a study session for his final. Cares about his students.
