Jake is very understanding about reasons for missing class, but you HAVE to give him notice beforehand. The texts are interesting and he really engages with them. Be prepared to participate in class. He gives arguably the most direct and clear feedback on papers. Overall, he is a great professor.

This professor was really cool. I enjoyed his english class a lot (even though I am a math major). The only problem is that you never know where you stand grade-wise in the class because he just give letter grades on papers. I was fully expecting and A but got docked on the last paper. Not necessarily and easy A, but everyone passes pretty much

JR is easily the best professor I've had yet and the reason I'm still an English major. He's incredibly helpful and very fair - he just asks for participation to make discussions lively and useful for all. He's always available to bounce essay ideas back and forth and to revise writing, in and out of office hours. Easy on the eyes. Great guy

Wish this course could have been in-person, since Zoom is a bit awkward. Despite that, Prof. Delgadillo was always engaging. Available outside of class for helpful feedback. Grading based on discussion posts, in-class participation (easy if you read the texts), 3 five page papers, and a group project. Offers many opportunities for extra credit.

One of the best professors I've had in OSU. She is funny and insightful. I've never enjoyed discussing in classes before this class. The books she required are interesting and it wasn't too much reading every week. She is willing to talk about your essays with you outside the class and will give you much useful advice. 10/10 recommended

The class was discussion based. We have like 6 books that we read in class. You read like 40-50pages in the chapter book and we discuss in class about certain topics. As long as you read it was an easy A. There are 2essays in the class and its out of 15pts. She is funny and insightful. Attendance and participation are key. 10/10 would recommend.

Prof. Delgadillo is my favorite instructor at OSU. She's smart, funny, and genuinely interested in what she teaches. She will assign a lot of reading, but it's paced as such that you won't get overwhelmed. Class discussions are great, and her insight on topics is very valuable. I loved her class, and I wish I'd had her for other ones. Great teacher

Dr. Delgadillo was one of the most caring professors I have had at OSU. She also made lectures interactive and interesting. She was kind, passionate about her area of study, and always open to discuss class topics/issues.

The class was not difficult if you showed up and did the readings. There are a few assignments, but they were not hard. You have to write 1 long paper and the rest are short 1 page responses. She is not the most technologically savvy.
Weird guy who never responds to emails. Very unorganized and unprepared. He doesn't move assignments around until last second wasting our time trying to figure out what it even is.

Ark Ramsay is a new professor at OSU who was very helpful during the pandemic and heavily reduced the workload so students could manage the class better. There is a textbook with weekly reading assigned, but there are no quizzes and I never had to read. They usually assigned one assignment a week, which wasn't too bad. Easy class, very nice prof.
He is a nice professor. He is willing to give more help to students and solve our problems by meeting us through zoom.

He's a really nice guy, but I feel as though I've learned nothing from him. I felt lost and totally unprepared to write any papers, especially the one for the exam. His powerpoints have little to no information, yet during lecture it seems as if there's nothing to take notes on. Seems way too much for an intro course.

Talks, and talks, and talks, and talks, and talks. He tends to mumble, and speak extremely fast, and over-explains things to the point where a simple concept becomes convoluted and confusing. Everything in the class seems disjointed because he frequently interrupts any material that isnt him talking to, ya know, talk some more.

This is tough because Sean is such a sweet lil man, but he was not meant to be a teacher. I learned basically nothing in this class, and we only ended up working on 4 projects. It is definitely an easy A if that's what you want, but if you're looking to delve into adobe programs, this isn't the class for you.

Prof O'Sullivan is absolutely enthusiastic about teaching and the subjects that he chooses. Lectures are engaging, but frequently disorganized, and you will always run out of time. Papers are graded pretty harshly, though he does give lots of feedback, and allows revisions. Good class, but can be difficult. Watch out for the quizzes!

I definitely learned a lot from O'Sullivan.  But you'll never cover everything in class that he plans to, and while he's a pretty fair grader, he seems to think students have time to revise (read: totally rewrite) their essays if they want an A. Frustrating to get Bs when the lowest grade I'd gotten on an English paper before was a 90.

Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!!! This is an amazing class and this is one of the best professors I had at OSU! He is very knowledgeable and teaches you very valuable information regarding film. Highest recommendation!

He is one of the sweetest profs in the English Department. There isn't an unkind  bone in his body. Yes, he speaks very fast. But it's not his fault that he is pure genius. The man is simply so well read and knowledgeable that he tries to pack in everything. Also, he will spend hours with you in his office going over your papers. Sean you rock!

An absolute sweetheart. He talks really fast and sometimes confusing but he means well and will eventually sort himself out. I learned so much about television! And it ends up tying in well with other classes (serialized narrative). His paper assignments are kind of confusing. His office hrs are very helpful - go to them!

An extremely funny man who had an unrivaled passion for what he was teaching. He has an extremely unique personality that will forever leave a mark in my book. Highly recommended, his classes are a little chalenging, but perfectly do-able. Not to mention, "challening" doesn't mean "bad"
Communicated the subject matter with enthusiasm and clarity. Made the class a lot of fun. I highly recommend him for his film classes. The movie choices worked perfectly.
His class was a relief to go to. I wasn't stressful, yet very intellectually stimulating.

He was a really good teacher for Introduction to film. Although he does talk a lot, he is very animated and keeps things interesting. The class was essentially just analyzing movies and knowing vocab words, not too much work but sometimes a big chunk of textbook reading.I would recommend it.

His lectures were very frustrating. He would have an idea, and attempt to explain it, end up WAY over explaining it, and the whole class would just be confused. If you try to talk in class he interrupts you constantly. Any paper he grades he fills every bit of white space with ramble-like sloppiness that he usually needs to interpret for you.

He talks too much. "We're going to cover x,y,z,a,b,c on Wednesday" - you're going to cover half that. His clarity is better one on one, either via email or in person. I got good grades on my papers, so if you get bad ones seek to understand why it is you do badly (short answers? har) Nice interesting guy but hard to learn from

He's fairly hard to understand, talks non-stop....NON-STOP!  His grading is pretty random, you cannot read his writing at all.  The actual readings are not hard but he makes his papers very hard with long-winded explanations.  Try to avoid him if you can.
Pretty good class, not too hard, he's a talker though. He asks you to read but you can get away without it, no one likes to read.
Great professor. Gives great feedback and is an easy grader.

This class was A LOT of work, but she was an easy grader and was more than willing to help if you had trouble. She responded quick to emails with tons of suggestions that made my papers better. If you want a class that doesn't have much work then I wouldn't recommend, but she does genuinely care about her students success

do not take this class with her if you plan on taking an online english course. this class is beyond difficult and is more work than anyone should have to handle, especially for an introduction course. take this class with literally any other professor because this ain't it chief

Samantha is amazing and my favorite professor here. She is consistently hilarious and fun to learn from, but maintains a good balance of learning to fun. She gives excellent feedback on papers and is very understanding if you're struggling. 11/10 would take her class again!

well, to be honest, she is a tough grader and hilarious sometimes. However, too inappropriate at times if your late you won't pass if your absent even worse. I hope you never register for this class or you will regret it just saying. if you want a good grade of course nevertheless she gives a good feedback and she has reasonable grading

Many quizzes that you will never get more than a 7 or 8/10 on. Doesn't allow technology which forces you to buy $60 worth of books, or fight for copies at the library. Not terribly hard as long as you get credit for other stuff. Extra credit is practically non-existent.

For a general education credit, professor Khansari is very strict about the attendance policy. She doesn't allow technology, which is immensely inconvenient because the course requires buying A LOT of novels. Folger's has all the plays free to download on the iPads OSU provides students. "Lectures" are two hour long discussions.

At first, she was kind of hard to read and she came off a little strong. As the semester progressed, she was great! She gives you feedback on all essays and rough drafts and also explain things clearly. Attend her office hours and you will be in great shape! I loved her

"who says" book had some readings in it, other readings provided. Two big project. NOT your view of folklore. There's no standard definition either. afsnet dot org can help explain. First project is on a tradition you've experienced. Second is based on primary research of a folklore topic. My classmates did tattoos, coming out, and others topics.

Show up to class as often as you can and don't procrastinate towards the end, a lot of stuff is due right at the end of the semester. I had 15-20 pages to write in the last week, alongside all my other finals; I cut it really close. Class is really quiet and awkward. She was fairly nice when I approached her after class. She's a VERY tough grader.
Grading is very tough. Class participation is mandatory. She is a very tough grader. Lots of reading, the beginning of the semester the class was easy then it became harder.

Very bad about returning work. No feedback for even short writing assignments, making much of the writing pointless since I didn't know how to improve. Most of class time was discussion of readings led entirely by students. Grading is VERY tough, and limited feedback is disappointing. Interesting course, but not worth it for the grade you will get.
Ms.Sims doesnt expect much, just do your best and you will pass.
Thank you so much! You gave me a great help.

Excellent teacher overall, my favorite class as a freshman. I speak for all when I say everyone felt open to speak their minds in that class. Good Times. The only bad thing about her was in the end...we spent the ENTIRE quarter writing a paper, and I wanted to see the final result. I tried contacting her 3 different times to see it and was ignored
She is a very friendly and understandable teacher. She knows her subject well and is always willing to give her assistance when needed
She's super cool. Whoever posted that comment about here being bad must be some lazy bum!
Very nice person academically and personally.
very easy to talk to. Very fair. tough grader though.  Class discussion awkward because of large group circle formation.
i agree with what I read this ta did not teach us how to write anything and she sometimes was not very helpful.  I hope i don't have her again.
Very unhelpful. English class - and we never even learned any grammar or English. This was a complete waste of time!
No Comments
Bad teacher, grades unfair, drop her class

Professor Fernandez was a fun professor to have, coming from someone who doesn't really like to write. She gives really good feedback and will answer any questions you have about your papers/assignments. Some assignments were kind of confusing in the way that she mentioned them, and sometimes she only mentioned things once so you have to listen.

Meaghan is an amazing professor. She is really approachable and helpful and the feedback she gives helps you tremendously with assignments. The manner in which she lays her class out is beautiful and proved to be really helpful for me: We were done with the final paper for the class before finals week began giving us plenty of time for all subjects

Meaghan is very approachable. She is more than willing to work with us individually on assignments. Her extensive feedback clarified exactly what she expected out of each assignment. Attendance is graded but the policy is lenient and she only enforces it if she feels like a student is slacking. Also provides multiple opportunities for extra credit.

In order to get an A in this class, you have to work very hard and play your cards right. It is supposed to be a simple class since everyone has to take it but heakes it very difficult. He is pretty funny and entertaining but he makes it very clear he is a hard grader and that he mainly gives C's.

Had him for English Composition 1001 at UC. He is an excellent professor with really engaging lectures. He is very interesting and young guy that really loves English and wants to share it with people.

Probably the best English teacher I have ever had. He is extremely engaging and a hilarious man. He has so much knowledge about the course material and is very ready to share it, alongside some witty comments. If you show up to class and if you are good at writing papers, then you will most likely do fine in this class.

Incredible English Teacher. Best I ever had. Gives incredible feedback. I was absolutely lost when I first started to write but he takes any paper you give him and tells you exactly what you've done right so that you can focus on writing the rest of the paper strongly. He doesn't try to change your writing style and he gives lost of compliments.

Extremely smart, but a ton of writing. FRESHMAN ENGLISH isn't supposed to be writing a two page paper twice a week on top of the normal assignments. Very good, engaging teacher but the grading scale along with the curriculum make this class not one for someone who isn't an experienced writer. Be prepared for poems. LOTS OF POEMS
Jessie is very passionate about what she teaches. She gives clear instructions about every project and detailed rubrics. Easy class and very interesting!
She is a really tough grader.
I extremely want to drop her course.

Jessie Male is an eccentric instructor that is passionate about what she is teaching. The amount of reading can be intimidating at first but it is pretty interesting and easy. Lots of interesting discussions. If you have a chance to take this class with her, I would definitely recommend doing so.

Didn't know I was taking a disabilities studies class until the first day of class. but I ended up learning a lot. She's type A and loud, but if you do your work, you'll be fine. Would suggest for 2nd year writing
Yes

Phelan is one of THE authorities on his field. When you're as good as he is, you get to use your own book. I have gone back to Living to Tell About It for other classes; Phelan is a wonderful professor.

He's really about himself...used his book and writings. Didn't "teach" a whole lot. Student-led discussion was a required part of the course. That's OK, but as a "Distinguished" Prof. he has a lot to do other than teach.
Jim is a great teacher, he was a lot of fun in the Harry Potter Freshmen Seminar class. All of the Harry Potter books were great, but he had us purchase his own book, which I never even opened.
Very interested and approachable concerning subject matter.
He's nice and willing to help you if you have problems. Sometimes a bit absent minded, but he knows his stuff. You will learn from him--or at the very least want to learn more by the quarter's end.

This guy is NOT hot and NOT a good teacher.  He's narrow minded & hypercritical, and he destroys any self-confidence you bring to the class.  Completely self-absorbed & doesn't care about others. Seems to enjoy humiliating students in front of the class.  Plus, can't seem to communicate his ideas.  One of the WORST teachers I had at OSU.

He's the best in the business, but boy will he push you hard! The writing load is quite a bit, but you learn a lot! Be prepared for mindboggling mental somersaults throughout the quarter. He cares deeply for his work and his students, and brings to bear his painstaking research to class. Extremely down-to-earth, Prof. Phelan is a great teacher.
best prof ever!  really.

I have rarely got so much out of one class. He is an authority on Narratology and Narrative Theory. Each class challenged and stretched my critical faculties to their limits. Though Dr. Phelan is high up there in the academic hierarchy he is one of the most approachable teachers I've studied under.

Emma is definitely passionate about english and haws so much to teach you, she really just wants to see that you are listening to the feedback she gives you and improving from it. She wants to see that you are engaged and participate in class. She isn't tough if you just listen to her advice and her style as a teacher and what she wants from you.

Emma was an awesome TA! She made recitation enjoyable and although she definitely intimidated me at first, she was a ton of help with the papers-- I would send her my rough draft of an essay and she'd send back paragraphs of feedback. She's encouraging without being easy and I would definitely recommend her if you're not shy of a challenge.

Enjoys teaching, engages with students. Very interested in topics. Recitation is graded based on attendance and participation. Looks for very specific answers, and can often come off rude or impatient if you give the wrong answer. Papers graded same way. Seemed that any remotely deviant thought is wrong - heard from other classmates too.
He was awesome! I loved taking his class, he was always extremely helpful. Pay attention in class, complete assignments on time, and follow directions and you will be fine!
Manny was great! I came out of the class, not liking shakespeare but liking the class.

Loved Manny. Not very often you get a course where the subject matter (Shakespeare) and the professor are engaging. The class relies heavily on discussion and lecture, but as long as you show up and finish assignments on time, you'll receive an A.

Manny is great! He gives you clear expectations and instructions for all assignments and is clearly passionate about Shakespeare. You are always tested on materials that were covered in class; basically, if you read the plays and do the assignments, you will be in good shape. I would highly recommend this class for the GE Literature requirement.

Manny is amazing and cares about his students. If you follow instructions, you'll do great. He has very clear rubrics for every assignment, and if you missed something on a smaller assignment, you can often hand it in a second time to get full credit You are never tested on anything not covered in class, so as long as you're listening, you're good
Awesome!

Manny is really really nice and an awesome prof. He's a grad student so he's young and he is really enthusiastic and funny, and really willing to help you outside of class if you're struggling! He grades really fairly, and even though he takes attendance, if you're sick or something he's really nice about it and excuses you from coming to class.
Great professor. Very fun class.
A lot of writing, but a chance to improve. Brad is super relaxed and hilarious, but don't be fooled, he is still a moderately tough grader and expects a lot.
Great guy! Super fun. Makes writing easy and worth while. He keeps the class interesting and is always there to help and answer questions. His feedback is extremely helpful.

Great Professor! He made 8 o'clock in the morning fun for everyone and entertaining. If you go to class it worth it. He understands its 8 in the morning too.  But if you go class you will get at least B in the class.

Professor Freeman (he can go by Brad) is a great teacher. He is tough when it comes to grading papers (even the smaller assignments), but he will give you really good feedback. He also is willing to meet with students outside of class to help them. I had a great time in this class.

Brad was hilarious & made the class fun. He tells you at the beginning of the year that a B is a good grade in his class, meaning that he is a tough grader. But he gives awesome feedback & tells you what to work on. I feel that taking his class improved my overall writing quality. Only 2 big papers that were pretty manageable.

Great teacher who is really enjoyable to listen too. A very hard grader in my opinion. Office hours helped a lot and let him know that I was putting forth effort. Really fun and helpful teacher but be prepared for a challenge!

Brad was a phenomenal professor, and I'm going out of my way to brag on him..he was just that good. Always came to class with a smile and had the entire class laughing within minutes. I always looked forward to his class, and it was interesting without being overly strenuous. Not to mention, he's a fox (:
Brad is a great english prof, the class is easier than the other 110 classes. makes everything interesting, and funny. very clear about what he expects. 2 papers, not bad at all. take him for 110!

Brad was an extremely helpful teacher. He genuinely cared about his students & went the extra mile to help them learn. He was very funny and made a normally boring subject interesting. Protip: Count how many times he asks "Does that make sense?" & bring it to his attention. He also once got in an argument with a door while teaching my class.

Brad is a very nice, helpful teacher who makes class interesting and fun, but he does not hand out A's by any means. You need to be a talented writer in order to get A's on the papers, but he does give very helpful comments on how writing can be improved.

Brad is a great teacher - he's hilarious, nice, and helpful. His papers are easy without being useless, but not so hard that you're struggling over them. I actually looked forward to going to all his classes!
I would definitely try to get Brad as your english 110 teacher. He makes class fun and interesting. There are only 2 papers and he is extremely helpful with both of them.

Brad makes teaching fun - he assigns interesting reading, and as long as you participate in discussions, you'll do fine. He doesn't assign a lot of "extra" papers that other English papers do, so you only have two, and they're pretty simple. He's very nice, but he doesn't go easy in grading. Highly recommended!
Great prof.
Not very exciting, monotone. She is a nice person but, doesn't make class particularly interesting.

Took in AU '10; I wanted to improve my fiction writing. It improved because of this class, but not because of the professor. Langhoff is really supportive and her comments on paper are helpful, but she had no control over the class and her assignments seemed to come out of pre-made lesson plans; she was not very creative. Nice, but a little boring
Monotone, course theme was better than other 110.01 classes that my friends took. Overall boring, could not wait to get out of class after sitting there for 90 minutes!

I would recommend trying to get a different professor for this course. She is very monotone and does not seem interested in the students. Her course theme isn't broad enough and doesn't seem to be optomistic to new ideas.
Do not take hers anyway!!!!

Dr. Hattaway was an extremely helpful professor and genuinely cares about what shes teaching. While its mandatory to do all readings and attend lectures, the class is more of a discussion based class so everyone gets the chance to express their opinions. Very easy to communicate with!

I LOVE Dr. Hattaway! She definitely cares about her students. Always offers help and very approachable. Attendance is mandatory but I never had a problem with not wanting to go to class. She clearly states her expectations for you but is very understanding. Participation is definitely important but the bare minimum is enough in that respect.

Class is mandatory. She expects her students to show effort, but otherwise she is very easygoing and helpful. Pretty sure she's about to win a Distinguished Teacher award at Ohio State. Great professor.

Love Dr Hattaway! Very nice woman! She gives a reasonable amount of work and always offers good feedback. Always willing to help students via email, office hours, and in her own free time. She hates when students are late to class or skip.

She just doesn't really do anything. She didn't teach anything. At all. Lectures were required, yet pointless.    And she even used the class to be an SJW preacher. Told us to explore different pronouns... Made the entire class about trans issues and able-ism.

Dr. Hattaway is awesome. Very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. There are lots of classroom discussions with plenty of opportunity to speak, so make sure you participate! And make sure you choose a topic that you won't get sick of for your ARP,  because the whole semester will be focused around that paper.
She is sooooo nice and easy grading. As a non-english student I still get a goog grade.
reading intensive and watch a lot of documentaries but she is REALLY nice and a easy grader

Really awesome teacher, no complaints except when she falsely believes people aren't paying attention and she calls them out. Clear grading criteria, never surprised by grades. Allowed 3 unexcused absences.
Very helpful, grades fairly, kept class interesting

My favorite professor I've had so far at OSU. She truly cares about her students and wants you to get the best grade possible. Very clear with what she expects, as I finished and turned in every paper feeling confident. You don't have to turn in a bunch of nonsense papers, but instead larger projects that you're prepared for. Definitely recommend!
MY FAVORITE TEACHER. She is so clear and an easy grader. She's also really good at keeping every student engaged and interested in the subject matter.
Very helpful, I actually learned a lot about rhetorical analysis from her. Interesting content in the class too. I would recommend her as a professor.

Dr. Hoffman was the best English prof I've ever had. She is very straightforward with what she wants with us & as long as she sees that you're attempting to understand the material, she'll give you credit for the homework readings. There were a couple papers but not a lot & she was always super helpful with feedback and extensions. Highly recommend
Ms. Hoffman was awesome! Everything was clearly taught, and class is always fun and engaging. Grading was a little tough on assigned papers though.
great first year english instructor. made class fun and relevant. learned a lot from her, always gave great suggestions on how to improve writing. very accessible as well by email and office hours.

Dr. Williams knows what she is talking about. She is a tough grader but she gives good feedback as to why she gave you the grade she did. Can make class awkward when she stands there and stares at us until someone talks but over all, a good professor.
This class is not difficult at all. Show up, say a few words in class, and type a couple of papers. BOOM!
Leads very interesting class discussions if you engage yourself. I learned a lot in this class and she is good at making sure no one falls behind.

Prof Williams is great! She's organized, prepared, and her lectures are great. Be aware that participation and attendance matters. She's a fair grader, and is there to help. She cares about her students and is passionate about her teaching. Everything was clear and organized. Not an easy class, but a great one!

This class was stressful all semester long (she called on me about 10 times per class), but I got a lot out of it and was very interested in student feedback. My biggest complaint was that the workload was substantially higher than my other GRADUATE courses. The reading was balanced, but there were too many small assignments. Harsh on participation

Lectures are extremely dry. All grading is done by GTAs which unfortunately means they are often given at last minute. Also, grading is far too harsh for an introductory course. However, midterm &a final were take-home. Find a different section of this class.

Lectures are really long and boring if you do not enjoy the material. However, recitation with the GTA is extremely enjoyable and a place where you can catch up on anything you missed and get clarification on anything you did not understand.

Professor Williams is a one hot professor and she really knows her stuff. She is an excellent person to take a class with and I loved her class very much. I would love to get to know her better and even take her out on a date! She is very beautiful and helpful and sweet. Thanks Professor Williams!!
Professor Williams is the beat professor I have had throughout my college career. She is so helpful and the essays are easily layed out for you to do. She really makes the class interesting.

She seems to be a very nice lady BUT, and this is a big BUT, she relies solely on her graduate student to grade quizzes, essays and midterms. Upward to a month+ to get feedback and often, other papers/tests are due before then. Grades are pretty ridiculous for a lower level class. Prepare for a LOT of reading and still getting a C on a quiz after.

Everything was clearly organized. Quizzes were easy and were very straightforward. You're really setup for success in this class because everything you need to know is emphasized and heavily discussed. She was super nice and made the class enjoyable and she even canceled one class to allow for a day to get caught up on assigned readings.

The quizzes are rough, but she's a very lenient grader on papers. Expects quite a bit out of class discussion, but nothing unreasonable if you have read the material. Sometimes the reading load is a little heavy, but she gave us days off to catch up. Nice lady, helpful outside of class.

This class was very interesting and she has a deep understanding of African American literature.  The reading assignments were appropriate- not too long, usually about 10-20 pages per assignment.  She is helpful and makes it clear what she wants you to learn and she grades very fairly.  Highly recommended!

Overall I would say this class was good.  I liked quite a few of the books she picked (and didn't hate any).  Her grading is fair though she expects a lot of discussion from the class. She is very insightful and helpful with paper drafts. (Sorry that her name looks weird. I put the correct accent on the a which the site evidently didn't like.)
Very rude and shows extreme bias to certain students. The material is boring and she makes the class even more boring.
Easy class, but can be boring. She really does care and is super accessible outside class, but the content itself isn't all that exciting.
Dr. Parrish puts a lot of emphasis on participation in class. I took the podcast one and the podcasts were long and boring. Need to stay on top of your work or you will fall behind
Dr. Parrish was a fair grader, and gave great feedback. Lots of group work, which I really liked. Overall, the class was a fairly easy A as long as you did the work.

She's not very lenient. If students didn't have a printed copy of their paper to class on peer review day, she would give them a 0 for the day and tell them there was no point in them coming to class that day. Just barely scraped by with an A and that was only due to extra credit she gave for filling out the end of year evaluations.

Interesting at moments, but overall pretty boring. A lot of writing, but she's not too tough of a grader. Just go to class, participate, and attend a couple office hours so she thinks you care and you'll probably get an A.
if you like to talk in class, she will be a good choice

Overall she is a great, funny teacher who gives good feedback on papers. We had class discussions on everything from TV shows to comic books, all of which were extremely interesting. Just make sure you are prepared to pay attention and participate in class and you will do fine. Only slightly difficult things are the papers, but she will help you.
She's a pretty tough grader but leaves really good feedback. She is very nice and has a good sense of humor too.

She assigns students to lead the most class meetings, so be ready to teach yourself. Weighs minimal-effort the same as 10-pg research projects, so do the digital projects when you can. Her quizzes are meant to see if you read the book, not to gauge your understanding of literary concepts. Avoid if possible, she's more frustrating than difficult.

For a writing class, we learned very little about actual writing. She was big on pushing her political agenda and not so big on actually teaching. Don't be late or miss any classes because she will be quick to dislike you, and not afraid to show it. Overall very annoying. Would not recommend.

She was super tough grader and her feedback was weirdly vague. I went to her so many times for all my papers and she'd say I wasn't doing as well as I could but wouldn't explain. Had a tech mishap for final project and asked to do it again next class and she refused, instead she had us watch some useless movie

She's very rude and gives useless feedback. We spent most classes on things that were irrelevant and not related to the course work; IE, "busy work." She also takes forever to grade, and when she does grade them, she takes points off for unrealistic expectations. It's almost like she's missing the point or just trying to take points off no reason.

Ms. Roundtree is very into useless work. We spent more time on things that didn't matter as much ex. the rhetorical use of captioning a video & not as much time on things that actually mattered to the course material ex. how to put a strategic plan together. She focuses too much an the little things and not on what matters most. Mostly, she's rude

She didn't grade things quickly at all. It took her about a month and a half to grade each and every paper that we turned in. She could be a bit condescending at times. However, she grows on you and can be very helpful if you reach out to her one on one.

I found that she gave poor examples in class and taught at a high school level. One example would be her teaching the "Quote Burger" for how to introduce quotes in papers. (Introduction, quote, discussion on quote) I found her teaching condescending and her feedback to be at a very basic level.
Prof Allen was great. She was one of the most accommodating and thoughtful professors that I've ever had. I learned so much about writing and technology in her classes.

Professor Allen is an awesome professor who really cares about all of her students. She is very accommodating when accommodations are needed, and is always looking to help students better understand material. All of the assignments for the class help develop skills which you can utilize outside of academia after you finish the class if you desire.

Dr. Kolkovich is the sweetest thing! She really cares about her students and helps them all be successful. She gives great feedback, and she is fair. Her lectures are so laid back and actually interesting. I enjoy coming to her classes each week. Her quizzes are easy and you can use your notes. Her papers are also very straight forward as well.
Very straightforward course - Olsen encourages students to think for themselves and give their honest opinions. If you give a decent effort you'll get an A.
He is so amazing, the best english teacher I ever had in my life. He is so funny and a really easy grader. His class is the easiest GE I had to take and it counts for multiple themes.

This class was one of the best I've taken so far, and Prof. O made it so fun! Really interesting literature that we got to read, and the assignments were super easy and helped me understand everything. Very accessible for any questions I had and responded quickly; overall he was super nice and his class was really fun to be in!
Prof O was FANTASTIC! Definitely one of the best professors I have ever had. I would recommend him to anyone.
One of the best professors during my undergrad studying at OSU. You will need to write some essays. Dr. Olsen is super friendly and always willing to help. I appreciate all his support.

My favorite class I have taken in college. Professor farmer is an amazing and passionate professor who cares deeply about the material and his students. Gives amazing feedback on essays and is extremely clear about course expectations. Literally the best ever. He's hilarious.

Dr. Farmer is dedicated, prepared, creative, consistent, demanding, engaging, and entertaining.  He is a delight to learn from and teaches in a manner that encourages retention of course information.  He is a carefull and thorough grader.

Professor Farmer was great! By far one of my favorite classes I have taken. He is hilarious and also just a good guy overall. He definitely pushes his students and has high expectations, especially on essays, but he is always willing to help if you just go to his office hours.

Professor Farmer's Shakespeare in Film was one of my favorite courses of all time. He is extremely knowledgable on all the content and teaches students about everything you need to know. Attendance is important and make sure you have watched the films. The discussions he leads in class will help you prepare for the exams and papers he assigns.
Please avoid this professor. He's rude and confrontational.
No. Just no. Try to cover whatever credit you need with any other professor.

Professor Farmer is a top tier academic and human being. You will truly learn in this class, and if you come in with a willingness to learn Shakespeare, to accept real criticism on your writing, and to participate. You will be amazed at how much you get out of the work if you apply yourself. Outside of class he is very compassionate and helpful.

I'm saying this out of the kindness of my heart: do not take this professor under any circumstances! He may be funny, but he is uncooperative and stubborn. His grading is needlessly unforgiving and the coursework is dull and fruitless. One of his few positive qualities is that he gives good feedback on papers, however.

Farmer has a very specific sort of traditional idea of how a class should run. He goes hard and does not let up whatsoever. I got so much out of it, he's so smart, he gave great readings, and genuinely cares about how you're doing. That being said, the minutia is incredibly important to him, be conscious of details and diligent and you'll do great.

He is an absolute gem at OSU, very accessible during office hours and will provide amazing feedback on written assignments. Also, his lectures are an absolute blast, super thought provoking and engaging. Forewarning though, not an easy class since he does grade critically, but the final is very much based on how much you paid attention during class

Farmer is very funny but is also one of the toughest graders I have ever had. His class also relies heavily on participation, so be sure to read the material and watch the films before class, so that you are not caught off guard for when he inevitably calls on you.

Not really sure what everyone on this app is talking about. Yes, he is a hard grader and expects all students to make very thorough thoughtful insights in essays. However, Alan Farmer is legitimately the best Professor I have ever had and the only Professor Ive known who absolutely cares about his students. Love the guy. Class is hard tho

Alan is really knowledgable about Shakespeare which is great. Be prepared to get called on. Something about him is condescending and when someone asks something in class he chuckles which is kind of annoying. His papers make you really think and if you don't go to class or read the books you'll probably fail the exam. Great class for GE.

Likes to say the "F" word, which is trashy not classy, and distracting. Interesting material and Alan can be humorous, but he can be rude and insulting when asked simple questions. Does not answer emails and has an attitude some teachers feel might help students when it really just pushes them away from learning what he has to teach. Disappointing.

Dr. Farmer is a tough grader, but I don't think either of my papers made much sense and I still pulled a B. His paper topics make you think hard, but you are well--prepared for the tests. If you pay attention to the lectures and take decent notes, you'll be set. Be prepared to be called on, though.

Prof. Farmer is very passionate about teaching. The classroom discussions were very engaging. If you attend class, you will be prepared for the tests, but he is a very harsh grader (I get solid letter grades below my average) and expects that you will have time to revise. It's an intense class that you will need to work for, but you will learn alot

Prof. Farmer is very focused on his own opinions and doesn't really listen to students' ideas. For the group paper, grading seemed to be based heavily on how much we relied on one of the resources, a database he created. We only had a couple of days to read each play, even the very long ones, and we were always behind the syllabus.

Professor Farmer will make you participate.  He's a good professor; I just like to volunteer my participation, rather than be called on. When you're dazing off into space, he knows the perfect time to call on you. When it comes to grading, he's tough, but he does allow you to rewrite papers for additional credit. No laptops. No iPads.
Really interesting and engaging class, good feedback on papers (go to office hours!),  sometimes lectures are poorly organized, but managed much better than less seasoned professors.

He's funny, and really enjoys teaching what he teaches. The complaints I have are: 1) He's not at all receptive of opinions other than his own. 2) He asks questions in a way that's kind of condescending and makes you afraid to attempt a response. 3) The grading for the collaborative essay seemed biased in favor of promoting the use of his database.

Professor Farmer was so much fun to learn from. He has a relaxed attitude, but he also has a crazy nerd thing. He is a tough grader, but he gives feedback and lets you revise. He shows good movies and is great at facilitating discussion. I am taking another class with him, and I look forward to it.

Going into a 4000-level class, I was not expecting to get an A, and if you expect one, you WILL be disappointed.  He is an extremely difficult grader, but he really does work to make you a better writer.  You can tell that he loves what he teaches about, and he even took time outside of class to meet about improving assignments. Great professor.

He took months to grade things. He was unclear and unapproachable, refusing to help clarify when asked. It's impossible to get an A on anything. He even assigned a ridiculously confusing collaborative essay, which turned out to be a shameless plug for his own poorly designed database. Avoid this class and this professor.

In a class where interpreting the text is everything he shoots down every idea that doesn't align with his own. He's takes forever to grade; one paper that we turned in on October 7th we didn't get back until Decmber 1st (Week before finals!) He's rude, unhelpful, and a textbook Shakespeare fanboy. Do not take this class with him.

Farmer assigns an excessive amount of writing  & there's a good chance your papers (which take 7+ hours to complete) will not be returned at all.  For this reason, it is nearly impossible to know where your grade stands in the class.  His lectures are engaging & educational but I found him to be arrogant and unapproachable in and outside of class

I love Prof. Farmer.  He's extremely intelligent and very good at facilitating class discussions.  He's a tough grader but allows a revision on your first essay.  As long as you read the plays and try, you should do well.  I definitely recommend him.

the material is good but the class is very difficult because he is a harsh grader, in office hours he is a bit crude and arrogant (though he is that way in class as well). i would completely avoid taking his courses.  you can rewrite some of your papers but you will be getting help from the writing center and not him to be able to do that.

Wonderful instructor! By far the best I've ever had. He is a harsh essay grader, but lets you revise them and will help you with your writing. He loves Shakespeare and is by far one of the brightest people I've ever met. He's so enthusiastic and loves his students. Come to class, participate, ask questions You'll do great!

He teaches in a way that would start to prepare students for grad school. His class is not easy and he expects your work to be done and to be prepared. He has a temper that shows itself rarely but when it does, look out. Overall he is an excellent academic and cares about his students. Don't expect to float by in his class.

He's a really great professor. His lectures are interesting, and he was really good about answering my emails. He grades tough, but he gives really helpful criticism and allows you to rewrite most of the essays. One of the best professors I've had so far. Definitely recommend.

Alan Farmer is by far one of my favorite professors. His Shakespeare in Film course really challenges you to look at films and Shakespeare in a new way. He is a hard grader but he makes you get to the meat of what you are trying to get across and he gives you a second chance on your first paper. Go to class because that is where the answers are.

This class is about separating the wheat from the chaff in the English department, and as such Farmer grades papers harshly for this class. It's not because he's being mean, it's because he wants to push you and help you go above and beyond. Be prepared to get lower grades on papers than you ever have before, but you will become a better writer.

Farmer's class is a must.  Keep on his good side and you'll get a recommendation letter out of him too.  Of course he's intelligent, but what really got me was how he went above and beyond to help students.  He wants everyone to succeed.  If you can't see that, get off of your English major ego ;)

He is a very knowledgable and intelligent man, but he assigns a ton of reading and makes you print off 25+ paged essays. So, make sure you have a lot of paper and a lot of ink handy before going into his class.

Alan Farmer is tops in the field of Shakespeare. I earned my C+, although that is always disappointing when you attend every class, contribute to class discussion and honestly try hard. You will learn so much, though, and he is quite funny.
He is a wonderful professor who is willing to help if needed.  He makes his intentions for the class known on the first day and keeps the class entertained while learning.

Prof Farmer is one of the best professors in the English department!  If you have the opportunity to take his class, do it!  I've learned more from him than any other professor.  He is hard on essays, but his comments are extremely helpful.  He is easy to get a hold of and he's very passionate about his field.  AWESOME!

This guy is such a jerk. In class, he gives off this appearance like he's really funny and oh-so-cool, but then he refuses to answer any questions or E-mails without making the questioner look like a complete idiot. He continually insults the intelligence of others and is ridiculously critical on essays. He is pompous and tries way too hard. Avoid.

Farmer is a great teacher. He loves what he teaches and is able to facilitate great class discussions. He's really funny and sarcastic and that makes going to class highly enjoyable. I would definitely recommend him for anything. Wonderful!
Incredibly smart, extremely helpful, and very cute.  He has excellent advice about writing essays!  HIGHLY recommended!

I really liked his style of teaching. You could tell he was really into what he was talking about. He was really funny, too, and a bit sarcastic at times. A bit tough on papers, but not too bad. He really likes it when you speak up in class.
Class was mostly fun because Prof. Farmer has such a nervous personality.  He's twitchy and uptight. He reminded me of Woody Allen.  Avoid the class if you hate Shakespeare.

This man is by far the best teacher I have ever had- He not only challenges you but offers so much help and is extremely reachable. I have never learned so much and continue to this day to learn from him. Take his class!!! It will change your life :-)

Alan was a very interesting professor. He definitely brings the New York City retro style in his method of teaching as well as the way he carries himself. His class was very fun for me as I had never taken a film class before. I learned a lot about analyzing film and literature in ways that I never knew. Tough grader on papers but excellent.
Has a lot of enthusiasm for his work and it shows.  One of the best professors I've had - he was more than fair with grades and gave good advice on essays.
Fun class, good guy. Definitely made the class more entertaining, but it went a bit too in depth than was necessary at times.

After hearing so many positive things about Prof. Farmer, I have to say I was a bit let down by the class.  He is very intelligent, but he was very, dare i say OVERLY critical of papers.  Class isn't too tough if you keep up with the readings.  The quizzes and exams were a breeze, so just put extra effort into your essay.

Kind of...formulaic?  He knows what he's teaching and is eager to help others understand it.  I don't understand this "hot" thing people are claiming, but he isn't an eyesore either.  Would look better if he buzzed his hair...if you're reading this.

short, easy quizzes at the beginning of each new play. option of writing a few short papers or one longer paper. midterm and a final that are pretty harmless if you actually show up to class and listen-- which is easy b/c he is a great & enthusiastic lecturer. he keeps things laidback and interesting. i highly recommend him.

Prof Farmer is a very good professor.  I never really liked Shakespeare prior to this class, but he made the material very interesting and relatable.  Lectures were not boring and I enjoyed listening to his take on the plays.  However, he is a tough grader on papers, and you will have a midterm AND final. I highly recommend him

Straightforward class, tests not difficult if you do the homework. Essays require a lot of thought and consideration. His enthusiasm for the subject is contagious, and it makes the class more fun than you'd think Shakespeare should be. Fantastic class.
He's overrated but pretty helpful with his comments.

Prof. Farmer is the least pretentious person in the English department. He is so humble and is truly teaching because he wants everyone to love Shakespeare as much as he does. I've never had a professor so willing to work with me on my papers outside of class. He's also written me countless letters of recommendation. Definitely a jewel in the dept.

People said hes arrogant or pretentious but hes not at all.  Hes just incredibly intelligent and knowledgeable. Fair grader & taught more about the writing process than my 398 professor. Makes incredible effort to meet with and/or talk to you outside of class if you need help.  My favorite by far.
Farmer is a smart guy, but he can be something of a windbag.  I'd take another class with him over say Highley.
He's okay by me.

Farmer is really cool.  I felt like I was learning from him.  The class was hard for me because I don't know how to write about film, but thats not his fault, duh.  I DO recommend him for this class and presumably for 520.  If he's pretentious, its b/c he is smart, so let him be.  If you're smart too, it will be okay.
Works extremely hard at meeting with you and goes out of his way to be available.  Very smart, enthusiastic, helpful, and not at all arrogant.
He's not awful, but he is arrogant.  I can see how he'd turn people off Shakespeare.
Avoid if you can!
The guy was pompous and arrogant. DO NOT take his class unless you LOVE Literature or like to hear people talking just to hear themselves talk. I liked Shakespeare a lot more BEFORE I took this class

Very smart. You will learn a lot of interesting and new things about Shakespeare. He's very nice and helpful. He's willing to spend as much time as necessary to make sure you understand and how to make papers better. I HIGHLY recommend his classes. He looks like Andy Dick and often twirls his hair which is really amusing.

He's a fine professor, but I wouldn't say that he's the dynamo that other people have written about.  He clearly knows his stuff, but his delivery sometimes comes off as a guy trying too hard to be liked.
You have to go to class and participate.  He's really smart and helpful.  As long as you study and do the work you should do fine.

Took shakespeare and film with him just because it fiit my schedule..hated shakespeare, LOVED the class. Took 520 with him becuase he made class so fun and interesting. I've never heard a bad thing about him!
One of the best.
What a great professor.  So enthusiastic and inspiring. He always goes out of his way to  help in anyway.  Extremely fair, and I would take his class over again. And yes, very cute.

Such a great professor.  I was kinda weary about taking this Shakespeare class, but he made it so interesting and you can feel his passion for it.  Make sure to take lots of notes so you can do well on the exam.  I never skipped a class because I loved it so much.  He's witty, cute, intelligent and just an awesome professor overall.

One of the best professors I have had. He is passionate about Shakespeare and wants to share that with you. He makes himself very available to you. He is a tough grader, but his critiques of your papers are always very in-depth and succinct. Great professoe. Plus, he's kind of cute :)

Best professor I've had in my 3 years here. Goes out of his way to help out and very approachable in office hours. Loves to meet with you and hear your ideas and has truly helped me share his passion for Shakespeare. Lots of reading but manageable. I'm going to look for his name and take his classes as much as possible in the future :)
Great teacher, great class.  actually made me like Shakespeare!  Great lectures, keeps 'em interesting and stimulating and very fair exams.
Great teacher.

Prof. Simmons is a very knowledgeable and caring teacher. She's an easy grader- as long as you do your work and show up to most of the classes, you'll get an easy A. Her lectures are interesting, and she has a great sense of humor. I sometimes go to class just for her British humor lol. Overall 10/10- would take again.
Clear expectations for class, participation and attendance not mandatory but important. Assignments not too difficult, easy grader. Good GE class.

What a sweet and knowledgable woman! Dr. Simmons is a wonderful prof that really cares about the success of her students. On more than one occasion, I emailed her with questions and went to office hours and she not only helped me, but also took the time to ask me about my other classes and goals. I'd highly recommend her!!

I feel blessed to have had simmons as my teacher for a british literature course. English is not for everyone and I think she understands that. It is a general education class and she treats it like one unlike other GE professors. It is very easy if you take brief notes and study a little before quiz day and exams. She is really funny as well!

It's impossible not to get an A in her class. Just read and show up to class if you want a good grade. She has a great sense of humor and super accommodating. Only downfall was how she handled finals week. We had a quiz, a paper, and an exam all within a week so it was a bit overwhelming especially with other finals going on. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
She is awesome. She is so witty and smart and interesting. Thumbs up would take again. She made British Literature awesome
Amazing professor.  Amazing person.  Easily the best professor I've ever had.

Clare Simmons has the rare and much loved gift of being a clear, concise, and rather easy teacher while also being able to work through material with a generally critical eye. Granted, in survey courses this is the goal. Lots of extra credit and very clear goals make her class, while not super fun or inspiring, easy and worth taking.

She gives very straight forward PowerPoint presentations and pretty easy tests as long as you're paying attention in class and taking notes. Everything is pretty clear cut, no surprises from her other than the weekly pop quizzes.

This class was an easy A. You don't even have to read all of the readings. Simply show up to class and do well on the case briefs. Clare is an easy grader, willing to edit your papers before you turn them in, and allows rewrites on every assignment. She is very nice and helpful and clearly wants students to succeed.

I would highly recommend Prof Simmons for any Lit class. I find most of them boring but she did a good job at keeping it interesting and humorous.  She is very helpful and accommodating - you need to do your work but she grades pretty easily and accepts all opinions in class.  Good class, good prof.

Professor Simmons took a potentially intimidating/boring subject and made extremely interesting and fun.  Assignments are light compared to many English classes, and grading is VERY fair. Class atmosphere is relaxed and her lectures are funny and thought-provoking.  She is exceptional. She's taking a sabbatical until next fall, so take her then!
Prof Simmons is a blessing to the English dept.  She is very intelligent, funny, and a sweet heart.  And British!  Take her class and you will not regret it! :)

LOVE HER!  If only all of osu's english profs were like this.  She's funny, approachable, and tries hard to make the class interesting.  even better-she's a nice grader and accepts late work.  it's a shame the honors dept hogs her for all of their classes!
She made class fun and interesting. Always extending herself out to help students. Definitely a seminar based class where she and the class all actively participate on the same level.
I LOVED this class.  I thought I would hate it but she really made it interesting.  Plus, the class was always laughing.  I would definitely recommend Professor Simmons to anyone I could.

I love Professor Simmons!  She was so nice about everything, always willing to re-examine our syllabus and if things got a little much she'd give us extra time, etc.  Very understanding and funny. fun class!

A truly wonderful professor.  She was the reason I decided to remain in the English program (I've changed my major 3 times). Professors of her caliber are rare, and you'll be lucky if you have one or two more professors like her.  Highly recommended.

I adored Prof Simmons.  To be honest, some people hated her though.  Usually it was just because they couldn't get into the material, but those people weren't good with English anyways, right?  Simmons loves to help people, always has good insight when you ask for help, and had plenty of unusual, cool information on all sorts of things.  A true gem

Very helpful, she is always willing to make time in her office if you need help on a paper or something. She is a fair grader, but she is tough, there is no slacking off in this class. Also, she will not give a big reading load when a paper is due. (how sweet)
fun class, she doesn't mind getting a little off topic sometimes, but i learned a lot. good, dry sense of humor. tough but fair grader, she knows her stuff. generally a classy british woman.
Very dry humor. Witty.  Looked forward to her class.  What else can you ask. Fair grader, seems to care a lot about student success.
hilarious, if you get her sense of humor (i don't know that a lot of students did). very helpful--always willing to meet up to talk about questions/paper issues/etc.
Very good Prof. Very insteresting to hear all of the "dirt" on the authors we studied.
She loses a point on "clarity" for being a Brit, but is one of the best teachers on the OSU faculty.  Had a blast in her class, and would recommend her to anyone who asked.
GREAT PROFESSOR....she always took the time to make sure you understood the material as well as brought food on movie days...what could be better??
As a professor and advisor, she is EXTREMELY helpful and also witty

Best professor I have ever taken. Does not beleive in "due dates," and as long as you have all of your assignments in before the end of the term you'll be okay. Extremely understanding professor, too. she understands the modern day struggles that most students go through and is very lenient.

Professor Halasek is great! She gives great feedback on assignments, which really helps you know where to improve for future projects. She responded to emails quickly and seemed like she really cared that her students were successful. I would highly recommend!

Prof. Halasek is such a passionate teacher! Her constructive feedback and encouragement were invaluable in improving my critical analysis and creative writing skills. Her contagious enthusiasm for her subject matter made even complex assignments accessible and interesting. approachable nature and engaging. Highly recommend taking a class with her!

I couldn't stand her methods class for literature any longer. I only lasted a few days. It was clear to me that the class was full of activism. We watched a torturous video we had to inquire about afterward, and she was smiling throughout those eleven minutes. Expect his from most classes in the humanities, they tend to be politically charged.

I would give her zero stars if I could. If you respect yourself as a human, do not take this class, especially online. She will post assignments very late and then expect it to be due the next day. And then she will have the audacity to grade it very roughly. Avoid her at all costs.

She is a nice and knowledgeable person, but she wasn't necessarily a great teacher, but that didn't matter since the class was extremely easy. We only had like 5 assignments all semester. There were readings and lectures every week that I didn't do and still got a good grade. She isn't very good with technology either.

Didn't do any of the readings, spoke only a few times, and got A-/B+s on the two essays. Class followed the syllabus for each week but the grade breakdown was NOTHING like what she put in the syllabus (no presentation happened even tho it was in the syllabus?? ONE online disc board) and was genuinely confused on what affected my grade.

She is a nice woman and very knowledgeable/passionate about film! Very open-minded. My only issues were getting her to respond to emails and her critiquing my own opinions about the films. Never responded to any emails. Another one is that she never grades assignments. She graded the day after final grades were due.

Not a good professor to have in college. She did not grade a single of the few assignments all semester and ignored everyone's emails. She then told us if we had done the work for class we had an A in a notice on Carmen. She graded the first paper right before the last one was due. We had no idea what to expect because of her lack of feedback.

Dr. MacPherson gives amazing and memorable lectures; she is literally a sponge for information and communicates it in a fun and engaging manner. Some of the readings she chooses are challenging, but I love that she pushes us to really think. She definitely has a sense of humor, which is always appreciated. She is also extremely giving of her time.
Awesome prof! She really helps you succeed in class and actually makes class discussion fun! Id recommend her for any course, she really knows her stuff and I was looking forward to all the lectures.

ENG 2261 is an easy literature GenEd requirement with Sandra. We were graded on midterm, final, participation, and two papers (one two page paper, and one four page paper). I had an A in the class, but don't know my percent because she didn't put in grades. I raised my hand in almost every class, and got B+/A- on papers, A on midterm.

The class is graded on daily participation and an essay and the final paper. That's it. She's a medium-tough grader-- for example, I usually get A's on papers and she gave me a B+ (not a huge difference but like put more effort in these papers than other english class papers).

She's really nice & approachable, but also passionate about the course. Her lectures aren't too bad, but they get boring. She is however terrible at grading assignments on time and never responds to her emails. For finals week, she assigned both a paper and the hardest exam I've ever taken, which was too much for a week span on top of other finals.

She is a teacher that will look out for you. I forgot to schedule my test through accommodation services at my university, and waiting too long, past the deadline. She went out of her way to give me the same accommodation, although she had no obligation to do so. Her class was fun, informative, and she loved passionate work and eager students.

One of my all-time favorite professors. She may be a little unorganized, but she is extremely intelligent. She inspires you to share your thoughts in class and is extremely inspirational. If you're interested in theory, particularly feminist and gender theory, I highly recommend her. Her lectures are always engaging and very complex.

She is terrible at grading on time and is incredibly ambiguous in class. I didn't get my midterm back until after our final. Her essay prompts are unclear, and rarely have a definite purpose. She also loves to discuss the history of sexuality in the English culture because she believes it is directly related lit--prepare yourself.
Extremely knowledgeable and well read. She is very willing to extend a helping hand to any who ask for it! Loved her class!

One of my favorite professors of all time. SO knowledgeable... on everything, yet somehow doesn't make you feel dumb. Very chill, too-- I was late on three of my assignments (by only a few days) and she didn't mind/ it didn't affect my grade. Plus the class itself was AMAZING. I'd take ANY class she taught if I weren't graduating :(

She was definitely one of the best professors I've had in the English department. She's really funny, extremely knowledgeable and interesting to talk to. The work load in the class was pretty light too. I highly recommend taking a class with her.

Biggest complaint: COMPLETELY Disorganized. Late to class at least 5 times, not prompt in grading/feedback, & often forgot upcoming assignments. Very knowledgeable of the material, but fell short with getting me to understand it. Never knew what to expect when it came to her attentions in grading. Overall, a professor that takes a lot of patience.

Worst Professor I have ever had. She uses no visual aids (writes random, incomprehensible words on the board). Doesn't respond to emails. Class is fast paced, difficult to follow, &often boring. Prof often gives inaccurate info as well. Hard 4 quizzes, take home midterm, 2 papers, final. Im an English major&it was still awful I don't recommend her!

Amazing teacher! Will guide you through rubrics and encourages creativity, so you can make any of the 3 Major Projects anyway you want (as long as you hit the bullet points). Super caring and you can have a great conversation with him. Also if you don't want to talk about English you can get him to talk about anything and take up some class time.
He was okay i guess, a couple long projects but overall easy class

didn't speak up then, but he was married (at the time, idk about now) and asked me out for coffee "to talk about my work." I got straight A's in his class prior to this, and after I said no, I never got higher than a B after that. Unsure if it was related but definitely felt off and unfair.

In writing papers I was given very negative and hateful feedback which really discouraged me. The feedback was very cruel and harsh and did not provide me with beneficial feedback to help me succeed in the course.
EASY A!!! He is friendly, and his classes are really easy. You only need to hit those specific criteria for each project, and you will get a solid A. I Definitely would recommend him to my friends.

Misha was AMAZING. I usually engaged in class, and spent more than a bit of time goofing off, but it was so easy to just relate to him as another person. 10/10 would take any class of his if it would fit in my schedule
never take his class never!

Great guy, but rambles a lot. The course is centered around writing a research paper at the end of the semester. Throughout the process, he is often unclear on what exactly he expects from students as far as assignments go. Overall, not a bad teacher to have for this GE class.
This is like the best professor ever he is so awesome.

If I could rate him a 0 I would. When I tell you guys that his class was harder than all my science classes COMBINED I'm not joking. Hard grader and SO MANY ASSIGNMENTS. The way he criticizes you and your papers is absolutely unnecessary and his reasoning for it is "too make you a better writer". If you need english as a pre-req DO NOT TAKE HIM.

he was my favorite professor ever. he is very clear on what he expects. he even lists outs every single thing you need in your essay and how it should be played out. there is really no way you should get less an a B if you do what he asks and edit your papers. he is also really funny and great at teaching English in general.

cool professor, lets students think for themselves and makes the class have a funny vibe to it. Always writing a paper but if you follow the steps how he explains then it should be easy. Can be an easy A but could also fall to a C. Have to stay on top of things.
Professor McCormick is a fantastic instructor. If you enjoy taking English classes, you're going to really like his classes. He's passionate about teaching and really cares about the students.

Paul is one of my favorite professors at OSUN. I feel like he really pushed us intellectually and he was a pretty honest guy. He also brought us donuts when we turned in our research papers! I could tell some people weren't interested so if writing isn't your thing, you may wanna try to find someone else
Paul was a very passionate professor.  English courses are not my favorite, but after having him as a professor, I look forward to next years courses.

Paul is great! He is always ready to help students, and if you go to his office hour, he will explain it in great detail. Also, He is willing to repeat it if you don't understand. If you are international students, it won't be hard for you to attend his class. He can see the effort you made on this class. 4 paper will be written, all have drafts!!!
I took a business writing class with him, and he was fantastic!  Funny, smart, and cute!
Paul is great!  He keeps things interesting and he's great one-on-one.
He's very hard to follow sometimes and can be a bit single minded, as in it seems that English may be the only important thing on the planet.
He knows what he's talking about but sometimes speaks on a different wavelength.  If you don't like English avoid him. But if you do, you'll really enjoy him.
He's Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrreat! Yippie.
He's willing to help, but he really doesn't.  He is very confusing and the readings had NOTHING to do with class.  He never explained anything clearly.
Paul is very helpful and nice...he always makes time for his students.  And he likes cats like me!

Very project heavy. If you satisfy the checklist you will be fine but it can be hard to find what she wants you to do. Never felt like I had a clear understanding of what I was supposed to be doing. Also turn in your stuff on time, she doesn't allow late work

Readings are useless and unnecessarily wrong. Don't buy the textbook. She gave me a 65 on the final pretty randomly. Got 100 on major project 1 and 2 which saved me. Follow a checklist. Doesn't matter if the quality of your work is bad as long as you satisfy the checklist.

She is very caring and accepting of personal conflicts and due dates. The class is very project and paper heavy, to a fault. She can be a tough grader and assignments are sort of ambiguous. However, I would take her class again.

She is nice don't get me wrong. But for a 7 week course this class was insane. You have 2 papers a week, 4 peer reviews, and so many readings. I will say the discussion posts aren't bad because you don't have to respond to classmates. You have to pay for a mandatory book as well that is highway robbery to only use for 7 weeks.
She was super helpful and every assignment was extremely straightforward. A lenient grader too. Would reccomend Art Education 2700 with her.
So so passionate and knowledgeable. Took her for the Brit Lit survey and could not recommend more. If you attend the lectures, you'll do well.

Best professor I have had at OSU, not even close. Her class can get a bit difficult at times, but she cares about how her students do and wants them to improve every day. Take her for any class if you need to, so worth it

Professor Lockett turned a class I was dreading into a favorite! She was interesting and brought humor into her lectures. I ran into her a couple times outside of class and she was always so sweet. Class was hard and required a lot of work, but I recommend it anyway because of Professor Lockett!
Very kind and funny! There are quizzes every week but not too hard, you do have to actually do the readings tho. A final project too! But Dr. Lockett is really sweet and caring.

Professor Lockett is very passionate about what she teaches. Lectures are pretty interesting at times, but she doesn't post slides on Carmen. Her quizzes are insanely detailed. She told our class that the final cumulative "quiz" (worth way more than any other quiz, basically a final) would be about "big ideas" from the class, which was a lie.

I took this class because it's required for my major. I really do not care about medieval history or classic literature, but Professor Lockett made this class so interesting and fun. Even on days where I didn't want to go to class I would because her enthusiasm for the topics always made the lectures entertaining.
Leslie Lockett is an OSU gem. So kind and caring. If you want to get an A in her class, you will.

I loved Prof. Lockett. Some of the content was a little harder than expected to be honest, but she was very supportive and as long as you follow the guidelines, rubric you should be fine. Decent amount of work with this class but its more time consuming than it is difficult.

Leslie was very knowledgeable about a LOT of things, even outside of the course material. It was interesting to hear all she knew and learn from her. The class has quite a bit of work, but she's a fairly easy grader. The class was discussion-based and it made for some engaging discussions.

Dr. Lockett is one of the most amazing professors I've had at OSU. She genuinely cares about student learning and success, and makes even challenging material both interesting and engaging. Classes are a mix of lecture and discussion, and as long as you do the readings, participate, and put forth effort on papers you will do well in the course.

Prof Lockett is an absolute sweetheart. Her paper feedback is more encouraging than constructive, but she is very accepting of all ideas. No electronics allowed and all materials must be printed for class.

Difficult class, but she is always ready to help. She grades easily but expects a lot of effort. Ask her anything about cheese, and she's immediately your best friend. I would gladly take her class again! Kind and caring.
Sweet, intelligent and helpful. Highly recommended.

This woman is absolutely wonderful. She made absolutely everything we did seem important and interesting and was willing to explain more than once if we felt she was unclear. A sweet, kind woman who does an excellent job teaching. I would take any class with her. Don't pass up the opportunity to have her.

Does a good job facilitating discussions. Only gives out reading quizzes if she finds that people aren't speaking up during discussion. Fair grader. Her feedback was really helpful and she makes her expectations very clear. Wasn't a big fan of the stuff we read, but got lots of practice with different methods of critical analysis.

She was extremely helpful and loved to engage her students! You really felt like she was trying to help you and she knew what she was talking about. She was very helpful. Essays were easy, and attendance was "mandatory" but she never kept attendance.

Prof. Lockett was ok. She had a tendency to micro-focus on the most minor details of the text and generally ignored the bigger picture. Class discussions drew on far too long and could get quite boring at times. She doesn't really grade too hard, though. If you're not an idiot, you'll get an A with just a little bit of effort.

I loved Leslie! She always walked into the room with a smile on her face and was incredibly sweet to everyone. She knows just about everything there is to know about Medieval literature and I always felt comfortable asking her questions. I got an A, and felt like I had to work for it, but not too hard. All the assignments were reasonable.

Having her as a prof was one of the most pleasurable academic experiences of my undergraduate career!  Her breadth of knowledge is staggering, her lectures are so helpful for understanding the material, and her sweet disposition and willingness to help made for a wonderful course.  Dr. Lockett's a class act, take her courses if you can.

Professor Lockett is one of those people who brighten your day as soon as they walk in the room.  She is obviously knowledgeable and interested in her subject.  There are great class discussions if you speak up, and she is definitely happy to help you.  My favorite professor I've had by far!

Professor Lockett is very sweet and really cares about helping students understand the material.  She is very knowledgeable and is excellent at creating a comfortable, non-threatening classroom atmosphere.  I would highly recommend her.

Leslie is such a sweet woman. She really cares about her students and will do anything she can to help them understand. Do the readings she assigns and join the discussions and she'll love you. Also, whoever you take for 398 is your English advisor, so if you can take her for 398, do it! She's so helpful, and one of the best professors I've had.
