An authority on medieval Lit and languages, she is also a very skilled professor and friend. Go to class, contribute to discussion and do the readings, and you've an easy A. One of the warmest individuals I've met in my academic career, absolutely love Leslie.

Dr. Lockett is an authority on Anglo-Saxon Literature. She is extremely helpful and pliable with those who find the going a little difficult. The quizzes and exams are easy if you keep pace with the workload.
He really cares about his students and wants the class to be engaging and fun for everyone.

Joey created a welcoming, laid-back environment for his English 2261 - Intro to Fiction class. He valued every student's opinion and genuinely cared about what you had to say. Joey made the class very accessible and constantly encouraged students to ask questions over email. Very easy class if you show up and do the reading.

Ferraro has amazing, insightful lectures. He really makes a huge effort to be accessible and fair to his students. Extremely accommodating and understanding. One of the best professors I have had at OSU. Genuinely cares about his students.

Prof. Ferraro is easily the best teacher Ive ever had. His lectures are always interesting and he is extremely accommodating. If you do the readings and pay attention, youll be fine. English 2261 is a stellar class only made better by his teaching, and Id recommend him to anyone.

Joey was the best instructor I have had in college so far. Very clear what the assigned work and expectations are and if you do that, it is an easy A. I would 10/10 recommend taking Narrative Medicine.

The narrative medicine class was the best English class Ive taken here. Joey is big on if you do the work and follow the instructions, you will do well. Hes a super great guy that tries to help in any way he can. You read a lot but the chosen readings are super interesting. No tests or quizzes, just papers and responses. Honestly the best!

This class was by far my favorite of the semester. There was a lot of reading, but it was easy reading for the most part. You could tell that Dr. Ferraro really does love literature. This class is definitely discussion-based, but he tries to make a way for everyone to be able to participate even if they are shyer. I would recommend this class.

She is one of the best professors you can get at Ohio State! She cares about her students, and what they're learning. She doesn't give you unnecessary assignments, everything in her class has a purpose. She has great communication skills, and makes class fun! As long as you go to class and do the assignments, you will be able to get a good grade.

Menefee was such a funny professor! I had her for one of my education content courses so while I had to be in her class I would definitely take another one with her. I will say she is blunt and swears a lot so that may catch people off guard, but she is always supportive and honest which is great when doing lesson plans or group work for teaching

Her class was so fun, and it was relatively small so it was more personal learning. She's very inclusive in the readings she selects and makes the class very fun. I would 100% take this class if you can! Its one of my favorites that I have taken.

Menefee was a great professor. She was so understanding and ready to change her class to work better for the students. You do have to read a book every week, but they're interesting, and you don't even HAVE to read them, I looked at summaries for most

This class is reading heavy, you'll need to read a book each week, but these books are current pieces of lit and are mostly easy to read and comprehend and are entertaining - and I don't really like reading. She's engaging, passionate, and fun, and makes it easy to participate and enjoy class. Not too many papers, and she is understanding usually.

Professor Buehl is a nice guy - there's no doubt about that. However, this semester he didn't grade a single thing until the *FINAL WEEK OF CLASS*. The midterm was so poorly designed he had to curve it 25 points - the average was below 72%. Grading criteria are also extremely unclear.
Easy class as long as your attend and apply yourself, great life writing skills, helpful direction from the professor.
really awesome teacher. really boring. easy A though

Jonathan was a great teacher. He definitely knew his stuff and had lots of experience to help you. However, there is a lot of reading and while projects were helpful, they were also sometimes confusing. He's a tough grader at times for the projects, but his comments are helpful and other assignments balance it out. Class discussion is encouraged.

I would not recommend  taking this class with her, she is very disorganized and it is hard for your to get any feedback from her and would not respond to emails. you would lose grades without even knowing the reason, i've heard other instructors give way less course work too so I would stay away
Stay away
awful
The professor is hard to give feedback unless you try. Highly recommended for taking the professor's class, if you want your GPA not so high. Good luck!

She is an extremely hard grader, if you do not meet her specific expectations you will just get a 0 there is no in between for grading. I would spend hours and hours reading and working on the homework just to receive 0's. For a GE class this was insane to me. I would not recommend, you will be stressed out.
Awful professor, probably the worst professor I've ever had at OSU.

Highly recommend this GenEd for the themes. A fully online class and everything is laid out you just have to do it. It is a lot of reading which is hard but if you stay on top of it, it isn't too bad. You can tell she loves teaching just through her short videos. Its discussion posts each week, each unit a longer assignment (3), and final project.

Dr. Winstead was very kind. She was very lenient regarding extensions and she provided opportunities to re-do assignments that you struggled with. You also get to watch iconic movies like The Shining and I Am Legend (for free!). Make sure you stay on top of the reading, and you'll be successful in this class.
She is such an engaging and caring professor. I 100% recommend taking her class!

I really enjoyed this course, I thought it was super interesting. The assignments and workload isn't bad at all, just weekly discussion posts, short lectures, readings, and film viewings. This class was online, but Professor Winstead seemed lovely and really into what she was teaching, as well. I would definitely recommend this course.

The class was pretty easy, although the TA I had for this class graded a little harder than necessary for a GE class. Like she was taking points off for unnecessary reasons I feel like just so the class was taken more seriously (that's what I at least thought). Anyways, I recommend.

Dr. Winstead was the sweetest lady! The class was a breeze with the exception of my TA that took the fun out of it. Dr. Winstead herself was very responsive and caring and made the class as unstressful as she could. She is super kind, just wish her TA's had the same energy. Bethany Geiger is the one to avoid- tough grader and passive aggressive.

She gives good lectures, I will say that. But she makes this class too hard for what the class should actually be grading. The assignments for "comprehension" are more about "are you creative in this weirdly specific area"?  Would NEVER take again. I'm a creative writing MAJOR and I think this is the most annoying set of assignments I've ever had.

She is very approachable and her course materials were interesting. I had her for a second session class, so it felt a bit rushed. However, I think that was more due to the class being only a half semester long. There were no essays, only discussion posts and worksheets to complete every week. The final was a creative project! Her grading was easy.

100% my favorite professor I've had. Professor Winstead is SO caring of her students, a very fair grader, passionate about women's literature, and is quite funny, sweet, and adorable. All of our weekly lectures and assignments were interesting and stimulating. I even signed up to take another course with her next semester! Take a class with her!!!!

Enough good things couldnt be said about Professor Winstead. She is extremely caring and passionate about the content she teaches and forms a bond with each of her students through personalized feedback on all of your assignments. Weekly quizzes are a bit specific at times, but she is truly a gem

I am not interested in english at ALL but Karen made it reasonable - she is very passionate & bubbly. The class also didn't require that much reading at one time. Pretty easy A if you show up, take notes, take the quizzes, do assignments, & go to recitation. Not a hard class by any means, but it won't be a total blast if you don't care about ENG.

Karen is my favorite professor that I have encountered during my tenure as an English major, and I'm now a senior! Her lectures are FASCINATING! If you don't show up, though, you won't pass as her lectures are what quizzes are based on. If you miss lecture though, she'll meet with you either during office hours OR whenever you can meet her! 11/10!!

Took her Chaucer class. She is definitely passionate, but the way she grades is rough. Weekly quizzes with super specific questions make up a large majority of grade; the only way to get the answers is to take detailed notes in class because she doesn't post slides. Definitely very passionate and caring though (very flexible on late assignments)

Her prompts for assignments/projects are vague, she provides no specific rubric but then gives out poor grades with only personal comments. Doesnt allow revision, doesnt posts slides online. Lectures are repetitive and boring.

Took vampire literature. Maybe it was my own fault for not being as interested in vampires as the rest of my class, but by the end of this class I never want to see or read another vampire story. There is a quiz every week and many weeks her questions were worded to trick you. On quiz she would ask about books (like twilight) that Ive never read

Of my favorite professors I have taken at Ohio State for my BA of English, and I'm a senior. You show up to class and you get all of the answers for the quizzes, she is flexible with all of her deadlines and you can write about almost anything, and she grades your essays within 2 days. Very passionate and loves to listen to students' opinions.

This was a grad class,  so this might be useful for a smaller audience. Karen was one of the most compassionate profs I've had this year, and her feedback is super positive if you put in a little effort. She's very willing to work with you and flexible on project ideas. I'm not a medievalist, but I'd recommend her!

Dr. Winstead is the best! Does not care about stupid minor details; she wants you to know the big picture things, which is really helpful for an English class. I learned so much, but it didn't even feel like a chore. Show up to lecture and you get the answers to the quizzes. Fair grader.

The class was all about monsters in literature and Professor Winstead's lectures were thorough and interesting. There was a lot of reading and film watching, but the workload was light with short weekly quizzes and an online final. If you can't keep up with the reading it's easy to get a lot of information from the lectures.

For 2201 just show up to class and take notes and you'll ace it. The quizzes and final are verbatim from the lecture notes and are easy enough to google if needed. There are 5 papers but those are TA graded, just don't be an idiot and you'll get at least 7/10. Especially lenient on the final paper. No attendance but you won't pass without it.

She was very passionate about the subject material and clearly knew what see was talking about. The class itself was interesting and she had thought provoking lectures. Her problem is that she is a very tough paper grader. If you have to many grammatical problems then your paper will be an immediate D. Otherwise HW and Quizzes are generally easy.

She was very passionate about her subject matter and offered stimulating insight into both the films and literature and possibilities for comparative analysis. Can seem a bit pretentious but, feel she just tries too hard sometimes. She does like to talk, but offers opportunities for students to respond, with a failure on the students part to do so.

Prof. Winstead really has a passion for what she teaches, and it shows.  She's interesting, and the entire class was SUPER easy until the final--out of the blue, it was extremely hard, poorly-written, and lots of us struggled.  Overall I loved her though.  I'm taking another class with her.

You can tell she's very passionate about what she's teaching. Lectures can be somewhat boring but she does her best to keep you interested. She makes sure students understand before moving on and even points out some topics that will be on the weekly quiz. Expect to get a lot of emails asking for notes because a student had to miss class.
Prof. Winstead is a fantastic teacher. She has a grasp on the material well beyond the scope of the class, and was somehow able to make Medieval womens lit interesting.

Dr. Winstead is an amazing teacher. The Arthurian Legends class she teaches is really fun and she is clearly an expert.Class discussions are interesting and help you understand the material. Not too hard just a bit of work. If you read the books you'll be fine. I just love her-- she's very funny and I very much enjoyed her class.

Can be kind of boring to sit through, but she makes the most of it. She's a sweet woman and makes sure you understand the works before she moves on. You can tell she is passionate about the subject matter. The quizzes online were easy but the exams were kind of hard. She was really nice about giving extra credit though. Good class for the most part

Probably one of my favorite teachers so far at Ohio State. The class itself was great and Winstead lead good discussions. She's very interested in finding what works for students and changes to help us. Class was on the challenging side, but it was interesting enough to make up for it and make it very enjoyable overall. I learned a lot in her class

Very engaging in class. Nice and respectful of other opinions. Wants a lot of participation. Knows her stuff and expects you to come prepared. Gives a nice curve to grade for improvement over the quarter - very helpful.
Early Brit lit... boring enough already, right? Winstead was terrrrrribly boring... avoid classes with her at all costs.

Good Lord, she almost made me want to change majors.  She was awful, and as an advisor, completely unhelpful.  She's not even on campus this quarter to be my advisor.  I'm really dissappointed in the English Department and OSU for hiring someone like this.

Actually takes a scientific approach to the humanities.  Lots of ways to pass the course (like an optional final), and she seems to really care about her students.  Also allows for different interpretations, if they are valid.
Horribly detailed exam expectations. Massive amounts of reading - not a good class to take if you are taking other English classes simulateously.
Really nice lady. Also, explains things well and keeps lectures fairly interesting even when tackling such boring subject matter as medieval literature.
Great class, great professor, good bit of reading but gives good explaination of exactly what she wants on the tests
Great class... great prof...

Daily homework assignments hard to keep up with, gives no explanation or guidance on what she expects.  Often belittles the class when their assignments are not up to par.  Very flighty and self-important.
Not an easy class. Daily assignments and take home reading quizzes. The prof also expects very detailed answers on exams.

Horrible, pretentious, fake british accent while reading was NOT a plus.  Got attitude with people who asked for help.  Liked hearing herself talk about mundane topics that didn't have to do with the exams and/or papers.  Do not recommend.
No Comments
Excellent professor!

Her passion for english, ghosts, and beyond made this class very enjoyable. There is effort to put in on the student's end with reading, writing, and participating, but I thought it was worth it. I had to take this as a requirement, but by the end of the semester this was one of my favorite classes. She is also super available and eager to help.

Angus Fletcher is the greatest teacher I've ever had and he's changed my life for the better. He has helped me to develop my career goals and feel more confident in my ability to write. I absolutely love this man and I'm so grateful I took his class.

I had Angus for Advanced Screenwriting and he was fantastic. After syllabus week we were basically released to work on our scripts and then met with him individually every two weeks to get feedback. He always gave me great notes and it was so helpful being able to get another set of ears and eyes on projects! I'd highly recommend taking his course!

Angus is the best English Professor I've had at OSU by far. He is incredibly smart, insightful, and just all around kind. He made the class extremely flexible and was always happy with the work everyone brought in. He knows so much about the publishing & screen writing industry and he has some amazing stories. He cares about his students' success.

I WOULD TAKE A BULLET FOR ANGUS. He is the most inspiring professor who cares for your success. He has been in, and knows, the screenwriting industry. He cares and will help you reach the goals that you have!

Ok so Angus isn't just the best professor I've ever had, he's genuinely one of the best people I've had the privilege of knowing. He's hilarious, insightful, and so dedicated to his student's success. He doesn't just teach how to write, he teaches each specific student how they should be writing and the careful attention he gives really pays off.
Quite honestly is changing my life. He is making me fall in love with my major (Film) all over again. I would take any class with him in a heartbeat. I love everything about him.

Dr. Fletcher was by far my favorite professor that I have ever had.  He is brilliant, kind, and inspiring.  The type of person I looked forward to learning from (very unique teaching style) and you'll even want to go to his office hours just to learn more.   If you have the chance to take a class with him, do NOT pass it up!! I love this man.
Heavy group project class which I wasn't anticipating, but worked out fine. Directions can be unclear at times, but Adrian is very nice and understanding.

Professor Fredal is an exceptional lecturer. I've never been more entertained in a class in my life, and I'm not even an english or polysci major. He's just really engaging. There is lots to read, usually 30-50 pages per class, and the papers are frequent and I personally found them somewhat difficult. But, if you pay attention, you'll be okay.

Dr. Fredal is an awesome professor! Very chill, laid back guy. All class time is discussion based, but it honestly helps you to understand the material more thoroughly, and it's overall a really low stress environment. Would 100% recommend.

Dr. Fredal's classes are always a pleasure to have. The classes are discussion-based. Be ready to debate with the teacher because he will challenge the students' every response to encourage further critical thinking. The grades were based on weekly reading response and unit papers. They are no sweat if you're coherent at writing and read the books.

Definitely attend lecture. He will provide literary information that isn't provided in the text. Take diligent notes of the readings and his lectures, for he will quiz you both on specific events in the Bible and literary themes and ideas he mentions in lecture. Don't skip the readings. He doesn't cover everything you're responsible for in lecture.
Prof. Fredal is passionate about this course, and provides plenty of information in his lectures. At times his chalkboard writing can be tough to read, but he is happy to answer any questions.

There are six quizzes, one is dropped, There's one midterm and one final, each are worth the same (about 3 times the quizzes). On every quiz/exam there's a bit of extra credit. He requires you show up to class (attendance/participation grade), but it's worth it because he gives lectures that essentially recap the reading along with some background.

Prof Fredal is a fun person, but not a good professor. He is a very inconsistent grader, giving you feedback and then changing his mind. Not sure he even reads some of the papers. Participation is difficult because of the way the class is structured, and how argumentative he is. I'm an English major and this class was rough. Don't recommend.
He is a great professor. Although his lectures tend to be a bit dry, they are informative. He gives great feedback on papers and is lenient with deadlines (if you give a good enough reason).

Lectures were really boring and group "discussions" poorly organized. He's also notorious for starting class late and then holding you over time. Fredal does give great feedback on papers and the option to revise your work, though, which I really appreciated. I got a B+ by showing up everyday and writing good-enough papers.

Jim is great. He has some pretty dry humor, but he had me laughing through all his lectures. You can tell he truly knows what he is talking about. Jim's extremely knowledgeable. He likes when you participate. The tests are short answer, but if you try than you'll get an A no problem. This was one of my favorite classes, take it!!
Professor Fredal is exceptional. He taught me so much about my writing style. He's an easy grader and very kind to his students.
Dr. Fredal is a really great guy, and the class is pretty easy as long as you show up to class and do the work. Also, he's pretty funny.

You do have to go to class and put time into all the reading responses if you want a good grade. He had a really dry humor that was entertaining at times, however the class became repetitive pretty fast.

Took in WI '12; Fredal is amazing. His class on the English Bible was completely subjective, which I know must be hard to do. Extremely interesting, so much information; the class is a little difficult but I learned a ton during his lectures. He's funny, which is nice because the material was a little dry sometimes. Overall, great professor
He was a fantastic teacher.  His style of teaching is more lecture-like, but he stops for any questions and will go into great depth to answer yours.  He's a very easy grader.

For a person who really doesn't like English too much, this has been one of my favorite classes. Fredal is a great guy who really cares about his students. He has a very good, dry sense of humor. Our class discussions on improving papers were extremely helpful. Fair grader. Do the work, attend class, and you'll get an A.
Awesome class, awesome professor. He is very funny, and class discussions were amazing.
Great teacher, hysterical, one of the best classes I've taken.
pretty funny guy, great for first yr comp; i was a decent writer to begin with but now i feel a lot more confident about writing at a college level

Actually cares about his students. Go in for office hours even if you think that your paper is good. Fair grader. Utilizes Carmen alot for making comments to papers. Hell of a guy too..very funny and witty, but definitely well respected by the class.

The class on **** was probably one of the most enjoyable english classes I have taken. Class discussions and workshops were very constructive and helpful. Sometimes discussion of texts got repetitive and boring but overall they kept my interest. Professor Fredal is kind, helpful, and witty, and his knowledge and interest in the subject showed.
Interesting class. A little bit over thought, but a lot of fun, and you learn plenty of good writing tips.

I really do not enjoy English and especially dislike writing, but this class was unusually tolerable.  Professor Fredal is pretty funny and is very nice and helpful.  Do not purchase anything at all for this class.  All materials which you need are available online.

A fair grader, open to class suggestions and questions, and has a very witty/dry sense of humor.  Overall, I enjoyed being in his class because he  emphasizes learning the material before having a good grade in the class.

Definitely recommend him for the 367. Class on 'Bullshit' kept the topic interesting and thought-provoking. Most constructive discussions I've ever had in a class. Definitely improved writing style. The end of the course seemed to be repetitive and boring, but it was nice to have a break.

Awesome professor! Probably my most favorite professor during my college career.  I took his class on 'Bullshit' and this guy is definitely no ****ter.  He doesn't talk just because he wants to fill time.  He's very concise.

had him a couple years ago for rhetoric. remember liking the material and thinking he was an interesting guy. first english class i had that convinced me i should make it a major. turns out they were rarely this fun. he's the type that's probably full of zings at dinner parties.

Good stuff:witty, funny, smart, fair grader, interesting material. Bad:completely disorganized and unstructured! lectured 5 mins after class ended b/c he wasn't finished talking, gave same grade for assignments despite some people not doing any research! never returned emails! final class he didn't even show up! didn't email us 1rst to let us know!

i really liked him, he was really easy to get along with and very helpful.  i got really sick in the middle of the quarter and he was really understanding about it and didn't make me feel like a bad person for missing class like my other professors.

Professor Fredal is a VERY good teacher for a writing course. He's very sharp-witted and his feedback is always helpful. I've heard his lecture-heavy courses are pretty dry though. He's somewhat hard to find outside of class though.

This class wasn't the easiest I've taken, but Dr. Fredal made it fun and interesting. He's very friendly and funny and will talk and joke around with students. Class discussion was great, and there was no need for me to read the book as he explained everything very clearly and used good examples. Just take notes! I highly recommend him.

For an honors writing course, the amount of actual writing required was minimal. Discussions in class were usually interesting but topics were beaten to death. However, the workshops (peer criticisms) in class were very helpful. If you need h367, try to get Fredal.
Fredal has a great sense of humor, I would recommend him. not too much reading, just show up and do the work and you will be fine
Fredal is cool. He is very sarcastic sometimes but that just makes class more fun. You gotta read, though.

Fredal was awesome...one big downside is that he is sometimes hard to get in contact with outside the classroom.  Other than that, his class was great and his teaching style was awesome too.  He's very laid back and has a witty, often subtle, sense of humor.  Good professor...probably one of the best the dept. has to offer.
He can be intimidating in class, but talk with him one-on-one and you'll never be scared again.
Contentious and sometimes rude, though not on purpose (seems to be a nice guy in real life). He just can't take people disagreeing with him and seems to have somewhat of a thin skin.

Professor Fredal was very conversant with the material and did his best to make classical rhetoric as accessible and interesting as he could. The workload was a bit much though, and he never responded to any of my emails. However, after hearing several horror stories from the other Intro to Rhetoric class, I would definitely recommend him.
No Comments

His class was so boring and he was such a jerk.  He picks favorites and he was all over this weird kid who took a completely retarded viewpoint against the rest of the class.  He was big on controversial topics and creating debates, which I hated.

Dr. Fredal has a very self depricating, dry sense of humor.  He's quite aware of the fact that he's incredibly boring, and so he often tries to keep things short and simple.  In general though, he's a good teacher and not very hard.  He likes to teach outdoors in the Au and Sp Quarters.

The class started out alright, but Professor Fredal picks a topic or two and doesn't talk about anything else the rest of the quarter. I think humanities professors in general need to get over the whole advertising obsession. Don't take his 367 unless you feel like writing the same 2 pages 12 times.
the class wasnt hard but he was a loon.  all we talked about the whole quarter was food topics.  it was just plain stupid.
No Comments

horrible class. this class was boring to the point that the teacher talked abt it being boring. pathetic. i wanted to stab myself in the face everyday. we had one topic and spent the entire quarter on researching and discussing, focus on structure/grammar

Severe lack of understanding for the student's position and gives no leeway to make anything up. Lectures are often vague and does not explain assignments well at all. Everything is a grey area within his assignments, and he gives poor answers to completely valid questions in class. Would never recommend.
Super easy. He helps whenever you need it. Always made himself available during and outside of class (email). I learned a lot of useful information on business writing.
While the content was interesting, he often sped through demonstrations, and assumed that his class had prior knowledge of the subject. Unorganized, and often unclear.

If you're intuitive or have already experience about using programs like Audacity, Photoshop and iMovie, don't expect to learn too much. Nice guy and a lot of the downfall of the class was IT issues that were out of his hands. Easy grader.
Unorganized and did not explain the subject matter well
Lectures could be kind of boring since he was a bit rambely, but he knew a lot about the subject.
Very long lectures and goes on many long tangents. My final grade consisted of three papers and a participation grade. We never had any homework.
He just talks and talks about random stuff during the lectures and then throws an easy paper at you every couple of weeks. Reading material was short.

Lectures are boring but easy to follow. Nice grader. Learned nothing that I didn't in high school - but made for an extremely easy class. Attendance is mandatory otherwise I never would have showed up.

This was a pretty easy class, but it was a little too easy to zone out. His lectures were a bit confusing and hard to follow at some times. He only gave 3 papers, so the class wasn't too assignment heavy. He's a great guy and very funny, but I genuinely don't think I learned anything that I didn't already learn in my high school English classes.

Professor Shuttleworth is super nice and understanding, and despite not always having the clearest grading criteria, he gives really good feedback and you can tell he wants you to improve and succeed. Not many assignments and he has good class discussions.
He gives good feedback on essays and the reading choices were pretty good.

Dr. Shuttleworth is a really good professor. Lectures consist of discussions over the readings, as long as you show up you'll be fine. There are no exams or quizzes, your grade consists of 4 essays over the 4 books you read. He is a very understanding that this is not the only course you're taking and takes this into consideration when grading.

Dr. Shuttleworth is my favorite professor that I have had throughout three years at OSU. I took English 2261 (Intro Poetry) with him in the spring semester, and his selections and discussions were perfectly varied. Many students in the class were there for the easy GE, but I am passionate about the material. Three essays, one in class.

I really appreciate the insight Dr. Shuttleworth has! He does talk the entire class time, but when you're able to listen he makes valid points. Very chill guy, easy grader. Only 2 papers and a midterm which is wonderful. Overall, if you can sit through lectures and catch his main points, you'll be good to go.

Dr. Shuttleworth gives amazing insight into literature! It makes you look at the world in an entirely different way and gives a lot of insight into life! The class made me truly appreciate literature! He lectures a lot but his lectures are very interesting!! He's a very reasonable grader. An amazing class that I would take again! (Eng 2202H)

Extremely light course load. There were two essays outside of class and one in class essay for a midterm. Dr. Shuttleworth will talk for the entirety of the 1h20min lecture without stopping. It can be incredibly dull at times. Overall, it's an easy class, you'll just have to suffer through long lectures.

Shuttleworth is a funny guy. His lectures are VERY long and boring but he'll crack a joke here and there. Nobody really pays attention everyone just sits on their laptops & does other homework. 2 papers and an in class essay. Very very easy and he gives amazing feedback. He's a great guy, just extremely boring.

He definitely knew his stuff, but classes were mainly just him talking the entire time & were reallyyy easy to zone out. However, the class was extremely low work - 2 papers which he gives good feedback on, a midterm which was just an in-class essay, and virtually no homework. Not needed to buy the book.
Straightforward class with few assignments and great lectures; he's really a character!

AMAZING!  Best prof. in the dept!  Great feedback on papers, consistently passionate in the classroom, genuine character.  Great communicator, very willing to meet in office hours to discuss material more or explain material differently.  Unique combination of art and poetry during lectures.  Always interesting.  Endlessly knowledgeable about 30's.

Great, passionate prof. Gives excellence feedback on papers and midterm (in-class essay).  Great reading selections.  He's clearly a prof that wants to be there and wants to help his students succeed.  His teaching style is wonderful: some lecture, some visual aids (he is interested in relating art to the poems).  I would *hands down* recommend!!

He cares about teaching; he just isn't particularly good at teaching in an engaging way.  He'll probably never give a paper higher than an A- but participation should make an A possible.  Just be prepared for incredibly boring lectures and slightly above average commentary on papers.

If you do not favor traditional english-style discussion this class is for you. The majority of the period is spent by him talking. You can get away with not reading. Only buy novels, all other material/poems you can get online and save money. He is a lenient grader and gives good feedback. And yes he has a British accent, making it all worthwhile.
Grades were two 4-page papers and one in-class essay, that's it. No curveballs, very easy. He's a good guy and has a sweet accent too. Definitely recommended.

On the positive, he's a nice guy, very smart, he grades fairly, and his comments on papers are helpful and in-depth. However his lectures are impossible to follow, and often boring. Very little discussion, which is very off-putting for an English class. His ideas will be the only ones you'll hear.
Good poem choices, kind of boring lectures, but he is understanding of family issues and lenient in grading. He is also hilarious.

by far the most brilliant mind for english literature of any teacher i've ever had! i highly recommend this professor. i found his lectures fascinating and eloquent. the work load was low: only 2 papers and an in-class essay for the midterm. his comments on my papers were thoughtful and helpful. take his class- you won't regret it!

He has to be one of the most boring professors I have ever had. His book choices were great for the most part, but discussions were rare, and his lectures were terrible. He knew his stuff, but I don't know if he should be teaching.

This was my second class with him and I must say there was no disappointment. If you're looking for easy, this isn't necessarily it. If you're interested in actually learning something, this is the professor for you. He gave thoughtful consideration to my work and I learned a great deal from my time with him.

He is a very, very good teacher. I had him for 20th century poetry. He is very well versed and quite funny. He is very helpful, and i really learned a lot. go to class, read the poems, you'll be fine. one 3-4 pg paper, midterm is in class essay, final is 5-6 page paper. i highly recommend him to anyone for any class.

Great prof! sometimes the discussions seemed never-ending, but he was very good at allowing students to see all sides of an argument.  I would definitely recommend him...he was extremely helpful and fair when grading essays.
Keeps your attention, his manner is a bit entertaining. I learned a lot in his class; you will pick apart novels all class long which can get overwhelming at times.

His lectures are amazingly difficult to pay attention to. He seems to know literature and be interested in teaching, I just didn't find him very good at actually teaching. Expect a lot of long, tangential lectures.
Choice of material was interesting, genuinely interested in what he teaches  He's very easy-going, witty, and there was little amount of work.

He's a nice guy but he's really boring.  I think it's pretty weird that people have said he's great (somebody told me they liked him because he was "actually English").  The worst thing about the class was his choice of material; the books were terrible.  Maybe I would have liked him better if the material had been more interesting.
Classes very structured, never out early.  Extremely intelligent but sometimes lectures are over your head and boring.  Grades tough.  I loved what he selected for us to read, though.
He is amazing to look at and a great teacher.

I was led astray the comments of others. Your favorite professor? I liked him, but your all-time favorite? He's a middle-of-the-road prof.: smart and articulate but often boring. Sometimes funny. Very traditional lecture/discussion, 2 papers-type class. Liked him better as the quarter progressed.
No Comments
Good curriculum, very intellegent, promotes good discussion.  One of my favorite English professors.  And cute too! If you like that rugged British type...
My favorite prof. in the department. Great lectures, intersting, always helpful. I wish I could've taken my entire course load from him.
No Comments
his english accent is very cute...don't worry he's not hard to undertand.  He's very interesting to listen to.
Amazing teacher, really helpful and an amazing person to talk to. Very personable
He is such an amazing person and amazing professor!!!! I hope to have him again in the future.
He is the best professor ever and makes class so enjoyable!!!!

Professor DeWitt has been one of my favorite professors so far. He's very friendly and genuinely cares about his students' success. Very flexible and understanding with extensions and gives helpful feedback on all projects. He designs the class so that we become better writers. If you can, please take his class!

An amazing professor who really cares about his students and consistently displays a clear passion for whatever final product they produce for projects. If you can take a course with him, then be sure to do it.

He's very passionate about what he teaches and even more passionate about his students. He actually cares for our well-being and understands that school can't always come first. I enjoyed every project and would definitely take this course again. Scott is awesome!

Plenty of his classes are studio, which means we have time in class to work on the projects that are assigned. There is only one project assigned at a time, and there is no other homework. Very friendly and approachable and truly cares about making sure his students succeed.
Scott clearly loves his job and loves teaching. He was very passionate about everything he taught and it was very easy to learn from him.

This class is amazing and Dr. Dewitt makes it wonderful. It was very well structured and I learned a ton. Dewitt knows a lot and is very helpful. His attendance policy is flexible as long as you keep him informed. I highly recommend taking his class.

professional and fun. Makes learning have a purpose and goal. Has great sense of humor but expects you take the class serious. Has detailed reasons for what he asks you to do. Great experience, would take any class with him. Finally, a college class that filled my expectations of what college should be and no instructor attitude and power trips.
Really interesting class. Engaging instructor.  I loved every minute of it.  Take any class with this instructor that you can!
One of the best and highly challenging classes I have ever taken. He was always there to help me if I needed it and made me accomplish things I never thought possible. Not too bad looking, either!
Encouraged office hours and gave good direction. Very passionate about the subject and chill. Good at creating a community within the class.

Tammy was great! She by far is the best professor I ever had at OSU! She cares about every student in her class, and it is clear that she loves the language she is teaching. She is always there to help through difficult topics and is always someone you can get ahold of after class. If you have her for any class you will truly benefit!!

AWESOME! Favorite prof I've had at OSU. Made learning a new language fun when its usually quite challenging. Obviously cares about her students a lot and it makes class more enjoyable as a result. Having to go to class 4 times a week is not fun for any class, but with Tammy it doesn't feel like a burden. Hope my other ASL profs are on par with her.

Such an amazing teacher. She makes ASL fun and I always looked forward to attending class. She cares about all of her students and always accepts feedback on how she can make the class better. Highly recommend!!

I really enjoyed how flexible Tammy was with her students. As she was going through grad school, she understands that being a student is difficult and is very accommodating and helpful. I would definitely would recommend taking Tammy for any ASL class.
Professor Eckard is by far one of the best professors I have had my 4 years at OSU. She is extremely caring and makes you wanted to come to class. Highly recommend taking her classes if you can!
Shes an incredibly caring person, but definitely a tough grader. She will give you clear feedback on your signing so you know how to improve. A lot of the class is study sessions (easy points).
She graded my video submission but when I ask for feedback she didnt give any.

Tammy is brilliant and so much fun to be around and to learn from. I found myself going to class early just to hang out and talk to her before the class started. She was always super helpful and understanding of our needs, and she would change course requirements or lecture materials if she found that we just weren't getting it.

By far one of my favorite professors. Her class becomes a little much at the end with the test and project. overall a great class and great professor. If you show up to class you will be fine! also Tammy is hearing!

Tammy is amazing, I took a fourth ASL class outside of the GE req just so I could take another one of her classes. Participation is key for any language class but Tammy is easy to connect with on a personal level.

Tammys awesome I truly did not think this was a challenging class as long as you show up and are nice to tammy she will do all in her power to help you and she is Accessible outside of class. The class was fun but sometimes was dry.
Great class and teacher. Totally recommended.

Tammy is tough, but fair! If you come to class, you'll do well. You'll get out of this class what you put into it, so if she thinks you're not trying that might be reflected in your grade for expressive tests and projects. Overall, she's funny, nice, and helpful. Just beware not to make a bad impression through poor attendance!

I loved Tammy! I took ASL on a whim for my language GE and this class couldn't have been a better start to it. Pretty laid back. A lot of interaction with other students, but it is a language class. Barely any homework, but learned a lot!

Tammy is an absolutely amazing instructor! love her class, love her. Great at teaching sign language and makes sure nobody is left behind. Grades very fairly. attend every class and you won't have to study outside of class.

She was a good teacher. However, compared to Tia and Marcia, my past ASL teachers, she is a tough grader. Attend class and you should be in good shape with getting a B in the class, A if you really work hard for it. Also, make sure you do the culture day readings, she will put questions on quizzes to see if you read them.
Tammy is the best instructor I've ever had. She really cares for her students and goes above and beyond to provide clarity.  Great class and love her.

Tammy is amazing and a great teacher. She really wants her students to succeed and understand the language. She's adorable, too. Definitely take her if you can! Bends over backwards for her students- even the ones who don't deserve it.

Tammy was extremely helpful. she puts everything from class on carmen. She allows you to turn in most of the assignments via carmen as well. Class was awkward at times due the fact that no one really knew each other or sign language, but it gets better. Tests are fairly easy as long as you know vocab
Very helpful and accessible, spends a lot of time making sure you have all of the concepts before moving on and willing to help one on one if needed. Excellent teacher!!
I took ASL to be able to communicate with the Deaf Community.  I learned a great deal from ASL 2.  Enjoyable teacher and class!

Tammy was a difficult teacher. You really have to do every homework and do extra studying on top to make sure you understand the vocab. She doesn't spend as much time on vocab as she could have. Her first test was scripted but your not allowed to have your own notes or ASL gloss to read off.

Dr. Wheeler genuinely does care about her students, but not so much their grades. She provides excellent insight during class, however, the workload is definitely overkill. She is a very tough grader and it seems like she looks for ways to take points off rather than award them. Would not take again, but I still learned a lot from the course.

Professor Wheeler is a difficult professor with high grading standards. However, if you want to pass the class, get ready to analyze as best you can with each assignment and RESORT BACK TO THE TEXTBOOK AND LECTURE NOTES. She loves Roberts and creates the lecture notes for cheats so make sure you reference those and I guarantee a decent grade.
Cares a lot about her students and is passionate about her job. However this class is TOUGH. Be prepared to work like hell. If your tryna just complete a GE, pick a diff professor.
yikes

I have never received a lower grade than in her class. No one in my entire class received full credit for anything. She encourages creativity, but "Roberts" is her bible. If anything you say goes against or isn't fully supported by Roberts, your grade will suffer. She is a nice professor, but for a freshman English course, she is WAY too strict.

i get no pleasure doing any of her assignments knowing full well there's going to be something to miss due to the stacks of papers we have to refer to every time we read. for an introductory class, it's so hard and challenging in the way that is obnoxious. 
i do enjoy the class discussions at the very least, and she seems pleasant outside of class.

I would rather eat nails then take her ever again. She failed me by one point because I was 'not adequate enough to continue without redoing the course'. She never once gave me constructive feedback on what I was doing wrong in my essays, even after multiple office hours. She plays favorites and is just an awful professor. Workload is ridiculous.

Any time a teacher brags about how hard they grade u know the class is going suck. Roxy likes to flex and tell the students that her class is one of the hardest to pass at osu. u shouldn't be a teacher if you take pride in failing kids and think that grading harsh is a badge of honor. Her teaching ethos is disgraceful and an embarrassment to OSU.

Prof. Wheeler genuinely cares about her students and makes herself available if you have questions. She is, however, a very tough grader and she expects a lot from students. You have to be prepared to voice your opinions in class and you have to do the reading, but getting a good grade isnt impossible, as long as you work for it.

Dr. Wheeler has higher expectations, but if you put in the effort, you will learn so much and actually improve. If you reach out to her, she is very kind and caring, and she will work with you. She is extremely articulate and knowledgeable about her field; discussions with her are engaging. For the serious student, I highly recommend her.

Want an easy A? Not your class. Want to be pushed, actually learn something about fiction, and have your essay writing skills challenged? Take this class, and know that every good grade you get was earned. C's are average. B's are above average. An A means you are a legend. She's a "tough" grader if you're used to a sub-par education and coasting .

Got a D the first time, thought maybe I can retake it and get a better grade. Not the case... this time I was told to drop the class myself, or she will fail me at the end. Even though my assignment turns out average and was constantly improving.

Basically all she talks about is the Roberts textbook and you have to read a book every week then write a paper (kinda) on it which she grades extremely harshly (The highest grade I heard was a 70). Half the class has already dropped it and everyone else probably would if they could. Do not take this class. She seems kina nice though
There is so much ready and it is nearly impossible to get an A with Roxann. Be prepared to talk or fail

Her entire course grade is made up of 4 grades. Says that her office hours will help you but when you go she just talks for hours. Her teaching style is basically talking at you the entire class. Her grading is very particular and she prides herself on her class being a tough one to pass. Honestly one of the worst profs I've encountered at OSU.

Professor Wheeler is very knowledgeable, although she can be very condescending. Make sure you read the books, because her exams are mainly quote analysis, but class basically consists of going over the sections you read so make sure to go. The class was very similar to my high school English courses, so I didn't find it to be that difficult.

Roxanne expects a lot from her students so you have to be focused and hardworking if you want to do well in her class. Going to office hours is key to getting a good grade on her papers because she is a tough grader and you want to make sure that you are identifying/analyzing correctly and thoroughly.

Very sweet woman. She's definitely a difficult grader, but I still admired her throughout the class. You will have to put in a lot of work in order to get a good grade, but I'm glad I took this class. I like her choice in books and the discussions we had on a daily basis were mind-opening and entertaining.
Roxann Wheeler: still one of the best professors at OSU. I think she gets a bum rap because she's a hard grader. Still, she's a genius.

She's really willing to help you during office hours, but there is a ton of reading. Like 50-100 pages before each class. The books are weird and not the typical fiction you'd think of. There's no homework besides reading, and the only grades are 2 tests, one 6 page paper, and participation, each worth 25%.  The exams are made to examine the book.

This class is difficult for a GE, but not impossible. She likes to help you perfect your papers and is good about working with students. I personally disagree with how she taught literature, but I can see progress in my writing. This class is not fantastic and is highly demanding, but it is not as bad as it could be.

Roxanne is a difficult teacher and expects a lot from a GE course. However, she is eager to work with you and very nice. Sometimes over the top nice if that exists. I suspect that she is a name grader, but I am happy with how she grades my stuff. I would recommend avoiding it, but this is not the end of the world.

This is far and away the worst class I have taken in my life. She teaches English in the most linear manner possible, only accepting one answer for a complex issue. She is also the worst name grader I have ever had. Stay away from this class at all costs-it will kill your GPA and you will not be happy.
Horrendous. Roxann is rude, unclear, unfriendly, and clearly disinterested in helping students understand her class material (which happens to be incredibly difficult). Avoid at all costs!
This class was a grind. No coverage of material, everything was vague. Class discussion was not a discussion, just her talking the entire time. Avoid. Seriously.
Professor Wheeler is not an easy teacher but extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Recommend.

It's not Roxanne, it's Roxann. For over 2 hours I spent my classtime looking out the window or just not paying attention...you really only need to read in order to do well...Sometimes we'd have to write a paper on one book and at the same time have to read something that is over 400 pages. Unclear on what she wants from you in papers...
one of the worst professors i've had. assignments were unclear, workload was ridiculous, no real ability to explain or communicate the material. avoid, avoid, avoid.
She is rude, non-understanding, and self-important.  Does not clarify information and she is non-bending when it comes to students personal lives.  I would say, just straight spiteful!

Roxanne actually was able to stir my interest in the material very well.  Her selections were good for the most part, and it's obvious she loves her work. Some of the primary and supplementary readings were dry, but you can't expect to love everything you read.  She's difficult, but invested in your success if you show that you care.

the antithesis to any great and inspiring teachers you've had before.  generally just lacks good social manners -- cutting you off while you're speaking, loves awkward silences, rude comments on papers, telling you you're wrong in front of everyone.  bad professor.

I hated most of what we read and load was pretty rough. Don't take her if you hate small group work. The handouts she gave us didn't clarify things and discussion never helped me to understand. Every time I volunteered in class (which was 20% of my grade) nothing was right enough. Basically, she made my life miserable for 10 weeks.

She demands a lot of critical thinking, discussion, and engagement. She also requires papers written for the class, and does not grade them easily. I have really taken a lot from the two classes I've taken with her though. She's great if you're bored with dull cake English classes. Definitely recommended if you like feminist theory/ gender studies!

I didn't think Roxanne was so bad.  He class on the early novel was really interesting and I thought the assignments were really helpful to my actual education, not something you can usually say about homework.  It was a real pleasure to take this class.
self important, arbitrary, not interested in students.
The workload was just unbelievable, and I was never exactly sure what she wanted.  We got to revise our papers which helped... but I was very very disappointed with this class.
No Comments
HAHAHAHHAHAHAHHAA!!! this class was so easy and fun, awesome topic too.

I didn't like the books we read and I didn't understand what she wanted on our papers. We just sat around and talked about sex most of the time (one of THOSE professors). I got an A, though - so I think it was easy.

I would recommend this class to anyone. I was nervous at first about this course but Angel made me feel confident in my writing skills and prepared us to complete assignments and we had good discussions in class. You have a discussion due each week which got a little tedious but this is a 4 credit hour course. 4 essays and a final group project.

Professor Evans was a great educator and you could tell she really cared about getting us excited about writing. Assignments were not considered late until after 24hrs after the due date which was really helpful. Really liked this class and would recommend it to anyone.
Evans ensures that you are well informed on assignments (there are 4 essays to write). She is willing to know your personal life and makes the environment feel full.

Dr. Bogen is an amazing person and instructor. I took her class for a GE requirement, and I am so happy I did. She is so easy to talk to, and very understanding of circumstances. Minimal homework, and a few papers. Very reasonable for a GE english class.

I loved this class!! I took it to fulfill a GE requirement and went into it expecting it to be boring but Anna's curriculum was engaging and interesting. The group discussions were centered around real-world topics and were interesting to learn about. She is very caring and understanding of each student's individual circumstances as well.
I had her for the general education seminar and she is a very sweet and caring lady. She grades late assignments and gives full credit and the class is overall very easy.

Lauren is a very kind and knowledgeable person, who made this class very interesting. Our grade was mostly made up of small reading quizzes over the books we read and a handful of papers, which were all graded very fairly. She was always very helpful and accessible with any questions or accommodations as well. Would highly recommend!

I had a difficult semester and got very behind in her class, she was sympathetic and didn't take off points for late submissions. As long as you read assignment instructions and follow them, you can get 100% in the class.

The best professor I have taken till now, she gives us a chance to revise our papers after submitting them and offers extra credit throughout the course, she gives full points on any assignments which are not part of the main papers and excuses us for a late submission.
I had a tough semester and she never took late penalty

Shes honestly super nice and understanding. This was a hard semester for me and I turned in a lot of of late work, but she never gave me a penalty for it. Very easy to communicate with and sends a nice message at the start of every week.

Megan is sweet and she cares about her students. The class is mainly group work, but she's always available to give feedback. Was the class super interesting? Well, is business writing super interesting? Actually, focus on independent group projects and student presentations made it more bearable than it would have been. She's a good person!

I had the unfortunate experience of having Kerns for both business writing  and professional writing . Both classes were nearly identical in their dryness and content. Megan is the least compelling professor I have ever met in the English department. You are almost guaranteed an A just by showing up, but even that is easier said than done.

The class wasn't difficult, as it's a writing GE course the grades come from all the paper assignments. Class time was spent mainly discussing readings & peer editing, class always seemed to be led more by students than by professor. She is nice & gives help if you ask, but she didn't really teach that much

You know how some instructors aspire to inspire, while others are just 'there'? She's one of the latter. She's not difficult, but that's because she didn't teach. She read directly from powerpoints prepped by someone else. She wrote poetry as the class read aloud. Students were treated like kindergarteners. And she took months to grade anything.

I did not like Professor Farrell. I feel like she would ramble on and on about nothing. The lectures were pointless, but the attendance was required. She never made much sense and then you would take the quiz and have no idea what's going on. It is ALOT of reading. This class is just a bunch of BS and this is coming from an English major.
the lectures were never very helpful, i don't think she ever really got to the point, but attendance for lecture is still required.

Prof Farrell extended our deadlines most of the time by at least a week. Even though there was a lot of reading, the quizzes were easy because most of the answers were discussed in class. The coursework consisted of 5 quizzes, 2 response papers, 1 final project, 1 group project, and an extra credit option.

Classes were very discussion based and you were given four excused absences. Every quiz was easy and the response papers were graded fairly. Sometimes there was a lot of reading but that was the only homework. Overall, prof was flexible with due dates and extended the due date every time.

Molly was kind and definitely cared about her students, but this class was a lot of reading. She also created her own grading scale where the highest grade you could get is a 95 and there are "slash" grades, which was ridiculous. She also doesn't post grades on Carmen. Alright class, she just did things in a strange way.

Her lectures had very little to do with literature and far more to do with the professor's own research interests. The TAs were great, but I would recommend taking the course with a different professor!

Professor Farrell was awesome! Lecture attendance not mandatory, recitation attendance was. Grade was based mostly on two big essays and some on two exams, extra credit was offered. She gave extremely interesting lectures and was genuinely interested in student success. Very knowledgeable and enjoyable. A bit of reading but not too bad!

Overall, this was an interesting class. It was actually a little frustrating as a senior because it felt like she could really dumb down the literary concepts, but not a bad option.  Prof. Farrell is really kind and interested in student feedback.

Professor Farrell was great and the class was extremely interesting. I had little interest in 19th century literature before taking this course, but I am so glad I did. It isn't a cake walk, but if you're looking for something interesting and challenging, I recommend this!

Wish I could tag more. Would definitely take again and she's there for her students. Honestly the greatest human on this earth right now. She's fantastic and challenging and open minded - really tested all of our belief systems and challenged the societal norms. She's very socially and politically aware and isn't afraid to speak her mind. PLUS MORE

Professor Farrell is great! She really listens to her students and is really interested in current events as well as the historical literature she lectures on! She gives many chances for extra credit, and never makes our discussions uncomfortable. She is intelligent and perceptive to what the class wants to discuss. I highly recommend her!

Molly is brilliant, relevant, and cool. She is one of the more "hip" English professors at Ohio State, and her class reflects that. She is open to new ideas as well. However, she is a tough grader. Go in for help and ask EXACTLy what she wants to see on the papers and you will do fine. I got a B+ but put in work.

I am a 4th year English major, and Molly was officially my favorite professor in my college career. She was so intent to listen to her students, and she truly cares about what WE want to learn. Heavily focused in discussion, but never made me feel nervous, as most discussion classes do. Please take her history based English classes!

She's super understanding and kind. Grades by letter, not by number. You can't get a 75, you get a C. Even then, she wouldn't let you get a C. For a lot of assignments, a C is the lowest thing you can get, so it's pretty difficult. No grammar or spelling checks. She just wants to know your thoughts and see that you put effort in.
Horrible professor. Doesn't realize the introductory nature of the classes and acts as though you have a whole degree in linguistics before you enter.

Genuinely one of the worst professors I have had at Ohio State. Loves the sound of his own voice. Employs complex explanations to flex his knowledge with no regard to how his students are learning. Graded by very few assignments. Quizzes are highly unfair and are meant to trick you. RUN if you have to take a class with him. Literally anyone else .

Dr. Seward was great! HE is super kind and gave us extra participation points just for getting things done on time. There's a few projects, some discussion posts, and lots of reading (which was expected in an English class). Would take him again- he's super understanding and helpful! Didn't feel super stressed about this class.
Professor Seward is fine; I wouldn't take him again, but if you happen to be in a class with him, you won't be left in the dust.

Seward helps to build your resume and portfolio in the course, and at no point is there ever really a need to crunch on readings or assignments. Very chill course that'll allow yourself to get introduced to technical writing and build a basic portfolio in order to land internships in the field.

Dr. Seward is an amazing professor compared to many others in the department. Also, I have a tough time believing some of these reviews that regard him as a tough grader with difficult assignments. All assignments had clear instructions, the deadlines were allowed to be moved back multiple days if asked, and grading was never overly harsh.

Great class. Dr. Seward is really laid back and understanding---he pushed back deadlines a ton when the class was struggling. On exams (which are long and challenging but open book and not timed) he gives really detailed, helpful feedback. Lots of discussions and readings but you can slide by without reading. I learned a lot.

For being a technical writing professor I could not understand any of his assignments without asking for numerous clarifications. Gives amazing feedback but takes off points as signals for improvement (not a fan). Multiple massive group projects. Lots of material to be graded on. Lectures consistent of him just rambling on and on. Veryconfusingprof

This professor is great. He is sweet and cares about you as a student. Has many office hour sessions instead of class and the assignments are manageable. You do have to buy three books but shouldn't cost too much, readings are actually interesting! Will not be disappointed
Never take this professor!!! Trust me !

The hardest part about this class was figuring out what I was supposed to do. Not that it was difficult, he just rambled on and on about absolutely nothing and all the projects were unclear. He loved to take off points for tiny things on every assignment since he "tends to round grades up" and offers rewrites at the end of the semester.

SO much rambling in classes, but he was so scatter brained that he gave a lot of extra time to complete assignments. Very understanding, just bad lecturer. Picky paper grader, but lenient with the topic you chose . extra credit opportunity end of course. you don't have to do pay much attention in class to get a passing grade (B and above).
Get ready to write small essays every week, and even though you put a lot of effort in writing the formal paper, you still cannot get an A. Tough grader, very strict.

Bummed to see negative reviews. Dr. Seward, in my class, was very helpful and knowledgeable. There was a decent amount of work the first 3 weeks of class, but after that the class was easy. There were no tests or quizzes, and we worked in small groups in the Mac lab. Also, he gives so much feedback on your work and allows revisions for full points.
Tough grader, no curve, mountain of homework.
Too many homework, too strict. Good feedback though.
In every time when I ask some questions for her, she is so unpatient.
She is a good educator. She knows what students need. She is awesome! I like her so much!
She is extremely helpful and always knows what students need. Also, she is patient with any questions you may have. Great class and great instructor!
One of the best lecturer!
Very nice teacher！Select her！
Nice teacher, very helpful.
Very nice teacher! Her class is really helpful and not hard.
She knows exactly what students need to learn. Very nice and helpful. Recommend her.
I just like her. She's is a good teacher!!!

Doesn't respond to emails from students and has no compassion. Had bad Covid and reached out to see if I could turn in a paper late. He never responded and gave me a 0. Class is the most boring thing I have ever been a part of. This class is about the devil and all we do is listen to him read random stuff from the Bible like a pastor. Awful class.

I really enjoyed this class by Prof. Hamlin. You can tell that he is really passionate about this subject and most class periods he goes on rambling. I took this class as a GE, I was close to dropping the course. Make sure to read material and maybe watch YT videos on it before coming to class. Only take if you are really interested in the Bible.

He's a great lecturer: engaging and hilarious. The readings can become demanding and the essays count for the vast majority of your grade--make sure you know how to write a good essay before you take this class. It can be an intense class, but it's very rewarding. If you want to put a lot in and get a lot out, take his class!

Great class and great readings from different genres. The reading load can be heavy, but little homework (a part from the reading), and a few quizzes. Exams include a Midterm, final essay and final exam. The exams can be tough if you don't pay attention in class as they often includes small details. Overall great class and engaged professor.

Great class and a great guy. While weekly quizzes can be a bit rough, they grade fairly. You deserve the points taken off of an essay, and you get time to improve before the big essay later on. Exams were not difficult whatsoever, be sure to take quality notes! Flexible and a comic, you'll enjoy learning about the Bible! Go, and do thou likewise.

STAY AWAY!!! Exams are structured in a way where you will have to memorize literature (bible)completely. Exam questions included questions that were literally one word and you had to say where in the bible it was and what context, and it could be from anywhere in the bible. Good luck memorizing every word in the bible. Also extremely tough grader

In this class, we were only presented with quizzes (11 to be exact) once every week and given one long 5-page essay to write and that's the only grades we had. Some of the reading was medieval reading and was hard to comprehend and we would then be tested over it without any explanation other than our own understanding we had formed.

Do not take his class. He (wrongfully) reported almost half the class for academic misconduct. He's nice and excited about Shakespeare but.. He took over 2 months to grade our 1st essay & had us write a 2nd before getting any feedback. No feedback. No Carmen grades. Just uncertainty and confusion. And fear of getting reported for things you dont do

CRAZY tough grader (class average for both exams was a 26/40). Once went 3 weeks straight without lectures or any word from him, never posted our true grades to carmen until the very end, made participation worth 30% of the final grade with only 5-ish weeks of synchronous lectures. Please spare yourselves and take a different class

I will never take this professor anymore. He was less caring all he cared for was his Shakespeare class and he will never specify what to read for the exam. He responded to email a bit rudely. Taking this class during the COVID is a nightmare . Y'all shoulod not take him just a warning.
I am taking hims for Shakespearean Lit and he is clearly very well versed in his material. He is so excited to teach in his classes. As of halfway through the semester, I like him!
In simple words, DO NOT TAKE HIM!

I would not take this class with Hamlin if I had other options of professors to take it with. His test style is a bit unfair in that he makes you memorize a work in its entirety and won't tell you even remotely what part of the book or piece he is going to focus on, and not something you could get from class. Very difficult, won't have him again

Hamlin is passionate about his subject (Shakespeare Lit), but he treats this class more like an upper-level course. He also does not use Carmen, so you will not know your grade until it's already on your transcript. There are pop quizzes after every reading that were pretty tricky.

Professor Hamlin is clearly brilliant; however, he does not utilize Carmen and did not post grades the entire semester. If you're someone who wants to know what your grade is before they are put into BuckeyeLink, take a different professor. The subject matter is boring but he does his best to make it manageable. Take a different lit GE.

By far one of my favorite professors ever. He is extremely excited about teaching the material. He knows an extensive amount. Uses slides to reinforce talk, but listening is most important. Exams are very difficult if you do not read the texts or take notes in class. If you're attentive in class, you'll be fine. He'll chant in Anglo-Saxan. 10/10.

Definitely attend class, only get 2 absences across lectures and recitations. Exams can be pretty specific--have textbook with you IN CLASS and highlight/annotate key passages that he mentions in class, this way you know what to focus on. Hamlin was entertaining and made the material engaging. If you show up and do the work, you'll do well!
Tests are specific, but if you do half the reading and pay attention in lecture you'll be fine. Very funny, makes dry course material interesting. Grades by a few things, but grades fair.

Dr. Hamlin tries to keep lecture interesting and does a good job for such a dry topic as medieval British literature. The class is lecture heavy and he doesnt post notes online so you really need to attend lectures and take notes to be sure you can study for the (fairly difficult) exams. Overall a good and fun professor.

This class could have easily been boring because it was a large lecture, but Professor Hamlin made rather dry material very interesting. He tied in quirky historical facts with the reading to make class more entertaining. Be prepared to take detailed notes because the exams ask specific questions, so you need to know the material well.

Not too much work but a lot of reading required. Final was not cumulative. Very entertaining lecture. Does not post slides online though. Everything he says in class, even if it is not on the slides, are fair game.
Learned a lot from him but he is a tough grader

Hannibal is just a fantastic human being.  He is so knowlegable and I want to take every class he offers.  He is so passionate and a mind-blowing lectureur.  He is so helpful and really knows what he's talking about.  Ask him a question after class, whether it be a question about the material or something that you became curious about, he knows it.

You would expect a class on the Bible as literature to be the most interesting class in the world. You would be wrong. This was my favorite class all semester. There were a couple papers, but otherwise the workload was very manageable, especially if you're already familiar with the Biblical text. Prof. Hamlin did a great job making this class fun!

Great professor! Real passion for what he teachers. Just be sure to PAY ATTENTION IN LECTURE! A lot of what he says ends up being short answers on tests. The class has its low points but show up to class and pay attention and you're pretty much guaranteed a good grade. He's also super helpful, go to office hours!

Great teacher! Really passionate about teaching. Very clear when communicating, and easy to talk to even outside of class. He's really knowledgable about the Bible and makes class as interesting as possible. There's a good bit of reading, but otherwise, take him if you can!
Awesome! So passionate about the subject matter!
Love Hamlin.  Have taken more than one class with him because he is so awesome.  If you get the chance to take his class, go for it.

Class was very interesting and Dr. Hamlin brought it to life. The Bible Can be very boring to study if not done correctly. Though he is a very tough grader, still one of my favorite classes here at OSU.

Really enjoyed this class, we had some really interesting discussions and read some of Shakespeare's lesser known plays as well as some famous ones. Professor Hamlin really knows what he's talking about and facilitates great discussion. Definitely suggest this class to anyone with an interest in Shakespeare. Midterm and final papers and exams

Midterms and finals draw specifically from what is said during class, so you really need to take notes. He was a pretty tough grader and overall the class was pretty hard. He's extra picky with papers, but doesn't always make it clear what you did wrong. Overall, he was really passionate about the material which made lectures were interesting.

Hamlin is great.  Really fun and interesting.  If you read the plays and go to class, you will do great.  Also, you should be able to write a decent 5 page analytical paper. The scenes he talks about in class are normally the ones on the tests so pay attention when he discusses them.

Absolutely LOVES what he studies, and does give phenomenal constructive feedback on papers for both content and mechanics. He has odd grading parameters for things like participation, which might irritate students when paired with his habit of long, context-heavy tangents on film (often leaving little time for students to actually participate).

The guy can pontificate like no other, but if you are interested in film, it's not that bad (usually). Assignments are straightforward and he provides some of the best feedback on essays I've ever gotten. Make sure you participate in class discussions, though.

Understanding, actually wants his students to think critically, and navigates discussions with care and consideration. If you ask for help sincerely, he's VERY understanding. Class was heavily based on discussions and quizzes (you'll HAVE to read the textbook for them). Slightly harsh grader on essays but provides insightful and detailed feedback.

Very passionate about film and what he does. Typically easy to talk to. If you dont attend lectures you wont get a nice grade. I dont really agree with attendance being mandatory especially because of covid, but yes, it is right now. He grades decently and is typically a nice and easy to get along with type of person.

Although this man is very smart, he just stands in front of the class and talks. Rather than actually really allowing this class to participate. He gives feedback on essays, but most of it is backhanded and if you ask questions, he never gives you a straight answer. He also is very hard to get ahold of, so hopefully you don't need anything.

This class was one of the most fun I have had yet.
