The lectures were straightforward and easy to understand, the quizzes and essays made you think but were easy if you paid attention, and the movie selection was varied and interesting. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone interested in film.

Professor Friedman is one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. The feedback he gave on projects and papers was really fantastic. I feel like I learned a lot from him. The films and readings he chose for the course were very interesting, too. His class was a lot of work, but definitely worth it.
Cares about teaching. Clear. Great feedback.

I thought the topic for the class was really interesting (imagining the nation in popular cinema) and that he chose interesting films and reading materials. He's very willing to help and grades reasonably. Classes can be a little dull at times, but Ryan is one of the nicest, smartest profs I've had. Would recommend!

Professor Friedman's reading materials are interesting, and he is extremely smart and insightful, but his lectures are a little dry. He doesn't lecture often, but when he does pull up PowerPoint, I die a little on the inside. Mostly though the class discussions are dictated by the students and are really enjoyable and interesting!

Took AU '12; Friedman is extremely smart and communicates his material very well; he is however, pretty boring. I felt myself watching the clock a lot. This might be because of the semester conversion, however. He allows students to speak a lot, which is nice, but he doesn't moderate discussion very well.  Overall, the class varied each meeting.

A lot of what you need to know are lectures and class discussions, so it's important to attend class. His lecturing style is really dry, tedious and lengthy. The content is interesting, the way he presents it isn't. Also, he don't know how to speak simply, so getting a yes or no answer can take an entire speech. He's not bad, but he's not the best.

Ryan is charming, very knowledgeable, and laid back his teaching style depends on the mood of the class, but it is clear he'd rather moderate discussion than lecture for 2 hours. His prompts and exmas are always thought provoking, he gives great writing tips, and has a great reading selection.

Overall, I thought this class was great. It was very useful towards developing writing skills. My writing abilities improved drastically from the first paper to the last paper. Prof. Friedman is awesome. He selected fascinating readings for class. He also types up his critiques for your papers, which is SO helpful. He is simply a great professor.

Ryan has a very strict teaching style, almost like he has practiced his whole entire lecture multiple times and does it in front of a mirror. He makes the class write a final 8 page paper as well as an exam that takes the entire period. It is like he thinks that his class is the only class that you are taking that quater.
A good professor, only downside is the material gets boring at times and his teaching style makes it easy to lose interest as a result.
Outstanding professor for my film class. He is very clear and communicates the subject matter in such a way that the whole course became very interesting.

I really loved Professor Helterbrand. He was funny, engaging, thoughtful, and thorough. Be prepared to read a few things weekly most of which are covered and reflected on in class. Journal responses are not harshly graded and are just a personal reflection.

Professor Helterbrand is a great guy who genuinely cares about his students. The only reason he did not get a 5 is because he never checks his emails. Seriously, if you have a question, stay after class or be prepared to figure it out on your own. That being said, this is the only bad thing I could say about this professor!
Dr. Helterbrand is the best professor! Interesting class content and discussions when I am taking this class!!!

Dr Helterbrand is an amazing professor who really cares about us. He is super funny and laid-back. You should do the readings, which are sometimes complicated, but he explains them in class in a really helpful way.
Very thought-provoking class with a lot of readings but overall pretty easy. Instructor cares a lot about his students and puts the extra time/work in to make sure they succeed.

He's classes are super fun. A lot of reading assignments but he willl go through them all in class so you could pretty much pass the class without reading any single one of them (but a lot of them are really interesting to read). Reading Journels and exams are easy as well. Highly recommended this class for diversity GE.

Dr. Helterbrand is one of the best professors I have ever had. The course has a good amount of work, but he makes it very manageable and will set you up for success. He is very caring and is willing to work with you on assignments/give you extra time if you reach out. I would 100% taking a course with him!

Dr. Helterbrand was SO amazing. Extremely nice and really cares about his students. He doesn't mind if you turn things in late which is great. Really easy grader and basically gives you the answers to the midterm and final. A lot of reading but he explains all of it in class so it isn't really necessary.

Dr. Helterbrand is super caring to all his students; he is easy to talk to and gives excellent advice on papers; this is a college writing class, so you will have to write papers, but Dr. Helterbrand will help you every step of the way. He is very easy-going on late work if you communicate with him.

Dr. Helterbrand is clearly passionate and knowledgeable about video games and cares about his students a lot (he's very understanding when it comes to late work). One of the best professors I have ever had and one of the coolest and most unique classes I have ever taken at OSU.

Dr. Helterbrand is a really good English professor. There are some big papers, but he is very understanding and very willing to help you out on them. Good feedback and will improve your writing. Gives class workdays a lot and does not bore you with useless info just to take up time.
Ryan is probably the best professor I've ever had. He is the most caring and understanding teacher.
This is the best professor Ive ever had. He really cares about your opinion and helping you express yourself through writing. This is a really fun class and you actually learn useful things.

Dr Helterbrand is the best professor I have ever had. He is very engaging; he gives clear instructions on what he wants for every assignment. He understands how busy students are and he is always easy on submission extension.

Cancels class a lot which is awesome. Hes very easy to reach out to if you have questions on anything. Hes very clear about what he wants to see on your assignments. Hes also really good at giving feedback. My writing has improved thanks to him. Would love to have him again sometime.

Dr. Helterbrand is amazing. Truly cares about what he's teaching and his students. Very easy on late assignments, and cancels class often too which is nice. Major assignment for class is an 8 page research paper, but he describes each step very clearly.

He is certainly one of the best professors at OSU. Professor Davis really cares for students and wants them to succeed. The readings can sometimes be challenging, but he explains them in great detail and is fantastic at teaching. Grades are mostly exams, but they're not hard because he clearly states what you need to know...just take good notes!

Though there is a lot of reading, this man deserves a Nobel Peace Prize. Favorite professor at OSU. Well-versed, great vocabulary, and interesting lecturer. Attendance is graded, but he's flexible and understanding. Gives hints during lectures about exams. I wish I took his class in person because he genuinely seems so cool! Choose him!!

Highly recommend taking professor Davis. His coursework is challenging and thought provoking and I feel I gained a lot from this class. I am normally not a fan of sci-fi but loved the readings in the class and the discussions. There was a good amount of homework (normally readings) but not an excessive amount which I appreciated.

Professor Davis is very intelligent and does a great job in teaching the class. The only grades are from the four exams we took throughout the semester and those are based on his online lecture videos. Exams aren't hard, you should easily be able to get an A or B as long as you watch the lecture videos and take notes.
This is one of my favorite classes I have ever taken at OSU. Professor Davis is a caring, intelligent, and articulate professor that stands alone in his openness to ideas and discussion.

I've taken a class with Professor Davis twice now, and I truthfully wish he could teach all of my classes. He is really wonderful at challenging you to consider the impact your education has on humanity generally, and really cares about your well-being and learning capacity. He challenges students to make up their own minds and helps them do so.
An engaging and up to date professor.

Professor Davis is awesome. I hate to say this but I started and completed every project on the day it was due, and got A's on all of them (that being said I like to write). Just read the books he assigns. Super chill and understanding. I'd grab a beer with him.

Pretty chill guy and straightforward class. Lots of group projects which he ended up having in place of quizzes which he gave time to work in class, no need to have to work outside of class in that respect. It is a literature class so you have to read but he applies the material to a lot of things outside the text and has interesting discussions.

When I saw that Prof. Daviss section of 3372 was listed as climate fiction, I was intrigued, and I was not disappointed. We read 5 books in the semester and had a lot of discussion on larger themes + implications of ideas discussed in the novels. Hes very flexible in terms of in class assignments. I highly recommend this class.

I signed up for this course ready for Harry Potter, and instead got climate fiction, end of the world dystopia, don't look forward to your future planet because there won't be one. It was pretty heavy and wasn't very literature focused, despite having a few novels that we had to read. Do not take if you have anxiety.

Do not miss your chance to take a class with Tommy Davis before graduating. His lectures are amazing and super informative and we had so many interesting discussions about the anthropocene and environmental humanities. I feel like I learned more in this class than in all my other classes combined and gained a new outlook on the world.

Honestly the best professor I've had thus far at Ohio State. I've taken three classes with Prof. Davis, and I can honestly say that no other professor even comes close to him. He has a genuine passion and personality built for education, learning, and revolution. If you wanna know what the last comment means take his courses.

He's one of the best professors I've had in four years as an English major. He's really helpful with materials (and general life advice) and always listens to students.  Lectures are interesting and you can tell Davis is engaged with the material. He's really bright and socially conscious, too.  I wish I could take more classes with him!

Professor Davis is one of the most caring professors I've ever had -- he extended paper deadlines and provided sources if necessary. Initially I was not interested in the course topic, but his lectures and humor changed that and it changed my passions in literature and in life. Seriously. He's interesting, clear-cut, and no nonsense.
Absolutely fantastic instructor.  Course was literally life-changing.

Really interesting class. He's super helpful and knows his stuff; also has a good sense of humor. Class was never boring! Would recommend to anyone interested in modernism. Probably one of the best instructors I've ever had at Ohio State.
Super helpful super nice guy
Easily the best professor in Ohio State's English Department. A role model for any english student looking to teach at a college level. Simply an amazing individual on every level.

Fantastic professor! His class is challenging at first, because he is very intelligent, but don't get intimidated. Stick with it and it will be very rewarding. He is a wealth of knowledge and is genuinely interested in what he teaches. He is also very approachable and willing to help. Would recommend.
Gorgeous hipster guy. Intelligent and interested, would recommend.

Professor Davis is a little intimidating at first, because he's so intelligent, but he's very approachable and receptive to questions.  I think he works hard to unpack material and he's extremely knowledgeable.  He's always highly prepared for class and grades papers fairly/promptly.  His class is the best one I've taken here at OSU.
No Comments

Great professor!  He is very enthusiastic about the subject material, makes the material interesting and understandable.  His class can be somewhat of a challenge, but as long as you attend lectures, it pays off in the end.

For a three credit hour GE this is a rough class with lots of work. First half is heavy on reading with some papers, second half is group project focused. Assignment instructions were unclear at times but Dr. Herman is always helpful and seems like a cool person who engages with her class.

Whatever you do, do not take this class. There is an excessive amount of homework. She grades EXTREMELY harshly and does not offer much grace when grading. Complete waste of time. Did not learn anything.

Dr. Herman is very available outside of class and really does want to help students. Her pre-lecture activities did get somewhat annoying throughout the semester. A large portion of the class was based on a group project.

Lots of lectures, takes attendance every day, hard grader, if you speak up in class and act like youre paying attention she will like you. Find a good group for the projects. Need to give best effort, but its more work than thought. Not horrible but probably wouldnt take this specific class again

PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HER. SHE IS AWFUL. ONE OF THE WORST GRADERS IN MY ENTIRE 4 YEARS HERE. SO RUBRIC HEAVY. SHE DOESN'T OFFER CONSTRUCTIVE FEEDBACK. SHE GRADES VERY HARSHLY FOR A SECOND LEVEL ENGLISH COURSE. DO NOT TAKE HER.

I really liked Dr. Herman. I saw some reviews talking about how she was a hard grader, but that wasnt my experience. I thought she was very fair and if you put in a moderate effort you should be fine! She was very caring and personable and seemed to want her students to really succeed. The class was a decent bit of work at times but manageable.
dont take her class if you want to pass.

Dr Herman was my absolute favorite teacher this semester. She is super nice and wants everyone to succeed. The class is laid out well and as long as you do your work to the best of your ability and show up to class, it was really easy to get a good grade. Only reason I didn't get an A is because I forgot about a few assignments.

Not a single assignment graded by her was above a 95% mark this semester (the high, not just for me) but her averages are generally high, so everyone basically gets a B+ for showing up. But if you want that A you gotta be the best in her lecture, for basically every assignment

Dr. Herman's class was structured really well. The resume writing, cover letter, etc. are all things that students looking for internships would need to do anyway but you get feedback and course credit. She is super accessible and nice but she can be a tough grader. If you put in the effort you get a lot out of this class.

She is one of the best yet toughest professors I have ever had, in any subject. She is easily accessible outside of class and gives excellent feedback. But she is a tough grader, one of the toughest I have ever known. I remember cursing her back when I was taking the class coz she made us work so hard to get a good grade. And uum, yep she is hot XD

Herman was a pretty great prof. The class itself was different from a typical writing course and challenged me often. Herman helped me to develop as a professional writer and explore how writing can be applicable to my engineering degree and leveraged in my career search. Also, shes not "hot" but is well dressed and fun to be around.

Dr. Herman is a great teacher. She cares a lot about learning but as others have mentioned she is a hard grader sometimes. The assignments in this class are not hard. If you show up to class you will do well.

Dr. Herman gives a lot by providing feedback, but she is one of the strictest teachers I have ever had, especially for a English class where grading is vague. No matter how hard I worked, I always seemed to end up with a Cs in assignments due to some petty reason such as referencing/and or citations, or some vague description about missing content.
Dr. Herman is very helpful and willing to help. However, when it comes to grading, she is pretty strict. Rules are rule.
Jennifer was a very nice and helpful teacher.  She made the topics (relatively) easy to understand.  Lots of reading for class(5 books + articles) but not too much actual homework.
She is a wonderful teacher. Do not worry about the difficult online readings, you will discuss them in class. Attendance is mandatory but class is very intersting, you won't be disapointed.

Highley is an amazing professor and cares about your success. He can be a bit hard to read at times but that is his sense of humor. He is always willing to meet with you outside of class and look at your papers! Take his class!

Everyone that I talked to in my class absolutely loves him and was sad to see the class end. He really cares about students succeeding and brings Shakespeare to life. He's really helpful in office hours, but you have to show him that you want to learn not just get an A. He will call you out for not participating but only bc he loves Shakespeare.

Prof. Highley is a wonderful man with a great sense of British humor. I really enjoy his lectures. That being said, he is a really tough grader on his exams, and they're all essay and short answer/analysis. I felt that he took off a lot of unnecessary points on my essays with little to no explanation.

Took AU 11; I cant believe Highley has bad reviews. Honestly the best English prof at OSU. He is knowledgeable and helpful, extremely funny, and very understanding of his students when they have problems (both in and out of class). He made me love Shakespeare. Keeps interest and gives a lot of feedback. Recommend.

Took AU '11; I can't believe Highley has bad reviews on here. He is by far the best professor in the English department; funny, helpful, knowledgeable, and completely understanding of his students when problems arise. He works with his students to get them to understand Shakespeare, and he makes it fun and interesting. He is an incredible professor

Highley is incredibly passionate about Shakespeare and has a great sense of humor. The readings can be tedious at times. He grades leniently and is more than willing to offer assistance outside of class. Oh, and he's British. I would highley (ha.) recommend him to anyone. :)

Prof Highley made things pretty interesting. He's enthusiastic about Shakespeare, can be funny (especially with his British humor). We read a lot of plays so at times the work load could be pretty heavy but he didn't grade too terribly hard. I learned a lot from this class.

We read seven Shakespeare plays during the quarter, and Prof. Highley led very interesting discussions about them.  He knows Shakespeare really well, and I learned a lot from his class.  I highly recommend taking Shakespeare with Prof. Highley.

He made Shakespeare fun. At times the lecture seemed to drag, but he always managed to capture our interests in the end. He brought us into the topic in a way that most others haven't before. He was interested in teaching and interested in our interpretations. He was also pretty funny at times!

Boring! He's a nice guy and sometimes funny, but he doesn't know how to connect with students/facilitate discussion. Pretty much shuts down all student comments. Class was really unfocused and jumped around a lot. He grades easily, but I didn't learn anything. He tells you potential exam questions, but they still take a long time!
i just saw your rebuttal to the comments and i have to say YOU ARE FUNNY!!!

Fun class. He's hilarious. Always cracking jokes and making fun of the time period. We had quizzes over the reading material but they were EXTREMELY easy if you read the stuff, and sometimes even if you didn't. Papers were easy and also graded easily. Take this class if you have any interest in London and need the GEC! You wont regret it!!

Dr. Highley is a fantastic professor!  It's rare for a Ren.Studies scholar to be so adept at reading film and looking at current cultural representations of Early Modern figures.  A fairl but tough grader on papers, and will definitely call you out if you bs anything.  I will definitely seek him out again!

Arrogant. He is the only teacher since 6th grade who has made me cry. Claims to want your opinion but basically tells you yours is wrong.  Comes off as if he thinks he knows everything just because he is British. Needs to get off the high horse. I can tell he is an intelligent man, but he portrays himself as if he is better than others.

Highly is absolutely AMAZING. Seriously. Okay, his lectures can kind of be boring, and he goes off topic a lot, but outside of class, he is amazing. I am taking another class with him in hopes of maybe having a more lucid experience, but he's great once you get to know him.

Professor Highley is no doubt the best professor I've had at this university.  Studying abroad with Highley was the chance of a lifetime! He helped me revise several drafts of the same paper...extremely helpful at office hours and his class is interesting! I highley recommend him :)
Highley is funny and nice, but grades kinda harshley. But I did enjoy the class and his anecdotes are pretty amusing and they make the classes easier to go to.
Though the class was pretty boring (and long), it was not hard to get an A.  I went in expecting it to be difficult, (given the material) but the quizzes were very easy.

Highley is a great professor.  He loves Shakespeare and knows more about him than anyone you'll ever meet. Professor Highley can be a tad bit arrogant at times and he has an annoying habit of not looking you in the eye when you speak to him, but other than that, he's great.
Professor Hightly was very unhelpful and very vague with his comments on papers.  I would not suggest taking a class with him if you can avoid it.
he loves his subject, and it shows.  An AMAZING course- i actually looked forward to class twice a week.  I highly reccommend Highley- (pardon the pun), he's hilarious and you'll learn a ton.
I've never had him in class either, but as my advisor he was also NO help at all.  He answered none of my questions and pretty much shoved me out of his office without having accomplished anything.
Highley is a great guy. He helped advise me when my advisor was not available. Really interesting!
Good Professor.  He loved his subject and you could tell.  I enjoyed his class

Who ever thought taking a Shakespeare class would be fun! With Prof. Highley class is always interesting.  His sense of humor really got the class going.  Expect to see a lot of red on your papers when you get them back, he knows what he is looking for
Great teacher.  Very interested in what he is teaching, makes it fun for the class.  Really gets the class involved in discussions.
One of the people who make the OSU Department of English blossom.
he is an okay teacher and is fun in class.  however, he is not a good advisor-- if you go into his office hours he will just stare at you.
He was a great teacher. He knew his material and he made interesting and worthwhile. I definitely recommend his class. If you're looking for a cake walk, this is not the class for you.
Great professor
No Comments

Awesome professor for ENGLISH 2367.06. So knowledgeable about disability studies and english. For an advanced english class, it was easier than I expected. Research paper final is fairly tough. Easy grader if you put effort in. A few participation points but not too crazy.

While the English 1110 classes is standardized across teachers she still tries to make it fun. Some lectures are boring but it's not her fault. Her hands are really tied on how to teach the class. She is fun, engaging and relatable.
Don't buy the textbook (I never used it) and it appears the worst assignment grade she gave a student was a 94%.

Did not follow the grading promises in the syllabus (said things would be graded within a week, its been almost a month)
Did not respond to emails
Very frequently posted assignments with the assignment explanation was in a link that were not accessible to students and did not change the accessibility until the night it was due

Assigns way too much reading. Tell me why I'm being asked to read 300 pages over the span of two days. Weekly journal assignments that ask for your thoughts on things we talked about in class yet somehow there is always something to nitpick about your opinions. Counted 50-100 "um"s per lecture. Definitely thinks he's too good to be teaching.

He lectures for the whole time but often opens it up to the class for thoughts. There are weekly journals and discussion posts. There is also a few larger writing assignments and quizzes. Everything is graded off of effort. As long as you put in the effort and try on your assignments and it shows, you will do fine in this class.

Really really enjoyed the "Themes in Science Fiction and Fantasy" course! Attendance was not required but I ended up going more often than not just because he is so passionate about the topic and I liked hearing the lectures. No exams, just a weekly journal, two short projects, and an essay. He's also very very caring and flexible with deadlines.

If you like long lectures, then this is the professor for you. He lectures for the entire class and often holds his students over. His voice is incredibly monotonous so it can be difficult to pay attention. Although this is a GE course there is a lot of homework. Luckily, most of the assigments don't require alot of critical thinking.
Is not clear with what he is expecting on assignments. Tough grader and is unforgiving if he does not agree with your thoughts .

Long and mundane lectures, yet definitely taught me how to analyze literature in new ways. Lots of hw and papers. Clear grading criteria and direct expectations. Take if you like to analyze many works, and write your own poetry, but be ready for long lectures and lots of hw.

Brewer is one of these professors who projects himself to be "too good" for teaching and too smart for students at Ohio State. It's like he could not care less. I recommend him if you're someone who enjoys being condescended to. If you're a dedicated major, avoid him.

Dr. Brewer is one of the most pretentious professors I have had at Ohio State. He assigns a lot of writing assignments but gives minimal to no feedback. His lectures are boring, unorganized, and you can tell he would rather be anywhere else than teaching. Not the hardest class in the world, but save yourself the migraine and take someone else.

Intro to Fiction with Professor Brewer is a great class. I would say is that as long as you put the work in, then it'll pay off. If you have questions, Dr. Brewer is willing to set up times to discuss essays and whatnot. He also gives great feedback on each of the writing assignments, which he grades with generosity given the writing's nature.

lectures are useless but you have to go, always seems unprepared, pretentious. i learned nothing in the class. grades fairly easily and assignments aren't difficult. really all you have to do is show up to class and watch the movies. but his lectures are like watching paint dry. feels like a waste of time and money.
Great guy. The participation grade can really hurt or help your grade. The books we read are really good and so are all the short stories.

He has a bad rep for being "boring," but I don't think it's fair for him to have a bad grade. Some of his lectures did drag on but his grading was lax, he was constantly available, and discussed a lot of things in class that he was looking for in homework. Nice guy. Had him for intro film and intro fiction. Hardest part of having him is attendance.

Super easy class. Theres a reading journal due each week thats very subjective so its free points. He says participation and attendance affects your grade heavily but I missed at least 5 classes and rarely spoke in class. I didnt read any of the books, just short summaries and I only read a few of the short stories and passed with a B

I showed up to every lecture I could (as useless as they were) and was at a 98% until the final exam which butchered my grade (unreasonable grading) only to end up just shy of an A (92.88). I pleaded with the professor to round up my grade or at least regrade my final exam, Nothing. (Too many As in the class I guess) This professor is a jerk.

I really liked Intro to Fiction. Classes are fun as it is mostly discussion based. I enjoyed the readings. Prepare for a weekly righting assignment, monthly papers, and a final paper. If you like reading, and are good at writing, this class is for you! He is explicit in what is required of you.

Lectures we're super useless. Ditched many times (had friend sign me in). It's film studies, should be fun, but he makes it so boring. In terms of class, pretty easy, no lie. Never did any homework. Final was on Carmen. If you take the class, you'll do fine, but it's just so boring. He also says "um" a lot, to the point where you can take shots.
lectures are extremely long and boring, only 2 papers and a final for a grade, would not take again
This class is incredibly boring. Lectures are long and dry. He'll use way too many examples for one concept. Show up, pay decent attention, take notes, watch the movies, and you should be fine.

I am a film major so I thought I would love this class but Brewer is SO boring. His lectures are too long with dumb partner questions at the end. He always seems very unprepared in his lectures and says "um" after every word. He uses annoying hand gestures and speaks so softly, you can't hear him. My TA didn't seem to know much about film, either.

I feel that other comments specifically on this class with Brewer were harsh.  He's pretty clear with expectations even if the TAs weren't.  Brewer makes it fairly easy to do well and tries to make lectures interesting.

His lectures were a bit boring, but he covered a lot of material in a short time period. He would sometimes look above the students instead of right at them, which is a bit weird. He would occasionally make funny jokes or pop culture references. I felt that the grading by his TAs was incredibly easy.
Ah, do not take this professor for this class. I am senior English major, have an interest in the text that we were reading, but could not get engaged in his lectures.  Save yourself the misery.

This class is truly a bore. Brewer is not interesting and neither are his TAs. The grading is extremely frustrating because the TAs will take points off of essay responses and quiz responses for not making points that were not asked of you in the prompt. It is as if they want you to read their minds. Waste of time. Awful class. Don't take.

Seemed somewhat average.  Grading was completely at the hands of the TA, so I can't really fault him on that (even though I'm doing well in the class, it seemed designed for one not to get an A). Lots of reading. Did give a bonus. Sometimes condescending, but he had his moments. It just was bad to have this class in Gateway....

This is literally the worst class I have ever taken. It is SO BORING, the professor assigns way too much reading prior to each lecture, and the grading is ridiculous. Absolutely NONE of the material is interesting. Brewer is just awful. His lectures are useless, yet you are required to attend. I promise you will regret taking this class.

Extremely boring and seems disinterested in the class. Assigns ungodly amounts of reading, then assigns both a quiz and a midterm on the same weekend. Fortunately all writing is online. Sparknotes is essential to survive the class. Mandatory attendance is a bummer, though  -- you could probably do just as well on assignments without his lectures.

I love this professor. Although his voice is somewhat monotone he tries to make the material interesting and occasionally makes corny jokes and bad movie references. The questions he poses in lectures are the exact same questions he asks on the midterm so pay attention and you will do fine. If your willing to do the reading then take this class.

Class is held in a movie theater.  Lighting is dim and he doesn't keep your attention.  Tons of reading for a gen ed! His TA's will grade you like you're in grad school.  Feedback is sparse and not helpful.  He phrases his questions very vaguely, but expects a specific answer.  Avoid if possible.

This is literally the worst class I've ever taken and I took 8am calculus... Absurd amounts of reading for a GenEd, online quizes that open Fri @ noon & close Sat @ midnight, required attendance for a large lecture class, and unclear grading rubric. If you're looking for a fun,easy gen ed to meet your lit requirement, keep looking; this isn't it.
He was a great teacher, I think I just wasn't into the topic and therefore got bored very easily.

I took H590.03 with David, and he is probably one of the best English professors I've had at OSU. He is a genuinely nice and funny guy who has an INCREDIBLE amount of knowledge and passion for English (especially 18th century British literature). I'm not a big fan of that time period, but he made the class enjoyable.

He is refreshingly similar to the POSITIVE comments on his ratemyprofessors page.  :)  This class is very easy and fun, especially if essay-writing comes easily for you.  It?s extremely funny, kind, and helpful.  Very eloquent as a previous comment said, and articulate but down-to-earth.  Highly recommended!!

Not a very good teacher. Do not take him unless you want to hear him repeat the same questions over and over and over. There was a point in the class when no one would say anything and he would admit to asking the wrong kinds of questions. Very poor lecture abilities. And every paper was a repeat of the last. His feedback is not useful eiether.Avoi

I love this guy. He was all about class discussion and letting us come up with ideas instead of forcing all of his on us. His selection of literature  was relevant to the subject but not the same monotonous crap. I love the way he talks, it's so... eloquent. He's really nice and listens to what everyone has say, no matter how stupid.

This is probably one of the easiest and most fun classes I've ever taken. Sometiems he can be a bit tedious as it seems to take him 100 years to get out a sentence, but overall he's really nice and funny. He's incredibly eloquent so if you don't understand big words, avoid  him. (ha.) Otherwise, he's great! Highly recommended!

Dr. Brewer's witty, free-form lectures are still with me five years later.  He is the finest professor I've yet encountered--he's brilliant, utterly unpretentious, generous with his time and funny as hell.    The writing projects for ENG 531 are among the best and most enjoyable things I've written, academic or otherwise.  Please take his classes.
I nearly fell asleep in this class every time it met.  He hasn't learned how to sustain and encourage discussion like he should of by this point in his career.

He only jabbers and doesn't listen. No chance for forum-like discussion. Focuses too much on his "eloquence" using vocabulary that might distance him from his students. He's supposed to be our advisor! And he was so frustrating.

Very smart guy with a good sense of humor and probably the NICEST, most polite professor I have had at OSU. Class a little boring at times, but I liked listening for his linguistic quirks, like "I don't mean to rehearse this again" and "This scene is delicious." Take his class - he's great.

Brewer was very helpful with everything in the class, but there was just SO much reading. Also, our discussions in class were annoying because he would want us to talk so he would just sit there and stare at us - but when he did talk, the "um"s were out of control.
Helpful, but said "um" before, after, and during just about every word.  annoying quirk, but decent teacher.

David Brewer is a good teacher who really enjoys what he does, in the case of my class the early British Novel. He was a good teacher to all of his students, and if I had to choose between him and another teacher for another class, I would choose David.
Great prof-- very enthusiastic, knowledgeable and prepared.
He's really into the material and fun to take a class with. Interesting Guy.
Brewer is an enthusiastic and encouraging instructor.  We need more of these!

Really great professor, super passionate about writing and genuinely wants everyone to improve. She's super funny and kinda makes everyone get to know each other, great vibes. Feedback is very direct (which I liked), just make sure you're prepared for it.

Greatest professor eeeeeever! I love her. Everyone loves her. She's so understanding, kind, funny, and really cares about your development as a writer. Gives great feedback and creates a super comfortable environment to share your work in. Definitely take a class with her and read her book if you haven't already!

No lectures! I felt like I bonded with everyone in this class, we played games in order to better learn how to include drama into teaching. This was my favorite class of my semester and the only one I would ever be willing to wake up and go to on a Monday morning. Highly recommend!

Professor Boyle was so incredibly sweet, and her classes were so enjoyable. The classes were very long and sometimes a little tedious, but overall it was great. She is really passionate about all her students being successful, and will always help if you ask. She's amazing! Definitely recommend!

I was not a fan of this teacher nor this class. She made this very enjoyable material very much unbearable. Readings were obnoxious and not conducive to learning. Disorganized class structure, yet wanted to emphasize structure in our own future classrooms. Funny. Do not recommend taking her nor this class.

I think maybe she just didn't like me for whatever reason, but she graded me harshly. It is a literature class, but be prepared to be graded like it's a composition class. The material itself is pretty great and if you are an education major, she does give you some good resources for the classroom. A lot of people just taking this for an easy A.

Highly recommend! Decent amount of reading but all really short children's chapter books (Charlotte's Web, Holes, etc.) and you just need to know enough to discuss book events with your group. Mostly small group discussion based class with small responses each week (200 words). No exams, just a final project. Strict on attendance (can miss 2).

Ms. Boyle is such a sweet lady and teacher. She makes class fun and engaging. There is quite a lot of reading (I think 10 novels in a semester?), but it's all children's literature, so they're easy reads. There are no tests or exams. Definitely be prepared to read novels and articles to prepare, but the class itself is quite easy and entertaining.

This class is intense with busy work, but it's also a six-week course. Dr. Squires has the material well organized on Carmen and provides helpful videos/lectures each week. She also responds promptly to emails and is a lenient grader with many of the assignments.

Professor Squires was a great teacher overall. I took an online asynchronous class with her over the summer, and she taught me a lot in a short six-week span. The class did feature a lot of homework (multiple activities due Mon/Wed/Fri), but the work felt meaningful and helped me grasp material that I was unfamiliar with!

Dr. Squires spends WAY too much time discussing her personal life (kids) and trying to incorporate humor such as memes, but this fails miserably. I did not truly learn anything from this class because she was SO unorganized.

Please do not take this class when there are so many easier upper-level English credits out there. She gave 8-10 assignments a week including anything from homeworks, quizzes, discussions, activities, and more. The work is so tedious and absolutely not on-par with a 3 credit hour class. This class wasn't worth it and only caused me so much stress.
Professor Squires assigns a lot, and I mean a LOT, of busy work. She's very knowledgeable about grammar but is very unapproachable when you ask her for help.

I was enrolled in Lauren's English 4572 class for Autumn semester 2021, in order to fulfill a minor requirement. Essentially, Lauren seems like a good person, but the course structure is FILLED with busy work. I would advise taking another class if possible. For reference, there were ten assignments (all worth points) due during week two alone.

Lauren was a great professor. I found the class to be really engaging and not too stressful. She wasn't a difficult grader, even though there were very few grades in the class (the whole class is out of 100 points). She wrote the textbook herself so it's online, free, and interactive, and she posts all her lecture slides online.
She'e one of the most sarcastic professors I've ever had. Went to her for office hours and she basically mocked her. Very unapproachable.

Dr. Squires is an awesome professor. Her ability to be informative but make lectures enjoyable is impeccable. She has an amazing sense of humor. I would without hesitation recommend her for any student of any major. She is in my top five educators at the college level.
OMG what an angel. Seriously. Love love love Dr. Squires and she loves her students, too. If you see her name next to a class offering, jump right on it.

I really, really liked Dr. Squires. She is so helpful and ALWAYS gets back to emails right away. She's a great teacher and you can tell she enjoys what she's teaching. I recommend taking her if you need this class. Dr. Squires knows what she's teaching, and she knows how to teach it.
Lectures were painfully boring. Constantly changed due dates the day before or even day of. Super easy grader and lets you have a say in groups.

The professor was very easy and gave out points for just doing the assignments. The ARP essay was the assignment we work on the majority of the semester. The lecture was offered through zoom but attendance and participation were graded.

Avoid her if you can. Her grades are based on whether she likes you as a student. She didn't read my final paper completely and graded based on the first paragraph. Also, her extra credit is useless since she just adds the points as regular assignments.
I feel torn on this review. This class is seemingly quite easy in the beginning of the year, and honestly is. However, grading feels slightly biased and confusing as the semester goes on.

Be prepared to get your fill of Russian women during WWII. If you arent reading about them, youre watching a movie about them. In Class, you just talk about what you read/watched. There are several books that you read throughout the semester. you will have to do an oral presentation over one at some point. Insanely boring, but its a credit.

This is one of the nicest professors I have had during my time at Ohio State. Mrs. Patton genuinely cares about the well-being of all of her students and always suggests good feedback. She is also so understanding about accommodations and works with every student.

Take this class! You won't regret it. Professor Patton is super flexible and really cares about her students. Aside from demeanor, her class is very interesting and I got a lot out of it. Keep up with the readings and the homework is very manageable and the same every week. Overall, great teacher and will be looking for more of her courses.

She taught me the most out of all my English professors. She really knows her stuff and took the time and effort to make sure I knew it too. Gives excellent, personalized feedback on all assignments. She can be a tough grader but it really helped me become a better writer. Take her class if you want to improve your writing!

She was such a kind, caring professor! She really went out of her way to be accessible in office hours or via email. You could tell that she really wanted her students to succeed. She's one of my favorite professors at OSU and I highly suggest taking English with her if possible, because an A is very obtainable
She is accessible but strict.

Professor Pattons class has been one of the most rewarding classes I have taken. We had three papers, one group project and weekly quizzes. The quizzes are difficult, so watch her lectures to pass them. She focuses heavily on syntax when grading, but gives thorough feedback on assignments. My writing greatly improved during the semester.
Jenny is fantastic! She TRULY CARES about each student and makes sure they know that. She is on your team and wants you to succeed and do well.

Jenny gives amazing feedback. My class required us to write multiple professional writing materials (blog posts, press releases, etc.) and lead up to a big group project. Kind of a lot of assignments but she spaces them out and makes sure to give us time in class to work. You can tell she loves what she does!! Highly recommend!!

loved this professor. she is so sweet and really cares about the material and her students. easy homework and assignments and she has some extra credit opportunities available. my favorite part was the feedback she provided. great class and teacher to take for an easy but interesting English class

Jennifer was by far the nicest (and best) professor I have had at OSU (and, for that matter, my entire academic past). In the beginning of the class, she really gets to know each and every student, and, to my surprise, she remembers details about everyone throughout the semester. There were only about 5 or 6 assignments (most of which were essays).

Amazing! Jenny really cares about her students. Papers may seem long and tedious but she gives great feedback and is there if you have any question. One of my favorite professors at OSU. If you can take her, do, you will not be disappointed.

Jenny is a great teacher. You can tell she really cares about her job and helping students. The workload is light and it's because she genuinely wants you to take something away from her class. Highly recommend!!

Absolute best first writing course professor. She may come off as a little eccentric, but that's because she loves what she does. You build on the same paper almost all semester which made me write my personal best paper (instead of cramming it in one night) She even sent me an email wishing me luck the next semester. One of the best OSU professors
She is very approachable and helpful. Her classes are easy to score too. One of the most kind-hearted professor in OSU!
Very helpful. Very clear instruction and a genuinely kind professor. She really cares about her students.
The lectures are almost meaningless, but Jenny is a genuinely nice person. Most approachable professor so far. Will definitely take her again for my second writing course!

Do not take this class for a GE. This course is all group projects. I spent more time on this class than my major classes. She is an easy grader. All deadlines are due by 5 pm W/F which was hard to manage. I thought this class would be business writing, but instead, it's all about the Ohio Sea Grant and Stone Laboratory. I learned nothing.

Dr. Teston was super nice. The whole class was just 3 projects, which she graded very easily and she was available during and after class to tell you if your project looks good or not. the class was definitely very political, but since her viewpoints are clear you can just tailor your projects to her views and get an A.

Professor Teston cares about students and how we are processing the material. For this histories and theories of writing class, we mostly do about 30pgs of reading before each class and just have discussion during class. She is super caring of everyone's opinions and really improves students critical analysis. She's really awesome, I recommend!
Entire class is structured by group work. Same group all semester. Easy grader with many opportunities to improve grades. Very patient and genuinely interested in helping.

Despite the subject matter being boring or otherwise depressing, Dr. Teston does an amazing job of bringing the class to life. She is a bit quirky, but is relatable.  I wouldn't say this class is an easy A, but if you put in the effort it's attainable. The magic to passing is reading the assignments and proving you understand what it means.

Professor Teston wants you to become a better writer, but I found a lot of lectures to be politically charged- you'll definitely know where she stands. She's not respectful toward students, their work, or opinions. She called a student names in front of an entire class. She doesn't realize how mean she sounds at times.  Avoid her class.

Gen ed second year writing course (honors). Had to write 25 page research paper, which sucked. She is very approachable and very helpful in office hours, and honestly wants you to become a better writer. That being said, it was a LOT OF WORK. Probably wouldn't retake it for a gen ed. I think I would be friends with her outside of class though!!
Seemed to think her class was the only one. Assigned a ludicrously long paper for a Gen. Ed. class. Had the most ridiculously inefficient methods of dividing the class into groups.
funny teacher, nice teacher, relatable, important assignments, not much homework,

One of the best professors I have ever had. A somewhat easy A but she does make you work for it. There's lots of papers but each one builds on the last, making it much easier. She's very funny, tells lots of jokes, and generally makes an otherwise possibly boring class fun. She has odd themes for her class like Dolly Parton but it works I guess.

Dr. Steele is the best ASL teacher! assignments and exams are quite easy and fair. She is very caring and knows how to make you understand the material. Attendance is important to do well! We did partner/group work every class for almost the entirety of class but the practice did really help. Its impossible to get below an A if you simply show up!
Easy to understand and great at ASL, very helpful when it comes questions and lets you know how you can get involved in the Deaf community outside of class.

I loved her class! She is extremely passionate and is very helpful!! As long as you go to class and semi-practice after you should be able to pass the class. The tests are online and she is always available for help. I am a little bummed I won't have her for ASL 2
Best professor I've had at OSU! Tamara is beyond kind and is genuinely passionate about what she's teaching. She makes ASL fun and easy to learn and I looked forward to going to class every day.

Tamara is an AMAZING teacher. She made things super clear and never assigned too much work. She is the professor to take if you really want to learn ASL. If you pay attention in class and study a little, you should get an A.

Shes an amazing professor for ASL beginners. Things were difficult since I took this class during covid, but she made every effort to make it work! 100% would take a class with her again, and 10/10 recommend to anyone beginning asl!

Tamara is such a kind and considerate professor and she really works to individualize her lessons. Somehow she makes me actually look forward to her lessons, even though they are at 8 AM for 4 days/ week.
She is nice but I would take someone else for sure. She grades ridiculous and inconsistent. Doesnt give good feedback of what she is looking for on tests.

Tamara is an amazing teacher and makes the class so fun and enjoyable! She wants you to become very proficient in ASL, so she has high expectations and can be a really tough grader. It's important for your grade to attend class every day. She's a great teacher to have for introductory ASL- just remember to practice your facial expressions!

She is a great teacher. You can tell she just loves to teach and has a passion for Sign Language.  She tells you exactly what each test or quiz will cover and prepares you for it.  She doesn't give out extra credit and she can be a tough grader, but if you participate in class, you will be okay. Make sure you go to class, or you will get behind.
Amazing teacher! Very Helpful, and just knows how to place things into your brain. You never leave that class without knowing something knew
Good professor. Most of the time is willing to help and clarify if you don't understand. Tests aren't bad and if you put in the work, you will be fine.

Dr. Thompson is an okay professor, especially for a basic-level English class. Her canvas was very unorganized, and all the dates said 2023 instead of 2025 so you frequently had to email her. Very few things are graded so your grade tanks super fast. Not very responsive to emails and often doesn't understand what she wants from you and when.

Great Professor. Took her Sci Fi-Fantasy class which was only half a semester. One big paper that is 2500 words and lots of discussions. But overall super easy and fun class! I would recommend this class to anyone.

I loved Professor Thompson! She is amazing! The only thing I hated was how many papers I had to write (my final essay had to be 2.5k-3k words), but that's not her fault. I turned in some of my major projects in late, and she still graded them with no penalty. Great professor, great topics, would 100% love to have her again.

It's a super easy class to fulfill a GE credit. There are 1-2 weekly assignments that take less than an hour to complete. The final is a 2500-word paper, but overall, the class was easy to get done. She is a pretty lenient grader, although she hasn't graded my paper yet. Recommend for an easy A.

Dr. Thompson is very nice and easygoing. the class is the perfect gen-ed to take if you do not want a lot of work. All assignments lead up to the final essay, which makes it very easy to put together and took me minimal effort. The only homework is watching good movies and a few small writing assignments. Lecture is boring, attendance is required.

This class was analyzing movies, but they were all pretty good and interesting. You can really get away with not watching the movies, as long as you can string together a paper at the end of the semester. Professor Thompson was super sweet and understanding (granted extensions) and graded my paper as 100% so easy grader as well. Low effort class.

I loved Zoe Thompson. She was by far the best professor during the pandemic. She was amazing and really was the only class that wasn't horrible. Cannot say enough positive things about her. Take her if at all possible.

Got to watch the first season of WestWorld and discuss it in class. Can be boring at times but is fun nonetheless. really easy to pass the class as long as you turn in all 6 assignments. Yes 6 assignments, one of those is the final as well.

I have had Zoe for two different classes and each time has been an amazing experience. Shes the most caring teacher Ive ever had. She wants all of her students to learn and enjoy what theyre learning rather than constantly worrying about receiving a good grade. If you have any GEs that she teaches, take any class she teaches.

Took this English class for a GE and ended up really enjoying the class. Not too much work outside of class, and only had to read 2 books, while also watching a tv show for the class. Great professor, super helpful at office hours!

Zoe is an amazing professor. I took this class as a GE and it was great for a first semester freshman. Very light homework outside of class, just reading poems, watching videos, and a few short writing assignments. She leaves great comments on all work. There was no final. She is also very kind and passionate about the subject, making it enjoyable.

This class was amazing! I loved all of the books we read, and there was no homework other than reading. There are quizzes after each book but they're easy and only about major plot points, so no need to study as long as you read. She is a serious paper grader but her class is really fun and she is very approachable for extra help!

Really great. Very clear on what she wants in her essays (office hours are a huge help) and classes are just a discussion. The classes tend to sway toward her interests (which often didn't really overlap with mine) but it was still fun. I highly recommend getting her if you have the chance.
Mr.slefenger yelled at me for talking to much

@ Saint A's The class had an unexpected national security theme and isn't a traditional english class but was very informative. All the lectures were very interesting and every paper had constructive helpful feedback that aided revision. Approachable and available after class for help. Gives many ex credit opportunities. Overall funny and helpful.

One of my favorite professors. Kept class fun and interesting for an 80 minute lecture. Notes were funny and he always started the class with an fun fact. Offered tons of opportunities for extra credit and more than willing to help with essays or projects when needed. One quiz on each play that we weren't told the day of, but we knew we had them

Great and entertaining professor. It helped that he did a sci fi themed composition class and I really love sci fi, but I felt every class was topical and fun. I felt his criticism of my essays were extremely helpful and every successive essay I wrote showed improvement from the last.  IF you get a chance to take his class, do it.

Slefinger is an awesome teacher. Willing to discuss with you if you're having issues or just having questions, and really funny and relatable overall. It IS possible he may be arrogant, but I've seen almost none of that, and I definitely would recommend him.

Mr. Slefinger seems to have a particular format for his essays that become more evident as you go through the course. Initially I remember thinking that he was arrogant but he is really a nice guy who very willing to help his students. He also offers a lot of extra credit.

For a GEC course, he makes it more difficult than it needs to be. He is arrogant and thinks that his class is the most important one when it really isn't. Expect to put a lot of work into this course. He is a really harsh grader. The only positive thinks about him are that he is easy to get into contact with and gives some extra credit.

Truly one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had at OSU! The history incorporated into each lesson gives the slightest insight into his pure intellect, drawing similarities and conclusions that I would never be able to connect. Definitely recommend! And he is incredibly kind and understanding.

Was a pretty easy class, a few small discussion boards and 3 long essays(shortest was 4 longest was 7). He's pretty cool, but the class isn't too interesting unless you like horror/ghost stories. Many reading assigned, but I did none and was fine. Also has u buy a textbook, but isn't really needed tbh
Go to class, finish homework as he instructed, and then you get an A+.

Immense amount of work for a 3 credit course. Expect 4-7 assignments per week. She makes them due on Sundays, making it extremely easy to submit assignments late, which is heavily penalized. Friendly attitude, but will still fail

Dr. Stearns isn't that bad. I think her attendance policy is too strict. Your only allowed missing 2 classes a semester and then after your 3rd absence you loose 35 points each time! There is many times I have drove to class, to not get any points that day. The class isn't hard itself, but the in class lectures are dry and boring.

Prof. Jani is insightful and challenging. He pushes students to think deeper, and welcomes students to disagree with him or bring in their own perspectives during discussions. Lots of reading, but definitely worth it

Good guy with a big heart. 
Beware that he's SUPER political and talks about his beliefs every class. Pulled up in a "BLM" t shirt last week. I don't mind because I agree with most of what he's saying but its controversial stuff so if you're sensitive in that area probably don't take it. 
He's knowledgeable and passionate about his area of study

Jani is great at facilitating thoughtful discussion. I appreciated him connecting the literature to broader political and historical context as well as events going on at OSU. He is vocal about his politics but allows for disagreement, as long as you can back it up. Bit disorganized but he cares and adapted to COVID better than any other prof.

I appreciated Pranav's warmth and passion, but he was disorganized and unclear with his expectations. He also didn't place much stock in the written assignments, for which he didn't provide substantial feedback. His hardline politics were somewhat grating and, at times, he bordered on a Fox News academic caricature. Nice guy, though, fwiw.

Prof. Jani's class is an excellent exercise in interdisciplinary thinking. He works hard to contextualize literature in its political and historical contexts, and provokes exciting debates in class. He is really accessible outside the class, and works towards building a strong community in his classes. One of my favorite professors!

He is one of the worst professors at Ohio State. If you disagree with him on socialism hell insult you and degrade you as a person. He doesnt know how businesses work. He doesnt even understand simple concepts and lives in a utopia. Do NOT take this course. Hell not respect you and hell judge you. Also be aware he has a tempter.

Most of the time I (generally) enjoyed Professor Jani's class. He is fairly disorganized, which can makes lectures and timely grading a challenge for him. He is also pretty extreme (politically), and fancies himself a Marxist, so yea handle that with extreme caution lol. Be careful with disagreeing
Interesting topic, and Dr. Jani is open to student feedback. I liked the interdisciplinary approach to literature.

You can learn from Pranav. You probably won't always agree with his views, but he is [usually] fair--and he'll teach you things you likely won't learn from any other prof. Downsides? Disorganized, slow grader, won't necessarily give comments on papers, and the freedom he tries to give students results in extremely unclear assignments.

So...I was really excited to take this class. Now it's becoming clear that the entire semester is going to be a monologue on socialism and why we shouldn't celebrate veterans. He's a nice guy who really wants to see students succeed, but he's gone way overboard with only giving his views then wondering why class participation is poor.
Pranav Jani considers himself a militant socialist. He is a bully to students who disagree with him.

Took AU '12; Jani is amazing. He can explain complex matters with complete clarity; he doesn't shy away from controversial subjects and talks to his students like adults, which I found really respectful. He shows his political views pretty openly, but he doesn't discriminate against you if yours are different. Loved his class; great professor.

Dr. Jani is one of the best Professors I've had at OSU.  It is clear that he cares about the topics he teaches.  Comments on papers are really helpful and he was a fair grader.  I wouldn't hesitate to take his class again.
Pranav is an amazing professor -- passionate about the material, knowledgeable, helpful -- and he's fun(ny) to boot. Great professor -- take class with him if you have the opportunity!
I nominated this guy for professor of the year at OSU.  Nuff said.
It doesn't get better than this, really! An intellectual powerhouse, a gifted teacher, and a generous human being. I would come to OSU just to be his student!

He does not prepare for class at all. Discussion seriously lacks in class, and he blames it on the students and not his topics and questions. Required drafts for papers, but failed to hand them back before your next draft was due. supposed to be a writing class, but he doesnt try at all to improve your writing.

Fabulous prof.  Authentic & sincerely engaged; loves teaching undergrads.  Politically honest & active, but prompts great discussions.  He demands a lot out of the essays, but he gives a lot back in terms of comments & really helps you improve your writing to be grad school-level good.
great professor
Challenging writing assignments I had to struggle with.  But I enjoyed his teaching style.
awesome professor. wish there were more like him at OSU.
great professor! really wants to help; just be prepared for lots of discussion & controversial topics.

Jani gets a bad rap from the more conventional students, because he's not afraid to discuss controversial topics.  The OSU needs more socially active, independent thinking professors like Jani.  He's the kind of motivated prof, who is really there for his students, that you would expect from a small, expensive, private university, not from OSU.

Awful! Rude and treats you like you're still in high school; Not very organized and no sense of time; I had him for his first class at OSU, so he might be better now, but I would never take a class of his again!
if you love to be shocked this is the professor for you! loves to get a reaction from his class, be prepared to converse about heated issues!
A disaster.  Seriously.
hard to get gpa
bad really bad

Miranda is definitely my favorite professor. Her class is relaxed and nothing is difficult. Even quizzes will give you three chances. At the same time, she gives high marks in writing assignments and will give you a lot of useful suggestions for your article. Apart from being slow to reply to emails, I can't think of a second shortcoming about her.

Miranda is definitely my favorite professor. Her class is relaxed and nothing is difficult, Even quizzes will give you three chances. At the same time, she gives high marks in writing assignments and will give you a lot of useful suggestions for your article. Apart from being slow to reply to emails, I can't think of a second shortcoming about her.

She is the greatest. She is very kind and helpful. The class generally has become easier because of her even though the course is designed to has many homework. She is not a tough grader. You will basically get more than whatever you deserve. If you revise what you have done in the first submission, she would raise your grade for that assignment.
Really recommend

This class have 2 group presentations and 2 exams (in the form of interview) in total. Ms. Miranda is engaging and generous gives points to students. Participation is required by asking at least 1 question in each class. The assignments are also very easy.
Already enrolled again!
Not difficult! You will get a A if you pay a little attention on it!!
It's really tough to maintain a good GPA, even though we work really hard on our homework. She consistently assigns us low grades.

I dont know why there are so many blames for Miranda. But I totally sure you can get A easily if you finished all of the homework and be respectful! She's so kind and will forgive you for turning in your homework late!!!
Really bad
Hard to get gpa, although we write homework hard, she gives us veryvery low gpa.

Hard to get high gpa, seldom answer email and give you confusing grade of assignments . She graded assignments very late and seldom answer your email. Compare with other 1901 teacher her class is very difficult to get a! Also, her assignments are complex.

The feedback is not timely and she is often unclear about the assignments. It feels like she talks down to us and the classroom atmosphere suffers as a result of her arrogance. It is clear she doesn't like teaching and I wish I took something else.

2 months into the semester and not a single thing graded, all she does is lecture, she makes me feel dumb when I amm confused, and I am pretty sure she made fun of the way I talked one time. She makes me hate my major, don't take this class if its not required.

Avoid her if possible although it is possible to get through if you are well organized (she is not). Unclear instructions and deadlines everywhere, syllabus conflicting with assignments all over the place. She is overly meticulous about cheating/AI and probably accused like half the class, including me (I didn't cheat). A ton of textbook reading.

Absolutely overwhelming. I've taken a dense, senior level class that was condensed into a month and still didn't do as much work or have to process as much material as she gives. It's crazy! Don't do it to yourself.

don't recommend this professor. The amount of homework released every day (Monday-Friday) makes it nearly impossible to complete the assignments while retaining information. Her grading system is completely confusing. I reached out on multiple occasions to inquire about grading and each time her answers were unclear and not helpful. Did not

Stay away from this professor. Homework assignments are so time consuming and she does not articulate her expectations well. The instructions and questions are unclear which led to lots of confusion. She assigns readings, videos, or hw for everyday of the week which made this class hard to manage with being busy. Overall didn't even learn anything

If I could rate this professor a 0, I would. She slams your carmen with assignment after assignment and gives poor instructions. Her feedback is mediocre at best. She wrongfully reported a group project to COAM immediately without any warning or inquisition about her suspicions. Do yourself a favor & find another teacher to take this course with!!!

She does not articulate her expectations well. I never knew how we were graded for essays and participation, it seemed very arbitrary. Her Carmen page was an absolute mess so I had to constantly check it to stay up to date on assignments. You can do well in this class if you are willing to work within a disorganized class structure.

RUN FROM THIS CLASS. The professor everything. Awfully organized gives incomplete grades even though it states that homework can be submitted whenever. Simply run. The class is hard and the professor is terrible.

Modan is a very accessible professor and will extend deadlines to provide more info if students are still stuck on some concepts before a quiz. On pretty much all of the quizzes online, you can take them as many times as you want before the deadline. A difficult grader and will knock points off for arbitrary reasons, but you can just try again.
Useless discussion in class and she has never followed her schedule so we Always left behind. No feedback for homework and midterm. You won't learn too much in this class.
Don't take this professor. Gets off topic. Tough grader. You won't learn much in this class.

Do not take this class unless you want to become a teacher. That criteria was specified nowhere in the course description, but we spent the whole semester discussing things in terms of "how would you explain this to your students?" Her grading is also arbitrary, and if you try to ask her why she took so many points off, you won't get an answer.

I actually thoroughly enjoyed this class. Modan was fun and we participated in a lot of discussion. She can be distant and come off as rude sometimes when you talk in class but, for the most part, she is pretty relaxed. The material can be a little difficult and her tests are ones that you have to study for, but nothing too back-breaking.

Worst professor I have had at OSU. Flippant, rude, acts like you are wasting her time if you try and speak to her post-class (don't even bother with office hours). Most boring, dry class ever, she just lectures, material is lengthy and useless. Nitpicky grader- midterm is difficult, final project/final are easy.

She never really taught. Just sat there as we did discussions about what we read the night before. When a student would talk, she just nodded and made a smile which was far from genuine. For our final project, she asked us to incorporate one more thing into our project a week before it was due.

My reasons for vexation will surely not fit in 350 characters.  Long story short, somewhat arbitrary, nitpicky grading, rewrites everyone's final projects, ridiculously plays favorites, has a ban on technology in class, tells overactive students to not participate.  Consider yourself warned. That being said, it is a somewhat interesting course.
Excellent teacher.  Sometimes difficult to follow, but the subject material is very difficult, so that oculd be the issue.  Extremely knowledgeable.

This class was extremely easy for me but she, while not a BAD professor, was sometimes irritating and confusing. I felt like a lot of stuff she taught was very opinionated and it seemed like she got annoyed with the class sometimes. The only thing that really messed me up was when we had a sub teach one day and they taught everything differently.

A challenging but worthwhile professor. She encouraged discussion and prompted students to think beyond what they thought they knew. A very good class to take, it will challenge your conception of language as long as you keep your mind open and engage in discussion. Its a class that you feel like you miss out if you skip.

Professor Modan really challenged students to think for themselves, and the class was extremely interesting. I would not recommend it if you are lazy, but if you're willing to do the work, you can learn a lot from her.

Professor Modan is truly a gem in the english/linguistics department. She has a great personality and teaches so well that it makes you want to drop your major and join her area. You learn a lot in this class, and critical thinking and speaking are crucial to your success in her class.

she's totally unfair. studyguides will never help you on exams or quizzes. she makes you feel completely STUPID. this class was a waste of time. i learned nothing. i became even more confused. she wants to fail everyone. she refuses to curve.
This was a great class. Professor Modan really cares about the subject and she made it relevant to our lives.
Don't listen to the other comments.  They don't know what the hell they're talking about.

It is obvious that she loves what she teaches but it is also obvious that she is horrible at teaching it.  Boring lectures, never answers questions, looks at you as though you should know the answer to the question you are asking.  Class could have been more interesting had it been taught!
She was a great teacher.
treated the class and students as if they interfered with her time. didn't teach anything all quarter. i felt like the class was a waste of time and effort
SHe was awful
the class was boring, never held my attention, and i felt as though i was being spoken to like a child. i do not feel i learned anything and i regret taking the class.
She's nice, but the class is very boring.  You aren't tested on anything, so her lectures seem somewhat pointless.  She doesn't give clear guidelines for any of the papers either.
I feel that she makes simple things way too complicated
Unknowledgeable, waits for the class to run things with discussion, asks a lot of questions but never answers them!

I really disliked the class. She was all right, but I was very confused and she really wasn't able to help.
Excellent professor, but you have to keep up with the reading to do well
I learned a lot in this class, and Dr. Modan is very helpful
No Comments

Never left a review for a professor before, if that tells you how bad it is. You will never know what she is asking, how to navigate the modules, or what the grading criteria is. You have two peer reviews per assignment because she doesn't want to grade herself. Drop this class, it is not worth it. Most of your assignments aren't even for a grade.

I'm not one to write a bad review about a teacher but honestly if you get her for this class drop before you take it. I should've listened to people on this RMP this is honestly the most disorganized class I've ever taken. Grades are awful and other online sections are 10x better and 10x easier. So much work for an online class. DONT TAKE!
awful. just awful. very unclear instructions and very harsh grader. offers way too many assignments with unclear goals.
Very disorganized modules, unclear instructions, and very nit-picky grading.
Extremely disorganized modules and way too many homework assignments for an online class.
Very tough grader throughout the course, required many assignments that were not graded. Gives lots of extra credit and bumps heavily by end of the semester. Very responsive in emails.

She grades very tough and for a class that's all about readability, you can't understand what her assignments are asking. She had to postpone an assignment because she couldn't explain it. Be prepared to receive poor grades for no reason, and do many assignments that don't get graded at all. Don't take this class
The most painful class I've ever taken in my life.

fantastic instructor; she is very understanding, always prepared to offer additional clarification on the assignments she gives. Some of the class assignments are a little complex, but you will learn more & advance greatly. Her teaching style includes many group activities & peer reviews that also assist you in building your own personal character.
She was very nice, but not a great teacher. She is unclear with project instructions and does not explain directions well at all.
she is such a tough grader and does not want her students to get A
The class is not hard, but when u see the professor just start to think about how to escape.
never choose this professor
Easy course with Hard instructor
strictest professor ever seen
Just listen carefully, you should learn something.

I love her so much
My favorite professor in Ohio!!!
So nice!!!!!

Professor Janyo is a kind lady if you talk to. However, her class requires strict attendance policy even though you come to class 1 min late and you will lose points. The most wonderful professor I've ever seen!

OMG
