She is a great teacher! We had great discussions and really easy reading quizzes.  We turned in papers to get a preliminary grade and then revised them for almost our entire grade. It would be hard to not get an A if you put any effort in whatsoever.

She was wonderful! The course material was engaging and fun (we read mystery novels!), and she was really great at connecting what we read with different schools of literary criticsm. For essays, we got initial grades and then a chance to revise them, plus we workshopped like crazy. I learned a lot and had a good time--definitely take her class!
She was amazing. Somewhat of an easy grader, yet still left very helpful comments. Class was as entertaining as a Shakespeare class can get. I would definitely recommend her!
No Comments
No Comments

Passionate about her area of expertise and genuinely engaged with the students in discussion.   Helpful grader with lots of essay comments. Rigorous reading, but light on the assignments.  Her soft voice could use with stronger projection in class.
She was an incredibly accommodating and caring educator. She clearly had a deep compassion for her students and their learning.

The class is supposed to be an introductory English class. However, the coursework was overboard. She took it upon her way to make her students feel like they were walking on eggshells. There wasn't any freedom in this class. She will give you a completion grade if you do the work. However, she will take away your grade, if you don't attend class.

This class can have a lot of work, but Prof. Buuck is always willing to help. I got so much out of attending office hours before each big assignment was due. My class was small and very relaxed. It was a fun class to take that also helped to expand my portfolio.

Very kind, and a delight to talk to. Gives well constructed, fast feedback. MAJOR HEADS-UP: In her 1110, your first major project's research question will determine the rest of your class. Choose something broad and easy to research. Only bad part of this class. Other than that, highly recommend. If you have to interview someone, choose her.

I loved having Professor Buuck! Her class can be overwhelming at times in terms of assignments, but I don't think that's her fault and she does her best to accommodate based on your needs. She is probably my favorite professor I have ever had at OSU! Could not recommend enough.

One of my best teachers at OSU so far. She really cares about her students' well being above all. Every assignment you can negotiate the due date. She gives feedback on work slow, but if you go out of your way to office hours she'll always be prepared to help where you need revision. A lot of submissions, but each assignment is easily achievable.

By far one of the best professors that I've had at OSU. She is easy going and very understandable. I've never liked English, but she made it fun and the workload is manageable, unlike other classes that you have to put in 10+ hours a day to get homework done. If you buy into the class it'll be fun, just do the work. HAVE FUN AND GOOD LUCK!!!

Prof. Buuck is easily one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. I love attending office hours. She gives excellent feedback, allows for revision credit, and is always there to help you through your drafts. The beginning of the semester is front-loaded with work, which you'll appreciate once everyone else starts dumping assignments on you.
Do not show up late for even a second.
SHE IS AMAZING and straight forward from the beginning.

She is a down to earth professor that is friendly, but don't be late to her class not even for a minute because she will count that as being late. I cannot stress myself enough but to READ THE SYLLABUS AND FOLLOW IT! She takes that seriously, if you don't follow it you will get lost. Beware though DO NOT SIGN any agreement she hands out.

Professor Buuck taught Business Writing this semester and is probably one of the most caring people you will ever meet, yet such a hard grader. I have taken over 90 credits at this point and have never run into someone who is so unwilling to work with you about changing a grade because of such a simple mistake. Attendance is a must.
One of the most caring professor at OSU.
Ms. Buuck is one unique professor. She cares about every students and she likes to give feedback.

There was a lot of papers and reading to complete throughout the course. The book we read was unbelievably dry. Her personality and the energy she brings to the classroom more than make up for it though. Overall it was a great class.
Great teacher, she is very passionate!

Great teacher. Was out of school nearly 10 years and she had her for my first English class. She will give everyone in the class personal attention but if you need more help and go to her office hours, she will do all she can for you. Highly recommend and really enjoyed her class

Mrs. Buuck is such a great teacher! She cares so much about helping her students and does everything she can to see them succeed. This class has greatly strengthened my writing skills. I had so much fun learning and improving throughout the semester! SUCH A GREAT TEACHER! highly recommend taking her classes!

Mrs. Buuck cares so much about her students and does everything she can to help them succeed. This class has strengthened my writing skills and I had so much fun learning and improving throughout the semester! GREAT teacher! Highly recommend taking her classes!

I took her for fiction writing II and thought that she was overall very positive. At the same time, she was helpful and was constantly offering feedback. she was highly interactive with students. The course was not easy though; she gives A LOT of assignments. Perhaps a little more than was comfortable. But overall, 5/5. Great class.
harsh

She is a very fair professor. She gives great feedback on assignments and is more than happy to help outside of class through email. She also gives extra credit sometimes. I would absolutely take a class with her again.

Professor Jamieson was extremely accessible, especially for a fully remote class. She gives clear feedback on papers, and is very understanding and flexible on grading and finishing assignments. There are some group projects but as long as you respond to discussion posts and keep up with assignments this is completely manageable.

She was a great English professor. She provided clear instructions for assignments and was accessible outside of class anytime. She responded to emails very quickly and was super helpful in explaining things. She actually cares on how you do in the class, makes sure everyone is doing well. She is a pretty tough grader so make sure to put effort.

She gives good feedback and responds to emails really fast. Although sometimes her answers are a little vague, but in the end your assignments are on your own anyways. Her grading is fair and there weren't very many assignments and they were all pretty easy. Definitely the best 1110 professor!

Professor Jamieson is great, she is available for advice on assignments and always gives good individual feedback. Two main projects and weekly discussions but she provides a lot of time for us to work on them and gives us the resources to do well and ask for help. She is also very organized and everything you need is available on Carmen.

really chill class. she gives a lot of time to work on assignments, and she responds to emails extremely fast. pretty easy grader overall, there's a couple of pretty big projects that are worth quite a bit (but again, she gives a lot of time to work on those). super organized as well, posts a lot of reminders/tips and is so sweet.

She is a great professor however her bigger projects do require a lot of work and can be time consuming. She's good at replying to emails especially if you need to clarify something. It's great to have extensions on deadlines for smaller assignments and she's aware of holidays and other student complications.

Dr. Nixon is awesome. EZ class. Three main writing projects. There are some short writings and discussions here and there, but if you hate English, take it with Dr. Nixon. I probably 60% effort and ended with a 99% in the class.
Harsh ratings, won't give you feedback, extreme amount of work, highly not recommended!
It's a terrible online class experience; she doesn't personally give you any input on your drafts at all!

She tries to do her best with an online format. She gives good feedback, and is a really energetic person, and generally a fast responder. She is generous with due dates and extensions, and she understands a students workload and organizes due dates well. Fun class overall, and an easy A.

Dr. Nixon was a great english professor! It's tough to get used to her carmen set up, but she answers emails super fast and is eager to help. She's not a tough grader even though there's a lot of writing to do. I totally reccomend!

Dr. Nixon is very kind and gives extensions out like candy if you just ask. Very understanding and her assignments aren't necessarily difficult. The hardest part of this course is understanding how it is setup on carmen- it's very confusing at first. All essays and assignments count towards the final project so make sure you do them!

Dr. Nixons class was set up pretty confusing. I had to email her a lot and check with other classmates so often just to understand the exact point of each assignment. Weekly checklist states A LOT of reading assignments, but to be honest theyre not necessary at all. Class is mostly just 4 big papers, if you choose a good topic it isnt too hard.

I had Prof Nixon for an all online class. She was really helpful and there was a lot of work, but everything worked toward your final paper. You might think that the work is stupid, but everything had a purpose to it. She took into account how students were struggling with covid and made our finals pass or fail, which helped a lot.
I loved this teacher! She was very nice and understanding towards students. You could tell that she wanted every student to get a good grade and helped everyone to the best of her abilities.
She is nice and supportive on my work and I can say that without her I cannot even finish my final work since I wasn't doing it in right way. Thanks her a lot!

This professor is doing nonsense thing! She asked me to rewrite my essay twice just because she didn't tell want I need to achieve at once! Now I have less than a week to write a final essay! It is killing me!
Bunch of busy work so much effort required for basic grades. Way too cheerful. Definitely has favorites.

Really great teacher. She genuinely cares about her students and is very forgiving grading wise. She looks more for comprehension and analysis in the papers written than having page and word counts. A decent bit of work needs to be done for the papers, but even the ones that seem irrelevant are solid practice for the final paper. NO EXAMS!
She's nice. Just prepare for paper then you'll be fine.
She is considerate and willing to help

Dr. Nixon is a super bubbly, bright professor. It is exactly what you'd expect out of an English class - Writing papers & analyzing sources, so don't come into it expecting anything less! While sometimes it felt a little film-studies heavy, the class made me a better writer. You're going to be totally fine if you do the work for this class.

This professor always likes to assign nonsense homework and make us read or watch nonsense movies. Always those few students make response in her class and her handwriting is really hard to recognize. But the good thing is no midterm or any quiz. All we have to do is a final paper.

On numerous occasions I have emailed her with no reply. Her syllabus doesn't match what she says in class. We have to watch dumb movies and answer things like "What repetitions do you notice?". I'm not even sure what that means. We also have to write 500 words a week on absolutely nothing. She's very nice but her assignments are ridiculous.

Shes a wonderful and the kindest professor ever. Always optimist, bubbly and fun and smiles a lot. Classes can be awkward at times, but it is very relaxing and somewhat fun. No tests, just a single research paper for the semester. The bubbliest professor ever!

The class was super easy, but also more helpful than I thought it would be. It was nice how Professor Nixon was always super bubbly and happy - it really made each class have a more social and relaxed feel. Things weren't always clear to begin with, but when you ask, she will go above and beyond to help you understand what it is you need to know.

Nixon was awkwardly happy all the time and was overall okay. Her office hours are the best way to get feedback. This class was writing one paper over the course of a semester, so the work load was usually either  a lot or none at all for a given week. You don't use the textbooks a ton but you should have them, check to see if there are pdfs online.

Im not happy at Elizabeth's grading  It was an easy A but I felt that she barely skimmed our papers and didnt give any feedback at all    I felt that this class was a waste of time and i didnt improve my writing I would rather have had a harder professor but it helped my gpa so i cant complain

Nixon is one of the nicest professors ever! The class was a lot of readingwriting at times, but not too much. The books we were pretty interesting and fun. She is super smiley and bubbly. Loved her class!

She is rather giggly and smiley but a super nice lady. The class is super easy, and I thought she made the material more interesting and had us look at online articles that were very relevant and interesting. However, after a while the class got monotonous.
The most annoying human being. She has a nervous giggle after every. single. sentence. No help at all, requires enormous amounts of reading between classes and unclear in assignments.

She's nice and smiles A LOT. The semester is spent working on one huge essay, so make sure you choose a good topic that you want to spend a lot of time with and like! She's super confusing with due dates and assignments in general. She told me my essay was good all semester then a few months in said it was wrong & I needed to talk to her...
The class was basically writing a long paper and presenting it. Keeps postponing due dates which made students unmotivated. She doesn't follow the syllabus. cancelled class for a week.

She cancelled class a lot, which was good with me, but she never ever explained when things were due. She just expects you to know. She is 100% correct all the time and she will repeat your correct responses and claim them as hers and tell you that you were wrong. GEH

ehh... she was ok i guess. kinda mad that she had us go out an buy a book called Revenge of the Cockroach People that we never even touched - waste of time. and she'll tell you you don't need to do anything to your draft, then dock you like 20 points for no reason on the final paper. overly happy all the time and bobs her head constantly.

Awful. The class was unorganized, she canceled class all the time, would never actually explain assignments before their due date, and will never email you back. I also still haven't received several assignments back yet which are needed for the final portfolio which is due today....
Great class, with some of the best literature selection I've had so far in college. interesting book and relevant to class and life.

she was all in all a nice person, but she was way too overexcited for very boring things that had nothing to do with math.  we spent the entire quarter covering "how to criticize a critical analysis". also, she would look over your drafts and tell you that you didn't need any work done, and then give you a B- on your final draft.
Very helpful and kind though sometimes her class might not be very interesting (though she is very enthusiastic about english which is always a good thing)
Amazing Professor! One of the best I have had.

Professor Ramsey is an extremely caring person, and she is very funny during lecture. She really did change the way that I write, and she made me a much more confident writer. Her feedback makes you know exactly how she feels about your work. If you have to take an english course, I recommend Mrs. Ramsey.
awesome

She engages students in discussion really well; makes a boring class interesting. Genuinely cares about students, English, teaching, etc. Has a good sense of humor and is really straightforward. There were 3 papers + mandatory volunteer experience, which was actually okay. She extended deadlines for papers depending on where we were at as a class.
Great instructor, very helpful with feedback and a great sense of humor!
Very nice and fair. Made a boring class interesting.
Very helpful and fair. She is a fun person to be around.

Class itself is fairly easy although the big paper can be tough, but she is a fair grader and very helpful. If you go to her or send her a question about your paper she will help you! Made english tolerable and she is just a really cool lady

Rebecca seems very kind. But her papers are ridiculous. And so much not needed course work that stimulates nothing in my brain on a learning aspect. I have gained nothing from this class besides headaches and bad paper grades.

The papers are way too long and her grading is very tough. All her course work is about liberal propaganda. I do not care for that but I am truly worried the school would hire someone for this much coursework in a gen ed. 8 page papers are ridiculous when students have many other classes. And the papers are not fun topics at all.

Unreasonable grader, stresses the importance of peer feedback but does not give timely feedback herself on major projects. She takes a month to grade each paper while you have other assignments in her class due - makes it hard to improve when you don't know what your grades are when you're still turning in work.

The problem is that, for me, it took forever to understand the way she was trying to teach. In this particular class, she was using "issues of concern" to teach students how to write with rhetoric. The idea is to use something that the students care about to motivate them to learn about rhetoric. She never explained this to us!

I read reviews for the business department page and should have listened. Extremely tough and unreasonable grader. Does not give clear instructions and generally doesn't seem to like her job. Avoid taking her if you can

I love Siders personality. He's hilarious! But he's a really tough grader! My major is criminal justice. Disney movies aren't my thing AT ALL! Trying to find sources and stuff like that only adds to the pressure. I don't want to do this presentation in December. Long story short, while I love his personality, I don't wanna take his class again.

Prof Siders has high expectations for his students! Tough grader and is honest about your work. He makes class fun and he is relatable. This class is very demanding but he makes it manageable and wants you to succeed. Go to his office hours for guidance. He responds to emails fast and you can tell he cares. Good Choice!

Professor Siders was easily my favorite professor at OSU thus far. He is very laid back, and will even roast you if you deserve it, but he also actually teaches you how to write and extract key points from works. He is a meme. If you meme and care about the class you will have no problem and enjoy every second of it. Best English professor ever.

Prof Siders is the best English teacher I have EVER had. He never failed to make the class interesting and fun! He always had a joke up his sleeve. Classes were discussion based which made the class a comfortable setting, allowing people to contribute to class regularly. I honestly learned so much and would definitely take his class again!!

Professor Anderson was a fantastic teacher. Lectures were engaging, feedback was plentiful and useful, and she is very understanding. However, know before you go in that the class has nothing to do with business writing. It's a semester-long collaboration project with Ohio Sea Grant/ Stone Laboratory that involves research and experimental design.
Great! There is a lot of reading, but not bad at all. Very helpful and interesting.
Good professor. Spend enough time to study and you will get good grades. Great reading materials and discussion for every module. His feedback is very helpful for students to improving their writing.
We read two novels and one nonfiction book, along with several poems and short stories. The lecture and materials were always interesting, powerful, and comforting.

Professor Ponce was a great professor. We went over so many different topics throughout the class, and he always made sure to have an open discussion. I was also sick for a majority of the semester so school became pretty difficult, but he made the content accessible and answered any questions I had along the way. You should take his class.

so sweet! his wit is next level, make sure you sit near the front of the class because he can be a bit soft spoken, but it's so worth it for his jokes. reading is a must for this class, as depending on the day it's either discussion based or lecture heavy. fun material, fun guy

Ponce is very intelligent and cares about your writing. For someone who doesn't enjoy writing, he made the class interesting for me. He always created interesting conversation and he grades pretty straight forward.

Ponce is an absolutely incredible teacher. He is wonderfully articulate, and has introduced me to so many levels of analysis -- from writing technique to sociopolitical issues, he's so well versed. He is definitely soft-spoken, but you will adjust. He always made me laugh, even when his jokes were a little dorky. You WILL read a ton. Worth it.

Created awesome syllabus, heavy on reading early in semester but easier load by the end. Very smart guy, provided great insights into readings, esp. engaging long history of black literature with present-day race issues. Too many small-group discussions, but overall, excellent class. Two papers.

Joe is one of my mentors in graduate school. He has a razor-sharp mind and always offers incisive feedback. I appreciate how he can point out the shortcomings in my work without making me feel stupid. I'd highly recommend him, particularly to grad students working in U.S. ethnic lit. P.S.: Don't try to sound pedantic; he will call your bluff.
would not recommend.  use your $ to learn something in a different class.

Soft spoken but you get used to it as the class goes on. Extremely smart and well-read. Understanding, considerate and fair. Expect to read what you're assigned and you'll do well. Liked him so much that I am taking a class next semester for fun. He's not too bad to look at either.

Is a well-read prof. for one, but he pushes a lot of reading on students. had to read a diff book every week. Also class assignments were boring. would have just liked to have class discussion. instead had to do tons of in-class exercises. even if workload is unbalanced he is still pretty helpful. grades fairly, perhaps even generously.
Good instructor, and did a good job of structuring the class so all of the reading built on it. I think he's doing a doctoral in far east lit, so he might put that kind of twist on things.

Bad stuff: soft-spoken and unable to be heard if you're a back-of-the-class sitter. NOT clear on important assignments like the FINAL PROJECT. Good stuff: overall, a great teacher. Enjoys teaching and willing to help students. Super-knowledgable, approachable, witty, and cool. Take him if you get a chance.
So dreamy and smart
He really engaged with the students in class discussions.  His lecture style was good.

Pretty good professor. Makes jokes that aren't funny followed up by "Just kidding." Eventually gets funnier when you're used to it. Class discussions were always fun. The final for the class might've been the easiest test I've taken in college, though the midterm was harder than expected. Also wrote short papers with prompts given by the teacher.
great!
Funny and engaging. Very willing to offer advice and guidance. Take advantage of office hours to get to know him. Wants to hear what his students think. One of the best English profs I have had here.
one word=boring
great teacher - very hot too!

The best professor I've had thus far!  As long as you do the work, it's not hard to do well in his class.  He's very helpful and easy to talk to.  Do not pass up the opportunity to take a class with him!!

He is very interested in the topic of the class, definitely knows his stuff and in turn makes others interested also.  Extremely helpful too.  It seems like the English department finally got it right when hiring him.
Very nice and knows his stuff.  Seems passionate about african american lit.  Very easy to talk to if you go to office hours.
No Comments
Class honestly sucked. A lot of reading. Quizzes are given and worth 10% of the grade, which adds up. I would not recommend

Prof. Schotter was really interesting and funny, lead good discussions, and you can tell how much he loves film. You definitely have to come to class and participate to do well, but it wasn't too hard and I learned a lot.

I wouldn't say Jesse was fantastic; he was just ok. It was good in the beginning watching classic Hollywood movies, but towards the end of the semester, it transitioned to avant-garde stuff that I had to sit through. Attending his lectures aren't optional if you want to pass and be prepared for quizzes.

Not a bad class if you have a good recitation leader. Movies were old, some black and white, different languages, silent, etc so if that's not your thing you will be bored. Overall it was fine for a GE but you could find a more interesting, easier one. Had to watch a 2+ hour movie each week to do well on weekly quizzes, plus 2 essays and a final.

I wouldnt take this class unless you really like obscure films or films in general. I thought I did coming in but these films werent the kind to sit back and enjoy you really have to try to understand them. Def a film class full of film students

Prof. Schotter is a nice guy and a fair teacher, though a little boring. This class was super easy but a lot of reading. A pretty big part of your grade is from participating in the class discussions which I didn't mind. If you genuinely like English and reading, you will enjoy this class.

I had Jesse for Intro to Film. Easy class if you take notes in lecture and watch the films on the syllabus. Professor is a little opinionated, but if you are not too passionate about the subject it shouldn't bother you.

I had Schotter for Intro to Film, and it was great. Your homework is to watch movies, plus some textbook reading--you don't it have to do, but it helped me understand material. No midterms, just weekly quizzes. His lectures are detailed & clear, and he is clearly passionate about his class. He always asks for feedback and works to answer questions.
Great professor, great class. Anyone who says the class is graded too hard - it isn't Schotter, it's his TA's.  Just go to class and office hours to have them review your papers and you'll be fine.

All he is is a lecturer. TAs do grading. He is very passionate about film though and that made learning the material all the easier. Some may be able to get away with not reading the textbook, but I found it a lot easier to understand if I did the required reading. Quizzes are extremely easy if you just watch the movies.
He was one of the most boring teachers at OSU. He is a hard grader and assigned more work than my upper level classes.
She does not care if her students pass or fail. Taking her class is totally waste of time and money.
She is Not caring at all.

I would like to recommend  Kathryn to students who like to understand writing. she is an amazing instructor. I took ESL 0190 this summer in a Columbus State Community College and She helped me to understand so many things that I did know before.

If all professors were like Bierschenk, everyone would become teaching professionals. He routinely provides every student with so much feedback that you can tell he's invested in helping each one succeed. He knows his stuff, and works to broaden student horizons. Probably the best possible professor for this specific version of ENGL3405.

There are easier 1110 instructors, with much less reading and writing. But Dr. Garvin has DRASTICALLY improved my writing. Expect a low grade on your first paper, tho she lets you rewrite. Participation is a big deal and she takes a daily toll so you have to get to class! I def recommend anything she teaches, she makes things very relevant.

I wasn't the best writer until I had her as a teacher. The topic she chose for the class was very interesting and she had a lot on her plate this semester and was still a fun easy going teacher. Can talk about anything during class she is an open person. Doesn't respond to emails well, but that's my only complaint. I very much recommend her class.
She picked up this class after spring break, and I think she's done a really good job trying to engage us and staying on top of grades. Facilitates discussion well.
Too harsh on students. Never understand she is talking about. Barely respond the emails. Absolutely don't recommend her class

Straightforward enough class and easy to pass if you attend and do the assignments. Good experience with useful writing skills for the workplace. She's pretty laid back and open to your feedback. Doesn't make you jump through hoops like other English profs.

Professor Garvin is clear, insightful, enthusiastic, kind, funny, and very accessible  to students. She is also helpful during office hours. But she is a stickler for things like attendance and turning things in on time. Otherwise not a tough grader at all despite what others have said
Fun class! Great envoierment Mrs. Garvin teaches a wonderful class.  But you must pay attention or you will get behind.  If you use a computer in class Youll have to use it up front.
umm what do i say mee like this clas will take aga1n//.
Kristina is a good teacher. She makes recitation clear and tries to make it interesting. She also gives a lot of help on papers. If you get stuck, she'll help you through it.
A very knowledgeable and dedicated TA. She gives very detailed feedback on papers, and her grading is reasonable. I would recommend for English majors, because she will make you a better writer.

Expectations and grading are somewhat unclear.  However, not a difficult class to do well in if you do most of the readings, and participate in class.  Exams followed the practice exam exactly.  Participation to show you have done the readings is key in a subjectively graded class.

She's a pretty good teacher and always willing to help. The material is very boring and somewhat difficult, but she knows what she's talking about and explains what's going to be on the test. She has high expectations for doing the reading and coming to class everyday, but if you do these things you will probably do well.

I learned more about writing in this class than any other English class at OSU. Garvin comes across as a harsh grader at first, but she eases up as the quarter goes on. later assignments are worth more so you can bomb the first one and still get an A. She makes you work though!

The class was not very difficult, but you have to keep up with the reading because she gives quizzes all the time. Also likes to make students work in groups and then speak to the whole class. I managed to get an A with a decent amount of effort.

Ms. Garvin is tough but as long as you participate (say something, at least once per class period) you will probably do well.  She is VERY concerned with ACTIVE class participation.  Lots of quizzes, and very LONG midterm!!  Be prepared!!  She grades fairly easy on the midterm though.  ALWAYS come to class.  Attendance is a major issue with her.

Hard teacher, harsh grader, never knew exactly what she expected. Never kept the students interest. Final paper was disastrous...she was never specific on what she wanted from us. I got a B in the class even though I put in 3x the effort compared to other classes. Drink Coffee so you won't fall asleep, she's really boring!

This was the second time I have taken American literature. The second time was for a diversity credit. I received an A first and a c in Ms. Garvins class when I put in twice the work as the first class. The class is boring and Ms. Garvin has a hard time explaining what she wants and is looking for. Good luck!
She has an old-fashioned teaching style. Grades harshly on papers, but easy on exams. She knows how to analyze the material, but is very biased. Cannot keep students' interest in class.

shes alright. harsh grader and sometimes pretty boring. knows what shes talking about. dumb midterm but grades easy on it. Expect to spend the entire class (2 hrs) talking about 20 minutes worth of info.  Drink coffee before this class or you'll fall asleep

The rules of the game for Jeremy's class are acknowledged at commencement. Jeremy will spend time with you if you ask for help, however, he does not appreciate those who stumble into class late. Visit the writing center and be open to revision. Jeremy's class will be an A for you if you can accept that your writing needs development.

Great Teacher! Clearly express the requirements and steps to look for resources and write papers. Give detailed comments and feedbacks for your papers and you can improve a lot from this course. He's also a nice grader! I really recommend him!
He expects you to participate in class. Helps students to understand what he wants on research papers. Just follow the rubrics then it would be fine.

He will scare you the first day.  He is serious about his expectations. He is actually an awesome guy.  He has given me great job recommendations and his class taught me a lot.  He is passionate about what he is teaching and if you need to improve your writing skills, his class will help tremendously.  You have to do the work though.

Firstly, let me just let everyone know that Jeremy is not a professor, he is a TA. That being said, this class is far from being an easy GEC. The attendance policy is strict and the reading quizzes are EXTREMELY specific (I recommend memorizing any and all names). The amount of work required in this class isn't worth the little knowledge you gain.

First day of class will scare 1/2 of students away, but this was a quality 367.02 course.  My writing improved markedly. Reqs: 10 question reading quiz everyday, drop 2 lowest grades. Three 3-4 page papers with drafts.  One 7-8 page final paper with draft. Books also required: ISBN 978-0-312-47499-7 and three pieces of literature.

Jeremy's a tough instructor and has high expectations, but you learn a great deal from him and he does not try to trick you. The reading quizzes are hard, so pay close attention to the reading material. Exams are long but cover stuff talked about in class, so if you go to class you'll be good. Don't take this class if you're looking for an easy GEC
Excellent, but the comments about it being a difficult class are correct. I would suggest taking this course.
Jeremy is intense, but his class is great practice if you are an English major. Be prepared to work hard, he has high expectations for his students.

He has a very good grasp of English but requires the most work of any class I have taken.  I am a biochemistry major and I spent more time reading story after story and writing 3 papers a week than I did on my major classes which are much harder.This class is a complete assault of busy work, I speak for my class completely... and know --"GOOD!"
No Comments
She is a born communicator. She really knows how to make people feel welcome and valued. She is also very mellow, creates a harmonious atmosphere. Smart and experienced, but also so humble.

Very helpful and inspirational class. Dr. Macbeth really respects students' ideas and provides her time and attentions to listen to and communicate with students. Her lectures are well-structured and easy to follow. I would like to take her class again.
Darling woman. Impossible to dislike her. So flexible and understanding, and very open-minded.
She is so nice. So easygoing!
Fantastic! So helpful, energetic, and realistic as to what she expects from her students. She is a great, inspiring teacher.
perfect!
She is a person full of patience. It's a very helpful class.
she is  the nicest teacher I have ever met!
Easy A++.. Keep it up
One of the best education professors I have encountered at OSU... Highly recommended!
She is the energetic, sweet, motherly, nice, helpful, value the learning process more than grading. Over all she is the best!!
Relatively easy. Probably the best professor you can ever find in your whole life! Take her class, and you will know why.
Really nice teacher
No Comments
She is very easy and always care about students. The great teacher!!!
She is a great teacher! Care about students and also give her students a good grade !

Don't say you're a republican due to him being a colossal liberal with emo bangs and a small horribly placed pony tail. He contradicts himself every time he opens his weirdly shaped mouth. He takes forever to hand things back. He would be more appreciated on a farm vs in a class room. Keep it moving Gabe.

The class is definitely not the easiest I have taken, and he sometimes takes time to get papers back. However, he's really insightful. It's obvious that he thoroughly understands the materials he's teaching. Overall, good class, good prof.
He was all right. Though he is sometimes unclear on what is wanted, he lets you make up your papers at the end of semester.

Very unorganized. Almost never gave us our papers back on time. If I did okay on the rough drafts, I did horrible on the final papers. Never understood what he wanted from us for our final papers. We get to make-up assignments, but he gave most of our papers back near the end of semester. No idea where my grade was at since he doesn't use Carmen.

David is good. I took a poetry class with him (HATE poetry and still hate it), and he helped a lot. Managed to get an A in a class that I despised, so that's something. Good instructor and knows his stuff. Good lecturer and engages the class well. Overall good.

Expensive required book used once. All other reading was free online.  Very nice and clearly extremely interested in the subject.  Scheduled final presentation same day as my final exam in another class and failed me. I provided the syllabus of other class and submitted my project so it could be graded. My other exam was 40% of grade could not miss
There were grade deductions for no apparent reason. Assignments were not returned within a reasonable time frame.
My absolute favorite professor ever... and I hate English. She is so understanding and willing to help.  Get her class if at all possible!!!!
awesome!
great!

Very helpful in making you a better writer. She knows the material well. Her class was modern and interesting: she would use modern music videos and things like that for us to analyze. I don't particularly like English, but I enjoyed her class nonetheless.

Prof Kelly is great one on one, very clear and tells you directly how to improve your writing. However class is often not as valuable. attendance is mandatory. she has lots of busy work assignments that don't help much. She expects you to write a great paper from just a few tips and we never had our papers back in time for us to adjust our writing

Dr. Kelly is a ridiculously hard grader compared to other 1100 teachers. She grades really, really, really hard and if your class is a Gen Ed I would schedule another professor. She's moving schools and not going to be at Ohio State anymore, but she asks too much of her students for a Gen Ed.
It's a lot of work, especially if you don't like writing, but the final paper is a breeze.
Best professor I've ever had. She is extremely helpful and clear about directions for papers. Learned so much through her class. Would definitely take again!

She seems a little intimidating at first, but she's really understanding and wants to help her students as much as she can! You have to go to class and buy the book, but if you put the work into your papers it's a fairly easy A. My class had three papers and a few small assignments.

I had Erin for freshman english.  She made reading about nature relatively interesting, a feat within itself.  Fair grader, understanding, completely willing and wanting to help.  Class was comprised of a few smaller assignments and a final paper.  I'd definitely take another class from her.
Don't listen to the review above me: midterm and final are CAKE. Only two other grades are papers, which you will want to put some time into. Solid class, recommend if you're interested in the Bard.

Erin was ok except for this was a GEC class and the midterm and final were OUTRAGEOUS!! She comes across as stuck up especially considering she graduated from Harvard. If you can, avoid this prof and take the 220 with another/more interesting teacher

This was a captivating class. Ben Owen was a fair grader and gave readingfilms that were interesting to get into. I absolutely loved this class. There was a bit of reading to do but it's a literature class so that was to be expected. He does mumble a little but i think its endearing and he is really nice. Plus the accent was easy on the ears.

He is awful. Indeed, different people have different opinions toward a movie or story. However, he always forces you to accept his idea. You will receive a bad grade if you don't accept his idea.  Never take his class. Let this awful nerd get out of OSU
Absolutely bad instructor.
Nice teacher. Easy A.

Very easy and very boring class. if you showed up and turned in all the assignments you will get an A. The assignments are all easy and can be completed within an hour, with the only exception being the final technical paper, which you can do in a group.
Mary makes an otherwise boring class, very interesting and exciting to attend. She cares about her students more than any other professor on campus. Take her class, easy A.

Very easy class, deadlines are pretty much optional because if you talk to her she will push it back. As long as she can tell you put in at least a little effort she will give you a good grade. She is also very helpful in putting together a good resume
Teacher has no engineering background, and will teach you nothing. Used to be an easy A class. Now sucks to be in class. Bad teachers should be removed.

My Worst college teacher ever. Grading based on how much she likes you. Knows next to nothing about good writing. Turned my grade from an A to a C for not attending class, when she herself just works on her work during class time and tells us to work on our drafts. She's a talker. Good at office politics, bad at teaching. Would not recommend.

Class is extremely easy with her.  Nothing has a deadline and if you suck up, she will extend any "deadline" she gave for the class.  Participate in class and it's not too boring.  Usually get out early and have lots of "work" days which are optional.
A fun professor who leads good discussions.  Very heavy participation and reading load.  A very difficult, sometimes vague grader but fair and often funny.  I'd take another class with him
Harshest grader I've had in the English department at OSU.

Two midterms;easy if you put minimal time into it. Two papers;decently hard. Doesn't teach you how to write, (since it is a Literature course) but expects you to write well for papers. Final is a 1500 word essay. He's real funquirky and interesting.  Reading quizzes keep you on top of your reading. BOOKS ARE NOT ON SPARKNOTES

He will give you feedback to become a better writer. The midterm was brutal and most people received a low grade, however you had a chance to revise your midterm after feedback in order to get a better grade.  You will have to be prepared for class, he will randomly test you on readings and participation is required. Very good teacher though!

This professor was always interested in what he was teaching. He is very helpful and encourages open discussion. The readings are required to achieve a good grade, the midterm is brutal (I received an 82%) but with his help I got an A overall. I understand better than ever how to read and analyze poetry. He is a great teacher and great guy.
Brian is a pretty cool professor, really makes class discussions fun. I had him at 7:30 as well and he made class actually enjoyable. I tell anyone to take Brian for English 110.01 (or .02, or.03)

Brian is an amazing teacher who keeps you interested the entire class time. He is thorough with his grading, is is very helpful and open to offering help on papers and such. I had his class at 7:30AM and it was still one of my favorite classes! I would recommend one of his classes to anyone!

Brian is an easy teacher who explains things very well. He is very encouraging during class discussions and very helpful with analysis. Other students talked about how much they hated their English classes, but I enjoyed mine.

Brian's awesome. He has a unique and almost cynical sense of humor, and it's amazing. He's very down to earth and young, so he's very easy to relate to. The workload is average, and as long as you put forth significant effort he'll recognize you for it. Class was actually a really good time. Definitely pick him for 110.01!
Sweetest Professor I Have taken at Barry U! Take her.. very knowledgeable.

She is nice. Class is a bunch of short documents (memos, emails, letter, resume, etc.) and one long proposal at the end of the class. Manageable class. Read the book for the quizzes. She is picky about the assignments but she will help you with plenty of class time to work on stuff. Dont be late and dont miss class.
Miss 1 class: -3 points. Too much busy work for a GE. You'll end up spending more $$$ than anticipated.
My class was about baseball and relating it to American Society. Kind of cool to actually analyze the game and literature about it. He's pretty cool, relates to you, and pretty easy going.

He is fine as a professor. He assigns tons of reading-you don't need to do it. However make sure you understand his point of view on the subject of your papers. If you do not write about what he wants, you will lose credit. He says you shouldn't be held down by the prompt, but if you go outside of it, you are wrong.

One of my favorite classes this semester. Just make sure to show up everyday because he takes attendance for points. He is willing to help you on papers, just ask. You should buy the books for reading but the ones to help read and write are pointless.
Nice teacher. Didn't read the book just read online summaries....I'm an international student, and I got A.

This is probably the easiest English class you could take. (My junior year HS english class was harder). There's 3 books to read for the course and i only read half of one (i found the books so boring!) and i am getting an A in the class. hes very helpful with the papers you have to write. Plus hes probably the nicest teacher. HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!

He is a nice guy and a pretty easy teacher but I feel like he'd be better off as a high school teacher instead. This class is a boring review of what you should already know by now. The books he chose were very simple to read and if you complete the papers and attend class you should at least get an A or B.

He is really nice and interested in what the student has to say. Very relaxed and fair with due dates, sometimes he would push a due date back because he was a bit late in returning a rough draft. Not much work involved in class. Need to read books and attendance is mandatory(3 unexcused absences allowed). Would recommended taking his class.

He is a nice teacher, explains grammar rules very well, and how to properly use MLA format. I couldn't get over how much this teacher reminded me of Kip from Napoleon Dynamite. I found it even more interesting that this seemingly mundane teacher has a tattoo. He appreciates your participation and actually listens to you.

Aaron was the most boring professor I had last quarter. Also, he tends to ramble on about useless or random ideas, which doesn't really teach anything and makes it hard to pinpoint what he's looking for on exam questions. Not particularly energetic or open.
WHY did this man try to teach me how to use a semi-colon? I am in college. Also, he was pretty boring most of the time, not gonna lie. Nothing spectacular but he was easy.

Aaron seems like a good guy and has a quirky sense of humor (and looks like Sherman from American Pie), but I don't think he's a great teacher. He was pretty smothering as a professor and didn't really allow any personality or opinion in our essays. He also tried to interject politics into everything, while claiming they didn't interest him.
One time I was texting in class to tell a friend how awesome this teacher was. Not even kidding. If you listen closely, you can learn a hell of a lot. People who say hes boring are just lazy
You'll learn a lot from him, but he doesn't hand you anything on a silver plate.

Aaron is probably a good teacher, but the material is extremely dull and uninteresting to me (and most others). It's not uncommon for me (and others) to space out for 20 minutes at a time as he drones on about British Literature. He has a very monotone voice that's easy to tune out. His exams are tough, but curves them and offers extra credit.
amazing.
wonderful!
do the papers and you should be fine! not harash grader

He is very approachable. If you actually participate in class it can be fun. He's definitely not boring. He creatively tries to adapt the course in a way that is less tedious for his students. overall, i highly recommend him...especially if you dislike english, he makes it fun

Aaron is an awesome teacher and a really funny guy. He is very nice and when you get papers back they will actually have useful feedback on them (shocker!). He doesn't penalize you for not carbon-copying his writing style, which is more than I can say for other English professors at OSU. Highly recommended!

Overall good teacher and a pretty funny guy. He talks a lot and goes off on a lot of tangents that can be interesting, but sometimes hard to follow. He grades pretty easy and there are no tests, only papers. He also changes his haircolor about every two or three weeks which kept things interesting.

The class was easy, we had 4 papers to write and they werent very long. He is very understanding, if you have a problem he is def approachable. The papers are the only assagments due so there is not too much work outside of class. we had to read by schedule, but i didnt read and still was able to get by.

He's a good person, but good teacher? He makes jokes and swears. However, he's very wordy and goes into about ten tangents while talking about one subject. Sometimes I really didn't know what he was talking about, and the comments on his drafts were less than helpful because you change those things, then he thinks of more things for the final draft
BEST ENGLISH TEACHER EVER!!!! HE REALLY HELPS HIS STUDENTS TO BECOME BETTER WRITERS
Awesome teacher.  Cracks jokes and cusses a lot.  Papers are graded fairly and sufficient time is given to complete them.
No Comments
No Comments
I LOVE AARON!!!! cooooolest teacher ever!!!

Aaron is INCREDIBLE!! He's an awesome teacher, good looking ;), hilariously entertaining, and all in all a very cool guy. I would 100% recommend his class to anyone who wants to have a great english 110 experience!
hot stuff, let me tell you!!
awesome!
He's a great teacher and knows how to have fun!! Haha this class was awesome, I'd recommend him to everyone.

I had a great time in English this quarter, it was so much fun! Aaron made the quarter go fast and really helped to make the assignments seem easier. He really made this class fun and interesting! I would definitely recommend him!
i 'heart' aaron...he's smart and gorgeous!!! and not to metion a fantastic teacher! -c
Funny as hell!!
Great professor! Responds to emails fast and brings in treats! Very nice and very good at her job. The subjest matter was simple. Take this class

Definitely take her class! She was funny, on point with relative topics and engaging. The whole semester I was thinking how wonderful she was (at this time she is a grad student)and she won an award for best graduate student teacher or something.

Katherine is a professor who  is vague on every assignment. The class was a break from the other hard classes at OSU but she is NOT a good teacher. Each assignment's content was entirely up to you which left you wondering what objectives you had to complete. The class was fun for making videos but I wasn't impressed with OSU's teacher selection.

Katherine is an absolute delight. If you're looking for an engaging, creative class, or something simple that's just a break you can enjoy, this is it. You have the freedom to explore and her teaching is absolutely fantastic. The best prof I've had at OSU.

Katherine is so great. The class itself gives you limitless bounds to be creative. It's genuinely a break from all the restrictions and guidelines given to you in every other course. This class was always like a break from school to just relax and let the imagination flow. She's also very helpful and very open to ideas and suggestions.
She is an awesome teacher. She even made brownies for the class. She is really helpful.

Not helpful when I emailed him multiple times and met with him. He can get off topic easily and sometimes calls students out if he doesn't like them.  He also takes a while to grade and email back. If you can, take a different teacher for this class.

Maybe if he had given easier tasks to complete, then the class would be easy, however, that is not the case here. He gives tough tasks to be completed during and outside of class that makes you wonder if the class was supposed to be designed this tough.
EXTREMELY EASY.  Everyone I know in the class with me got an A.  I finished the class with 992/1000 points and had the option for extra credit.  Take this if you can.

Professor Black's engineering writing course was very easy. You do need the textbook for some quizzes. Most of the material learned isn't that difficult and most of the projects don't require much effort. Very easy to get an A.

He's really open to any writing topics, which can be a good or bad thing--not much direction, but a lot of freedom. In class he's pretty quiet the first few weeks, but after that he starts making freaking hilarious comments and one-liners. I'd probably take him again.
Easy to get an A.  A really nice guy, kind of shy.  Really laid back.

This class is structured as a workshop. There are assigned readings for the first few weeks, but then you end up just reading poems in class and discussing them. There are also many days that you spend just reading classmates' poetry and giving feedback. Chris is a very cool and laid back guy.

Loved taking her class, you read about 5/6 books throughout the semester. As long as you read and participate in class you will do well. 2 mini-papers throughout the semester and one final paper. Really fun class, attendance does matter however.
Bob really helped me a lot when I was a freshman. He taught me many useful writing skills which I am still utilizing now. He is a very nice person and dedicates to teach.
Bob is the most passionate teacher I have met in OSU. And his writing class is extremely useful for me.

This class was mandatory and I frankly had no choice but to take it but I felt and still feel lucky to have Bob for this course. He is very passionate about teaching and really loves his students. His lectures might be a little bit non-relevant but he's always there for students.  And he likes to bring snacks for us!
Probably the best class I have taken at OSU EVER!!!!! He is an amazing professor who is passionate about the law and makes it interesting and fun for everyone. The HIGHEST recommendation!

He is kind of kooky but overall an awesome professor! I always wanted to go to class because it was extremely laid back. Bob is super passionate about getting his students to think, which by his philosophy will lead to a better writer.

I couldn't have asked for a better intro. to law school/legal writing course. Bob truly wanted to help prepare students for law school and general life as a lawyer, and he certainly succeeded. He wasn't caught up with grades, but preferred meeting with students one-on-one throughout the quarter to help with assignments.
Absolutely a great teacher !

If you are even considering law school, take this course. It's roughly half learning about law school writing, and half preparation for law school itself. Anyone who takes this course will begin law school with a huge advantage over their classmates. And as far as Bob himself well, people, and instructors, just don't get any better than him.

I feel that Bob is a professor that students get to experience once in a blue moon. He genuinely cares about students and that they learn the material teaching.  It's not everyday that although the material may be challenging, you still want to show up to class everyday, on time, ready to learn, and Bob makes you want to do that. awesome!
funny guy!
He is an amazing professor. Super laid back. If you come to class, do the work, and try-- you should get an a.

He's one of the coolest teacher I ever had. He's fun. He keeps his class short which is awesome! He's more liek that kind of teacher who makes you think than just remember what he says. I really enjoyed the class. Also, take his class if you want an easy A.
easy A class, extremely easy. short class time. he is very passionate. good teacher!
No wonder he's so easy.  He doesn't have an English degree.
Bob is the English teacher you want. He is hilarious and makes class enjoyable. He is very easy but you still learn a lot. Bob is the coolest guy ever!
he is the best teacher ever i had my life time wallahi, he is helpfull and he know what he is talking about.
the best lecturer/teacher you can get. period.
He is so funny, he says whatever he wants.  He is not an easy teacher, but he is a fair grader.  I would definitly take a class with him again.  He also keeps class very short which is awesome.

I think Bob is a professor who can make writing appeal to just about any student, because in his class, its more of a "thinking" class than it is a "proper"/**** essay-writing class.  He can relate to the students, and also cares about them.  I think he teaches the kind of class students WANT to do well in.
Bob is amazing! He is fun and cool, and he never holds anything back. "Blob" rules!
His hippy-chic style and way of teaching makes me actually want to go to class!
funniest teacher i have ever had

Very Liberal...all we did was watch movies...in a writing class!!  If you like watching movies like Al Gore's "Inconvenient Truth" you will love him.  Even though the real title should be "Pack of Lies".  Gore won't even let reporters or scientist ask him questions about the movie yet good old Bob has us watch it as if it were fact!!!
You will get an easy A if you have him!  He is very nice to everyone and help students a lot.  I hope he teaches 367.01 next year :)
Bob is one of the nicest people in the whole world. He's the sort of teacher that I know I can come back to and he'll still be willing to help me.
Bob's the coolest, great guy, easy class, easy A, cool as hell, although a little too into his cats.
Bob is a great guy!  He even invited me to Thanksgiving dinner since I wasn't going home.

This was one of the first courses I ever took here as an incoming freshman. Bob spoiled me! The entire 10 weeks we worked on writing an autobiography- VERY EASY, yet enlightening! Bob is awesome and so funny! He kept the class interesting. I definitely recommend him-- Take English 110C with Bob!!!
Bob is the man!!
Fabulous teacher!  He made Eng 110 enjoyable- Very entertaining and friendly.  You'll learn a lot while laughing your butt off
Blog is an awesome teacher!! By far one of the funnest classes I've ever taken..you'll have a lot of fun, but you'll learn a lot as well. :)
My favorite teacher. I still see him around campus and he is so friendly. funny guy, makes the class very easy but encourages you to learn. So fun. I LOVED this class because of Bob.

Bottom line: English 110L sucks, so take it with Bob and he makes it a breeze.  He's not simple, but he makes it so the word load is not a lot at anytime and the books we read were pretty interesting.  He flipping rules.

I am a student from Wuhan Univ. China P.R.. Though i've only been taught by him for less than 10 h.i still want to say he is a good guy,and a very warm-hearted teacher as well.To meet him is a great honor for me, and hope he best of luck in OSU.

Great teacher, great guy. Our entire class consisted of writing a personal autobiography and reading 3 autobiographies we select individually. Kept things interesting by letting you write about what you were interested in.
Cool dude.
Bob is really helpful teacher. He help me write a better english paper than i used to. He has great personilty and good teaching experience
Bob is a lot fun and he is just a great guy!  His class also has a friendly environment.

Definitely one of the greatest teachers I have had while here at Ohio State. I'm almost in my third year and still remember that first quarter and how much fun his class was. I really got to know myself in that class and he is such a blast!!
interesting and creative
he's a nice guy, very helpful and understanding... i can't see why anyone would dislike his class... it was open and interesting... the most enjoyable class of my autumn quarter by far

Whoever found it necessary to diss Bob, what class were you taking?!?! Obviously you are not 1 that enjoys interacting w/a prof who is kind & genuinely cares about his students! Open your eyes and realize that there is more to college then textboo

Mr Eckhart... although everyone calls him Bob... is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He actually makes English interesting!? CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT!? All you incoming freshman take English 110C w/ Bob Eckhart!

He's awesome...really nice and funny...and you actually learn in this class. You don't learn pointless stuff you'll never need, you learn lessons about life and things that really matter.  He's a great teacher!
this is the only english class i have ever taken and actually enjoyed. he treats the students like peers, and is willing to provide as little or as much help as you need.

One of the worst teachers I have had.  Though he did treat students as friends, which some may have liked, I felt he didn't take his job seriously.  He basis of grading was unclear and I feel the work assigned was pointless.  I feel as though I regressed.

W231 is based on writing a recommendation report for a local organization in teams. She walks you through every step of the process. She is also extremely helpful. Her lectures are very entertaining and she has a great sense of humor! If she's teaching a class you're taking, pick her! You will definitely be glad you did!
She's awesome!

Debbie is a GREAT teacher. She's dedicated, she knows her stuff and wants you to succeed. Not too many teachers that really have your back the way she does. She won't let you off easy though - she makes you earn it. Loved her class and highly recommend.
Great teacher. She's not easy but she's fair, she cares and most importantly - she's there for you. HIGHLY recommended.
She tries to scare students into dropping for the first few weeks. after that, she eases up a lot. She's a fair and easy grader. I ended up liking her, but definately not at first.
Amazing teacher.  I wish she was an engineer so she could teach all my classes.  Makes reaserch papers enjoyable.  She was excellent even though she was pregnant during my quarter.

Excellent professor.  Passionate and excited about teaching and really cares that her students learn and understand the material and the core concepts.  Gives a lot of great notes on papers.  She even critiqued a paper with full notes for me after the final!!  Really a great professor!!
assigns maybe too much reading, but you will be glad and might even change your mind about some things after you read it. she's smart and fair and worth taking for a chance of pace.

Great professor to have in class! Very knowledgeable, gives excellent feedbacks on papers, extra willing to help. Assigns many papers and readings, especially during the first half of the quarter. Grading is very easy. She's somewhat of a crazy English teacher who is extremely passionate about writing, but you can't go wrong with Professor Minor!

Highly recommended, relates very well to her students, gives feedback on papers before the final drafts are due...we even got to watch a couple flicks during the quarter...topics of class were interesting, definately one of the better 2-hour classes i've taken
Best teacher ever!

I had Brad at Seattle University where he teaches now. I was dreading taking a writing class, but his class was my favorite of the quarter. The textbook readings aren't really used, but make sure to read any pdf documents/papers he assigns because those will be important.

Brad is such an amazing guy.  He's teaching at Seattle University, which is where I have him as a teacher.  He really makes an effort to connect with you and help you in any way that he can.  The course RACE, SEX, & MONEY ON TV is 100% my favorite class I have ever taken (including high school classes).  Became an even better writer after this.
Good teacher!

Brad was one of my favorite teachers. Class theme was "Race, Class, & Gender after the Apocalypse". One of the most interesting classes I've taken. Actually excited to go to class. Discussion was always thought provoking. Must go to class and expect a little reading and a good amount of writing. He is helpful with the writing so it isn't that bad.

Jen is the best instructor I have had in my four years here at OSU. Her teaching style is great and it helps that she truly wants us to succeed. Her class requires some work, but she provides you with all of the knowledge and tools to do it. I would recommend taking any classes with her that you can!
You get an A as long as you do the assignment. Super easy class and Jen is an excellent teacher! Definitely take any class you can with her! She is very helpful and fun.

She is very nice, but her midterm was extremely difficult and her class requires a lot of work. Her papers are difficult because the rubrics are not very good. She will help you if you go to her, though.

SP15: Meg is awesome, she is so nice and chill. There are weekly readings but you are not quizzed on them like it says in the syllabus. There are 2 2-3 page papers and 1 5-7 page paper. Participation is huge. She is an easy grader and offers extra credit to raise your grade. There is a group presentation and a solo pres. which are graded easy.
good teacher. she is really helpful and easy to score A as long as you follow what she wants.

Meg is great. She is slightly odd, but in a good way. The meditation and mindfulness were very interesting and eye opening. Subject matter wasn't my favorite, but Meg's passion really made the class enjoyable. Also, side note, she has a very nice sense of style. Would DEFINITELY take again!

Very easy class. You have to attend which sucks and you are not allowed to use technology. (I do but u gotta pull it off) There are three papers and the longest one is 7 pages. Not bad at all,  there is extra credit and its an easy A.

Not the best with guidelines for papers but an easy grader. Discussion based with a directed, liberal focus. Participation and reading are "required" to keep the conversation going but not a huge grade factor. I definitely enjoyed her class. Inspired me to write. Best English professor I've ever had; someone you get coffee and talk about life with.

One of my favorite teachers at OSU, her class can get repetitive but she brings wonderful energy to the room and isn't a stickler for grammar. Participating is important to her but not vital for a good grade. There's a lot of assigned reading, all of which are relatively interesting, but the bulk of your points are won on essays.

The class can be interesting, but because a lot of it is material already covered in other classes, it gets repetitive and you get bored... She doesn't allow the use of laptops or tablets, so good luck entertaining yourself as you die slowly in the nearly two hour class.
meg is an awesome instructor and really gets the entire class engaged. I would recommend this class, for its ease and its quality. Plus, meg's pretty fine I must say.
She is a great professor who is very helpful and is a fair grader on papers. She offers extra credit which only requires to write a one page paper. Very highly suggest to take her class
During lectures, he goes off on tangents that I found hard to follow. I also found it difficult to pay attention anyway. He was a tough grader and you read a new play every 2 weeks.
The class material was too advanced for the level of course, and he was a hard grader. The lectures were un-interesting, and there was a lot of useless work, as well as a lot of reading.
He is one of the worst professors that I have ever had.  Super boring and a hard grader.  Loads a bunch of useless work on you. Don't take a class with him.  Terrible.

I loved, loved Prof. Halasek! She is so nice and easy to talk to. Her class definitely involves some assignments and you need to keep good track of them and attend in order to do well. But, do these things and you will do great in her class. Also, she is nice to talk to and very understanding so don't be shy!
one of the best professors I've ever had..it isn't an easy A, you will have to do work, but she does a great job of explaining the topics. also very helpful during office hours

Brilliant, brilliant professor.  She is not only extremely knowledgeable about writing, she understands how to teach writing to students.  She is very easy to talk to and is more than willing to help students.  If you have anyone other than Dr. Halasek for English 398, I'm sorry, because no one should teach this class but her.

Nobody should be allowed to teach this course other than Dr. Halasek, or at least they should have to follow her exact model, which still wouldn't get you the same incredible experience.  This class will make you look at EVERYTHING differently. Make sure you can write, but if you can, you will do well. Got nearly a perfect score on the exam, READ!.

She is very helpful and always clear. The class was a five week course, but it never felt overwhelming even with two papers due a week! She made it easy to ask for help, and to understand the material!! Would most definately recommend to all!!!

Gave a tremendous amout of busy work and is not open to feedback from students. She gives random assignments in a whim and most are due on weekend at very specific times. Is not very considerate if you have other obligations. Do not take her if you have a job or other classes that require attention.

One of the best classes I have ever taken. She is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. I have taken multiple classes with her, she does expect a lot of out of class work from her students but you learn a lot. Wish I could have her again.
fascinating class (intro to rhetoric), super-smart lady, and a great time.  just a crazy amount of homework, and it sometimes seems like a lot of b.s.  oh, well.

Intelligent professor, but perhaps to a fault because she might expect too much out of students.  Very encouraging in class discussions. She's easy to talk to, too.  Students decided on the format of the exams, which were decided to be take home.  Two longer papers/projects.  Tough grader, but she had conferences before hand.

Feel like everything in this class is really vague. Despite having read all the assigned material, I consistently am not sure what exactly she wants. For example, the quiz directions are "Analyze this." Then we have like 5 min to bs something. Frustrated that this is jeopardizing my 4.0 gpa. Would not recommend.

Hottest professor I've had at OSU. Pop quizzes are tough at first but they prepare you for what she expects for her tests. Once you understand how to answer her analyses, it becomes a much more enjoyable class.
Overall a great teacher. She's so patient and knows a lot.

To be honest she has to be one of the most attractive women I have had as a teacher. Other than that, I have to say that so far she is always willing to help. I suck at writing in general, but she will help you. I think she is a good teacher. I hate writing, but I'm glad I have her as a teacher. :)
She is and an extremely creative teacher, and she is always willing to help students during office hours and during class.
This class literally changed my life.

At first, I wasn't looking forward to this class because I hate writing papers; however, it ended up being one of my favorite classes at OSU. Lauren is an excellent teacher. She is extremely helpful and supportive, allows multiple revisions on papers, and will give you a TON of feedback for you to work with. As long as you try, you will get an A.
She wants all students to meet with her only during her office hours. She prefers not to discuss a lot after the class. Being late means being absent, even just 10 minutes.
she is a little bit haughty. sometimes the feedback is mean lecture is good
Mira is obviously interested in her topic and students. Class discussions were helpful and comments on papers were constructive.
Great Instructor...Discussions and readings were interesting. A lot of flexibility and freedom in the writing assignments.
not a easy grader, strict and tough
She was a very helpful professor and made the class more interesting than I thought it could be.

She is a really nice person, although the subject was a not my cup of tea. Shakespeare is her thing, so be prepared to do something relating to him. I enjoyed her class though. It was fun, for Shakespeare anyway.

She's an easy grader. There isn't a ton of work. She only gives 4 assignments throughout the quarter. Great class for english 110.02. But a warning, the class is about shakespeare, so if you hate shakespeare...you probably won't like the class
No Comments

Had this prof last year   She takes what's said in class and integrates into the next day's lecture and quizzes, so pay attention. Some of the theory stuff is boring, but it does build your vocabulary.  Loved working with comics and much of the class was fun. Some group work, tons of writing.  Answers e-mail fairly quickly.
She is very personable and willing to teach, but is not a very helpful or positive person if you ask for help on your papers. The class is a lot of work for more than the credit hours.

Theresa is very personable, and is genuinely interested in teaching and hearing and reading what students have to write. She always is excited to read our work, and usually finds good in everything. Very well read, and fun teacher. I liked this class.

I had her a few years ago, got in an argument with her about my analysis of my ad and don't try to integrate technology, she doesn't understand it. Like everyone says on here she was a very tough grader. Also, this probably is just a me thing, I definitely had a problem with how she would spell "Hello," "Hallo" then be tough on our writing.

If you get her, you better drop. She is such a hard grader for an introductory class. When asked why you got points off of an assignment, she never gives a legitimate answer and will never change your grade. Hardest class I have taken here at Ohio State.

A friendly enough person, but a tough grader for a first-level course, and doesn't say why points are removed even when directly asked. Nothing very important is said during lecture, but total grade is very attendance-heavy. If you get stuck with her, I'd recommend just taking the class another semester.
If you choose her class unfortunately, you'd better drop it immediately. : )

A very strange grader. Her criteria is very unclear and sometimes her comments on your finished work directly contradict that criteria (though she won't give points back). Extremely difficult to get a good trade for an intro-level writing course. Many papers will have points off without any clear reason given whatsoever.

If you have chance to take English 1110 later, drop her class and take another time. Tough grader, most of students can only receive grade around B. She took off points even because of the class participation.

She's very tough with grading. Isn't clear at all about what's expected for assignments. Her lectures are an absolute waste of time, but attendance is mandatory. She can come across as being nice, but don't be fooled. Absolutely would never take a course with her again.

She grades extremely tough and will tell you to change things in one draft then takes off points for you changing it in the next draft.  She is very inconsistent and doesn't grade on a rubric so when you point these things out to her  she doesn't change your grade. It seems to me she only believes in one way (her way) to write a paper.
Very tough grader and not very sympathetic or understanding. Makes an easy class pretty hard

Margaret grades extremely tough, especially for a first year writing course. I had friends in the same course with a different teacher who got easy A's. Do not take this course with her, she grades way to hard.
Don't take it.
Horrible grader! Even if you fix everything she asked,  she will still find more things that are wrong and ignore your efforts on this course.  I do not recommend her at all.
So boring!!! very lower grade. Don't take her class!!!!
She is a really tough grader.

Margaret was a wonderful professor! She had an obvious passion for poetry, enjoyed getting to know her students, and was helpful in person and also over email.  One of the best professors I've had at my time at OSU

I thought the review below was rather harsh. She is a an extremely nice teacher who encourages class discussion. The course material can be dry at times, but she supplements short stories with movies which help keep things interesting!
Terrible. So boring. Requires textbooks that the book stores do not even carry.

She enjoys the subject and teaching. If you read the books, you will do well in the class. It was an overall easy class, and that was nice as it is a GEC. She gets quite annoyed if students don't read and participate, so always read prior to class. She is flexible about the due dates for writing assignments, which is really helpful if needed.

Very knowledge teacher, really knows her stuff. Terribly confusing and condescending. If you have a real passion for writing and maintain a high level of work, you'll be fine. Otherwise beware: class will be dreadful.

Very nice lady. She knows people are just getting the GEC credit and structures the class accordingly. Only writing was a final paper. You MUST read the books to do well, but if you do, it's not that hard of a class.

She is a nice lady but she is a hard grader. She is overly picky about small details like sentence structure and word choice and it seems like she thinks there's just one correct way to write a paper.
