She basically tried to change everything about my writing style. There are so many easier and more interesting 367 classes so don't take this one.

She is a nice woman but a rough teacher. She is an extremely hard grader- the class had a hard time passing our take home exams that were essays. For an intro class, this basic literature course was wayyy too difficult to pass with an A. I don't recommend taking it if you don't have to. The class will just frustrate you with it's work load.
She is truly passionate about her topic! She is also a sweetheart, and would do anything to help her students succeed.
We had an hour and a half long lecture on the proper use of a semicolon. Enough said.
Horrible! She is an impossible graders and even if you fix everything she asks she will still find more things that are wrong. I do not recommend her at all.

David is approachable, interesting, and wonderfully profane. I always looked forward to his classespecially workshops, where he gave consistently great feedback. He's pretty scatter-brained though, which didn't bother me very muchin fact it was kind of entertainingbut some may feel otherwise. Above all, taking his class made me a better writer.

Good teacher and knows his stuff, but comes to class in a bad mood.  Can take it out on students, so be prepared.  Very liberal and not shy about sharing his views.  You will learn a lot about writing and other good stuff, but he takes things personally at times when students are only asking for help or clarification.

The class was the same every day. Read, discuss in class, and workshop the second half of the semester. He was good at giving feedback and pretty helpful, but sometimes the class was just boring and drawn out. He also is clearly liberal and tends to unnecessarily bring minor controversial/political conversations into class. He values participation.
Basic Introductory English course.
so many works need to do and strict grading will let you fail

Coming from a business major who has hated every GEN ED I have been in, DO THIS CLASS. Comes off as strict at first, but she loosens up. A lot of class discussion based and let's you do papers on what you want to do. I was the one who had to bring her class evals to her, and I read thru everyone's, and all had positive things to say about her. 9/10
I am an international student and I thought I would fail her class. You just have to participate and hand up your work on time and you're good to go! :) Overall a really enjoyable class.

Annie comes off as a strict teacher early on, but she becomes much easier. She assigns assignments that can take some time, but most of your grade comes from essays. Don't be afraid to ask questions or meet with her at office hours because she really does want to see everybody succeed. Overall, a good teacher that makes you work for your grade

High school-like class structure. She seems tough, but if you go to class and participate you'll do fine and get on her good side. She used the book at first and had "pop quizzes", but focused more on in-class discussions halfway through the semester. At times gives lots of assignments. Most of the grade is based on essays (not too difficult).

Annie comes off as tough at the beginning, and led a couple kids to drop. Overall this class was pretty interesting, and not a whole lot of work. She gave us mini writing projects, most which were graded just for having it done. The essays are heavy for grade, but If you put in time, and go to office hours, she helps your paper.

Started off the class expecting a lot out of all the students (giving reading quizzes and many assignments), but as the class went on she quit giving quizzes and assigning chapters to read. Just make sure you attend every class and participate a few times every class. She is not a tough grader, just follow the rubric and you will get an A.
1. Tough Grader, 2. Ready to do some stupid reading quiz 3. Spend some time on it, or you will fail.
Usual English class, must be able to really put forth the creative thinking and have a good understanding of what's going on in order to understand assignments.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had. She makes it too hard and does not help well. There is so much reading which you'll most likely be quizzed on orally or written quiz. If you don't participate, you will get a C. She is the worst English professor at The Ohio State University.

GE that everyone has to take. Takes the class way to seriously so only a few people ever answer questions. Quizzes are given orally and if you miss your question you fail the whole quiz. Is very adamant in her opinions and is difficult to talk to her about anything. Just drop the class of you have her and try again next time.

Annie is a no BS professor. She expects you to come to class and participate and I don't think there's anything wrong with that. The environment also made it easier to talk to classmates and participate. She is a tough grader and there is a lot of work but I learned so much and I felt I could always go to her when I needed help. I recommend!!

This is a mandatory class to take for all majors. She treats the class as if it was an honors level major class. There were three required readings, a quiz, and an essay due the first week. Also, if she saw me typing this, she would mark me absent for the day. After 3 absences, she drops your grade 4%

She gives a lot of homework and assignments, but she is a pretty nice grader. Kind of opinionated, but gets friendlier as the class goes along. Overall the class was OK, but I liked having her as a teacher.

Do not take her. Just don't. There are easier teachers who will help you, not waste your time, and give you fair grades. Her rubric's are crazy and have no effect on your overall grade for a paper and her comments on papers are extremely unhelpful.

By far my least favorite professor I had this year at Ohio State. She runs the classroom like an elementary school setting. Many times you will be asked to work on a paper, while she stares at you, makes you feel uncomfortable, and grades you on how much effort your putting in. A ridiculous amount of work. And ridiculous grading. Don't take her.

Seemed nice, very strict with everything, unhelpful with some problems I had in the class, very inflexible with anything. For example states that you can miss 3 class days unexcused, yet if you miss a day when something is due you can not turn it in online has to be hard copy, if not in class you lose all points.

Seemed nice, very strict with everything, unhelpful with some problems I had in the class, very very inflexible with anything. For example states that you can miss 3 class days unexcused, yet if you miss a day when something is due you can not turn it in online has to be hard copy, if not in class you lose all points.
Annie is very sweet and an overall good instructor. I really enjoyed her class!
She seemed fine at first but turned out to be really rude. Every email she sent seemed condescending and she isn't flexible at all. I did not like her whatsoever.

Really awesome teacher. Loved the excerpts she provided and loved writing. She is always ready to help you with your writing. Although I dreaded the final writing project, I felt well-prepared. She is very strongly opinionated on some topics, which makes free discussion difficult, but otherwise a really great teacher.
Great instructor. I had her for her first time teaching 2367H. Greatly enjoyed the class. She gave us huge freedom on the papers.

At first I was disappointed because the course material wasn't as intellectually stimulating as I thought it would be. But I ended up liking her in the end because she was really helpful when it came to writing our final paper. She even set up individual appointments with all of us to go through our drafts!

Marsch, as someone else mentioned, does not teach much. She uses the discussion too heavily and only gives bare bones explanations for basic concepts. Her teaching style is very unfocused and hard to listen to. She also doesn't moderate a discussion. The class would have been more fun if I had just read the books alone.

Class is discussion-based, both in lecture and on a discussion board. Contributing regularly is a major part of the grade. She tends to take a backseat after starting the discussion, so make sure you know how to enter the conversation. She's pretty flexible with the essay formats if you have an idea you want to pursue.

This was the most pointless class I have ever taken. Lots of busy workwritingreading. If you don't read you won't do good on the take home essay exams. I wouldn't recommend this class. Choose a different GE!!

If you do the assigned work ( a lot but manageable) you will do pretty well. The class was all discussion and participation based. Students gave their thoughts on the readings the entire lecture. The midterm and finals were essays (tough grader). There was one presentation about a quote.

she knows what she is talking about. She gives you a chance to ask questions and there are really no wrong answers, she. She would be nice to go out and have a cup of coffee with and disscuss a book with
She is helpful enough. However, the classes are just discussion based. Essay exams (2). Discussion board and participation. Not bad, but not an extremely easy grader.

Took her twice now. One class was mostly discussion with her guiding with questions, one class asked her a lot of questions so she spent a lot of time explaining. She seems to do whatever the class needs. I liked the discussions better, but both ways worked out. She picked awesome material and I learned a ton about stuff that really matters.

Marsch does not teach. Discussion is interesting and you learn from your peers but not from her. She assigns too many readings that never get discussed in class. She is a nice lady but is not a teacher. It is the class material that is interesting and useful not her in any way. She doesn't give any feedback on exams. good class bad teacher.
She is the best professor I have ever encountered and she taught the best class I have ever taken or expect to take. Period.

This professor is not easy but she is very valuable in your pursuit of an education. If you want an easy ride through a class, you won?t like her. She sticks to the policy and holds students to a high standard but isn?t that why we pursued a higher education, right? This is what all professors should be like. Learned so much from her.

My favorite class and prof at OSU. Tons of discussion. She listens really closely to what students are saying, and it seems like she's just going to let everyone talk, but then she somehow summarizes everything and puts it into an intellectual framework and ties it back into class. She always made my ideas sound smarter than I thought they were.

I'm a senior and she was by far my favorite professor so far. I learned something everyday, so I was excited to come to class. She had high expectations for everyone and then worked tirelessly to help us meet them. Wicked smart, but lots of profs are. She knows how to teach and wants to share her knowledge, which makes all the difference.

Middletown too. "I don't have answers for you, I just have a lot of questions." I'm a better writer and a better thinker because of her class. I always get a lot of compliments from my other teachers. That's all from Ms. Marsch. I hated it at first, but now I know what she was doing for me and I'm grateful, just like she said would happen.

I had her at Miami Middletown and she told us on Monday that by Wednesday we needed to have a rough draft for a 7 page paper written and peer edited by two other people in the class. It doesn't give you a lot of time to write a good paper

She just exudes love--not creepy, just really inspiring. I'm learning a lot from what she assigns, but also who she is. Perfect for a class on love, which is an impossible topic anyway ("I'm not sure I know much about love, but I know a lot about what other people across the world say about it. Let's look at some and see what we think." Awesome.)
3 books plus a bunch of other stuff for a 10 week course. Too much reading! I dropped the first day.

This teacher notices everything, even when she doesn't say anything. She actually really cares about the students in her class as people. We've had the best conversations in her office. I went there to talk about the exam and we ended up talking about my life. OMG she doesn't accept laziness from people, though, like, at all.

good class, awesome teacher. She was wicked smart and always enthusiastic. We read a ton, but I ended up really liking all the books. The theory stuff is hard, but she explains it enough that you get why it's important to think about.
She Was Awesome. Even though it was early, I liked coming to class and I was smarter for being there. Sweet class. I'm seriously a better person.
Excellent teacher for this class. Knowledgable, intelligent, well-spoken. If you don't participate, you will not do well!

My favorite teacher at OSU so far. Passionate, knowledgeable, open to ideas, listens, clear expectations. Exceptional mind and kind and warm person--not a normal combo in a lot of people. Read, think, learn and you'll do great. Totally ideal learning experience. I can't say enough about her and her class. I'm kind of in love.
took it a while ago. was great. wrote about whatever we wanted to, she helped you if you wanted. lots of discussion.
Class was pretty fun if you did the work. She was really great. Smart and Nice. She thought she was funny, which was funny.

I was in this class with you guys. It wasn't that bad. I LEARNED. Sure I didn't get an A right away, but she was always helpful and my writing improved. For a class the majority of which didn't speak English very well, I thought she did an amazing job. Discussions were good if you discussed. & the cancellations were reasonable. I liked class & her.

She is really terrible. She did not teach at all during the class. All was stupid and useless discussion.Missed several lectures because of kinds of "accidents" Whatever how hard you work, she will never give you useful feedbacks and grade your paper fairly. I am doubting her professional as a teacher. stay away from her.
A Terrible instructor, miss 3 classes. The discuss in the class is meaningless. Grade the paper slowly and gave unbelievable low score. Never take her class.

Very terrible instructor. She cannot lead a discussion in a direction. Seems nice in class, but the score she gave for the paper is horrible. So many people got C-level and D-level for the first paper.Strongly suggest not taking her class.

She is very knowledgeable, but a poor first year English teacher. Shows up to class late many times and hold class past the bell. Homework and papers are kind of ridiculous for first year writing. All in all, there's better teachers out there and if you're going to take English just take the regular class English 100.01.

She flew thru the powerpoint and refused to put the notes on Carmen. She also missed 3 classes. The class was  at 730 a.m. and we were never notified ahead of time that class was canceled. The entire class would be waiting and then we would find out she wasn't coming. After the initial class to get the syllabus then she missed the very next class.

We read four books and wrote four 2-3 page papers. Elizabeth is a really good teacher. She verbalizes students' ideas very well and is very helpful in writing the essays. She's also a cool person; she shared stories w/ us about her ****en escapades. Haha. Keep in mind though, that Elizabeth is kind of a tough grader.
Worst class I have ever took. She thinks she knows everything and grades papers extremely hard. Would stay away from at all cost.

I went into English 110 expecting it to be a joke as all GEC classes at OSU seem to be, but was surprised.  It was actually a good class!  The focus of this particular class was other forms of expression- audio, images, video.  More project work than reading.
Her English 110 was very similar to the Philosophy course that I'm taking this quarter. Very interesting... very thought provoking. Make sure to participate in class.

She was a very good teacher that made you think more deeply about things and the world around you. I tried very hard in her class and I learned many great things from her and our class discussions. She's not an easy teacher, but the experience is worth it

Ms. Toliver worked with me in person and through email throughout the semester to help me succeed in the course. She taught me everything I know about all the genres of Nonfiction. Great passionate teacher.

There was a lot of reading in the class, but she picked interesting material so I didn't mind. My writing improved greatly with her because she gave a ton of good feedback. Participation does matter and sometimes she will call you out if you are too quiet. Overall, she's a great instructor and I enjoyed the class.

Toliver was one of the best professors I've had so far. She cares about her students and made my writing so much stronger. Although she is a tough grader when it comes to the papers if you send her your draft she gives really great feedback. Going to office hours helped with getting feedback and even ideas of where I should start.

Rachel is one of the best professors  I've had at OSU. She genuinely cares about all of her students and is extremely accessible outside of class. If you go to her office hours she will tell you exactly what to change to get a better grade and is very willing to help. She also reads all drafts you send her and gives really good feedback.

Great teacher. Amazing feedback. As long as you communicate with her and send her drafts, you can get an A. She will tell you exactly what you need to change to bump up your grade. She will also work with you if you need an extension as long as you have been in constant communication about it. Basically communication is key.

Toliver is one of the most fair and reasonable professors that I have ever had. While she does challenge you to put forth your best work, she provides more than enough resources to make sure you get the grade you want! As far as deadlines go, as long as you communicate with her, she is willing to work with you! She's very outgoing and sweet.

Toliver is a tough teacher, but you get out of this class what you put in. She is extremely knowledgeable and eager to help all students. I would definitely recommend this class, and an A is definitely achievable, but this isn't a class you can just sleep through.

Loved listening to her speak in class, such an interesting and intelligent person. Such fun classes, the time goes by quickly. Loved talking to her outside of class. She truly cares deeply for all of her students. Makes herself available outside of class and will give good feedback.
The best professor I have had at Ohio State so far. Teaches a lot about writing and wants everyone to do great. She also taught us a lot about life. Wish I could take more classes from her!

best  college teacher I have ever had.  She wants to help you and if you show her that you want to succeed in her class she will help you do so.  She's kind of a slow grader, but she's super cool and hip
She is a great teacher and helped me to develop good writing habits
Fun class. Kinda like a high school course just show up to class and relax.
"Showed an episode of Rick and Morty in class today, if this doesn't earn me that ratemyprofessors chili pepper, idfk what will" Here's hoping. Also, that some it up pretty well.

Take this class if you want to open your mind, be inspired and become more comfortable sharing your creative writing/exploring genres. Paige is always willing to give advice, and the readings she assigns are SO AMAZING. She has great taste, and wants to hear her students opinions. Highly recommend. Fun, quirky and well worth your time.
Worth going to lecture. Paige keeps you engaged and is very willing to help if you are willing to put in the proper effort. It's a lot of work but she tries to make it as interesting as possible.
Really great instructor.  Gives a lot of energy to the classroom and was one of the few classes this semester that I actually wanted to show up to.  Would take again.
Pretty easy class. Paige is super chill and really helps the class be keeping is relaxed. Papers aren't hard if you put a little bit of work in. Plus, she's really hot, so it helps the class go by.
Excellent professor! She always gives detailed feedback to my writing. That's very helpful.
Willie is a very good instructor, his course theme sucked ( pop culture and sexuality?) but overall the class was very easy and willie kept it interesting.
Willie is a very easy-going guy.  He makes class fun and interesting.  He is carefree and grades fairly.  I would highly recommended Willie as an English 1100 professor!
The book is okay, and I found her comments really useful. Good class!
Professor Cleto let me write  short responses instead of talking in class, which made the class alot less stressful for me. I wish more professors gave that option.

I don't think she teaches online much, but, if you get the chance, take her class online. Her lectures were really interesting, and the work was not too awkward online. Today, we are all cats. (I'll never forget that.)
Writing is boring, but Sara made it fun.
I never took a folklore class before this & didn't really know what it was. Now I know & I'm going to take more. Thanks, Sara!
I'd take any class with Dr. Cleto!
Amazing teacher! She went out of her way to offer us alternative participation opportunities, and her whole attitude towards the class was incredibly inclusive. She knows what's up.

The negative reviews are just sour grapes. You ruin your own grade when you don't come to class, and she even offers lots of alternative participation options if you don't like to talk in class. She could not have been clearer.  Her reading assignments were sometimes a little uncomfortable, but I learned a lot from her!

Not a professional professor. She grades unfairly and doesn't use a grading log for projects and papers so you never know  where your grade is coming from. If you don't come to class she will find a way to ruin your grade. I do not recommned this professor.
Will  sabotage your grade if she feels you don't participate. She will grade you harder on projects and papers if you don't talk in class. Overall horrible professor don't recommend her class,

Pretty easy class. No exams. A final paper that you work on throughout the semester, and it was graded easily imo. There is a presentation you do on your paper. Simply do the readings and take notes, as she sometimes will collect it for a grade. Overall, she is a good teacher, but sometimes her lectures get boring.
Mean to my grade, crazy, so serious about tiny things, restrict of grading, can't understand the comments, so "hilarious", difficult to do the best, good to talk, full of knowledge
Professor Haugtvedt is generally nice to the class but in no way accessible to individual students. Her assignments are difficult and the instructions are not clear.

Easy A. Only one symposium presentation and a final paper, no midterms, no final.  Do the readings, take notes (she will collect them randomly), participate in discussion, you should be fine. She's kind of bland at times but she's a great lecturer.
Do exactly as she instructs and you will do well in this class. Very elementary writing class. She comes across as sort of bland but she does open up and is very helpful.

While the reading for this course is heavy at times, that's as challenging as it gets. She's a fair grader with no exams, just papers and projects. Classes are usually discussion based and she collects notes from the reading as homework most days. Only thing I don't like about the class is how much group work there is. Other than that, solid class.
Honestly thought she was a little standoffish at first, but she turned out to be super helpful and a really nice person as long as you talk to her and or respond in class
Not tough on paper grading. Mostly reading and essay assignments that are made known in advance.

I would advise not to take a class with her. She made us buy a book that had nothing to do with the class and it was very expensive. Her lectures were confusing and nonrelevant. She was very rude to students and gave us unrelevant group assignments that didn't help with the learning experience whatsoever. I got an A, but the class gave me nothing.

Nicole is a really nice lady. Don't get me wrong, but she is very disorganized. She took a long time to grade things, which was really frustrating at time because there is no way to gauge how you are doing in the class. It has been and entire week after my finally exam and I still have a "N/A" in Carmen, which I can do nothing at this point....

All of these reviews were really positive, and I genuinely wish my experience was but it wasn't. She was very all over the place and canceled class a lot, but never really explained the paper till right before it. She was very unorganized and DOES NOT USE CARMEN and never answers emails. Maybe she it was a bad semester for her?
Great teacher. Quirky. Passionate.  9.5/10

Amazing, humble caring instructor. She was willing to meet up on weekends to help with papers. She respects student's opinions and ideas too. She does a great deal to personalize lessons and help each student. She gives redos of each assignment with specific feedback. But don't expect a free grade. She is fun to talk about politics in class too.
Amazing Professor

Honestly, the best English teacher I have ever had. Maybe its because she doesn't really grade the papers really harsh? She gives revision opportunities on all the papers except for the final paper. I even think she didn't even read the final paper because I didn't get a specific grade on it, but i got an A in the class. EASY TEACHER

Nicole's class was never a burden to attend; her lectures were at least semi-interesting and she is quite a humorous person. She's pretty disorganized and slow at responding to emails, but she's fair about moving deadlines and due dates if they need to be. She's very willing to meet with students (even on weekends) if they need help.

Nicole Butler is an amazing lecturer! She truly desires her students to develop writing skills and use writing as a tool for analysis. Her use of documentaries makes the class very interesting and engaging! Nicole encourages group discussion and teamwork, cares about each student individually, and is understanding. Best professor I've ever had!!!

Many students complain about ENG110, but I found it interesting. She is probably one of the easiest english teachers for 110. 60% the grade is the paper. There arent a lot of work.  So take her class, recommended!

Very helpful. Will work with you in developing your papers. Is a nice person who wants to see her students do well. Does not work for the grammar police like so many other English teachers. She places more emphasis on content. Plenty of due dates to remember, but that's just the nature of the course not a reflection of her teaching. I recommend her
She literally wants all of her students to pass! If you want to boost up your grade, take her! You will never regret it.
really good, really caring, super fun. best prof I've had so far

Maryna is one of the best professors I've encountered! She truly cares about helping students write their papers without a big headache. Her classes are entertaining and are useful in writing your final paper. She gave extra credit at the end, so it was impossible not to get an A

She was extremely clear on what she was looking for in papers and gave a lot of good examples from past students. She was super lenient with due dates and was willing to work with your schedule. Showing up to class was never a struggle because she made it very enjoyable to be in. She also played a decent amount of movies/videos.

Maryna is such an awesome teacher. She's so nice and very helpful, and her class is fun and interesting. Her assignments aren't hard at all. She really cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. I would recommend her class to anyone.
Maryna is awesome! She was always super excited and very passionate about the subject matter and her students' success. Easy class, just show up, do your work, and it'll all fall into place!
she's nice sweet lady , easy class , respect her and what she's doing you will get what you want . she will help you through the semester with everything you need and you will get A with no pain
If you had the chance to select the instructor before you enroll, choose Maryna, because she is so nice, helpful and generous and she tried to make this course interesting and she did.

Maryna was very helpful throughout the semester! She really likes to help her students, and offers extra credit opportunities. With the final paper,she would grade it, hand it back, then you could fix it for a better grade. She also brought food the last 2 weeks of class!

Such a great lady! Was contemplating dropping the class for about the first week because of the course theme, but am so happy I didn't.  She is extremely lenient with due dates and extra credit.  She's fairly young so she really understands how to make a class interesting and enjoyable.

I loved having her teach my class! She spread out the material so that nobody would procrastinate the large paper at the end, which saved a lot of us. She was also flexible and was willing to work around us if we needed some deadlines moved around. Also very kind and very funny! Not too much work, and I didn't really use the textbook.

Kate has been my favorite professor at Ohio State so far. She is so dedicated to her students and was respected by everyone in my class. If you take her comments and apply them to your work, you will succeed in this class. Do the readings and actively engage in class. It pays off.
She was an awesome English teacher. Gave us extensions on projects and was super understanding. Grading policy was clear and easy. The class is an easy A as long as you did the work.

Corey picked the coolest books for this class. He taught cool concepts of fiction I had never heard of before. Theres a good amount of reading, but it was almost all good. There are pop quizzes but super easy if you do the reading. Sometimes his interpretations of books were mind blowing. He can be a tough grader, but theres always bonus questions.

Meghan is definitely a good professor. Just follow the things that she said. You would be regretted. You have to buy the textbook because there are some things that covered during the class. So, Good luck!
Horrible. He mumbles through his lectures, does not give good grading criteria, and does not teach.

I've had Prof Conroy 2 times, and here's the deal: If you want a good grade with minimum work, he's an easy grader, doesn't care if you've done the reading or are behind. He's a nice guy, funny, lets you out of class early. BUT: If this is a subject that you really need to learn and understand well, you'd be better with someone who cares more
Easy class but the schedule was unorganized.
Interesting class and an interesting guy.
He tends to get off topic, yes. He jokes around quite a bit (like, about half the class), but when he actually gets to the material, he knows what he's talking about. And he's a reasonable grader.

I don't know what everyone's complaining about.  Show up to class because he's funny and draws your attention to what's important.  My notes were so helpful on the 3 papers- for which he even gives potential topics to choose from.  I did really well- because I showed up, took notes, and put a lot of thought into my papers.  Great guy, great class.

Spent so much of lectures on pointless chitchat. I didn't feel like coming to lecture benefitted me at all. Annoying and talks because he likes his own voice. Often gets caught up in own thoughts making his points difficult to understand. Course should've been interesting but he made me hate it. I'm here to learn not to listen to you babble.

Anyone who complains about this class is ridiculous. Come on, guys. It's a film class--an easy A for English majors! I really enjoyed going to this class. The professor rambled sometimes, but he was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable on the subject. I definitely learned more than I ever wanted to know about Hitchcock.

He's funny and quirky. Hard to follow at times, but he means well and he WILL help you if you contact him. He's actually one of the first professors I've had who has encouraged discussions to a really beneficial degree. I loved him.

I absolutely loved this professor. If you're into quirky dudes who constantly laugh at their own jokes while still conveying all the necessary points-this is the guy for you. Fair, honest,  and helpful critiques with thoughtful consideration of the(our)work. Don't buy the frowny face on the side of his name, he is terribly good at what he does!

Film class was fun. Watched some great movies and read some great books. Very knowledgeable about film in general. Loves to joke around with students and have a bit of fun in class. Also understanding and willing to compromise with students or help when needed.

avoid if you can, i attended every class and turned in good work- however he doesn't learn names and throws out random grades at the end of the quarter. this class should have been fun, but besides the sweet movies, i dreaded his lectures.

Awesome professor - one of my favorites in three years. He's really funny and really tries to get students involved in participation. If you actually make an attempt to try and talk in class and voice your opinion on something he gives you a lot of attention and spends time interpreting people's different ideas.

HILARIOUS! But only if you like dry sense of humor - he will laugh at his own jokes even if no one else does, which is also part of why he is funny. LOVES participation and willing to debate interpretations in a respectful way. Had a great time in his class. 3 papers instead of tests. Hot in a disgruntled professor kind of way...

He laughs at his own jokes... even when no one else laughs. There is a lot of reading and he talks for most of the class period by answering his own questions. Attendance is mandatory and takes off lots of points if you are absent. Required three papers due instead of having exams which was cool.

I don't know what others mean by "dry humor" because there was absolutely nothing humorous to Prof. Conroy.He seems to find himself very funny, though.Classes are incredibly BORING!Mandatory attendance(docks grade severly for missing class) when you could sit at home and still pass.Not very insightful, learned nothing.Helpful in office hours though
super teacher. also funny.

He's laidback and pretty funny if you like a dry sense of humor. I didn't really mind the class but it got boring because he didn't seem very prepared. I got an A on everything but read only 2 books, if that tells you anything. I wouldn't choose this professor but don't put a gun to your head if you have him for one of your future classes.
This prof. is VERY unwilling to help with anything. Do not take this class it is the worst English class I have ever had.
No Comments

A wonderful prof- He's witty, fun, and chooses provacative material to discuss in his classes. Classes are never boring- though he may ramble on and on, they're always somewhat in relation to the material and at least give a creative spin to the course. Hi

He has an unusual, silly and ornery sense of humor.  Once you get used to his offbeat humor, you'll appreciate the class so much more.  The only time it hinders the learning process is when it interferes with student discussion.  Otherwise, he is very insightful and guides you through the material creatively.
The absolute worst.
Best English teacher on campus.

I don't think any body else really liked him, but I enjoyed the class.  Maybe it depends on your personality or ability to tolerate a certain dry humor?  I can't imagine him not being helpful, and he gave me a break on a few assignments...
No Comments
No Comments
Good professor, funny, knows his stuff.  Best English class I've taken.

Conroy seems very much in his own world most of the time, which you can take as being funny or annoying. I found him clever and funny, even if "inconsistent," as people have been saying. In either case, he can be incredibly analytic and insightful and this fact alone is worth taking his class.

He's a witty guy, but he rambles too much, and is a tough grader.  He's a complete butthole sometimes, but he isn't too helpful and seems to be quite unfair.  He's very, VERY inconsistent in class discussions and grading.  If you want a clown who doesn't help you, pick Conroy.

Haha, he's super nice and rather sneaky (as in wittily sneaky...he'll pick on you and you won't realize it until after the fact).  He's always more than happy to help with any problem.  Haha, I'm pretty sure he wrote the first review about himself down at the bottom of this list!

Such a fun professor.  I had him for a film studies class and I just loved him.  He really had a passion for the subject and he made me love it.  I wish I'd had more classes with him before graduating.

Simply put, if you're an idiot, he probably won't like you.  If you show an inkling of intelligence and ability to write thought provoking material, you'll do fine.  Some people don't like him because....some people are idiots.
I enjoyed his courses, I took 2 both film courses.  He was a good prof, and he chose interesting subject matter
Funny, enjoyed the class but wasn't always clear what was exected.
Conroy was off topic CONSTANTLY and you never knew what his point was. I learned absolutely nothing in that class, except to avoid him completely for the next three years.
Pompous, refuses to return papers in a timely manner, brags about how his students hate him.  What a jerk.
The quote was  I want page numbers on the damn quotes!   Perhaps one of the funniest classes to memory, and I'm still wondering what was in that mug of his...
No Comments
Really smart.  This prof changed my life. He understands the important questions facing literature today. This is not always the case in the English dept.

Professor Johnson is a very sweet lady. She cares about her students a lot. Her notes are somewhat unorganized in class, but she gives out study sheets that have most of the important information. She does not used Carmen/Canvas, but I still found her to be accessible.

Prof. Johnson is funny and genuinely cares about her students. I do wish she was a little more organized, as that would make taking notes a much easier. I didn't buy the book, because everything we needed from each chapter was given on a study sheet. There were several small writing assignments and two longer papers, but nothing difficult.
Strict grader. The class is graded off 3 papers plus participation. She cares about her students. Classes are discussion based.

Prof. Johnson is the best professor I have ever had.  She is really funny, smart, nice, and cares about us.  We often have small and large group discussion about interesting, current issues.   She assigns about one homework assignment per week, but they are not bad at all! The whole class really gets to know each other by the end of the semester.
Participate and write well, that's all it takes. Homework assignments are incredibly easy.

I've never liked any English classes until I had her. A lot of reading from the textbook and discussions in class took up a lot of the course. 3 papers the whole semester and you WILL come out a much better writer than before. Make sure to take advantage of her office hours because she will give you personalized help for being a better writer.

AWESOME professor! I loved her class. No exams, just 3 papers to write. She is the most helpful professor I have had. She really wants you to do well, so go to office hours!! She's funny and entertaining, and she knows no one wants to be in class for 1hr and 20min, so we were always let out early. HIGHLY recommend this teacher!!
friendly, knowledgeable, funny, knowledgeable, encourages discussion, never too much work, gives you a lot to think about
Wonderfully challenging professor. She knows her stuff, so know yours when you get to class. No midterms or final. Just writing assignments. No textbooks. She provides course packet. Great class.

do not take this professor.  she is incredibly condescending, egotistical, and generally pretty useless.  LOVES the sound of her own voice--when you try to give input, she'll start talking before you're done talking.  some serious attitude issues with students at times.  thinks she's brilliant and tries to hard to convince us that she is.
No Comments

This course was a 6-day trip to New York to attend the HRW Film Festival,  Fordham Human Rights Conference, and Columbia Archives. Most of the trip was paid for and the professors were friendly, knowledgeable, and made everyone comfortable. We had planned activities but also time to choose what we wanted to do--one of my best college memories!

One of my favorite instructors at OSU! This class was extremely interesting and exposed students to a subject that we do not usually here about. She was very passionate about this subject and made her students feel the same. Highest Recommendation!

Professor Hesford encourages students to look very critically at course texts, and does not encourage any particular line of thinking. Assignment descriptions were often unclear, but she was a surprisingly generous grader, despite being very critical when giving feedback on assignment drafts.
Professor Hesford's class was by no means easy, but not a brain-buster either. She really cared about what she was teaching and strove to assist her students in any way possible. Great class!

Prof. Hesford is a great teacher. She makes the subject matter interesting and creates a learning environment that is comfortable. She challenges her students to think critically without making the assignments impossible. I highly recommend taking any of her classes
Amazing

I would definitely recommend taking a class with Professor Hesford.  Her subject matter is intellectually stimulating and engaging.  She is very helpful if you are struggling with an assignment but she will still challenge you as a writer.  Very fair grader and the assignments keep you interested in the class.

I would strongly recommend taking a course with Professor Hesford. She is a very talented instructor and always accessible. The work load for the course was very reasonable and the assignments were creative and enjoyable. Lectures were informative and class discussions were very rich. Grading was fair and assignments returned in a timely manner.

Absolute class act.  Does not push an intellectual agenda on her classes like many professors do.  It's so refreshing to have a rhet/comp professor that does not suffer from the siege mentality that plagues so many scholars of the field, and instead situates herself as an interdisciplinarian.
Hesford didn't recognize that she was teaching a freshman writing class.  She expected more than we were able to give her.

Wendy's a great professor.  She's accommodating,  engaging and genuinely interested in what she's teaching.  The subject matter was difficult and sometimes a little abstract, but at the same time she's very willing to give out A's.

Dr. Hesford really broadened my horizons on the topic of visual rhetoric.  This is really one of those classes that has carried over into my life-- I'm constantly finding myself analyzing billboards and commercials.  And she was so available and helpful when it came to projects and papers.  Overall, a wonderful experience.
Sometimes she gets caught up in her own jargon, but she really does want her students to succeed (as evidenced by all the As she gives).

I don't know why Wendy would ever get any negative reviews - she's friendly, engaging, and always available for help or advice (which she is excellent at giving). On top of all this, she's a pretty generous grader. Definitely take one of her classes if you get the chance.

Prof. Hesford was an excellent teacher. She genuinely cared about her students and always wanted to help us better understand. She also understood when something was difficult and took more time to explain it. She wanted us all to succeed, and helped in the areas where individual students needed more practice, while not slowing down the whole class
I found this course to be absolutely fascinating. This instructor was very helpful, and  her lectures were challenging and stimulating. Great Professor!

I failed to see any practical value in having us "simulate" the activities we could use with our students, most of which revolved around the Consumer Gaze, which I do not use because I find it to be very high school and not exactly intellectual. Also felt Wendy had pre-packaged responses to any comment, so challenging her is out of the question.

Mostly the purpose of this class was to promote the instructor's own curriculum. Sometimes it seems like this is the whole point of the whole First Year Writing Program. I think that is a sad, sad thing. Student writing is served by the dedication and one-on-one help of the GTA's and Lecturers who teach 110, but this course doesn't help them do it.
helpful, accessible, and friendly

The entire 781 experience was an enormous disappointment. I found the training to be a lot of talk and theory with no practical foundation. Further, Wendy is unfriendly (unless you're one of the whippersnappers ready to sacrifice precious time to her committees and workshops) and narrow-minded. Take questions to Eddie instead.

OSU's First-Year Writing Program, and specifically its teacher training program (the pre-quarter workshop and 781) are nationally recognized, multiple-award-winning programs for a reason. Wendy Hesford's creative teaching and practical advice and support have been invaluable to me, and are an asset to all new grad teachers at OSU. EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!

Wendy is very passionate about her work & is always willing to help. Eddie and the WPAs are extremely approachable. However, the PQ workshop and 781 should address nuts and bolts issues (student apathy and prioritizing our course work over all else) much more. It would also help if there were greater consensus on expectations of the assignments.
Contrary to one responder, I found all the Writing Program Administrators (including those who are graduate students) very helpful, skilled teachers and excellent role models.

781 focuses on training people to be teachers.  Wendy works hard for her Graduate students, to help their success as instructors.  When I started teaching I struggled with plannign lessons, grading papers, and doing my own coursework.  Without the help of Wendy and her staff, I don't know what I would have done.  THANK YOU!
No Comments
ugh. TERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRible class!
TERRIBLY boring & useless class.

Yes, this class can seem boring at times, but Wendy, Eddie and all of the WPA's put a lot of time and effort into creating this course--and they are all obviously over qualified.  I think everyone is pretty freaked out about teaching at first, and we should all be a little more respectful and appreciative.

Isn't there ANYone else who could be hired to teach this course? Someone, perhaps, who is not so pedantic and unhelpful? Someone who has spent as much time in the classroom as in the theory closet? Someone who does not encourage and promote mediocrity among teachers? Someone who chooses Writing Program Administrators with actual teaching chops?

No doubt she is the least effective classroom instructor I've encountered in seven years as a postsecondary student. Avoid if you can (but you can't, because everyone has to take this completely useless class!)

Concerned mainly with developing her own curriculum. Lectures about things she really doesn't know how to put into practice. Not interesting. Fairly pedantic. A poor writer, and a poorer teacher of writing. I give her an E.
Boring.
I found her to be helpful, open, and, pace the previous reviewer, quite flexible.

Lecture was ok, but she really helped me improve my writing.  You get to turn in a rough draft before the final-graded-paper is due. There are not a lot of assignments and she helped with all of them if you had questions! A LOT of weight is put on your final paper, but you pick the topic.
No Comments
Too quick to defend the quality of her curriculum, and therefore inflexible/unwilling to consider its flaws; Doesn't address how to teach WRITING, only how to teach ANALYSIS--but both are important!
She gave great comments on papers.  She reads the first draft and allows you to correct before turning in the final draft.  Lecture was sometimes unclear.  Didnt go over all the reading selections.
She was extremely helpful with papers and would go over things with us that we didn't understand. She is willing to look over papers and help you before you turn them in.
Amazing woman

I absolutely loved her as a lecturer. I typically sat in the back of the room and listened to discussion rather than participate, but I absolutely loved hearing people geek out about the stories we read. Deadlines are manageable and the reading is overall very well chosen. I recommend this class to anyone who is looking to try something new.

I dropped it on the second day because she drove me absolutely insane. Shes the oh so typical english professor, who isnt brittish, but speaks in a faux-brittish accent at all times. Wasted 90% of the first two days talking about herself. I told myself Id tough it out, but I just couldnt take the monotiny. Self published textbook scam. Not cool.
Dr. Heaphy is a great professor, and always an extremely fair grader

A delightful human being, Heaphy is interested in hearing your thoughts. I never found myself needing to read (skim each before class; course packet is a bunch of online articles - don't buy) but participating is essential for the flow of her class. She's quite good at holding an uncomfortable silence until someone answers her questions. Funny brit

Maura is so sweet! She is enthusiastic and caring and this class was really quite a breeze. The pace is easy and she is MORE than willing to help in any way she can. I missed several classes for Dr. appts and she was so understanding. It would be impossible to not like her or this class!

I loved Maura Heaphy! She was so sweet and enthusiastic about teaching. She was always willing and eager to help me in any way that she could. The pace of the class was perfect and the assignments weren't too difficult.

Professor Heaphy is so sweet and kind! She loves the material she teaches, which is apparent in class discussions. She's incredibly helpful and flexible if you ever need an extension or anything. Typically, you only need to read a few of the stories per section in order to write a quality response paper. Easy material as well. You will love her!
She is wonderful- a bit wordy but that is just her enthusiasm. She really cares about her students and is really well versed in the topic (professional writing).
Not very helpful in critiques, she gets mired down in the details and loses sight of anything but plot-driven story. Would not reccommend.

She genuinely enjoyed teaching. She even made Sci Fi a little fun to hear and read about. She was extremely helpful. She was interested firstly in getting us into the topic and secondly with our grades etc. I would recommend her to anyone willing to take a SciFi course. Be prepared for geeks! Ha...

Maura is a wonderful teacher.  I wasn't sure what to expect from the class, but was pleasantly surprised in that it challenged me and brought my writing to a new level.  Her comments are not always clear, but she always gives valid and insightful perspectives to your writing.  I would highly recommend any class she is teaching.

I was a bit disapointed with this class. Maura is a very sweet woman and very enthusiastic about her job. I was not challenged in the class at all, however. Her class is great if you want a pleasant and easy GEC fulfillment perhaps, but being a literature dork I didn't really feel like I got much out of the class.
She is a great teacher, funny, and a good explainer. She is a brit though, and her hard 'g's come out as 'j's

Very nice and interesting. Makes a very boring class, become quite interesting. If you talk up in her class it will help and she seems to be really into science fiction. I enjoyed her class and highly recommend her.
Nicest lady ever.  Super sweet - will pretty much do anything she can to help students.  Should not be hard to get a good grade in her class.

Interesting class.  Very practical subject, really.  Nice lady.  Gives a bit too much busy work (yuck), but she is extremely helpful and couldn't be nicer.  I'd recommend the class (and the teacher!).

1 or 2 absences excused easily. Others made up by going to a reading. Grades fair, but seems impossible to get an A. Will edit your papers by changing seemingly minor words in your story. Bubbly, polite, forgiving, slight British accent, and does not count early grades against you and only uses them as a reference for you. Highly recommend!
Very good teacher

Mrs. Heaphy is wonderful!  She really makes the class interesting and fun, when it could be so boring.  Her comments on drafts are so helpful, and as long as you follow her comments on how to revise, you will very easily get an A on the final draft.  I'm really glad I had her as my 110 teacher.
Maura was a great teacher.  She truly cares about her students, and her enthusiasm about the subject clearly makes her students want to learn. I would reccomend her to anyone.
No Comments
Maura was great, she was very helpful and truly cared about her studnets. I would love to have her as a teacher again.
WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD!! she makes no sense and all of the assignments are crap! Never take her class, you will regret it!

I have NEVER been so confused and lost in an English class before. She expects everyone to do exactly what she wants, even though she never really explains what she wants. When you ask her questions all she does is confuse you further. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. If I could drop it I would.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. She loads slides, talks down to you, and basically wants everyone to regurgitate what she so knowledgeably tells you during class.  She doesn't invoke original thought and actually frowns upon it.  My survey classes i did great in, i almost failed this.  DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

This is a low level English class and she grades like it is an upper level class. I have never gotten grades this low in English before...even in classes which much harder material. I thought her grading was unfair and her expectations way too high.

LOVE PROFESSOR CIPRIANO! She's seriously the best. I can't wait to take class with her next semester in English 2266! She cares so much about her work and she loves helping outside of class if you take her up on it.

Sidd was a funny guy and gives good feedback on your papers. Like any English class he just wants to see progress over the year so make the changes he suggest and you will get an A in his course. Also, be active in class and visit him if you get stuck, he will basically tell you what to write.

funny, kind, engaging teacher with a lot of interest in helping individual students with writing research papers and figuring out formatting/style guidelines for MLA. fair, generous grader, and super fun lectures!
One of the best teachers at OSU, so nice and helpful!

Great TA. Super awkward, but doesn't mean too. No one talked in the class so she had no idea what to do. She does take attendance with a sign in sheet. I went up to her saying I was doing pretty bad (C) because of the test and she asked if i needed extra credit. Bumped up my grade. Very caring, very cool.

Show up, tell your opinions about poetry, and leave. It was a pretty easy class. The only grades were 3 essays and 4 short quizzes, as well as attendance/participation. He was nice and occasionally funny, but he was very old and talks pretty much in a whisper.

Riede is a great guy and his course is by no means difficult. If you participate once or twice a week and put some effort into the 3 simple projects assigned during the semester, you can end up with an A. You don't really need the textbook by the way... all of the assigned poems in the textbook are available on the internet.

Good: NO EXAMS. TEXTBOOK NOT NECESSARY.  2 PAPERS 1 PROJECT. I GOT ALL PERFECT SCORES. NICE POETRY SELECTION. SEEMS KNOWLEDGEABLE AND PASSIONATE ABOUT POETRY.   Neutral: hair reminds me of Einstein  bad: poetry could be so fun but he made it so boring. wants participation, but makes it hard to participate. needs a megaphone.

The class itself can be boring, but he is very passionate about what he does. Participation is "required," but I personally only ever spoke up about three times and passed with an A-. He is an easy grader because even if he disagrees with you, you can get an A if your paper is written well and you support your claims.
My class with him was an absolute bore, but it was incredibly easy. I had my laptop out and did homework during the class every day and it was no problem. Got an A-.

This class is extremely boring. Participation is necessary but hard to do. Sometimes if someone says something he does not agree with he makes fun of them. I do not recommend this class, it's not for everyone. I did not learn anything. He goes on and on and on about poems and that's basically it. Also never gives A's.

He is pretty strict about attendance but you can tell he cares a lot about the students and the material he is teaching. I really enjoyed his class and he is a really intelligent person if you talk to him more about literature.

I dislike Prof. Riede.  He's intelligent, but very rude.  Demands class participation but will make fun of you or respond rudely if you don't say what he wants to hear.  His lectures are extremely boring.  Takes attendance but not very well and then marks you absent more than you are.  2 papers and pop essay quizzes.  I do not recommend him at all.

Dr. Riede was a pretty chill guy.  For an honors course, it was minimal work and only had a few writing assignments. He was helpful with compositions during office hours. Classes could be dry, but sometimes funny based on class dynamics. Our final project was a chill research paper with presentation. I enjoyed his witty humor.
Not Bad...Not bad at all... Pretty relaxed discussion based class with minimal writing. And its an Honors course

I understand why Prof Riede is not everybody's favorite. He is "old-school" and if you don't show an interest in the material, then he doesn't show in interest in you.  Fair? That's for you to decide. I found him to be incredibly helpful anytime I had a question, and his comments on papers were always constructive and insightful.

Worst English professor I've ever had. Does not care for students' interpretations of poetry if he thinks they're "wrong." Grading is completely ridiculous--he told the class that A's would not be given on papers unless they were at the Graduate level--and includes no basis or reasoning to help students improve. Impossible to hear during lectures.
This guy is the most boring man on the planet

This man is one of the most boring people I have ever encountered. He isn't clear with what he wants for assignments and takes forever to get through the simplest material. His attendance policy is very strict and he's of no help to you at all, so if you don't get poetry, avoid him at all costs!

He was a nice enough man, but as a teacher, he has room for improvement. He takes his own thoughts and opinions as fact and refuses to listen to anyone else. He's a harsh but fair grader, and his attendance policy is strict. He can be pretty condescending and that's a put off.
Not the most interesting instructor, but he was very nice and clearly very intelligent.
My favorite professor at Ohio State.

He is such the stereotypical stuffy college professor, somewhat dull and more interested in the topic than in actually teaching, but while he grades papers much harsher than most, he also makes it worth less of the grade.  If you get past the stale vibe, you WILL learn from him
Stimulating; intellectual.  Full of ideas and good sense of humor.  Can seem strict but is really understanding.
Wonderful teacher.  I recommend him highly.
Very intelligent and experienced. He's kind of a free spirit. Did go off on tangents, usually unrelated but always funny.  He gave fair grades and since I wrote well, I received A's.  Stop whining!
he's pretty boring, talks endlessly about nothing, class could be over early every day if he would just get to his points and move on, doesn't give many A's on papers
He's a boring professor.  Almost everyone falls asleep.  He takes too long to cover the materials.  Booorrriiinnnggg
He's Boring. No Passion. No Excitment for the material (or students). Lacks Organization. Not open to new ideas or analysis. What we've learned this quarter? Don't take his classes.
Boooooooorrring
No Comments
learned the most in this class freshman year!
Very intelligent, stimulating, exciting.

She is awesome. Take her if you have the chance. 3-4 kinda major writing assignments with the biggest one being 1,200 words. Go to class since attendance is taken for a grade. Really chill class and my writing improved a lot.

Lots of reading (to be fair IS a reading class) but she choose mostly interesting books. She is a very easy grader. While there are lots of little things your graded on nothing is difficult or takes long other then reading the books. She will dock your grade by 1/3 a letter grade if absent more then 4 times so go.
Dr. Bruce Wallace was the best professor I've ever had. She is the nicest lady, and very well respected. I took the class online and she was very organized, it was amazing.

Karen is hands down the best teacher I have had at OSU. She is very flexible with deadlines and doesn't care about irrelevant stuff like so many stuck up professors do. Taking her class is a pleasure.

Karen is amazing! She is a hardcore gamer which is perfect for her in teaching the Gaming Analysis English course. In total there was only 3 major writing assignment, not really even major. There are a couple of paragraph writings here and there, but sooooooo easy. Take Karen!

One of the best professors I've ever had. I didn't read one book and received an A+ in the course. No tests or midterms/finals, just a paper to write at the end of the year.  The projects were fun and we read comic books instead of boring old classics!

She was a TA for this class, and recitations were pretty boring. We had to submit weekly questions (which I hated). She made information really clear, but I often found myself disagreeing with her feedback on papers. A perfect grade was almost always an A-
Easily one of the best instructors I've had at OSU. Very helpful and teaches concrete things to make you a better writer. Easily got a 100% in this class.

She is overall pretty cool. Definitely passionate about subject. Lecture is boring, and she is greatly offended if there is no participation. She's pretty straight forward about assignments and grading. BEWARE though she can be prone to strange emotional fits, sparked by what I think she takes as disrespect? Leaving early etc.

Karen is kind of goofy and awkward, but clearly passionate about what she teaches. She's also very kind and was understanding about absences.  She grades fairly easy on the papers, as long as you meet length requirement.  The class was mainly lecture though and boring.

Erin was a great professor with a very clear syllabus. There were no surprises really, and she was an extremely lenient grader. She would let you redo the points you missed on the homework. There were no exams in this class (Technical Writing). If you have a passion for writing and structure, you will enjoy this class. Show up and get an easy A.
He's extremely random in how he chooses to grade work. Awful teacher.
best professor i ever had. :)
He is extremely helpful and makes our class fun/easy to be in

Good teacher, fun class. It involved a LOT of reading (6 novels) and one major paper (10-12 pages). Midterm and final were fairly easy. I would recommend this class if you have an interest in English, if not you may find it overwhelming.

Rachels a fantastic teacher. Shes engaging when she lectures, and really cares about her students. Shes generous with extensions and clearly understands OSUs workload and the stress it brings. There are papers, but she gives great feedback and doesnt grade harshly. Theres much class discussion and everyones input is heard. Would take again.

Rachel was an extremely great teacher to have throughout the semester. Make sure you read all the assigned readings, as she can easily tell if you haven't read the texts. Her feedback is amazing and will help you improve your future papers. If you have any questions, she's great at responding to emails. She also grades papers in a timely manner.

Great professor. Changes the syllabus to lessen the amount of homework. You just write one paper over the semester. He gives great feedback every step and allows rewrites if you need it. Fantastic guy!

I no longer go to OSU, but Dr. Richmond remains one of the best professors I have ever had. The man is brilliant and engaging, our class always talked about how amazing he was. Definitely take this class!

Dr. Richmond is a really great professor. While is seems really young, he is very passionate about his teachings and cares a lot about the class. He is an easy grader, but this class was a second session class, so it was a little difficult paper wise.  I highly recommend Dr. Richmond if you're thinking about having him.

Andrew Richmond is quite unique (In a good way!). Andrew's appearance is like a young college graduate, but his mind and speech are that of a much older and wiser man. I greatly enjoy his lectures because he really knows how to make the material understandable. The class itself is quite easy and does not require a lot of work other than reading.

He went really in depth with his discussions both in and out of class. If you're into english classes, he's a great professor to have. I really enjoyed talking to him about the readings and getting his feedback on my writing.

While he may know his stuff when it comes to his specialty, he expects way too much out of students who are just taking the class for a GE.  He will always rip apart your assignments with all kinds of negative feedback which comes across as rude and arrogant.  First day of class 25 people now half way through the semester only 10 are left.

Richmond is really engaged both with his students and the course material. It is clear that he knows what he is doing. The readings and viewings were always intriguing and relevant. Great class, great professor.

This class was extremely interesting and enjoyable. Dr. Richmond encourages great classroom discussions on a variety of relevant sources that include modern films and writings. The assignments are not difficult and help and feedback are always readily available.

Professor Cherry is helpful and engaging. We do a practice quiz before each quiz to make sure we are prepared. He sometimes assumes students know things but if you ask him to clarify, he will.I have him for a Grammar class but if you're taking a writing class, you should know that his specialty is grammar and you will probably be graded on grammar.
Not interested in actually teaching you. Vague in his expectations. Difficult to get tangible feedback from. Very set in his ways, odd expectations.
Just terrible. Way too into grammar and he's one of the worst professors you'll ever have. Clearly plays favorites and grades accordingly.

Cherry is passionate about  grammar. Over analyzes it. A lot of class was spent discussing and debating certain grammar. It was highly time consuming and annoying.  I did learn a lot but it was frustrating at times.

Cherry is closed-minded and disorganized. Overemphasis on grammar. Inconsistent with the syllabus schedule. Regularly delayed due dates, though inconsistently enough that you had to do your papers on time. We only once turned a paper in on the date it was originally due. Terrible at communicating expectations. Class time was regularly wasted.
WORST professor i have ever met. Tough grader. Nothing to say. Don't take his class   or you will cry.
Honestly the WORST teacher/professor I've ever had. I have nothing good to say at all.
He's a decent professor. Not always clear about what he wants in papers but not a terribly hard grader and will help if you ask. Overall a nice guy and not that bad of a class.

He has no idea what he is doing. He is incompetent and obviously has tenure. One time, he didn't know the answer to the question and blamed the book - "Hey, I didn't write the question!" Yeah, you are paid to know the answers! Seriously, it would have been waste of time going to class if it wasn't mandatory. I only learned from the book.

Professor Cherry is very vague in what he expects from the students, but if you put time into your writing, he will reward you with high scores.  I was in honors and while an A is very difficult to attain, an A- is not.  Overall, I really enjoyed this class and would recommend it to anyone who wishes to improve their writing skills.

I agree he is not the most organized or clear with his expectations. He seemed kind of unclear about assignments, but with a little imagination an A was easy. He didn't grade hard so it compensated for the unclear assignment expectations. I would definatly take him again! Easy A!

disorganized and unclear. he definately wants to show off himself over helping his students. he only asks questions that require an opinion because he feels he has to. Opinions often go with a "you're wrong" vibe. i really hate this class. it's obvious he has some sort of tenure otherwise there's no way he'd still be here.
He's really disorganized and grades almost solely on prose and word choice instead of content and clarity.

i could spend all day bad mouthing this incompetent teacher. simply put, he is a bum acting as an english teacher. OSU should get rid of this guy. explored metaphysical topics in and out, but never actually learned anything useful besides the principals found in Dan Millman's "way of the peaceful warrior" (good book) save yourself the frustration

Disorganized. Not clear in what he expects. Will read maybe three people's papers and comment and will help no one else. Seems to get mad when people have questions. Nice guy, but the class was barely about what the class was supposed to be.

He was okay at first, but as the quarter progressed he got less and less cool. Very disorganized. Doesn't seem to have a plan or answers for any questions. Seemed to hold grudges against students in class and would refuse to help them, passing the buck to other students to help them.

Wow! If you want to really waste your money on a class, here it is. Prof. Cherry is more concerned about ending classes early than he is about providing you with a good course. He's disorganized, unprepared for class, and a poor communicator. Also, he seemed to like some of the female students a little too much.

I learned a lot about the theory of rhetoric, but the class was poorly run and the syllabus changed 4 or 5 times. Prof. Cherry would type up outlines, reviews, or discussion points during class time which was sometimes acceptable, but sometimes he was unprepared. He's a nice guy, but he doesn't communicate his expectations clearly for the course

Prof. Cherry was unprepared for class and a terrible communicator. He was easily frustrated when students asked for clarification, and we had to ask often. He means well and is passionate about philosophy... so I'm confused why he teaches "Writing and It's Places". This class was a complete waste of my time.

Ummm....I still have no idea what this class was supposed to teach us.  Quite possibly the biggest waste of my time.  I spent most of my time trying to figure out what exacly he wanted us to do.  Stickler on grammar, which is one plus for him.

He doesn't do anything for the class.  He makes students lead group discussion over the readings and that's all that is done in class.  He is very unclear, stresses good communication when he is possibly one of the worst communicators ever.  But easy grader.

The 1st day of class started in a weird manner, but I had hopes. However it slowly got worse and boring. He's very unclear in what he expects from you, and isn't really prepared for the day. Most classes we left an hour early, because we didn't know what to do. Pretty easy grader just really particular on mechanics. He's also set in his beliefs.
He has no idea what is going on--like the dude in the big labowski

Prof. Cherry spent five weeks in a course entitled "writing and its places" teaching business ethics. He centers all of his discussion around philosophy. Not a difficult grader but picky in mechanics. He is very set in his ways and his opinions, but no reason not to take a class from him.

Ray is the master of folklore, particularly Irish folklore. That is his big specialty, so his passion shines through every lecture. The assignments have value, the readings are interesting, and he is pretty fun to stare at the whole lecture. Ray is a good man and a great professor.
Ray Cashman is the man! TAKE HIS CLASS! He's so passionate about what he teaches and he is so nice and funny. Take his class!!

One of the best professors I have ever had. Extremely knowledgeable and interested in what he teaches. The course is challenging, but he makes it fun and I learned a lot. He genuinely cares about his students and he really listens to what people have to say. Take his class!!

Uses a projector!! It's great. Really good teacher that has a nice balance of lecture and discussion. Brings his own notes to class so you stay pretty focused. Our class had a nice mix of movies too. Definitely an expert in his field. Recommend!

Great professor! He knows the subject well, loves to talk about it, and is very well organized. The midterm was easy, but the collection project was a lot of work. The final is to write two papers. Not a bad class at all!! He really is a nice guy.
Dr. Cashman is great, and if you can take his class, you should. He is funny, engaging, knowledgeable, and helpful: everything you could ask for in a professor.
very nice command of subject matter. funny, reasonable, helpful.
Fun class. All you need to do is read and attend. Exam was easy. Very little studying needed for the exam. He keeps it interesting.

Prof. Cashman absolutely LOVES folklore and loves passing on everything he knows to his students.  I LOVED his Irish Folklore class (he studied in Ireland, so it's his specialty)  He's funny sometimes and pretty easygoing.  He can be a tough grader sometimes, but if you do readings, go to class, and put effort in, you'll be fine.
No Comments
It seems to be virtually impossible to get an "A" on an essay assignment in his honors course. He is a very tough grader.

Almost too nice and helpful. Professor Brewer tries as hard as she can to make sure every student in her class learns how to write well. No midterm or final, and only a few papers that build off of one another.

Took her intro class at CCSU. Attendance policy is pretty strict (any more than 2 absences lowers your grade 13 of a letter), but overall easy class. Humorous, sweet, and brings us food every now and then. I loved how the papers were all related to each other. Great teacher, I would recommend to anyone.
Super nice lady. Young and very humorous. My favorite class of the semester. Few written assignments that build on each other. Love this teacher.
Very helpful, laid back, and an easy grader
Really helpful. Majority of grade is based off of participation. No textbook required
Super helpful and class was very easy. I hardly ever did the readings. Grade is based off participation (talk to her) and Three papers. Easy and fun!

He is a young guy and seems enjoyable at first. He explains things in class that doesn't pertain to the big papers. I was writing a 150 point paper with doubts on wondering how it was to be done. Does not clarify well on what he expects until you get the paper back and see your grade. If possible avoid him.

Tory is a funny guy but he is a very hard grader, especially on the big paper.  He does offer the opportunity to look over it and edit if before you turn it in.  He does not explain anything very well in class.  It's basically up to you to figure things out.
Tory was a great teacher. He was helpful and very funny. Take his class if you want a timely, relevant, and compelling teacher! Ha.

Very down to earth teacher, is around the age of all the students taking the class. Likes to talk about pop-culture for the entire class instead of focusing on the class material. Grades very hard but curves the class vary hard at the end (curved my class 5% points). Fun class, but not much learned, I'd take the class.
She was a great professor! She was very passionate and made the class interesting!
Very helpful teacher who wants you to succeed and be creative. I really enjoyed her class and the way she teaches.
I loved her! She took a subject that I hated and turned it into something bearable. If given the opportunity, definitely take her class.
Awesome teacher. Helpful and interesting classroom material. After taking her class I became more confident in my writing styles. Definitely my favorite teacher and  best class of the year.
Ms. Fox-Gieg's class helped my writing a lot! I'm now getting A-/A's on papers that I write for other classes--I used to mostly get B's.

So helpful and accommodating. She went out of her way to make sure we all got the most out her class that we could and that we got the best grade possible. Plus she brought us donuts and bagels every week!
best class/teacher i've had at OSU. fun and helpful. if you are even slightly interested in this subject, take her class.

Overall, a really good class with a good professor. She had some issues at the beginning with emailing us when class was cancelled, but she brought bagels for the whole class which made up for it! She goes out of her way to help you and gives you lots of feedback on papers so you have a chance to do well. Overall, very nice and very helpful.
Fantastic Professor. My favorite by far!

I've never liked an English class before, so I was sort of dreading taking 110. I ended up really liking the class! She cares about her students and constantly went out of her way to help. We did some awesome things in class too. She pushes you to learn and think for yourself. By the end of the quarter, I actually looked forward to going to class.
Best teacher I've ever had. She made the class so much fun and I learned a lot. Ms. Fox-Gieg was always available for extra help and seemed to really want us to do well. Take her if you can.
Fantastic Professor.  My favorite by far!
Awesome professor, must take this class!
