Erin is great! Class was pretty easy, just make sure you show up and participate. Only two tests and one paper, made the class very manageable. You take a quiz on each play you read, and they were all super easy. Awesome gen-ed!
A lot of fun.  She's very jokey which at first I thought I would hate but I got to really like her.

One of the best instructors I've had at OSU. Guaranteed a few laughs each class. Very clear, very knowledgeable, very engaging. Learned a ton! Excellent instructor. As long as you attend classes and do the readings, the pop quizzes are easy. Exams are easy if you do the readings. Would HIGHLY recommend if you get the chance to take her class.

A young teacher who is very passionate about Medieval Literature. She is knowledgeable and can answer any question you have. Very helpful! Assigns tons of reading every week so free up some extra time. Easy comprehension quizzes weekly. Jokes a lot to keep the class interesting and fun. Recommend!
Cool guy and great professor. Knows a lot about philosophy! Hope he stays at CCAD

Easily the most interesting professor I've had at CCAD. Extremely intelligent and knowledgeable in more than just philosophy. I can guarantee he's the smartest person in the room, but as long as you realize that you'll be good. As long as you're willing to devote yourself to some abstract concepts, you'll be fine.
I was really challenged by his class, but benefited from it greatly.  The quality of my writing greatly improved due to his teaching.
intro to shakespeare class, recommend go to class and listen, read material, and you'll do fine. he's a great teacher adn really interesting, i recoomend if you are interested in shakespeare
I learned a lot.

This was the worst writing class ever!  His prompts are ridiculously vague, and then he grades based on his own personal "feelings" about the paper.  He'll try to help you, but most of the time it's useless.  Don't take this class if you want to do creative writing because he stifles originality.
No Comments

Expects a lot, but is very willing to help you.  You just have to really put in a good effort & be up for a challenge.  I learned things in his class that I have constantly been able to apply in other areas & other classes.
Good teacher, very helpful!!
No Comments
interesting in class discussions, he knows what he is talking about. doesnt give too many As.
eh.. this class was ok.  required more work than most other 110 classes.

Professor Ulman was one of the more interesting professors I've had. He took an English class and put a technologysocial blogging twist on it. I have no interest in English but I enjoyed his class. Show up, pay a little attention, and you'll be fine.
Great teacher, always prepared and talks about interesting ideas.  Not easy, but not too hard either, and learning the material is very interesting.  Great guy, always willing to help.

Im a deans list student who WITHDREW. class description misleading. Raved of how it was not typical lecture & how theres guest speakers field trips engaging materials etc. Was the epitome of a lecture. Used the first 4/5 absences in 3 weeks. Class supposed to be about forming your ENV citizenship role, he expects too much too soon. He isn't clear.

We only had to write three papers for this course (all under 1500 words), plus he's a really lenient grader. The class was about analyzing and conducting literacy narratives, which was definitely a new subject to me. Ulman is a very enthusiastic teacher, but he does have a tendency to be long-winded at times =P

Prof Ulman is a very nice man and he is very passionate about him class but he is lectures for a realllllllly long time. He just wants to be as clear as possible but sometimes he will just ramble on for half an hour if he has sometime "quick" to say.
He really has a passion for teaching though course material is slightly unorganized and difficult to follow. Lets you resubmit papers which is extremely helpful as he is a harder grader

This class was a lot harder and more confusing than it needed to be because of her. She would read directly from the board/paper she passes out. I did feel a bit babied taking her class and I think she created an unproductive atmosphere. Unhelpful when asking about assignments and could be degrading when we answered questions. Could be nice @ times
Terribly unhelpful and generally asymptomatic. I would discourage anyone from taking her class.

Nancy Yan wasn't a bad teacher.  I had her for my 2nd writing class, which was "Art and Politics".  She definitely has very left wing political opinions (all the readings were from very left wing authors), but she doesn't let that affect her grading.  I openly disagreed with her both in my writing and in class and I got an A for the course.
If you can write and come up with logical arguments, then you will do fine. No textbooks, just a lot of printing. Margin notes are long but easy points. Good prof overall.

Your grade is entirely based on whether or not she agrees with your opinion. Avoid at all costs. Doesn't care about teaching at all. Expects you to check your email each night for work that's due in the morning.

Well, Im a 3.9 student. This is the first class ever I got C, entirely. I dont think she ever interested in teaching. I guess she just want get the job done and get rid of it. Just wish you find other opening sections.
She is a very caring and considerate professor and will help you see the world differently.
Y r the best... I love u

Classes were so random. Very little structure. We would do 2 completely different things in the same week. Very unclear about instructions. She's crazy and entertaining though, you can definitely learn something from her.
Mediocre at best... Wasn't always clear about assignments and jumped around a lot
Easy class, go and get an A.  She had a slight accent, but was still easy enough to understand.

Amazing professor. Anyone who gives him a bad rating is a bad student. He does take attendance  but as long as you do all of your assignments and participate every once in a while, he'll let those missed classes slip his mind. Very helpful on all assignments and gives excellent constructive criticism. He is way hot too! :)

Very nice (& cute) guy, but very tough professor considering he's a grad student. He was a hard grader and didn't give much feedback, so it's difficult to know how you're doing in the class. Assigned a LOT of reading & work, I didnt like the class at all. He was sweet though, he brought candy for Halloween and bought us pizza during movie nights.
He's a really nice guy with extensive knowledge of the subject. Very clear and pretty funny too. I enjoyed going to class.

Seth is really nice and funny. I enjoyed his class. I took his five-week course, so I'm not sure if that makes a difference but there was a lot of busy work which was annoying. But he gave a lot of opportunities for extra credit such as movie nights where we ate pizza and he also brought in candy a lot to the class.

PRETTY  HARD CLASS. I MADE THE MISTAKE OF THINKING THIS POETRY CLASS WAS AN EASY A, AND IT DEFINITELY WAS NOT. HES PRETTY TOUGH ON GRADING AND HIS QUIZES ARE ACTUALLY DIFFICULT. HES A NICE GUY, BUT HARD GRADER. IF UR TAKING THIS CLASS AS AN EASY WAY OUT LIKE I DID, ULL REGRET IT. THIS CLASS IS N E THING BUT EASY.
GOOD CLASS, JUST THAT THE QUIZES ARE A LITTLE TOUGH.

Changes the way he wants to grade on a day to day basis. He went on and on about iambic pentameter forever. allows you to miss 2 classes and then deducts your grade for every class missed after that. Collects journals and will give you a 0 if you aren't there on the day he collects it (double jeapordy in my opinion). Smokin' hot and pretty funny

Seth is extremely nice. I feel bad he had to teach my class full of uninterested students. Especially the one who was totally annoyed that Percy Shelley used laudanum. anyway. He'll undoubtedly make a fine professor one day. His tests simply required some thought/articulation. Isn't that what you do in an English class anyway? Oh and movie nights!

Seth is not a truly terrible teacher, he just lacks clarity from what he expects from the class. Without warning students what to study, quizzes will include political dates of certain European events, and quote identification with examples so bland they could belong to any number of the works on the syllabus.

He lied about his grading methods in the syllabus, not telling anyone that he had changed them until after he handed back two assignments. I like poetry and read a lot in my spare time, but this guy just sucked. Be careful about interpreting a poem in your own way on his tests, he doesn't like it if you don't read it the same way he does. Watch out

Going into the course I did well in English, but was not very interested in it. The topics he first presented I thought were going to be awful, but it turned out to be an awesome class and now I'm an English major and graduating on time! Overall his class was great and he was very helpful!

Although he was not the main professor he did teach for two classes and both classes he taught were very clear and easy to understand. If you take the time to clearly convey what your having trouble with he can help you.

I thought Seth was a great professor. He is funny in class and makes it interesting. If you have any problems or trouble with the papers he is willing to talk and listen with you in his office hours. If you are good at analyzing poems/essays this would be a great class to take and I would recommend taking it with him.

He is not really helpful, especially with the papers. He doesn't say clearly what he wants in the papers. And the class discussions were useless, people rarely spoke because the topics were really boring. I didn't enjoy the class at all.
He is not clear, does not help much, kind of very strict, hated the class, please watch out.
hes cool and funny. the papers kinda suck, but each one leads up to the next and makes it easier
He's a really nice guy & is funny, but i hated the class. it caused me a lot of stress and tears. you'll  have to worry VERY hard for him.
BEST. PROFESSOR. EVER.
BEST TEACHER EVER! TAKE IT. The Material was fun, the way he taught was awesome. Loved it, loved him. Really learned a lot.
Hands down the best teacher I've had at Ohio State. I've taken two classes with TIm and those two classes have taught me more practical knowledge than most of my other classes combined.
Would highly recommend! Interesting, engaging, and downright fun.
The best professor I've ever had

By far my favorite professor I've ever had, and probably ever will.  Engages you to think for yourself and through unconventional teaching methods helps you attain higher levels of character.  Attendance isn't really mandatory, but you won't want to miss one class because they're all so interesting.  Will go above and beyond for all students.
AWESOME TEACHER... Probably the best i've ever had

IF U HAVE TO TAKE ENGLISH 367 I RECOMMEND U TAKE TIMOTHY JENSEN. IN ALL HONESTY HE WAS BY FAR THE BEST PROFESSOR IVE HAD AT OSU THUS FAR. HES FUN. I ADMIT THO U HAVE TO GENUINELY MAKE AN EFFORT OR ELSE ULL MOST LIKELY STRUGGLE. AS LONG AS UR NOT LAZY THEN U WILL ENJOY THIS CLASS AS MUCH AS I DID!!
Sometimes a little unclear on what he wants from assignments, but probably my favorite teacher ive had, makes class fun
He doesn't always explain his assignments very well but he makes class interesting and enjoyable. He is always willing to meet with you and help with an assignment.

I never knew they handed out B's in English 110.  The prof is very unclear in what he wants in the papers.  One could try to revise a paper in his class a hundred times, and you still wouldn't get a good grade.  It ticked me off more than anything.  He rants about irrelevant issues thinking it is interesting to everyone else.  Look for a diff. prof

Read the readings, you talk a lot about them in class. He is laid back when it comes to discussions which make you feel comfortable. He really tries to make sure you understand the concepts and is very willing to help.
He's a pretty awesome guy.  Great teacher.  Makes the class very interesting.
Is not clear in her interpretations of texts and grades papers very strictly.
Jennifer is a great professor.  She really knows her stuff. She is really helpful and willing to work with students.  Pretty easy grader.  Do the reading and you will be fine.
She was so nice! I really liked the class

really nice! i really enjoyed going to class. some of the lectures were a bit dry. but it is a class based on shakespeare so its understandable. i would totally take a class with her again. she is very fair. and her exams are challenging but not impossible. i learned a lot! she has coach shoes and a huge michael kors bag!
She is really great, and really knows what she's talking about. I would definitely take another one of her classes. Super nice lady.

Loved her, loved the class. Would definitely take any of her classes. Fair grader. Will meet outside of office hours. Snazzy dresser too. Soft spoken, nice, helpful, wants to see her students succeed. Good professor.
Very great teacher! She is so helpful if you have questions and very flexible. As long as you do the work, you will get a good grade.

Spark Notes work just as well as the book for the most part.  The tests are written and as long as you go to class it is not that challenging.  She was a nice teacher and cared about the class.  I liked her and the class
She is a great professer. really nice and understanding, not to mention she kinda has good style!

i found her really helpful and nice. she met me outside of office hours a few times cause i had class then, and to be fair, she said she had problems with some email filter. i thought she was fun in class and she spent a lot of time on paper comments
She is very disorganized.  She makes it sound like she is available but doesn't respond to emails and cancels her office hours often.  She is all over the place as far as teaching goes.

I always do badly at English but she gave me an A- so she can't be too hard. Was helpful in office hours and conferences and easy to talk to. The course was a lot of work but I think they all are. I enjoyed it more than I thought I would.

She hands out instructions for assignments that don't make any sense. After you do badly on an assignment, she tells you how you were supposed to do it.  She assigns way too much work for one quarter and is very disorganized, so there is constant confusion about what you are supposed to have done for class.  This class ruined my quarter.

Expects first level writing course students to write graduate student quality papers.  Assigns massive amounts of reading along with massive amounts of writing/projects for a 10 week period.  Bottomline, expects too much for a first writing course.
I have yet to experience how difficult a teacher she is as nothing has been graded at this point.  However, she is a great in class and her good looks don't hurt either.

Matthew Bolton was a professor at Otterbein University where I took a Modern Horror class from him. He gives you tough readings, but the class discussions are stimulating and keep you interested. He also has this weird attractiveness going for him. He makes you think, and use you noggin. He is constantly moving around when he talks.
The readings are difficult to keep up with. He has a 5 question quiz over that and the film you watch. The readings range anywhere from 30-70 pages(no joke!). I would avoid taking this class.
One of the most helpful and nice teachers I have had, but still makes the class challenging, no interest before this class started but she made me love it.
Works you very hard only to reward you at the end for your hard work

Very good teacher. I wanted to drop this class the very first day, but after the first week I loved this teacher. Work hard and make sure you keep up with the homework and you will get an A. She doesn't grade very hard.
She is a challenging professor but if you attend class, interact and do the work you will do well in the course.
Great teacher. The class was a fair bit of work, but she made it fun and interesting. She also offered great advice during her office hours.
Avoid her at all costs...Hands down, the worst instructor in the Dept.of Englsh. She's unorganized, forgetful, and a major bore! Snooze.....
awesome teacher. very fun and pretty easy. make sure to take the class where you get to make movies!
Very helpful teacher. Not a difficult grader. If she knows you're working hard, you'll get a good grade. Made the class fun and as interesting as possible!
He was a great teacher, helpful and knowledgeable.

My overall writing skills improved, but the class was very hard simply because the topic was so obscure and difficult to comprehend. We had to write papers with basically no prompt or idea of how to write them, and his tough grading made it nearly impossible to receive an A.

The topic for my class was political dissent - something I was not interested in. However, I can honestly say that I learned more about writing in that class than all 4 years of h.s. combined. My writing improved greatly. He taught us different writing styles. We had a class blog and a few papers.

Just come back and see if he's still here teaching. Wow 367 now. Be his friends, but not his students... cuz as I know, no A in his sec. Demand you a lot, and ease himself. Btw, his clothing taste is not bad, if you major in Fashion.

Terrible.He wanted the papers to be very specific which did not leave very much room to relate the thesis back to the course theme.  The theme was suppose to be American culture but in all of the readings, another culture was the focus which frequently happened to be the Chinese culture.  He studied in Japan and makes that apparent.

Michael does a fantastic job trying to make his classes contemporary and relevant to the changing world today. He falls short by picking extremely obscure and irrelevant texts to write long papers about. He never gives a paper prompt, which complicates the already impossible writing, and is a tough grader. Class isnt bad but the writing is hard.
The topic for his class was political dissent so I was just uninterested

Professor Allen is extremely knowledgeable and has plenty of anecdotes to share with the class. He is clearly an expert in his field. He expects a lot from students' writing, and he grades very critically. Professor Allen does not make an easy class, but you will certainly earn the grades you receive.

Allen is an absolutely fantastic professor. He is extremely knowledgeable and knows how to keep the class interesting. He shares personal stories and will joke with students. He is very passionate and willing to help students who seek him out. You need to do the work and show interest or he will be less inclined to help you out; highly recommended.

Professor Allen is awesome; I highly recommend him.  He is a fount of knowledge and I left the class with a great relationship with him; he ended up writing a recommendation letter for me.  With his advice and critiques, I really improved my writing in the course.

Best Class I have ever taken. He's a superb professor with amazing knowledge. I learned so much. He's a tough grader, but in the end I know all the hard work is worth it because I'll be a better writer by the end of it.

What I expected to be a boring prerequisite class turned out to be challenging in a fun way.  He chose mostly interesting lit (a few boring short ones) and was clear about how to improve my writing. Taking him again because he has made me a better writer. Maybe tough grader to some, but personally he's a favorite. Organized and interesting teacher!

I highly recommend Prof. Allen as your teacher and advisor. I took his course focusing on Indigneous lit. An eye-opening experience. Anyone interested in postcolonial and ethnic studies would benefit greatly from his courses on American Indian and other Indigenous lit. He is intelligent and reliable. Great guide for a (long term) writing project.

Great professor, very intelligent. If you ask for help or advice he is glad to give it, and he is passionate about what he teaches. If you need a diversity studies class, definitely consider taking from him. He is not afraid to challenge you though, so keep that in mind, but you are guaranteed to learn a lot.

professor allen was one of the best professors i have ever had! he really challenged me, and expected much out of the class. he was thoroughly interested in the subject matter. i wish he taught at the university of oregon permanently, he would be a real asset.

Took him for American Indian lit. Somewhat confusing/unclear on paper assignments. We had 4 papers due it he quarter. He makes you do a discussion activity where you have to do 6-8 questions (really dumb). Not that easy of a grader
Tooks Oceanic Literature and Native American Literature from Dr Allen.  Excellent Prof.  Interesting classes.  Lots of papers, but good topics.  Fun class with lots of discussion.

He is a good teacher and tough, makes you learn a lot and work very hard, but he doesn't seem to like his students much or to listen before speaking when you meet with him one-on-one.  I felt like he thought I was stupid even though really he was not listening to what I was saying and just wanted to talk first.

Made an otherwise boring subject relatively interesting. Most people aren't used to focusing so much on the same materials for "close analysis" and coming up with ideas that they didn't already write about--so it can be a challenge to people.  Lots of papers, but if you have half a brain they're not difficult at all.

Very good teacher.  He makes you learn to write! This class was like writing bootcamp--we had papers due practically every class. Knowlegeable, nice, cares about students. Flexible. Tough grader, but he really makes you learn the stuff. Interesting class content.

I had him for American Indian Poetry last year.  The class and texts were really interesting, but his grading was a little hard.  I thought that I deserved at least an A-, and ended up with a B...not too big of a deal, but when you are trying for grad school, every little bit counts!

I had him for American Indian Poetry and Pacific Island Lit in the same quarter. Firm instructor, fair with grading, but he does expect a lot. Still one of my favorite instructors though. I highly recommend him.

Classes tend to be fruitless unless you're interested in Mommaday and various other practically unknown Native American writers. Also make sure you don't mind learning from someone who is self centered and condescending.
Wasn't completely interested in the subject of the class but he made it very worth while.  He is very upbeat and passionate about his teaching.

He was interesting and the readings were actually good so that helped the class to be a fun one. We also got to watch the movies of the books once we finished them. But, as a professor he isn't anything special - there are better.

Very interesting class.  He's very knowledgable on the subject (American Indian Poetry/Lit).  It's a lot of work and a lot of reading, but if you're prepared and participate, you can learn a lot and he'll like you.
Great class.  Really knowledgable and friendly.  Has a lot of favorite words--one of them is "stunning."  :-)  But he's a great teacher and his class was really interesting and very well-organized.
Great teacher. Lots of work, but you can slack off if you pay attention in class!
Good guy.  Good teacher.  Reading was a ****, but they weren't bad texts.  Lectures a little much about background info, but overall a good teacher and a good course.
Lot's of reading required, but he teaches one heck of a fun course. Great discussions, great reading (as far as required readings go) and lots of fun. What a fast quarter!
No Comments
he's great!
best teacher I ever had!  if you're english, take one of his courses!
I absolutely loved his class. Fun, intelligent, genuinely interested in the course material and very easy on the eyes. Fair grader and very engaging. This class is definitely worth taking!!

Mr. Manning was a great teacher. I took him for my second writing course. Had absolutely no interest in the course material, but he made it interesting. I've been recommending him to everyone that asks me what class to take. He's awesome!
Great teacher. Cared a lot about his students. If you really want a good grade, just go talk to him and he will help you with your papers. relatively easy grader, highly recomend his class!!!!!
He was extremely helpful and office hours helped tremendously. He has a passion for teaching and sharing his ideas.
He is awesome and funny guy. This class improved my writing a lot and you guys absolutely should take his class.
He is a great teacher. Always made me laugh. Go to office hours he can help you a lot. I highly recommend his class.
Incredibly funny. Really helpful in my writing style. Made class really enjoyable!
Mr. Manning is so great. I had an amazing time in his class. He is fun and funny and he makes class extremely enjoyable. Definitely recommend him as a teacher!

Attendance is mandatory but that's standard for most recitation classes. Overall her recitation is rather boring, and she has a knack for not continuing the lecture unless students raise their hands/ are involved, which can make for lots of awkward silences. She isn't quick to mark off point, but be prepared to be bored. Stay away from 8am classes!

Sarah always seems nervous, which is understandable, but it tends to produce boring lectures. Very knowledgable and helpful, and the assignments/exams aren't bad. There is a lot of reading(3+ books, 3+ plays) and it never gets discussed far enough in depth to make it worthwhile. I understand its English, but this is a survey course.
I really wish i could get something out of my classes...I get easily confused by her teaching. Also it's so difficult to know what she expects when it comes to writing projects
She was awesome!
Amazing teacher! Very refreshing teaching style, definitely recommend taking her class!
I loved this class even though it was at 8:00 am! He really cares about his students and absolutely loves what he does! Highly recommended!

One of my favorite classes at Ohio State, Mehta was extremely enthusiastic and made a point to reach out to the students. He will give extensive feedback on papers, but it will leave you with a higher grade than you originally earned. He is still my favorite teacher, and did a wonderful job teaching British Literature

He was extremely helpful! Go to his office!!! he loves tearing apart your papers and making them his, but it will make you a better writer. He is their for YOUR success. Great teacher. He gets so excited and it is adorable. I would suggest him over and over again. Just have him look over your paper a couple times before turning it in!
Suhaan was an amazing teacher and this was one of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU so far! He loves his craft and make you enjoy it as well too. Highest recommendation.
Great prof. he wants to make you a better writer and he will. Wish I could take more classes from him
Great teacher who really cares about the success of his students. I would recommend him to everybody.
hands down best professor i have had!! i have learned so much and really improved my writing. very organized and interesting to listen to. i have reccomended this class to everyone i know!

Suhaan is awesome! He knows what he's talking about, and makes the class so much fun. You can miss a few classes like every english class, but he honestly makes me want to go. favorite teacher at osu thus far. Definitely take this class. Put forth effort and take part in class discussion and you'll get an A.
he is an amazin proff....his brings life to whtever he teaches...gonna miss his classes whn he leaves...he is AWESOME
he is the most amazin professor u can ever have.....always there for u....he is a student's delight :)
Hand down, the best class I've had this year. Very approachable, very helpful & definitely easy to talk to. Wish we had him for all our years in college.

A very approachable guy who enjoys teaching and always makes time for his students. Suhaan knows how to make a dull GEC interesting and a great learning experience. Easily the most enjoyable class in my freshman year.
Suhaan is a wonderful teacher. He is incredibly knowledgeable on the subject, and will answer any question a student has. He also does a killer John Wayne impression. Ask him to do it. He is so cool.
Loud and clear
Pretty easy grader, wants you to do well; class gets boring at time and he makes you do alot of in class group things but will help you a lot with papers if you go to him in office hours
Professor Mehta is so so helpful and his class is very interesting.  I love Frankenstein and he is so knowledgeable about the subject! Take his class!
Very helpful and sweet--I'd recommed taking him!
No Comments
Interesting class, fun teacher, sometimes not very clear but he loves what he does and is helpful if you ask him to clarify one on one :)

Pretty easy grader but the class is boring. He is really frantic and talks so fast that you get lost in all his words. Overall, the class isn't bad, a lot of the assigned reading on the syllabus is not discussed in class either.

Daniel is a very good teacher both in teaching and grading. If you do everything he told you, you are likey to get A. Attendance is not mandatory and doesn't effect your grade. You need to finish two research paper but If you modify the paper as he said or his notes. You will get A!

I am obsessed with Erin McGraw. She is the nicest lady, but also the toughest teacher. She's never mean or condecending or rude, the class atmosphere is wonderful. I love her so much. One of the best professors I've ever had.

I'm writing this here because I had Erin at the University of Cincinnati over 15 years ago and have never forgotten her or her classes. She is exactly what a workshop leader should be--kind, but rigorous, understanding but not permissive, and incredibly generous. Now that I write and teach, I know even more what a blessing I had in that woman.

Erin is a GREAT professor!  Anyone interested in osu's creative writing program should look for her class.  She loves getting to know her students and creates a laid back atmosphere--very approachable, not stuck up like a lot of english profs.  She'll give a lot of criticism, but it's always for the best.
It was quite possibly one of the best classes I've ever had here, and I am so glad I've taken it.

Erin McGraw is the creative writing program's best-kept secret. She is the best reader and line editor in the program, and her attention to character and structure have changed the way I think about my own work. Her scholarly attention to craft is an example students would do well to emulate. The rigor of her courses helped me improve my stories.

Very understanding that you are involved in a life outside of class, unlike Robin Markels. In terms of course amount, lots of short readings. Found it helpful that she required revised products for discussion throughout the quarter as getting started seemed to be the main focus of my 265 and my other 565. Very gracious, and helpful Teacher.

One of the best teachers I have ever had: incredibly clear and helpful in teaching students the fundamentals of fiction writing.  Not pompous or overly pedantic.  Is genuinely interested in seeing everyone succeed.  Makes coming to class a real pleasure.

Wrote my story off because she did not like the subject matter.  Yeah, that was great criticism there.  Easy class, but her criticism was never helpful, just her letting me know the kind of stories she likes to read.  No criticism to help me become a better writer.

She went to clown school, that says it all. But seriously, she's helpful, doesn't play favorites, and can often see where you're going with a story and offer insightful tips on how to get there. Wants to see everyone published.
Good criticism, highly intelligent, funny, and engaging. Effectively diffuses annoying classmates and encourages diverse opinions. Exactly what I would like to be when I become a professor.
very enthusiastic and helpful. assigns an appropriate amount of work.
Bad class.
No Comments
great teacher
Intelligent and animated, an amazing reader.
Go to class, participate, and be sure to read the material. Isn't always clear on what he is expecting so be sure to ask lots of questions.
Great Teacher! I learned so much about writing.
Never gives anyone "A"'s and thinks that we are all English majors. And grades as if we have a masters in English.
Very helpful but takes more homework compared to other lecturer
best teacher very. There is no need to explain if you have taken his course

He is very helpful. He loves teaching and enjoys interacting. he doesn't like quiet classes. when he asks questions he likes responses. he will sit and wait for a while until someone responds. he is funny in his own little way. he will give you direct feedback and tell you exactly why you got the grade you did. he is a pretty easy grader.

Dr. Vadnais is really funny and makes class interesting. He cares more about effort than correctness for the most part and overall the class is a pretty straightforward English class but he lets you personalize the topics.

Dr. Vadnais is very approachable and easy to understand. Class is mandatory, but he allows a student 3 unexcused absences before grade reduction. He is very knowledgable and is willing to help students when they seek help. His assignments are frequent, but he grades more for effort rather than for accuracy.
what he taught made no sense at all.
He gives a lot of homework and quizzes. He is a nice guy though.
super helpful, happy to be teaching. total badass. was the only class i actually looked forward to going to. highly recommended!

Miss Glaviano is an incredible teacher. She is smart, relaxed, funny, and very willing to work with students. Her class isn't too hard, but she will ask a lot of you. The readings she assigns are awesome. Workshop classes at this university tend to attract the coolest students. I highly recommend her class. She is one of the best. Worth it!

Very good teacher at OSU.She is willing to help everyone and goes the lecture well. You can get an easy A in the class because she will give curve and extra credit. You will get full scores of presentation regardless of how you do it. And the same as active listening. What you need to do is to attend every class then you will get 50 of 100 score

She's like an angel!! Actually she loves to teach, takes care of every student and tries best to help you. Her classes are well-arranged and she will teach you to write your paper step by step right just after the semester starts. Excellent professor and great friend!
Very helpful and genuinely interested in teaching. The subject matter was also diverse and interesting. Grades fairly easily.

I would not recommend this professor. I ended up with a good grade, but I think because I've had good English teachers in the past. Low levels of homework, though, and she's very willing to help. Also, she gives a lot of feedback, but don't expect an easy A if you're not comfortable with English to begin with. She also seems disorganized or ditzy.
Super nice, and extremely helpful. Dresses well all the time too!
She encourages her students to think for themselves while improving their writing.  I never had a teacher who was so helpful.
Really knows her stuff.  Opened my mind to new ideas.  Grades fairly and was always willing to help.  Gives lots of feedback for improvment.  I would recommend this class to anyone.

She tries, and has lots of energy.  However, she just isn't a good professor.  She barely taught anything, didn't conduct class well.  She didn't respond to emails or attempts at asking for help, and never took attendance even though it was required.

Taking now, SP '13; Jenkins has the knowledge and energy to be a good professor, but she's not. 10% of our grade is based on attendance, but she never takes it; most classes, she just kind of stares at us as she reads the textbook aloud, word for word. She never replies to emails and she lets class discussion get WAY out of hand. Hope she improves.

Amazing teacher! Always kept class interested and encouraged everyone to get involved. The assignments were not that bad and everything was explained very thoroughly. Highly recommend taking any class she teaches.

Mrs. Jansen is AWESOME. She is extremely nice, and makes class entertaining. She doesn't expect anything she doesn't tell you, and is willing to help anyone. Extremely easy grader, and papers/exams aren't difficult. One of the best teachers I have had. Will be missed greatly. PLUS, she's quite the looker. definitely take her if possible!
She is very interested in the class, very helpful, grades very fairly. As long as you go to class you will be ok, and read obviously. Plus shes cute, recommend!

Anne Jansen is going to make a fantastic PH.D of English. Not only does she have a huge dedication to the field of literature, but she teaches it with objectivity and a genuine caring for students' educations. She does an excellent job creating and sustaining class discussion. Read the work, go to class, get an A. Simple.

She was a great teacher.  Always emailed you back.  Always helpful, and very nice.  She kept you entertained the entire class.  I never bought Commonplace, and don't recommend it, you can get around it.  Great teacher, and fun class.  I'll miss her as a teacher.

She's a really nice and fun professor!! She tries to make class fun and she's really good at explaining key concepts.  If you don't understand something she explains it until you get it and she doesn't make you feel stupid.  I absolutely loved her and her class and I will miss it next quarter. You should be lucky to have her!!

Dr. Christensen is a pretty decent professor. Her class, although not very interesting, was pretty easy as long as effort was clearly made. I spent a few hours on each of my papers and received all A's. Make sure you do assigned readings though, because she will randomly call on people in class.

Talks super fast.  Assignments aren't explained very well.  We basically taught the class to ourselves. (< which she claims is on purpose) Seemed distracted and missed more class herself (applying for jobs) than we were allowed to miss in the first place.

She's really nice and easy to relate to.  I thought her class was really enjoyable and I wasn't necessarily looking forward to it before I took it.  I think she's really well prepared and genuinely enjoyed her as a professor.

She talks ridiculously fast and is hard to understand. Also, she's nice but she doesn't give you any points if your assignment is even slightly late. Her projects for 269 can be difficult and she doesn't give you much help for them.

This guy is tough. I don't recommend him if you are very sensitive about your work, but he is incredibly helpful if you actually want to get better/can handle brutal honesty. I recommend going to office hours for one-on-one time with him; he's kinder out of the classroom and will like you for putting in the extra time/effort to see him.

Andrew is a teacher who has the student's success in mind.  He's brutally honest and is not afraid to obliterate your ego, but he's only as harsh as he sees fit.  His lively sense of humor and wit makes every class something to look forward to, and with his strong understanding of poetry and grammar, he's a teacher of exceptional quality.

An excellent prof.  You will learn more from him than any other creative teacher you'll ever have.  But be forewarned, he is not easy.  If you really want to be a writer, take this class, but you just want the easy A that most creative writing classes are, stay away.

Hudgins is as knowledgeable on the subject of poetry as you could hope to find. He was helpful, and quick to respond to questions. The syllabus is clear: there are no surprises waiting. If you pay attention, read the text, and work consistently to improve, you will find the class rewarding and fun. I highly recommend this workshop/prof. Hudgins.

He is very direct and blunt in his criticisms which are sometimes needlessly cruel. The assignments, particularly ones in formal style and meter are difficult, and he does not let a poor effort slide. Certainly not for the faint of heart or those without a sense of humor. That said, my writing has never improved so much in a workshop.

I agree with everything said already. He's rarely satisfied, always challenging, and very direct with his criticism. That said, this is one of the few workshops I've taken in which one sees a dramatic improvement in the overall quality of the class' writing as a whole. Serious poets should benefit dramatically from this class.

The most juvenile grown man I have ever met. And thinks there should be no laws protecting fetuses who are one month away from birth.  Compared one such fetus to the deer pushed to side of road in Stafford's famous poem.  His juvenile sense of humor is no better than his vicious politics.

Impossible to satisfy, sometimes deliberately cruel, cares more about his subject than his students... which is precisely what aspiring poets need. If you don't like his teaching methods, you need to seriously question your own commitment to writing, because his comments are 98% on target.

Smart and accomplished but not always supportive. Often disregards students' feelings when making comments on their writing. Has been known to gossip about students with other profs. If you disagree w/him, watch out!

I like his teaching style, but his workshops are not for the faint of heart. He is difficult to please, and he forces students to utilize formal meters and rhyme schemes. He is also mean, but he is a very good teacher. I recommend only serious students.

Very hard, but made you a far better writer because of it. Honesty and directness were appreciated to get down to business and be a writer, do the work. No BSing here, thank god. Maybe not super personable, but at least you learn something worthwhile.

Great teacher.  Made the class interesting.  Chose "college life" for our theme.  Brought us donuts from Buckeye Donuts one day.  Definitely recommend this professor even though she is a grad student at OSU.

Prof Herman was delightful! He's super passionate and knowledgable...and he has a really funny, really nerdy, sense of humor. The reading was pretty intense but if you take good notes you can get by with skimming the texts. He's also an incredibly fair grader. Loved him!

He is really a great instructor.  He goes to great lengths to discuss topics and make sure they are given in a clear manner. I learned a lot from him and definitely wish I could take another class.  The reading load was heavy, but that wouldn't deter me from taking another course with him.  He is a fantastic instructor - very helpful!
He is a great professor. He made a difficult subject crystal clear. He is very approachable and engaged the class in thought-provoking discussions. I would recommend him to anyone.

Had him for a course on Modernist and Post-Modernist lit, which is fairly heady stuff as literature goes, so it figures that he is clearly incredibly smart. But, he isn't a jerk, makes corny jokes in class, doesn't call randomly on students, and is a fair grader. I didn't read any of the books and scored a 96 on the midterm. You'll learn a lot too.
Good sense of humor.  Insightful grading.  I wish Herman could teach all of my classes.

I attended a conference where Prof. Herman presented a paper-he was clearly one of the star attractions there. He is one of the leading scholars in Cognitive Narratology & probably has the longest resume in the entire English Department. Most importantly, by all accounts, he is EXTREMELY approachable and will help you out a LOT with your writing.

He did not allocate time well.He ever used ONLY one class to teach us how to write a paper, but use amounts of time to talk about usefuless things with classmates. After that, he said he was concerned about our paper...
he is the worst prof i have experienced. dont ever take his class. he wont help you even if you have question!!
No Comments
He always talks about plagiarism. I didn't learn anything in his class. He establishes his authorithy by making threats.
Loves talking about plagiarism.. A very crazy guy

Ms. Huntman (or Rebe as she had us call her) is very kind and an interesting woman. However, I felt that I went back in my learning rather than advanced. She had us write as if we were in the fourth grade and was not really clear about anything. I ended up having to talk to other English 110 professors who seemed a lot more knowledgeable than her.

Rebe is so kind and genuinely cares about the content she teaches. She makes class interesting and worth going to! 1 hr and 20 mins does not seem long with her. I highly recommend this class! Learned so much
great teacher

Dr. Benson is great. He may be the most interesting man in the world. His class is straight forward as well. He outlines everything for you and makes it easy for you to do your project. If you go to him during office hours he will give you ideas for your project and pretty much tell you what to do. I think he is amazing, you want to have Dr. Benson

Dr. Benson leads an engaging class with multiply opportunities for classroom interactions. He really seems to enjoy thinking about situations students propose and gladly talks through any issues. He will basically grade your papers before you actually turn them in. This class is an easy A.
Super helpful with writing advice.  Very clear, and teaches well.  Grades easily but gives a lot of feedback. Great instructor overall.

I absolutely love Dr. T. Not only is he a wonderful person who genuinely wants everyone to do well and become more interested in the material, but he is so helpful if you come to him with questions/concerns. I had him during my first quarter here & now I'm a senior & still remember him fondly as a truly excellent professor. Take the class!
You just need to listen and be a good writer to receive a good grade in the class. He's very passionate about it, even when the audience is not at all. He knows what he's talking about

A professor who is very passionate about what he teaches. Grades in an unbiased way, and gives great feedback. Very helpful if you have questions. Updates Carmen often. Sometimes can be difficult to understand, but overall, very recommended!

Love Dr. T! Great guy, kept class interesting, even if he did get off on tangents, they were always interesting and did relate to the material somehow! Lots of work with computers; we did discussions on Carmen. He's very willing to help out with papers or questions, and gives excellent feedback. I'd definitely take a class with him again!
Professor T is a great professor and really cares. He does ramble off-topic but he's very computer/carmen orienanted I would rececommd him for a professor

He's fair in his grading and will let you rewrite your paper if you do poorly. He usually rambles but its only because he actually likes the stuff you're reading about. He's willing to read your paper before you turn it in, and he genuinely tries to make the class interesting and thought-provoking. Would recommend.

Prof. T is a great guy. He was extremely willing to be flexible and work with students. He had no problem looking over papers before turning them in. He even let the class do re-writes after one paper turned out not so well. I wasn't interested in the subject (poetry) but he was awesome!

Les is a cool guy.  He's a jolly fella and our whole quarter was based on the wizard of oz and related materials.  He definitely challenged me in my first quarter here, but looking back, it wasn;t so bad.  I fell asleep a lot but it was a discussion based class so if I was more into it I would have been awake.  Does a lot with computers!!

Les is a really nice guy who really cares about teaching and his students. He can ramble a bit, but its always in a good-hearted and down to earth way, which keeps it from being painful or annoying. A couple of shorter papers, attendance, and really fair midterms were all he required. An enjoyable experience, would definitely recommend.
Fine teacher

He is by far one of my favorite professors.  He is extremely helpful and very fun.  His lectures tend to drag on, but the subject matter is always interesing.  He is challenging, but he grades very fairly.  I would recommend him to anyone.

I had Les for his fairytales class. While he is EXTREMELY knowledgable, he also tends to go off on a lot of tangents. He's a great guy though, super helpful in office hours and willing to advise you about things that don't have anything to do with class. he's awesome though, I definitely recommend him.
Great guy, but rambles a bit.  Hard to take notes in his class, but lectures interesting and good feedback on papers.  Tests fair.

Really nice guy.  I thought a lot of in-class assignments were a waste of time, but the papers assigned really helped improve my writing.  Good selection of reading material.  Overall, I'd definitely recommend this class.

Les is an extremely nice man and he runs his classes in a conversational tone. Sometimes he's only conversing with himself, but he knows when it's time to change topics. Great in the office, willing to approach you like a human being. Fairly easy grader, goes easy on the good writers. Not big on time-wasting.

I have never connected with a professor on such a personal level.  He is the kindest and most genuine man that I have ever met.  He wants nothing more than for you to understand and internalize the material.  He is a very liberal grader so long as your responses emerge from synthesizing your own experience with the literature.  He likes to teach!

Very good instructor, knows an enormous amount of about Romantic Era BritLit.  Also knows a lot of related material, he can easily give a modern cross-reference for clarity--like a current movie.  Very interested and helpful!
Rambles too much, very hard grader
This was a good class overall. A moderate work load and interesting. Not too hard although he was alittle picky on grading.

Michael is an amazing teacher for anything and everything rhetoric. He's incredible with giving thorough feedback. If students care and are willing to work hard, his classes will help in so many ways. He was instrumental in my thesis project and has informed the my teaching in significant ways. Take his class(es)!!!!
Very smart,intelligent, and passionate guy who knows what his students need. The class is interesting that you will never feel boring. No exam, only several papers required. Hightly recommend!

Amazing, Amazing teacher.  No tests, only 4 easy and fun papers.  Learned more in this class than any I've taken so far.  Lots of fun!  Easy class!  Highly recommended.  You get to resubmit your papers so you can get an A if you put in the effort.  Nice grader, very fair.

Harker was an awesome teacher.  He allows you to resubmit your paper until you get the grade you wanted.  There were no tests, just 4 papers and a video documentary that he made very easy.  Harker comes highly recommended.
Possibly the greatest lecturer I have ever had. The class itself was kind of weak, but Harker himself is a magnificent teacher; funny, clever and nice guy.

Michael did an excellent job teaching 276. He was clear in his expectations and went out of his way to help students strengthen their writing styles. The assignments were very creative and highly stimulating. I would definitely take a class with him again.

Great teacher.  Clear on whats expected and open to helping students.  Gives credit where credits due and will help you get a good grade in the class if you're willing to give effort.  I would take another class by him for sure.
He is so nice and i love his lecture. Extremely helpful and very smart. He taught me a great deal of knowledge and he is so nice to everyone.
Arrogant
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent.  Best English professor I have had so far.  Really learned a lot.

Dr. Simpkins' class is great for opening your mind to analytical reading and writing. The class isn't hard because you have a lot of freedom to write about whatever you want and to voice your opinions. For critical thinking and a really relaxed classroom setting, this class is awesome.

This class was the easiest class I've taken. She's a great teacher and very helpful on papers. Workload was not heavy at all and she was understanding if you forgot to do something or didn't finish it. DEFINITELY take her, you won't regret it!
Kinda spacey, but who cares.  Fun teacher who is helpful if you go to her, lots of freedom with writing, which i think is a good thing
Very nice, very helpful teacher. The course itself is pretty boring but she does a good job of helping us through it.

Definitely the most passive-aggressive professor I've ever come across and maybe even the most immature as well.  Her behavior toward the end of the quarter was positively unbearable and just plain rude, her handouts were ridiculously convoluted, and her "teaching style" was both impossible to pin down and understand.  Do not take her courses.

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS WOMAN-YOU WILL REGRET IT. her grading is completely arbitrary.  she liked me, so i got consistently high marks, but people she hated were left in the cold no matter what the quality of their work.  she seems confused all the time and was late for class alot. I have been at OSU 5 years--worst teacher by FAR.
No Comments

I can't believe she is teaching English majors to write.  We did very little writing and a lot of endless, meandering text analysis.  Every day was a lost cause and we never knew what pointless exercise we'd be given.  Lots of dead space and confusion in the lecture.  She seemed confused about what she is supposed to be doing.  BEWARE!!!

Worst teacher ever. For an Honors English 110 class, we got more than our fair share of circular definitions, vague explanations, and blatantly rude comments. She is quite literally incapable of helping you. Don't waste your time. You'll only be insulted.

Unbelievably disorganized.  Class started out interesting and then basically went to hell.  Assignments were very vague and unclear.  Never quite sure what she wanted or what she was going for.  A lot of freedom to write as you wish but very unhelpful.  WAY harder than it needed to be.  Avoid it.

What a strange class, I thought I was going to learn ways to improve my critical writing but learned nothing of the sort. Simpkins did not provide valuable feedback on any of my papers and the prompts became more confusing as the class wore on. Also, her grading is completely arbitrary.

I recently had an experience with her grading problems mentioned earlier.  I receive an excellent grade on a paper that she took two weeks to grade.  I did not even revise the paper except for typos, and I got a very high score!  I cannot wait until I am done with her class and her terrible grading.

She is a nice person and all, but she can get real confusing real quick.  If you want to learn what a pentad, dramatism, terministic screen, and such are then take this class with her.  If you want a class that will improve your writing, look elsewhere.

went to office hours to get feedback on a paper and she told me she doesn't work that way. why teach a critical writing course then? worst teacher i have had in a long time, has no grading system, every single person in the class got a 97 on their papers. she just doesn't care.
Very unorganized.  Never followed the syllabus.  Nice lady.....BAD teacher.
Bad, bad, bad.  Very unorganized.  Doesn't know what she's talking about.

Ms. Simpkins is an extraordinary resource in the use of the English language. I felt her knowledge and wisdom were unmatched as compared to other professors regardless of subject matter. The experience went beyond basic instruction as it provided lifelong

Absolutely the worst class I have taken at this school. Her paper grading was ridiculous (she used ones with a bunch of errors as examples), and the paper topics were the same time after time. She was never really clear, either, as to what she wanted.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  Very unorganized.  Not a consistant grader.  Final was nothing like the class.  Half the class had A's going into the final, no one ended up with an A.  I had an A, ended up with a C.  Worst decision I made taking this clas

Decent professor, talks about civil rights way too much, but knows her stuff. Books are pretty confusing, don't pay too much attention to them. Grades odd though, I got a 100 on one paper, then a 70 on the next for an equally good paper...so watch out
He is great with analyzing the readings,but when it comes to the papers he is tough. Make sure you come to prepared to class with the readings done!

This professor is awful. He REFUSES to answer any emails and has told us that multiple times. The only times he is willing to talk about someone about problems they're having is outside of class. The class structure is basically him talking throughout the entire class without any interaction except for maybe reading out loud. Overall terrible...

Advise against classes with him. I've finished my Eng classes with a 3.75 Eng GPA, but was going to get a B- at best in his class(?). I knew the material, took the midterm, and got a C, so I tried to discuss my grade with him but he wouldn't even listen.  He just claimed that he "has been grading a long time and knows what he's doing." Exemplary.
Terrible. Terrible. Terrible Teacher. Good luck getting email responses and he gets a kick out of not helping students and letting them fail.

Not too difficult, the a two hour class can get old easy, with him just talking and little class interaction. 2 midterms and final paper, midterms are broken down into 60% objective and 40% essay. Have to read the books or at least have a clear understanding of them. I thought Love in World Lit would be a bit more interesting, but it's not too dull

I absolutely love Jim as a professor. He fascinates me (and he's also pretty cute;)His class was pretty easy, you just HAVE to keep up with the readings and ALWAYS come to class. Some questions on the test come directly from what he says during class. His tests are mostly writing and he grades relatively leniant.

I think he was an absolutely wonderful teacher, he had passion, insight, and really loved what he was doing. Very cultured and understanding, an actual human being! I loved his class and his humor and always looked forward to his teaching, he does well with the time he is given and the requirements of the course. Wonderful!

Terrible professor. I had serious problems this quarter getting help from him.  He doesn't seem to care much at all about the students. The class was DREADFULLY boring (Dream of the Red Chamber...worst book EVER), and it was not about adventure quests like I thought it was. Dr. Hsu is a pretty easy grader, but the books are very difficult and borin

I would NOT recommend this teacher. Hes bad at answering questions and very difficult to schedule an appointment with (impossible). He summarizes stories in class however fails to TEACH much of anything. The instructions for the essays were often unclear. I would rate him a 4 out of 10. If youre looking to improve for your next writing class DO NOT take Dr. Hsu.

this teacher was terrible. 10% of the grade is a combination of participation and random pop quizzes. if you fail more than 2 pop quizzes (roughly worth less than 2% of your overall grade) you fail the class. the exams are all essay and be prepared to write. he does a terrible job preparing you for the tests and the material is painfully boring.

such an amazing teacher! I absolutely loved coming to his class. The books were great, he is really funny, and the exams were reasonably easy. If you have the chance, please take one of his courses. You wont regret it!

Great teacher!! I learned so much in his class. He is very knowledgable about the literature he is teaching. I would switch to english major if I could have all my classes with him. You can miss 2 classes without your grade being effected. Really great selection of literature. There are 3 midterms, attend class and read the books and youll be fine.

I had Dr. Hsu when he was still a TA and he was an amazing teacher.  He really took the time to get to know his students, he remembered my name years after I had been in his class.  Everytime I think of Wuthering Heights I think of his class.

Dr. Hsu was very knowledgeable and passionate about the literature but he did not respond to emails quickly and was not too helpful. Overall, a good teacher though. We read Romeo and Juliet, Wuthering Heights, Goodbye Columbus, The Great Gatsby and some poems and short stories. There are two exams and a take home exam.
Makes you work, but hey its college. Grades more then generous, and wants everyone to succeed. Great guy
Andy's a really tough teacher, but he's also really willing to help. I had to work very hard in this class, but it paid off in the end.
no comment
Excellent example of how teaching should be done. Andy has a brilliant career ahead him no matter what he does.
good

Andy is a very intelligent and cool guy. He likes to teach and is very understanding, always willing to help students. I learned a lot in his class, not only about the writing process, but critical thinking and discussions. It was nevertheless a little bit challenging, a lot of work, but overall it worth it. At the end, you just learned tons!!!
intelligent, enthusiastic, and definitely hot.

I had Andy for English 367.01 and English 291.  He is, BY FAR, the best professor/teacher at The Ohio State University.  He is a nice guy, who is truely interested in teaching.  On a 1 to 10 scale, I give Andy a 50.
Very fair...exams were open book...kept the class interesting...highly recommended!

Really, really sincere and understanding guy.  He brings a pretty fresh perspective to a pretty blah class, and he's great just to have a chat with.  His classes are laid back and comfortable, yet I still learned.  That he's supercute[tm] just adds to the package.

He is always willing to talk with students about anything and encourages them to get in touch with him.  His tests were extremely easy.  He seems like he has high expectations, but he's really not that bad.  I loved being in his class.
I totally agree! Andy was just great! I highly recommend any class he teaches!
Dude, this guy's class is easy if you actually do the work he assigns.  He's interesting, funny, highly intelligent, and he's really hot too(which always helps keep me interested!).
Took the class way to seriously as if it were an upper level english class.. NOT EASY AT ALL. You have to put so much thought and effort into everything and everyone get's failing grades back.

GREAT teacher. This class was not hard at all. Sit in the front of the class for the whole course, participate consistently for the first week, take her writing suggestions seriously and improve and you will definitely recieve an A. I did. She was extremely helpful, at times she even helped me come up with an excellent thesis for my papers. Great.
Great professor, enjoyed being in her class even though I was not interested in English. If you put forth effort and have good writing skills it is not hard to get a good grade.
Sometimes it was unclear what she wanted, but she was very willing to help.
Very helpful and easy-going professor.

Very clear and easy to recieve good grades.  Looks mostly for good effort and improvement in writing.  Very guided in final written paper.  Not too much work outside of a few essays.  Some readings at the beginning of th course with in class quizzes.

I was reminiscing about Leila's class recently and just had to chime in on these reviews. As you've read, she is just wonderful. So thoughtful and well spoken. She is a dedicated, organized, and kind-spirited individual. Count yourself lucky if you take on of her courses. The material challenged me in the best way and enriched my college education.

Leila is spectacular when it comes to teaching. She is always willing to help and is truly invested in her students. She genuinely cares about students' success and I cannot have asked for a better professor. If you have the chance to take her class, definitely do. I have yet to come across such a helpful and caring professor.

Leila is my favorite professor i've had at OSU. There is a good amount of reading material, but its good literature and it's not that boring. The books are really interesting. She's an easy and fair grader and as long as you put care into your work you are good to go!

Ms. Ben-Nasr is awesome. Her selection of literature was interesting and engaging, and she conveyed a strong interest in the material. As long as your are willing to put in a good effort on the writing assignments, this is not necessarily a hard class.

Leila is hands down the best teacher I have had. She is a great person! She is a terribly easy grader! She cares about her material and her students as long you go to class and make an effort to do the assigned work. Everything you want in a teacher. However, the class is a lot of reading and a lot of writing which you will have to be prepared for

Ms. Ben-Nasr truly seems to care about the literature we are reading and she is passionate about it. She's very well educated on the authors, and cares a lot about giving background information on them. She is really dedicated to giving feedback on papers to make them better, & she's not a harsh grader. Some activities she does are gimmicky though.
Awosome teacher.. very helpfull and articulates material easily.. nice grader.

I hate english and I managed to do well. Students should go to class and if you have to miss just tell her and that would be fine. Very easy best english teacher I've had and she grades lightly, very understandable and helpful!

She was the best teacher I've ever had! At times she can be long winded but she articulates everything very well so students do not miss anything. Basically, if you attend class, and do not miss paper due dates you will be fine. She is always open for help!

I had Amber for 1110.02, and in my section attendance was required and participation was expected but it was easy to earn an A because she was willing to meet and help on the one paper that was required for our final. Seriously, if you meet with her she will tell you what she looks for in a paper and if you follow that you WILL NOT get a bad grade.

Awful teacher, not helpful at all. Random train of thought, very scatterbrained during lecture. 3-5 page paper every week, graded hard. Basically only graded by if she likes your papers (not by rubrics which suck anyway) and topic for final paper. Harder than any other 1110.01 class from what I've heard. Pop quizzes are difficult. Overall annoying.

If you get her for English 1110.01 drop or switch teachers. her class is way harder than every other english 1110.01 class. you have to write a 3-5 page paper every week and she grades hard and does not keep up on grading. you get random pop quizzes. in every other english class you work on one paper the entire year and turn it in for you final.

He's strange, a bit quirky but you can tell he wants his students to succeed. Make sure you go to class, he's not lenient when it comes to attendance.  I was doing well in his class but because I had 3 absences too many I had to withdraw. Not bad overall. Wants you to think outside the box, find the deeper meaning behind the text.

This class is all over the place. The syllabus says the course is designed to help our writing skills but I have yet to learn one thing about writing.  All we do is read different material and sometimes take quizzes over them, sounds more like a reading class to me. Weird professor, his method of teaching is awful and he expects way too much.

This class is not an easy A for a GEC, and Josh expects a lot of work out of you. That being said, he is very lenient with deadlines if you are at least trying. Urges students to think of literature from a new perspective outside what many are taught beforehand. Highly recommended for those who want a challenging GEC to better their writing skills.

Very hard class. Josh is interesting and cool but the expectations placed upon students in this course are above what you would expect from a GEC course. Don't plan on breezing through this one! My first B came here

This class is a lot of work, he requires 3 three page papers and 1 five page paper. and there are quizzes almost every class over the reading. Participation and attendance is required. If you are looking for a kind of blow off GEC, this is not it.

Really great teacher. Meets whenever you need to meet outside of class and does a great job answering emails. Watched some interesting films in the class. Comp 308 was a great class and really tested your critical thinking skills.

Great guy. He is very knowledgeable with the historical context of the readings and sometimes can go off on a tangent discussing them and forget about the reading for the day. He is very personable and has a great sense of humor. Sometimes boring, mostly not. VERY easy A and stimulating most of the time.
good teacher
He expects a lot of reading, but it's a literature class! I feel like my ability to read poetry has increased a lot since taking this class. He is a cool guy.

This guy has no life and doesn't expect you to have one either. He assigns hours of work and god forbid you don't talk in class, he goes crazy. He talked through the entire midterm. he needs social skills. avoid this creep
Super interesting person. You can tell he's really passionate about the texts and interested in exploring student's ideas. He could be a little mean at times. But in general, a really nice guy.

Can be intimidating at times, but REALLY knows the texts.  Extremely fair grader, and welcome to listen to students opinions. However, you must take the effort to do all of the reading, cause he will single you out in front of everyone, and you'll be totally lost for the rest of class. One of the most interesting profs I've met, highly recommend.

Cool guy and very enthusiastic about the subject. Very fair grader but he will call you out on your **** if he thinks you're making stuff up/wrong. Exams were pretty easy as long as you read the definitions and came to class!

Josh Gass is my favorite professor at this university so far. He is highly knowledgeable, and finds great ways to get students to think critically and creatively on the texts. I really liked that he encouraged you to disagree with his theories. It was always great to hear everybody's opinion on the readings.
awful! the concepts were not clear, and he was not helpful. his shirt was always unbuttoned and he chewed tobacco during his office hours. it was the worst class i've ever taken.

The class was really hard and he wasn't helpful at all. I'd never take a course with him again or recommend him. His shirt would always be unbuttoned and he would chew tobacco during office hours. It was an awful experience!
Good guy, but often gets kind of upset when people don't talk in class. He's generally a funny guy and is pretty fair grader.  I'd take a class with him again for sure.

I liked this teacher a lot. He was very flexible, and even let me write a creative story instead of an analytical essay. Gives options to write creatively on midterms, which is refreshing for a brit lit class. He tended to get frustrated when no one talked, and would curse in frustration... good teacher if you aren't offended by cussing.
Funny. Class isn't boring, but some of the text choices are bland. You learn a lot.

He is a great teacher! He's very funny and keeps the class interesting! He is very nice and cares a lot about the students and what they have to say in class discussions. Overall he's an excellent teacher! I definitely recommend to take his class!
Gass enriched my understanding of literature.  He's a great guy and a philosopher.
Excellent, articulate, witty lecturer with loads of philosophical depth and analytical power.
Helpful. Makes class interesting and fun to participate. Talks with you instead of condescendingly above you.
my favorite teacher here at OSU. HILARIOUS. very very passionate about his job and helping his students.
Overall good teacher, very interesting but a little abstract. I'd recommend him to others.
No Comments
The amount of work seemed extreme when you couldn't think of anything to write, but if you did it ahead of time, you'd be fine. Shes a tough critic but a kind grader if you're trying.

Cynthia Selfe was a wonderful teacher. It was challenging at times, but I really learned valuable things from her class.   This was my favorite class that I have taken at OSU so far, I would recommend anyone who has the opportunity to take a class with Dr. Selfe!!
Couple of tough projects. Easy class though. The attendance policy sucks but you get to be creative. And very little written assignments is always a plus

One of the most insightful and rewarding classes I've ever had. If you go into the class with the intention of enjoying the information instead of brushing it off, you will love what you learn. Professor Selfe has a very unique teaching style, and one thing that is imperative is to KEEP UP! So do your readings, and don't procrastinate.

If you're going to take this class, take 269 first with Prof. T.  It was easy for me because I already had an introduction.  A lot of people struggled and she constantly changed assignments.  Critiques were a big mean, but led to an overall good final project. She always brings cookies too which is nice. love/hate relationship.
Very unclear about the assignments and would never clarify. She also changed them over and over again throughout your progress. Bad professor, very bad.

Prof. Selfe creates a very comfortable and intriguing discussion environment for class readings. Most readings are online and I took a lot from each of them, especially after discussion. When you work on your video and audio assignments, take some time to plan with her. Just b/c it's a video Eng class doesn't mean it's easy. Not for lazies!
awesome person, and crazy lady, and crazy teacher.  TAKE HER CLASS!!!
Horrible professor

Horrible professor makes the class way more difficult than it has to be. Readings are ridiculously long and she teaches like shes reading an essay. Do not recommend this professor to anyone looking for an easy A

Requires a lot of reading, papers are easy. There are some free points like attendance and group presentations, but the midterm and final can be pretty difficult. I averaged an A in attendance, group project, and on the two essays but got an average C- on the tests.

This class wasn't difficult. The quizzes weren't that bad., and the response papers were very easy. However, she took a week longer than my other professors to post grades, and this was the first final that I took, and was the smallest class by far, and one of the shortest finals. I wouldn't recommend that you take her unless you're patient.

Classes were monotinous. Quizzes took some getting used to before being able to anticipate what was coming. Midterm and final was just regurgitating information from power point slides as it relates to specific works. With minimal amount of effort, a B is definitely possible.

Each class consists of a discussion of the readings due for that day. Attendance is mandatory but speaking in class is not. 4 Quizzes, long, lots of writing talking about significance of passages from your readings. Exams are like quizzes but longer. 2 papers (2 and 5 pages), tough grader. it's possible to scrape a B with reading summaries online
basically read alot and then regurgitate it on long awful quiz's. Ontop of writing 2 papers that she grades VERY hard on.

David is great.  He expects you to show up and put in the work, but is extremely helpful too. His feedback is on point and he definitely knows his stuff. In my experience, you can't do much better than his workshop.

Noelle is really laid back and doesn't care what you really do as long as you show up and stay off your phone. If you ask for an extension she gives you one and will read over your essay before it's due.

Noelle is an awesome teacher who goes out of her way to help anyone who needs it including international students who she gave extra attention to help them with their speech and writing techniques as well as making sure they understood the material. She explains everything clearly and really is passionate about the class. She lets you pick topics.

The quizzes are very hard and test on very specific details rather than concepts (ex: what is the name of the horse in the 10 minute video we watched on the second day of class).  He himself is funny and the class is interesting, but if you are looking for an easy A gen ed I would not recommend this class at all.

For a GE there is way too much work required to get a good grade. The readings are long and dry, and the test questions are on the smallest details from readings. There is a quizlet that has the test questions on it I found by the third quiz and did very well. Overall would not recommend this class for an easy GE

Professor Green is interesting to listen to, but he tends to ramble and go on weird tangents. All you really have to do to pass the class is show up and sign the attendance sheet and do the discussion posts online. The quizzes aren't hard, they are just random stuff from his lectures. There are flash cards of the questions he asks on studyblue
Great teacher. Expert in his field.  Very helpful and accessible.  Made a difficult class (Chaucer) easy to understand. I enjoyed having his class.

Really nice and intelligent guy. A cautious academic, which is refreshing for an English prof. Lectures sometimes ramble/get way off topic, but only because he's so interested in the subject. Liberal attendance policy, but don't be fooled: he wants you to write about the things discussed in class in essays and on exams.

The specificity of the test questions is daunting at first, but if you make flash cards for every person, place, document and artifact you'll be fine.  No writing or historical thought is required.  Mandatory lectures consist of Dr. Green reading the assigned primary sources aloud, occasionally with commentary.  He is a very nice fellow.

This GEC requires an IMMENSE amount of work/reading. The tests Q's (there are tests and a final) are RANDOM and minute details from the material in class and the book. I thought this class would be interesting, but it turned out to be quite demanding and is now lowering my GPA significantly. I do not recommend.

Take this if you need a GEC.  It was very interesting and class was actually easy to pay attention to.  Questions are somewhat random but for the most part if you read the stories and notes you will get an A no problem.

Richard and the material itself were both verrryy interesting. I enjoyed coming to class, and attendance was taken for points.
