Only complaint were the exams - grade was made up of 3 tests and a final, and his questions are VERY random and detailed. you must pay TONS of attention to minute details, but overall this class was a great GEC.

Great teacher.  Very helpful and listens to his students. My only complaint is that the material we studied was a bit dull, so it in turn made him seem dull.  No biggie, as long as you show up and take notes you'll get a decent grade.

Dr. Green was very interesting. He is an older English gentleman with such a keen sense of humor that makes for a great learning environment. He listens very well to others and maintains a positive attitude toward everyone he meets or teaches. I would recommend Dr. Green to anyone who likes professors with a great sense of humor and cheerfulness.
I enjoyed the class and learning to translate Old English.  Prf. Green very likable and helpful if had questions or needed clarification!

Really cool. Sometimes it was difficult to know what to take notes on. He rambled at times but was funny and entertaining. Great movies were shown in class. Fun way to get your "culture and ideas" credits out of the way.
Loved it! Write down what he says and you'll be fine on the multiple choice tests. Very interesting

Prof. Green is a delightful old man who inspires me to want to learn more about traditional ballads. However, he seems to lose his train of thought during lecture and as a result you have no idea what is going to be on the final. He only has a few grades in the class so it's pretty easy. Make sure to keep up with readings and you should be okay.
Great prof who helps you out a lot.
This class was very interesting. All multiple choice tests and he always let us out early.

Excellent discourse and easygoing atmosphere. Green excels at letting students lead the discussion where it may go, but equally good at leading discussion where it has to. Not a linear class model. Fair essay grader. Exams are not difficult, albeit in class and with essay portions.
Lectures wander and you have no clue what's goign to be on the quizzes. Averages for quizzes are 6 of 10, which leaves most of the classes at a D average.
Lectures are kinda longwinded and boring, but has a great accent.

Awesome professor.  Its obvious how much he cares about his students, the world, and writing.  Easily my favorite professor thus far.  The only part of the class that made me nervous was peer review, but you get used to that pretty quickly, and it helps with the creative writing process.

One of my favorite professors hands down. Genuinely interested in his students opinions and exploring new ideas in discussion. If you want to open your mind, take his class. Weekly 500 word journals about the current novel graded for completion & midterm and final were take home essays. Low key, fun professor who makes you want to try your best.

Would have liked it better if it was less of a discussion b/c many times students would get us off topic because of dumb misinterpretations.  And not to be mean because I am empathetic towards that but when you have a question that shows you haven't critically thought about themes on the worksheet or read then don't ask in a 300 person lecture!

Many times he would get off topic and discuss things that have nothing to do with what we were supposed to read. He is also a published author, and would often bring up his books in class. He made this class very hard to follow.

Prof. Martinez was amazing. As a published author of fiction, he really had true experience to help us in our own creative writing. I would recommend him for anything because he is so down to earth and fun. It was scary at first, but class became so fun once we all got more comfortable with each other. Great, great professor!

Great professor, really interested in your ideas. On the downside he is never there for his office hours, and if you make an appointment he doesn't show up. If you're a self-starter and don't need much guidance, take his class. Good guy though, really believes that teaching is the impetus of social change.

Professor Martinez is by far the best teacher I've had in my career at OSU. He's funny, and incredibly down to earth, and as long as you try, there's pretty much no way you can get less than an A. Also, he says he keeps attendance but he doesn't. =)

I lucked out in landing w/ Martinez as my advisor and 398 prof.  He's up for favorite teacher for a reason.  Not for those who don't care about literature, ideas or who don't want to get engaged.  Buf if that matters to you - this guy is great.  (good novelist too!)  Highly recommended.
A fabulous professor; accessible, articulate & knowledgeable.  Loves teaching; and is "hip," easy to relate to, sensitive, authentic & passionate.  He's up for favorite English prof for a reason...
He is very nice and willing to help.  The journals every week are fairly easy.  This class was a lot more fun than I've heard other 398 classes were.

His class is interesting though he does digress a lot.  As long as you turn everything in and look like you put at least a small amount of effort in, you should be fine and get a high grade.  I'm not even sure he read the last couple of response papers I turned in.    Write down one or two things he says in class and regurgitate for weekly paper.

he spent a lot of time talking about politics which had nothing to do with the class. he was picky about what he wanted on papers but didnt give many guidelines. hw every week.  nice guy, but i dont like his teaching style.  he made what could have been an interesting class BORING!
Prof. Martinez is really smart and he made me want to learn more.  He can really get you to think about the stories and poetry in ways that you've never thought about.  I really enjoyed the class.
Read the assigned readings for class because there are pop quizzes.  Some written papers and participation is factored into grade.  Great Professor!

Andrew Smart is an amazing professor. His classes were entertaining and interesting to attend. We had 5 online quizzes, a presentation, and a final paper as our major grades. There were several readings but all were interesting. Andrew cared about his students and was focused on giving new views to different media, not forcing theories or info.

Andrew Smart is a very good professor he is extremely helpful and more then willing to help. He has a good sense of humor which makes classes a little more bearable. If you miss classes you fail. Two unexcused absences is the maximum until grades are affected.

Brittany was not only a great teacher but you can tell that she loves her job and cares for all of her students. SO long as  you attend her class and participate there is no reason you shouldn't succeed.

Suzannah was amazing! I had so much fun in her class. She challenges you to become a better writer and pushes you on the assignments. Her workshops were awesome and her rants about random topics were even more awesome. Would highly recommend taking Suzannah's class.

Absolutely amazing. The assignments were practical and she really cares about how you are doing in the class and works with you to help you out. Very easy on the eyes so that makes being in class even better.
Always gave tons of feedback on papers and was very helpful and approachable if you ever needed assistance.

Doesn't show up to class or respect your opinion (disagree with him and he'all tell you that you're wrong and part of what's wrong with the world). Hardly ever actually goes over the material in class. Provides personal attacks during his many never ending rants. Constantly puts down those above him and the "corrupt system." Takes 3+ weeks to grade

As an international student, this class was not that easy. In a semester, he covered 6 books(Hamlet, Midsummer night dream, Tempest etc). There are 2 exams and 2 essays. On the exams, he will give you lines what certain character said(without the character's name).  To get full point, you should write the name of character, what is the situation.

One of the most down to earth and best instructors at Iowa. Very flexible on meeting outside of class, willing to help with whatever it may be. He actually cares about what he is teaching, and that reflects in the classroom. I would highly recommend Dr. McBride to anyone.
Great teacher, easy class. Lets you choose your paper topics and makes writing enjoyable.

Great teacher! He is concerned about improving your writing and analytical skills for your future and is extremely helpful. His feedback on papers is detailed and tells you exactly what is wrong and how to improve.  His assignments are very useful and the paper topics are so interesting. I have found this class very helpful in other classes.
Great teacher. Very funny. Allows you to think outside of the box.

Matt was one heck of a teacher. Even though I'm not a big fan of sitting down and writing any papers, I still thoroughly enjoyed his class.  He was always enthusiastic and made things enjoyable. He is also not too demanding of a professor, and it is fairly easy to do well in his class. I would recommend taking him.

Matt McBride was an amazing teacher and the best one I've had all year. He genuinely cares and wants us to express ourselves and be creative. He is always so understanding on due dates and he relates with us students so well. So glad I got the chance to have him as a teacher.

Matt is easily one of the best instructors that I have ever had.  He is relaxed but serious about what he teaches. He is also very approachable when it comes to reviewing a paper before it is due.  He is straight forward with what you need to do and there aren't any surprises when it comes to his teaching.

Matt McBride is single handedly the best English teacher I've ever had. Very reasonable and loves what he teaches. He will move deadlines if you ask for more time in advance. He has an awesome sense of humor that always kept me interested in class. Being a science major, I thought this was going to be awful, but it ended up being my favorite class.
Great teacher! Really makes class enjoyable and interesting. Very easy going and helpful. As long as you do the work you will get a good grade

Matt is the best teacher ive ever had. He is laid-back, fun, helpful, interesting, intelligent, and good at teaching. He cares about his students and is enthusiastic about teaching. He does a great job of making the class understandable and relatable. Not much homework, fun, easy, interactive class. Would not miss his class for anything.

Matt is a great guy. He is young, but is very intelligent and truly cares about his students' understanding and doing well in the class. Extremely helpful as well as funny and makes the class worth going. Get Matt if you can!

This was my favorite class all semester- I was both made to interested and challenged by Matt McBride. He was extremely helpful, very funny, and pushed us all to become better writers/thinkers. I don't know what else you could want in a professor. I would highly recommend this class to anybody!
Really helpful teacher. He cares a lot about his students.
great professor all around. very helpful and really cares about what he does. one of the best teachers i have had at osu.
Awesome teacher!

The best, and most willingly helpful professor I have had so far. Everything he taught was relevant, and it was easy to understand. He had a lot of enthusiasm and wanted to get the best out of his students. Great all round professor, and very easy to talk to from a students perspective. 10/10
Great teacher and easy going.
Classy guy always enjoyed his outfits and was extremely helpful in office hours. Made class interesting and is hilarious

Solid teacher. He cultivates deeper thinking through getting the students to analyze writing and people critically. Very helpful and knowledgeable when it comes to English. Engages the whole class and explains concepts well

I loved this class! He takes attendance every class, but I never missed class because I was very interested in his lectures.  I feel that I am a better writer now that I have taken the class. He makes class super fun and he does not make you do busy work.  If you put in the work and follow guidelines, you will do fine.

He is great. Easy going and overall good character. The class is easy, always to the point. Medium use of the textbook; however, can go the entire semester without using it (as i did). Will have about 2-3 200 word small essays to write per week; but other than that no workload. No exams, just one major paper in the end of the semester. Easy class!

Great teacher, is on a first name basis with all students. Keeps his students involved without it being annoying. Work load isn't bad at all but it's definitely a class you have to do homework in a few times a week. If you put in effort, he WILL make you a better writer and thinker. Above all, he has a GREAT mustache!

This English instructor is surely an interesting lecturer and is not one to be missed! He is a great instructor who gives out snacks randomly. Not to say a class that is not too hard nor too laid back. Getting work done can almost guarantee you an A without the need of extra credits or curving. Advise? Just follows to his instruction!

The grades were ridiculous. I never know a 1110 class can be this hard. The averages of every assignments were C or D. I am not Shakespeare. She gave feedback too slow and useless. So disappointed. Do not choose her class.

Would not recommend taking this class online. The assignments are given with little to no explanation other than the description online. The due dates on the assignments/papers are 5pm. She is very slow at responding to emails, which is the only way to contact her. Her grading is extremely tough, even if peer reviews say otherwise.

Alison is pretty good at teaching the material for the course.  Her grading, however, is closer to ridiculous than anything.  She puts way too much emphasis on paper length and revisions.  Even if all of your peers thought your paper was excellent, she would drop you a couple letter grades if you didn't make "significant and meaningful changes."
She's a tough grader but will gladly help you if ask for it. You'll get a good grade in her class as long as you actually try. I really liked her and would take a class with her again.

Most of the grade is based off  of pop quizzes. Most of them you take from reading the novel 'Vanity Fair' and they're not easy. If you don't like reading, then don't take the class. The class is also VERY liberal. If you're looking for an easy Gen Ed  then I would advise looking for another class.

Dr. Cyzewski is a very caring woman and can/will work with you if you need accommodations on any of her MANY papers or assignments. There are readings every night and its expected that they be analyzed and ready for class the very next day, which can feel like busy work. She tries to make class interesting but her teaching style is a bit awkward.

Julie grades papers fairly tough, but she is a good professor overall. Her quizzes and informal writing are easy and she leads class discussions very well. I enjoyed the class albeit the reading was a lot at times.

You'll ed up reading about an hour every day. I thought this intro to fiction class was contemporary fiction like harry potter LOL but it's dry readings like one reading was cask of amontillado, lonely londoners, ajantala, the tiger's bride, just dry readings. WAYYYY much work than I wanted to do for a gen ed.
I hate english but I love Alex. Great teacher and I would recommend to anyone.

Ms. Stern is a great teacher, her energy really added to the class and to the material. Always smiling, easy to understand. Quizzes could be difficult, make sure you read the material. Really helpful.

Mrs. Stern is by far the sweetest person I have ever met. Her smile just lights up the whole room. I dont think I have ever seen her in a bad mood. She will always go that extra mile to help you out make extra office hours need be. She is very clear on what she expects in her paper and as long as you worked hard on it she will give you the benefit
Alexis is not only a great teacher, but a great person too.  I miss her energy and her smile.                                                                                               -Justin S.
She is very passionate about teaching.  I appreciate when a teacher is as dedicated to the class as you are expected to be.
great teacher, very willing to help and genuinely enjoys teaching. Highly recommended

AMAZING teacher.  She made concepts easy to understand and definitely helped A LOT with the requirements given by the department.  Sometimes would grade papers tough but offers enough help that there is no excuse to not get at least an A-.

Derek is hands down one of the best instructor's I have had here at OSU. He always has great feedback, he is a great teacher, and he's a really nice guy who is easy to approach. It's mentioned by someone else there is a TON of busy work, but that's the class' fault. I went everyday, did all the work, went to a few office hours, and got a solid A.

Derek is a great teacher. He gives good feedback and is always willing to help students. The work isn't difficult, but there's lot of it, so be prepared. I wouldn't say he was cold. I think he had high expectations for his students, and he was visibly disappointed when they weren't reaching their full potential. Do your best, and you'll get an A.
Derek will give you advice when needed and is alwasy willing to meet with you. sometimes, however, he can come off as cold.

An insightful and helpful beginner writing class. Constant busy work--reading short stories, practice writing assignments, editing every peer's story, mandatory attendance to author visits, etc.--but that's just the nature of the course. Derek always gives detailed, thoughtful feedback. Do all the work and participate in class, and it's an easy A.

Overall, good professor, he gives you advice(s) about editing your papers & gives a second chance to get a higher grade. However, he's a very tough grader, but as long as you try your best & ask him for help, you'll get an A in his class.

If you are a very good writer/English major, you can get an A in this class without opening a textbook or even speaking in class. But this class was unbearable because Willow's lectures were boring, random, and all over the place. It was difficult to know what information was important because all of it seemed unimportant. Lots of films though! :-)

Very hard to take notes. Discussions and lectures are all over the place because they are so opinion-based. She is also very soft-spoken and makes weird vague references. Do the readings or you'll be even more lost.

Nancy is a thoughtful teacher with a lot of good ideas. Her feedback was helpful and insightful and she led good discussions on published and student works, even when the class wasn't feeling talkative. Always willing to help. There is a lot of work, but it's easy. Show up to class, do all of the work, participate, and you'll get an A.
Hands down the best writing teacher I've had in any discipline. I cannot recommend her enough.
Simply the best. Take her if you're serious about writing and you will never have a better experience. Fair and very generous with her time.
A very insightful reader. Lets students choose direction of workshop, but always reigns things back in when class gets away from topic.
very vague and seems to be bitter and lofty towards students. unless you suck up, you wont do well. i feel like she barely read my poems at all.
Not too helpful. Vague comments on work that were only dealing with service issues. No real motivation to draft work successfully.
What a great, fun, interesting, and quite sexy professor! Loved her class and highly recommend enrolling in her courses!
great prof (and quite a cutie)

Andrew's class is fairly easy as long as you participate and listen to his comments about your writing.  However, he is very opinionated about everything and if you see things different than he does, you are wrong. End of story.  He often asks open ended questions to the class, only to shut down any suggestions he doesnt have in mind.
Very clear and concise as to what he expects in class. Andrew is always willing to help and will respond quickly to e-mails. I loved having him as a teacher! Ask him about his adventures in India!
Kathleen is the sweetest woman ever and loves to help her students improve their writing. She is passionate about what she teaches and also extremely talented. She is absolutely amazing.

Catherine is the best professor I have ever had. She's interesting, funny, and very laid back. Her class is so entertaining and she cusses sometimes. Haha. I'd love to take every single one of her classes if I could.
Catherine is funny and nice. She is a great professor who is not afraid to show her nerdy side and be relate-able to her students. I recommend her to anyone.

Cathrine was a great teacher. I wasn't looking forward to this class at all but after the first class, I couldn't wait to go to the next one. She is funny and helpful, and puts boring works into terms that are interesting and funny. Great teacher
Catherine is the bees knees.

Catherine is a great teacher. She is very helpfull and wants to get the class involved. Participate in class and read the handouts and you should be fine. Her grading on the papers seems to be a little hard but just keep revising it with her and you should be fine!
Nick was a fantastic teacher. He is interested in what he's teaching and understands that students have other classes. He is laid back but also very respectable. Great person :)
Easiest class I have ever taken. Nick was the man.
Good teacher.

Marvelous! Silas really cares about writing and will alwasy be there to help you! If you have SILAS Hansen as a teacher, you have been blessed and don't waste the opportunity to learn from such a great writer!
She's really helpful but class is pretty boring.

Good teacher but the business class assignments were overwhelming. Everything gets assigned for the second half of class and you are left with no time to complete them. Not ideal when taking other classes........ Wish I had taken something else.

Mr. Clark is a great teacher! He was super clear on instructions, and we always talked about things in class. Always willing to help a student out or try and advise them. Overall a great guy. He's also really cute.
Extremely good teacher!!!

I took ENG 110.01 with him. He was pretty awesome on each and every level. He was really clear with regards to instructions and conveyed the material really well. He helped people who weren't doing well in class or had missed a class. He did make us work REALLY hard though for our grades. But I would love to take another class with him.

Adam was a real laid back guy who knew how to connect to the entire class. He fed off the "smart" kids to keep the discussions alive while still involving the "quite" kids through group discussions and random questions. He loves what he does and communicates it well without talking over the heads of students
A very nice, down-to-earth guy who taught a relatively easy class.  The reading material was worth the while and the discussions insightful.  A pleasant surprise.
great instructor. Kind of cute too!
One of the best instructors at Ohio State.
He was an awesome teacher. I was completely nervous before taking his class, but it just kept getting better and better. I would definitely try and take more classes with him. Loved him.

Very interesting class. All the readings are fun (Watchmen was required reading), relevant and relatively cheap. He can be a tad boring, but he appears very interested in the course material. Very knowledgeable about all of the material covered in class. Good discussions.
This class was hard, I never had to do so much work for an english class. One thing I agree with the others, he is very boring and ANALytical!

Greg's not a bad teacher but he is kind of boring to listen to. I was really excited to take Brit Lit before the quarter began but I was a little disappointed after I started attending his class. The class could be much more interesting than it is, he just doesn't talk about the interesting points. He's just an okay professor.

Greg was very interested in teaching.  He was also interested in making his students think and cared about our opinions.  He led discussions very well.  The class is easy if you do the readings, make it to class, participate, and turn in assignments.  I would take another class taught by Greg.

The only thing I got out of Greg's class was a good grade. I felt that he was overly analytical and that when he was explaining certain things, he didn't actually answer the original question. He had almost no sense of humor, and I absolutely dreaded going to his class.
Greg is very patient and really cares that his students understand the material.  I would definitely take another class taught by him.
No Comments

Greg was really helpful, always willing to explain himself if there were any questions or anything he felt he said unclearly.  Fortunately, he's gorgeous, so that made a 7:30 Monday morning a little easier to get up for.
Greg is awesome.  He makes the class fun and easier than you think, but you still have to work hard.  I actually enjoyed English for once.

Quizzes and exams were fair (except for one quiz), and discussions were drawn out, but Nick did his best to keep the book discussions interesting for everyone. Pop quizzes are a major drawback, but definitely motivated me to go to class. Overall, a decent instructor for a boringly average class.

Nick is a great guy and teacher. He knows what he's talking about and does a good job of communicating it to the class. He expects a lot, but at the same time he realizes that the class is a GEC and not a bunch of Enlgish majors. The reading and writing assignments were interesting, fair, and helpful. I definitely recommend taking 367 with Nick!

If you are not a good writer, do not take this class. He will help you only at his convenience and when he does, it's somewhat unclear exactly what he wants from your papers. He's alright, but doesn't seem to have an opinion about anything.

Nick was a great teacher. He makes his classes interesting and he tries to find reading material that will be an easy read for everyone. I appreciated this because he took the time to research the assignments he gave, which was awesome. He is also really easy to talk to and teaches well. Be prepared to volunteer, because he expects it.
All my other friends hated their English 110 class, but taking English 110.02 with Hetrick was awesome. He put together a really interesting syllabus to keep us awake through our 7:30am class.
I learned a lot from Nick.  He is really patient and cares that his students understand.  I would definitely take another class taught by him.
VERY SMART and makes class fun!

I really liked Nicholas for 110.01, it was my favorite class that quarter. He kept things interesting and was pretty funny. He referenced many a movie and tv show and I appreciated that. I thought he was fair with papers and was very helpful in making suggestions for a better paper.
Pretty good teacher, but the class is pretty boring. Really easy class with no homework except for the papers, which are also not difficult. Very little work required for this class.
Nick is an awsome guy.  Very helpful.  Class is boring by nature but he makes it interesting.  Very easy to pay attention and has a good sense of humor.
Her class is fun and easy with just a few papers and she's nnot hard to look at ;]
shes great and you should take her class if you can
A fun class and what a beautiful woman!
She is amazing!!
No Comments

This class was really fun and easy. Sara was a very good teacher, and she was very fair about everything. Theres no tests, except for the basic paper assignments, and the final was an easy research paper.

Steve is a good guy and has the power to motivate you to write, which some professors just lack that ability. What's sad is that he easily goes off on tangents and workshops get a bit superficial and lacking.

He was totally unorganized, expected the class to do too many critiques in class,  other students' critiques were superficial and limited and he allowed this to happen, jokes far too much and could not stay on topic.  I learned very little from this class.

i felt cheated by this class.  for an upper level writing workshop, there was little structure, classes were poorly organized, critiques were led off topic, and hardly anything got accomplished.  least helpful prof ever.
The best professor I had in college. Always entertaining and helpful.

One of my favorite professors.  He's pretty crazy, but he's fun, he's smart and he listens.  The class isn't very structured, so if that's something you need, you might try a different writing workshop.  It worked for me though.
I thought she was a great teacher, she seemed clear and concise, just expect some class busywork.
get on her good side and work with her outside of class.

She treats her students like they are in high school. Instead of letting the class out early, she makes people do tons of busy work when she's run out of things to say. Unless you want to be treated like a child don't take her for anything! The only good thing about her class is that she accepts filler material on papers without noticing.
Very helpful and understanding when it comes to the assignments.  Gives you great feedback.  Do the assignments and attendence is a must!!!
Very helpful and understanding when it comes to the assignments.  Gives you great feedback.  Do the assignments and attendence is a must!!!
No Comments

Very willing to help with papers. Great editor. For essay and research make sure you pick a good topic. Color coated handouts are a nice touch. Classes interesting, welcomes student input during activities. Handing in drafts is a must. Try on the drafts and listen to her feedback you'll be fine.

She's sweet and generous and loves what she does, which makes you love it too. With any workshop, you get as much as you put into it, so it's really the student's responsibility to come to class prepared and she'll help from there. I'd recommend her to anybody.

I've taken a few courses with her and she is an asset to any student that is blessed with her presence at their university. She is a no nonsense professor, with the intention to push her students and teach. Many students don't appreciate her because of the course load and the readings, but if you are in college to LEARN AND GROW, you'll love her.
great teacher!!!!!!!!!!!
Eaton's class was not easy, but I learned a lot.  She aims to push students to think, and you will learn as much out of her class as you want to-It's that simple.
Personal agenda to push, making it difficult to understand the class material.  Will take it personal and will also seek revenge if students have not done the reading.  Avoid if you can.
No Comments

I took Ms. Eaton's 101 class a couple years ago and I still remember her as one of my favorite teachers.  She was clear, intelligent, and the goal of her class was just to make us question our surroundings, which is an admirable goal for a class.
Take English with Newton!!!
He once wrote on a major paper of mine that he "doubted [my] intellectual grasp." I found that to be exceedingly harsh and unhelpful. But he's a nice guy.
Very tough grader on papers

As said before, read! Thought-provoking class; she'll make you think and re-think what you thought you knew. Class was lecture with discussion throughout. Caring teacher, wants students to do well but makes them earn it.

One of the best professors I've had thus far, as well as one of the most interesting classes I've taken. She challenges students but it's because she wants them to think for themselves and to LEARN something in her class. As said before, READ. The quizzes are tough. Overall, however, a great professor.

She is great! I would love to take another class with her. Do your reading to do well on the quizzes. Extremely helpful and cheerful person. This class was very enjoyable and she is awesome. Do your reading, study for the tests, and listen in class, and you'll be set.

Her vast knowledge of potentially everything can be quite intimidating, but she is probably the nicest and inviting instructor I've had in the English Department. Don't raise you're hand for mere comments or suggestions: be clear, straightforward, and to the point. She keeps it fresh, but asks that you do too. Do the reading, you'll have quizzes.

She's an amazing prof. and is very interested in helping her students.  The most important thing to her is that the students get something out of the class.  A lot of reading, but it is an English class.
Teacher is extremely hard. Don't walk into this class with kid gloves. Quizzes often to make sure you read.
Very smart woman. Class is challenging with a lot of reading.
Least helpful English educator I have had at OSU. Steer clear if possible.
not enjoyable. avoid
Bad

So much work for so little reward. Impossible to impress her and her grading is brutally subjective. On top of that, just not great at teaching the content. ANY other teacher for this class is better.
Avoid, a royal pain to deal with, go with any other grad-student-"teacher" in the english dept. and your life will be much easier.
Just bad. I don't know what class she thought she was teaching, but it wasn't an entry level college course. Avoid unless you like working hard for nothing.

Does not help with papers, gives ideas she then 180s on. Can't offer useful advice during office hours, as any advice she offers she then decides wasn't as "fruitful" as she thought it would be. Extremely exhausting class compared to 95% of the other freshman english teachers. Avoid this teacher at all costs, eng 1110 is supposed to be an easy A

Willing to help, but too hard of a grader for a required freshman english class. The topic of ethnography is stupid because its all graded based on her opinion, not on how well you actually write. If you want a good grade you have to go to her office hours a lot and basically have her tell you what she wants you to write about and say, or else you wont get a good grade.

Two classes in and I'm putting this up in hopes of saving a future freshman; avoid at all costs!! Every 4 times you are tardy is counted as an absence. I'm sorry, but isn't this college? She does not allow electronics in class as well (computers, phones, etc.).

English 1110 was anything but a freshman English class, her expectations are insane. Her grading rubrics for the major projects in the class appear to be written for grad students. Worked my tail off and still didn't crack an "A". Avoid unless you're majoring in English, or wish to have every aspect of your writing scrutinized to death.
Grades freshman English class based on bad rubrics and strange standards. Very different from other 1110 teachers. Difficult to get above a B. Wouldn't recommend. Unless you're a masochist.

Absolutely awful. Appears nice, friendly, and willing to help, but then she grades ruthlessly for a freshman english class. When you go in for help, she gives you ideas for your paper and points you in helpful directions. When you implement her ideas, she then finds something wrong with them and gives you a poor grade as a result. Avoid if u want A

She seems very sweet at first because in this class all you basically do is watch movies and write 4 papers BUT she is an EXTREMELY difficult grader. This class is a requirement and all my friends had the easiest time in theirs but her class is awful, get a different professor!

Very confusing class, supposed to be an english class but it is more like a film class. She grades papers extremely hard and never explains what the paper is even supposed to be about. She will pretend to like your paper in conferences but then will destroy your paper once handed in. Take this class with a different teacher.
Very confusing and boring lectures.  No one really understood what we were supposed to be writing.  Bad class, bad teacher don't take with her
Not much work but she grades hard and is almost useless when editing your papers.  Not helpful at all and talks way to fast

Class sucks.. unless you have a class time where you watch a movie, but when she lectures it is not interactive at all and it kind of stinks. However she is a very nice lady, and there is no final which is cool. I would probably take the class again if need be.

Mrs. Pettella is one of the greatest teachers ever. She is VERY clear about what she expects, and is willing to do everything in her power to help her students get an A in her class. I HIGHLY recommend students schedule appointments to meet with her if needed, as she is MORE than happy to help you. CHOOSE HER TO BE YOUR 110 TEACHER AT ALL COSTS.
There is no finals in this class for English 110 at least. She lets you make corrections to every paper you write. I recomend her. She is also very helpful.
Nice, tries to be funny, take-home midterm and final, easy quizzes, if you're stuck having to take brit lit. this is probably the woman you want to have
Very sweet and funny. Attendance is mandatory and very strict, but class is mostly a discussion rather than a lecture. Strongly recommended!!

One of the best instructors I had at this university. I learned so many valuable things about both writing and life from him. He is seriously wonderful. Makes you write a lot, but nurtures your writing and is always so helpful and supportive
He was a great professor! He was so helpful in developing my writing. He was available for extra help and the class was pretty easy, as long as you turned in your stories.

this class was so good! Preston was so helpful and willing to help me on my writing. even though the class was super hard - he made us write a story every week! - it was a lot of fun and I learned so much about thinking and creating characters. so fun! and so hot...!
Best English teacher ever!! He's so chill and I actually learned a lot!

Pretty easy but incredibly boring. The book is used for weekly homework assignments, which don't take too much time. Attendance is taken sometimes and factors a little into final grade. The only other assignments are the midterm, final, and one easy project. Paying attention is tough because she is very monotonous, but she's very nice in general.

Easy class with no exams. She is a very nice professor and is very helpful but the class is very boring, and she grades exams pretty hard. Be very specific in your essays as she quickly takes off letter grades when you are not clear

Easy class with no exams with very few assignments. Problem is how important it then is to get good grades on these assignments. Grades essays very harshly. Tip with getting an A is when writing an essay, be as specific and explicit with what you mean as possible or you will lose letter grades.
Pretty easy class, not too much work and there are no exams.
He is just amazing and inspiring. The best teacher I've ever had in my entire college life. Too bad this is the last semester he teach at OSU.
Professor Myers came into the course with a passion for literature that was only second to his interaction with the students. Would take anything he teaches.

Myers was one of the best professors I've had and probably will have. I've never met an instructor so willing to help and discuss what we as a class wanted. I highly advise anyone to take a class with him.
Myers is amazing. He is not only a fantastic professor, he is a wonderful person. Anyone who says otherwise is simply wrong. He loves his job and he really values his students.
Entertaining discussions. Involves the students in all areas of discussion, welcomes new ideas and encourages self-thought not just rehearsed regurgitation of his own point of view.
Professor Myers is a brilliant critic and a hilarious instructor.
Soooooo arrogant. Acts like he values students' opinions but really only thinks he is right. Loves to hear himself talk. Totally useless.

She is an awesome professor, SO understanding, and very laid back. The class is easy. There is one midterm, a few easy quizzes, and two papers. The final exam is the last paper. I really love Dr. Kiser; she is passionate and knowledgable about what she teaches.

Dr. Kiser is great. She understands college students and our humor.The class is easy if you do the work. It is typically readings and weekly responses each week with an in class midterm and and a large essay for a final. Dr. Kiser will ask questions that will make you think. I am not interested in English whatsoever but I enjoyed the class!
She's very interested in her teaching, but classes were generally boring.  Only grades were two papers and two exams.  Class isn't mandatory.

Lecutes a lot, all notes are verbal. Must attend class if you want the information she is putting out.  Midterm and final include passage identification and a short essay. Easy grader as long as work is completed with effort. Funny, laid back, enjoyable
Yup, she's amazing. Funny, astute, understanding, helpful.

Very knowledgeable and kind lady. Lots of reading (it is a literature class) but very little work. Only work was in-class essay for midterm, take-home essay, take-home final, one homework per week (3-5 questions you have about text, she answers them), and one class session you help lead. Attendance not mandatory but definitely necessary.
She is fantastic. She makes it easy to understand the difficult language of the texts and she always has hilarious comments about the stories. One of my favorite professors

Her lectures are great, especially because she is able to speak old and middle english which is like the coolest thing ever to hear. Funny too because she always noted sexual symbolism in like, everything, but always preceded it with "I don't want to go too much into this, but..." and did anyway. Very nice and fair.

Kiser is a great teacher!  She is very fair and if you attend class her exams are fine.  You dont really need to read, as long as you go to class and take good notes.  She is very helpful if you go and see her.  She explains the texts very well.
Excellent teacher. There was a lot of reading, but it was worth it for the lectures.

Prof. Kiser is one of the best I've ever had.  She knows everything about the middle ages and made the class a million times more interesting than I thought it would be.  She's very kind and easy to talk to.  As long as you go to class, do the readings, and use some of her interpretations in papers, you'll be fine.
Dr. Kiser is really cool. Her teaching style is very clear, but I think she fell a little flat when she tried to lead discussions. Not everyone got to be involved.
Very personable and kind; you can tell she wants her students to succeed.  Class is very laid back, and you won't feel too intimidated to participate in dicussions.  80% of grade is from papers.

Though I was already interested in her course before I took it, her discussions made the class even more so. She's a very fair grader and as long as you read the material, her quizzes are a breeze. Her finals integrate the material but the themes and quotes are ones discussed in class, so be sure to go and you'll get an A.

She's a very nice lady and I like talking to her out of class, but I had the misfortune of disagreeing with her in my analysis of Chaucer and even though I backed it up with lots of citations from the text, she wouldn't concede that my view was valid too.
What a brilliant, informative, and kind professor.  Her class is one that I look forward to, due to her knowledge capacity.  This is what a professor should be.
So helpful, always willing to do what she can to assist her students.  Great advisor, all around good person
A brilliant scholar who is also a warm and encouraging teacher--a combination that's increasingly difficult to find.  I felt challenged at every class meeting and learned greatly from her.
Sweet, sweet lady.  Not full of herself like so many of her colleagues.  English majors will enjoy her classes.  So will people taking electives.
You can tell she enjoys teaching.  You'll have to work for a good grade, but she's not too tough.  Recommended.

Allie Wollner is an incredible English teacher with a true passion. She is also very friendly to all students and is also pretty funny. She is flexible for office hours and is willing to help any student. Best English teacher I have ever had!

Dr. Kopec is the greatest english teacher I have ever had. I am an english major and I have been writing and reading my entire life, and never have I ever been so educated as I have been by Dr. Kopec. He is a PHENOMENAL professor. TAKE HIS COURSE NO MATTER WHAT

I had to work really hard in this class, but I didn't mind  because he put in so much work and effort that it was easy for us to be motivated. He actually helped us understand how to write better, and I honestly learned a lot. His classes were interactive and he was always encouraging, and somehow he got me to actually enjoy English for once.
I've had two classes with Dr. Kopec. He is my favorite professor I have ever had. HIGHLY SUGGEST TAKING HIS CLASSES, no matter what he's teaching.
Great teacher! Really helped me improved my writing!

Spinrad is one of the best Profs I have ever had.  She is very passionate about Shakespeare and the entire history surrounding the era.  She is a tough grader but she makes you learn to write a proper essay.  Not a class for the faint of heart or those who don't like Shakespeare.  All others, dive in!  You will be sorry when it's over!
Best English class I had at OSU. Spinrad actually made me care about Shakespeare. Paper-grading was tough, but I managed decent grades after talking with her about my first paper.

I am dropping her class because it's almost the 7th week and I feel like I haven't learned a thing. If you're a visual learner, she is NOT for you. It seems as if she is not really connecting to any of the students. It's not that she's bad personally, I just can't follow her teaching style.

Listen, chumps. I got a C on my first midterm and went to her office and discussed my paper with her and I got nothing but A's and a lot of praise for the rest of the quarter. Can't write excellent papers? Don't take on the Spinrad cuz she'lll blast ur arse

The first C I've ever received on a paper. Everyone is saying that she just wants you to reguritate what she says, however, when I did that on exams I got the comment "You're just re-writing what was said in lecture" written next to every essay. I still have no idea what she wants from her students, except to be able to tear apart their every word.
She wanted us to "dig deep" into  the play "Everyman", which is about as deep as a puddle. I felt like I had to dumb down what I was capable of writing to get a good grade in this class.

Dr. Spinrad is the diggity dawg smiggity smog. When you get your first midterm back you will want to cut off her hands and bury them. And then, when you let go of your ego, you will see that she was totally right in tearing you apart. Anyway, Spinrad knows her shakespeare. She will provide you with really profound insights to the PUREGENIUSofSHKSPR
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!

Grades like you ate her children, but once you go see her in her office, she lightens up. You can't BS a paper in this class. She takes attendance (before class and after the break, so no sneaking out.) She's a tough professor but she does really care about shakespeare. A bit weird though, I wouldn't really recommend her.
If you enjoy Renaissance Literature, maybe you'll love her. Maybe you'll even love the C papers she'll return to you too.

Professor Spinrad is totally awesome. I really enjoyed her teaching style, and the class discussion. She's pretty awesome. I found her to be a very, very hard grader, though (my first C on a paper in my college career, I'm an English major and a senior), but yeah,  I definitely earned that C.

Spinrad was entertaining overall and really loves the material but only gives you half the class time for an essay exam and expects you to write every single detail and exactly the way she wants to hear it.  Be ready to write for exams!!!!

You will not be "analyzing" Shakespeare's plays in this course.  Instead you will be spoon-fed Dr. Sprinrad's own personal interpretation of the text and God help you if you stray from that interpretation on tests or papers.  Banking style education at it's finest.  Recommended for anyone who doesn't mind being told what to think.
Phoebe's way rad!!! TAKE HER! :)

There are many things that can be said about Spinrad. I went into her class loving Shakespeare and everything he had ever written. Now I detest Shakespeare and the pretentious academic bullcrap that he represents. This is OSU, not 'Nam, and I don't need a drill sergeant as my professor. Spinrad has ruined Shakespeare for me forever. Thanks, Phoebe.

I didn't find this class as hard as everyone else seemed to--the Captain is pretty straightforward about what she expects on tests and papers, and her lectures are very enlightening and engaging.  Wicked sense of humor.  I got As on every test and assignment, so it's definitely not impossible.

Dr.Spinrad is a VERY VERY EXTREMELY Hard grader. She expects ALOT out of you, especially in Honors classes. Be ready to read critically and in depth of the plays.Be prepared to have you papers Dissected. Overall, it is clear that she loves what she is doing and knows alot. Go to office hours for any and EVERYTHING.....in the end it should pay off.

I agree with the above. I want to emphasize a point: she can be a subjective and erratic grader. On each of 5 essays of an exam over ONE play, I got an A-, B+, B-, C, C-.  Having read, attended class, and studied I can only assume there is a flaw in her grading style. MANY OTHERS experienced this and shared the frustration that this "quirk" caused.

Learned a lot from her but that didn't seem to matter in my grades. She expects you to parrot back exactly what she thinks, not to use your own ideas. Interesting lady but has sucked any bit of enjoyment out of Shakespeare for me.
The best I've had at OSU yet. Knowledgable, interesting, sarcastic, and entertaining. Regardless of how you feel about Shakespeare, take the class. PS. She TELLS you EXACTLY what will be on the exam.

She is hysterical!  Very sarcastic, and a picky grader.  But you get chances to revise your paper AND midterm, so she's hard, but fair.  I learned a lot from her class, tons of insight into Shakespearean culture.  Her analysis of Hamlet is especially enlightening.  For tests, make sure you repeat everything she says in class, then you'll be golden!
Totally worth it.  Her Renaissance sex jokes were hilarious...
we don't need the drill sergeant motif at ohio state!

She tries to say she's super hard to scare people off. She's not unreasonable at all (i.e. gives you exam questions before the exam!). She tells you upfront she's the chair of COAM and she reads all the spark notes, cliff notes, etc so just don't be an idiot and use them. you just have to take good notes in class and regurgate what she says.

she prides herself on being the hardest grader in the english department. she told us the very FIRST day.  i should have dropped the class then. she was boring and almost made me hate shakespeare's work. the only way to pass this class is to kiss up to her and quote back everything that spews out of her mouth on the exam.

Amazingly poor professor. She ALMOST made me dislike the greatest English author ever born. To her, all other critics are morons and no production has ever gotten it right. If you know NOTHING about the Bard, you'll learn something. Otherwise, take another class, or read Shakespeare:Our Contemporary.

I HATE Shakespeare, but she definitely made the class interesting (or, at the very least, bearable). She demands respect from her students, but in return she respects them. Don't take her class if you want the easy A. In the end, though, it's pretty reward

Horrible, horrible, horrible...do not take Spitwad's class unless you a White Anglo-Saxon Catholic! She is very old-school preachy and should retire! The trick of passing her class? Study the New Testament. Tape record her lectures and repeat word by word what she has taught on her essays. Her classes are not intended for critical thought!

My experiences with Prof. Spinrad were my most memorable and cherished at Ohio State.  She made me a better writer and a better student.  I took every class she offered and each was enjoyable and motivating.  I can not recommend her enough (foot stomp).

Great class. In a nutshell, if you put the effort in, you'll learn to write clear and concise essays, and you'll also learn a bit about life through her stories about her years as a captain. I was so stoked to take this class and I wasn't let down!

I found Prof Spinrad to be a fair teacher.  She let her students know what she wanted to see in assignments and exams.  She always made herself available for office hours for students seeking clarification.  Anyone who rates her unfavorably clearly is NOT a serious student.

Dr. Spinrad is the best professor I have ever had. Her expectation of excellance forced me to learn how to write. Also, her consistency in standing by her convictions & teaching the truth has forever changed my life, and my living. She is truly a teacher, deserving of utmost respect and gratitude.

Had her for a course on Machiavelli and other writers of the period.  She was great--a genuine "broad," and I mean that in the most complimentary of terms.  I learned tons.  If people think she's a hard grader, they must be used to pretty easy classes.  She was in the middle as far as grading goes.

Very dismissive of students. Insists on being called Prof. Spinrad, depsite all other profs in dept. going by their first name. Isn't interested in anything outside of her two feet. Does the word hubris mean anything to you? Epitome of the worst in academia.

She is incredibly intelligent, but has a very distinct personality and sense of humor so you either love her or you hate her. She is a hard grader but she makes your writing so much better for it. Take Shakespeare with her--it's super easy.

Spinrad is definitely a diffifult professor, but well worth the effort. Her attitude can be very off-putting, but she'll bend over backwards to help you do well in her class and afterwards. Plus, she writes the BEST recommendations, so make friends!
No Comments
interesting class, but TOUGH grader.  papers must say what she wants to hear, but if you go to office hours, she'll tell you what to write.

Very good Prof! Yes, she is a difficult grader. Yes, her classes are hard. Yes, you have to work to get anywhere in her classes. But if you do what she asks and follow her directions you CAN get an AI did. She also has a very witty, dry humour. Dont exp

Knows her Shakespeare--but very hard grader.  GPA-killer here.  Seriously.  She commented on a paper that I sounded like Dogberry myself.  That hurt.  You also get to memorize a long-ass soliloquy (sp?) from Hamlet or some****.
This teacher sucks a big one.  Don't ever take any of her classes--it's a waste of time and money.

She's definitely a hard ass about grading.  However, she is passionate about her work and although you may not do as well as you'd like in her classes, you will learn something.  Isn't that what scholarship is all about?
Outstanding instructor.  She is passionate about her subject, and her enthusiasm is contagious!  I would highly recommend this instructor (but come prepared to work!).
Fantastic teacher.
VERY difficult grader, but teaches a fun class. Probably the most interesting professor in the English department. Don't expect any A's, though.
Can you say  Narrow-minded ..? She can...
Hard professor but fair; she won't let you suffer forever for one mistake.  Willing to meet and discuss anything.
Stop whining. A Shakespeare scholar form whom I learned much.
No Comments
Obessed with Star Trek & smokers rights, must think like she does or pay for it
No Comments
Generally understanding, willing to help you in a crisis situation, HARD grader!
Learn to write what she wants to read, or else yer in trouble.
Obsessed with her years of being in the military.  Memory passages pointless.
hardest grader in the dept but im glad i took her class- learned a lot
Ms. Falcon is a fair grader. If you show interest in her class and go to class and do the work, you'll be fine.
you will not find a better teacher, hands down and feet up. she's a swell lady and yuh will do well in this class if you show up. she's rather awesome fellow students obtaining that higher education

Asha was an incredible teacher.  She made class interesting everyday, playing music, showing clips from films, etc.  As long as you show up to class, you will get a good grade. (by good, I mean an A). If you have the opportunity to take a class from Asha, do it!!

Asha is the best english teacher that you can possibly have. She is probably my favorite teacher at OSU. She is easygoing and runs lots of fun activities so that incorporating methods in your paper comes naturally.

Asha is a really great professor; she has a great sense of humor (we watched part of superbad in class and she liked it, and she swears sometimes), she is always willing to help you, and she is not a very harsh grader unless you can't write to save your life. If you can have her for english, do it!
It's a difficult class, be prepared to put in the work, but he makes it awesome. A really great professor and easygoing. Definitely a worthwhile class if you like creative writing.

Very boring class, but that's no fault of the teacher.  Bill tried to keep things as interesting as the subject matter allowed (which was minimal).  Expect to write alot as with any 110 class.  Grading was semi-harsh in terms of a GEC but gave plenty extra opportunities to make up for it.

Super nice person, reasonable workload (7-8 hrs per week), fun class outside of the lecture portion. Discussion-based, but if you talk at least once per class you should be okay. Do the readings and pay attention and it's not hard to get an A

Just be prepared for the reading quizzes and participate in discussions and you'll be fine. You don't need to read completely through every book--just enough to get a good idea of each (and on the nights before quizzes!). The professor was nice, reasonable, and enthusiastic about the course, though lectures could get boring at times.

Mary is a good teacher, but her lectures can be a little boring to sit through unless you really love poetry. Not an insane amount of work: readings, 5 posts on Carmen, one shorter paper, midterm and final. I got an A but really put in some effort, especially studying for the lengthy midterm.

I took british literature with Mary and she was so interested with the material. She really wants her students to learn and if you participate and show up to class you will be fine. I cant say enough great things about Mary! If you take her class get excited because shes great!
This class was pretty good, a lot of reading, but her lectures are EXTREMELY boring. And her teaching style is kind of weird.   But she's not bad.
Really nice teacher. Explained the readings well, liked to have class input and kept the classes rather interesting. Highly Recommended

Every class was very interesting, and I learned many new things each time. I was already a very good writer, but she made me into an amazing writer. The Ohio State University should be very proud to have such a valuable mind among its staff.

Annete was so helpful and understanding. She offered me an extension when I had three midterms the day a paper was due. Go to class and take good notes and you will be fine. Know the study guides for midterm/final. Enjoyable class.

Really into the subject, and really accessible for meetings and appointments. Very helpful and willing to answer questions. Tests are kind of hard (mostly essay/short answer) and the questions are thurough, but the study guide is really helpful. Reading the texts is definitely a must for passage identification.
Annette is helpful and really wants you to do well. The class is a lot of group work. You do presentations and write several small paper assignments. You also get to design your own assignments.
She is a very helpful teacher and is very good at explaining things.
So amazing.

Annette was a fantastic teacher, she was extremely helpful, tried her best to make sure you understood everything, and was very kind with grading, even to those who did not deserve a kind response (turning in a paper a week late). Nonetheless, take this class with her if you need to.

Annette is wonderful. She is so helpful and communicates the subject matter very clearly. She encourags students to voice their opinions and gets really excited about the material, which is always fun. I highly recommend her!

Annette is great!! She is so friendly and really listens to her students. She really cares about what she does and tries to make the class as easy for people as she can. Very helpful. Make sure to read those headnotes!
Annette was great, really helpful and understanding. The class is not hard but you do have to go, also keep up with the readings as most classes are discussion based.
No Comments
Material could not have been more boring, but the papers were few and far between. Chris is a character-I laugh everyday in the class-very entertaining :)

Boring material, but Chris actually made it exciting with her energy, jokes, and passion. She clearly loves to teach and was always willing to help students. Very understanding and very sweet. And the easiest grader I'd ever had! Never bought the textbook... All the material can be found online.

The course material is boring, but Chris is probably one of the few professors who could make it remotely exciting! She is sweet, energetic, funny, passionate, and understanding. It's obvious that she enjoys teaching and talking to students. Always willing to help and constantly mentioned that she wanted everyone to pass. Also, EASIEST GRADER EVER!
GREAT TEACHER!!!!

I loved this class!!  I had just icked up English as my second major and this was my first major related course -- she made it such an enjoyable experience.  You can learn a tremendous amount from her, but she makes it interesting and her energy level is off the charts!  :)

There are no words I can say about Chris aside from absolutely phenomenal. Amazing human being and just as good as a professor. I got to know her very well throughout the quarter and having her was something that brightened my day every class period. Almost anyone can get along with her and enjoy her lectures. Good choice Ohio State!

Chris is an excellent teacher. She creates a laid back atmosphere that is conducive to learning. She takes the boring stuff and makes you waut nt to come to class. Her quizzes were simple as long as you read the plays and I got over a hundred percent on the mid-term. If you want an easy A, but still want to learn something, take her class!

Chris is awesome! Her lectures are interesting and she is always full of energy! Her tests are really easy as long as you read the plays and take notes during the lecture. Good class if you want to learn everything about Shakespeare, but do not want to spend an incredible amount of time on essays and other tedious assignments.

Chris is awesome. She really helped me out and was hilarious. First class in a while I actually wanted to go to. She does her best to make the boring material at least a little interesting. Do anything you can to get her as a teacher, it's worth it.
Chris is the best !

Chris is the best teacher you will ever have at Ohio State.  Everyone gets As and everyone learns too!  She is crazy and hilarious and makes the class worth going to, even though you dont really need to go.

Awesome, they don't come any better than Chris. She loves teaching, loves being helpful, and loves passing the entire class. You will pass. Kind, caring, enjoys her students and being a professor. She's out to help you pass GECs. Take any class of hers that you can get. I know I can definitely count on her after the quarter is over for anything.
If you want an off the cuff, off color, slightly inappropriate professor. Pick Chris. She is fantastic and a lot of fun. Works with you to get the grade you want. Take every class you can with her.

fun class, one of the only professors office hours that i frequented once a week. random stories and conversations about the coolest of topics, one of the most fun classes i had at OSU. understands that GECs are kind of a pain so makes it as painfree as possible while still teaching the required material. highly recommended
chris was the best teacher i have had in my entire time at ohio state. i absolutely loved her. she was helpful and really funny!  TAKE HER CLASS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Chris is fantastic, she is always willing to help students and understands that english 201 is gec class and wants everyone to pass....with As....the final was an oral final which consisted of saying what you learned for the quarter! she always made class entertaining with all of her crazy stories and really made you want to go to class!!!
Chris is totally awesome. She answered everyone's questions and was just really nice and friendly. It was good experience being in her class.
Chris is great - she made me write better and she's really funny.
A mean and nasty person. Not at all helpful. She will intentionally goad a student into anger to cover for her failures. AVOID.

Extremely boring. I didn't pay attention to anything and did the bare minimum not to fail. Luckily the course is Pass/fail... I'm glad I took this class because it corresponds to the internship, but the class itself is boring and useless.
Really nice instructor and willing to work with you within reason.  Not the most interesting class, nor the most interesting teacher; however, if you go to class, you should be fine.

Trish was pretty good teacher. Her papers were not very difficult. Her reading assignments however were somewhat boring. She isn't a hard grader-this was the first class I ever took at OSU and I got an A. You just need to do the work.

worst prof i have ever had, didnt know what the hell she was talking about, gives little to no paper turn around time, grades harshly, has no valuable critisisms on drafts, frankly the woman is annoying and i cant stand her. she has no idea how to teach and she needs to stop now!!!
Nice lady, but not very clear on some papers.  Very strict about plagurism, be careful.  She tried to report most of my class for plagurism after we turned in a paper.

Loved her class!! I never liked English before her class. She is very helpful, and great at teaching. She really cares and takes the time out on each persons essay to make sure we understood. Helps that she is very cool and easy to talk to as well. She made class fun.
bvb
Great class. completely discussion based. I don't know about "hot" but definetely cute.

Rebekah was awesome! The class was great and the topic "The American Experience: Alien Invasion" made English interesting, if you can actually believe that! As an accounting major I really enjoyed this class.
Rebecca was fabulous!  She made this required class fun and exciting.  Usually, it's impossible to know which TA is teaching a class, but if you can get Rebekah, try to!
No Comments

Wow...where do I start?! Not the best, but not the worst teacher either. She's kind of a feminazi, but then again my class theme sucked. She's a nice TA, but it does seem like she hates men (always girls vs boys). Also, i didn't learn much from her.
Very helpful, patient and nice instructor who really cares about her students. Responded to emails so fast...Gives very specific feedback.

Given the comments before, I just wanna say she's really changed. Very nice and helpful. Maybe it's because the course she's teaching is 108 instead of 107 now. Well, she's not an intructor who just plays with you in class, but really wants to tell you sth, wants you reap sth from it. She's not only an instructor, but also can be a genuine friend.
DO NOT take her class!!

She won't give an A, the explaination she gave is "A means perfect, and nobody is perfect." so people who are trying to get an A in EDU T&L 107 may not want choose this instructor. and she talks so slow that you might fall into sleep which my friend did in the first two week.

Ashley is a new teacher, but she's a natural.  Her warmth and self-deprecating sense of humor keep the classroom open and fun.  The class is workshop based and she was so good at facilitating critiques in a constructive, efficient manner.  I loved the class and after taking it am now planning on a creative writing minor.

She requires a lot of groupwork and class participation. She is excited about her work. She really goes into detail on the material. There is a lot of reading in her course, but the assignments are very manageable and the exams are take-home.

She is very upbeat and is very excited about her work. She does a great job explaining the material and really encourages class participation. The class was easy and required very little work. There is a lot of reading, though. She is very easy on the eyes.
Keeps things light and fun. Easy to get a good grade.
Had Ms. Ravert for Intro to Fiction Winter 09.  She is young, pleasant to be around and genuinely interested in the subject of fiction writing/analysis.

She is a great young teacher. Will go over the readings and lecture then let you choose some classmates to group with so you can discuss the topic some more. Shes very helpful with any questions and is nice and funny. Very very smart choice.

i took her class only last year but i'll always remember her. you can learn a lot from her. my ability to make and critique arguments improved a lot. the only complaint i have is that her handwriting is beastly.....
worst teacher ever. ridiculous. can't grade well if you pay her. i think she just gives out random grades. it's embarassing that she even has a job at ohio state. who knows how she got it

yeah the class is easy, but she's crazy. babbles on and on about random plays and shows you probably haven't seen. talks to hear herself talk, and frankly is just annoying. doesn't grade papers for content but rather for punctuation and spacing? take it if you want an easy class, but i have no idea why she's still teaching

I had her for Honors Drama Lit and she is everything you could want out of a Drama Lit teacher. She wears adorable outfits, talks straight, and relates the work to real life. She makes the class very easy and relaxed. We don't have attendance in the class but everyone goes if only for the entertainment value. Awesome teacher :-)
Very good teacher. Hilarious woman who finds a way to make everything interesting. Really helped improve my writing from the start of the year. Definately a candidate for "what not to wear"

One of the best professors that you'll ever have. She doesn't waste your time. She has efficient teaching methods and is really funny. She will get you out early nearly everyday but at the end of the quarter you'll be surprised by how much your writing has improved. This was H110.01 by the way.
very good professor. realizes the class is a GEC and makes it as tolerable as possible. very entertaining and very smart.
Very good teacher. Makes class interesting and tailors her teaching agenda to fit each class personally. Just read the material and know how to write beforehand and it should be an easy A.

Dr. Mitchell is a very quirky and amusing professor. I only took the class as a GEC, but actually enjoyed going to class. She offers infinite help if you ask for it on papers, and is willing to go back and discuss any questions and comments you might have. Overall, a very good professor.

honors 110.02 class.  she likes to give examples of themes that are discussed in various poems, stories, and plays, is very good at getting her point across.  often uses pop culture in discussion, good sense of humor. fairly easy class, read a short story for about every class, three essays (20% of grade each), free writes, and class participation.
Perfect professor for a easy class. Really easy going, easy class. Perfect for a writing class that I did not want to take. The papers are hard though, so put forth effort there.

Best teacher I've had at OSU.  Had him as a freshman, I'm now a senior.  Extremely helpful, and I really liked writing after I was done with the class. Material was actually rather dry and he made it as interesting as it could be.  He also talked about Napoleon Dynamite all the damn time and it was great! Wish I woulda kept in touch with that dude.
Great class, do the work, be nice and you are bound to get an A.
Taught a good class with clear expectations and standard homework load. Not too hard, and a forgiving grader, as long as you've done the work. Facilitates good discussion in the classroom.
Prof. Burke is the best!  Plus she's pretty hot :)
really cool and makes the class as fun, shes done teaching after spring 2011 though :(
Fun and interesting. She's cute and picks good material, fun for a lit class.

Great prof! Provided background info that made the material easier to understand.  Attendance mandatory but can miss a few days it's ok.  Really interested in the material and getting people to understand it.  Brought coffee and donuts to the 7:30am final- fun class, good workload- go to class and read the material- should get an A.
She's really nice and funny. She brought donuts for us b/c we came in the day before Thanksgiving. She's smart too and loves what she does. Great teacher, take her if you can!
Nice guy, good teacher. Demands class participation and you can't BS a paper he wants real ideas. Grades hard but is very willing to help so ask sooner rather than later. Class is very interesting.
He was intense and made you earn your grade, but I found when you put in the effort you get the grade you want. Class participation is required.

Consult with him before your final submissions and he will steer you straight. He is intense, wants real ideas, a lot of fun and hot as hell. You will enjoy the class and your writing will be better structured as a result.
He will not give A's on anything and will find a way to subtract points on anything that you write

Bart is very strict on everything. He somehow finds something wrong with presentations and essays to give you a bad grade or anything but an A. He expects you to actively participate at every class and if not you automatically lose a letter grade.  It's a freaking English class, give me a break. I would highly recommend William Hall.
The best teacher around, would love to help you any time. Consult the essays with him before final submission, you will definitely get an A in this class.
Cares alot about his students. Extremely helpful, and willing to help at almost any chance he can get. One of the best professors I have had.

he knows what he's talking about, and is more than willing to help.  He was very very good at picking apart our short stories during workshops, i learned a ton more from him about short story writing than i did from the textbook that we studied at the beginning of the course.

A good teacher with a laid back attitude. despite the fact that my class was at 7:30 in the morning, things were still interesting. put some thought into your papers, and you'll do fine. if not he's more than willing to help. best part about the class was how non-specific the essay prompts were
Bart is veryhelpful. He concerned about his students and taking time talk to us individually about our papers.
No Comments

I took this class for a GEC, and it was a fairly easy A.  As long as you keep up with the readings, the quizzes are simple.  Although it's easy, Jeff is NOT helpful outside of class.  Highly disorganized and doesn't return emails.  Talk to him in person if something needs done.  Otherwise, it's one of the easiest classes I've taken at OSU

Amazing teacher, dynamic and entertaining. Knows what he's talking about, can lead discussion well, and is fun to be around. Grades fairly easy and gives a lot of grace. Best teacher at OSU I've had so far!
Great guy, very articulate and easy to pay attention to in class.  Go to his office hours for any help.
Great at keeping class involved, he's very funny and sarcastic. He can take a joke which is good. Graded tuff, but fair. No complaints!

Awesome lecturer, but terrible time mgmt. Never had grades prepared when students asked. I didn't know what my grade going into the FINAL!! Unacceptable, maybe there were some personal issues I don't know, but he is a great speaker and very knowledgeable. Frustrating
great!
He's such a nice man. He always speak slowly for student's convinience, and caring and devoting.
If you try hard to write your paper, it is easy to get A.
I never dreaded this class and rarely got bored. He's very chill and has interesting and fun activities! Definitely became a better writer.
Great teacher, very helpful to students who actually want to apply themselves.  Down to earth and his class is enjoyable to go to. Not bored at all during class!

He was an awesome prof and answered every question I had at his office hours, and I was there a lot. And he really takes the time to look through your work and give you helpful advice for essay writing in the future. Very glad I had him.
Really nice, friendly guy. There are a lot of little assignments but as long as you keep on top of things the class isn't bad. Good content
I'm not an English person but Mr. Fleischmann is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He's a great teacher who grades fairly and shows a lot of enthusiasm.

He can be be funny and interesting as well as has helpful things to say about your writing. If you just do the work and show up to class, you'll get an A, it doesn't matter how good of a writer you are.

Extremely easy class just do the essays and do the stated word count. Don't bother reading the textbook it's pointless but keep up with the novel reading (it's usually about 50 pages a week, takes less than an hour).
Only taken one English class but he was awesome. He is a little goofy and weird but he really helped me write better thesis.
No Comments

If you are dying to take a Bible class at OSU, try to take Prof Farmer's honors 280 even if you are not an honors student. Peterson is not so great- she's boring and makes the class seem very easy in lecture, but then her exams asks the most random, insignificant questions. I've never regretting wasting my time with a class more than this one.

The class wasn't hard. And although I'm a huge poetry fan and this was a poetry class, I got a B on my final paper (which I attest was extremely well written, and she will not give it back to me since I didn't submit it with an envelope, it' absurd) and ended with a B+. She would not budge on reconsidering my final paper grade so I could get an A-.

Oh where to begin. If you plan on missing a SINGLE class DO NOT get this professor. She starts class early quizzes every class. Takes attendance based on quizzes. Will mark you ABSENT if you are late! On the plus if you are a literature nut she is incredibly interested in her field. Lectures are painfully boring.
Ugh.
