didn't like her teaching style. everyday the same:gave us background info, then did partner/group work to look a bit closer into the book of the Bible, and then she read an excerpt from some 18th cent novel tht makes 1 word allusion to the Bible. usually got out of class 30-60 min early. didn't know what to study for midterm but i got a 100
Dr. Kwon provides very helpful advice for your paper and if you follow her comments you end up writing a much better essay. Her teaching style is also brilliant too.

I had Kyounghye awhile ago and she was awesome. Her lectures were informative and she was great at leading discussions.  She makes you think about the books in interesting ways. I'd definately recommend.
I loved having Kyounghye for this class. The class is focused on interpreting plays and she picks very interesting ones. Sex was a common theme in some texts. She is very funny and cute as well!

Choice of texts painfully dry and/or random.  Included a severe overdose of "clash of cultures" texts.  Included M. Butterfly (French guy loves chinese crossdressing spy), Death & The King's Horseman, Los Vendidos, Ubu Rex, and Rhinocerous. On the whole texts felt to be without literary value.  Her teaching ability however is fine.
kyounghye knows a lot about shakespeare. she's a pretty good prof. made me a lot more intersetde in the plays.

Kyoung Hye was very understanding and helpful. Her exams were hard but fair and if you talked to her she said exactly what she wanted. You can do well as long as you do all the reading. She's also really cute (;

Kyoung Hye got a lot of complaints for being "the worst teacher ever."  in truth, she wasn't bad at all and actually pretty helpful.  at the beginning of the quarter, she was very nervous and hard to understand, but this got better.  it's easy to convince her to change the workload if you complain enough. class is easy if you go and take notes.

Actually Kyoung Hye was great. she explained everything and was fun and made total sense. At least you do very well if you do the work, and her grading criteria was clear. She told us what she wanted and explained her grades. Very good prof. I highly recommend.

Probably the worst class I've had the unfortuanate experience of taking during my entire college career. Students would regulary walk out on class early. Uncomfortable with authority, oblivious to class flow or attention, unclear grading  criteria, general inexperience. Avoid this professor at all costs.

Kyounghye was a great teacher.  She made everything seem difficult, but really if you put in the effort it is an easy A.  She does a good job of making you think about the subject matter, so it was actually interesting.  Also, she never just sits there and lectures.  Good class, easy A.

Kyoung hye is fun and chooses interesting topics for the class.  The American Experience was translated in my class into movies, tv shows, and whatever else we wanted to discuss.  Very easy if you do the work.

easy A. the class isn't too bad, but some of the assignments were annoying. you have to go to class b/c he takes attendence & u have to email him if you cant make it to class. Baker is the type of teacher that likes for people to talk and be active (u do a lot of group work). other than that, its a class that is managable for 3 months of a quarter
it was a fun class. i expected more modern books tho.

Michael Baker was an amazing instructor, he encouraged class discussion but also made it fun. His reading quizzes were frustrating, but made you keep up with material and he even drops the lowest three. He's very, very fair if you put in the effort. He is even willing to work with late assignments, if you make an effort. Wonderful and recommended!

The last poster is wrong. He gave all papers back in a  week. He is the kind of teacher where if you do your work and come to class you will do well. He does give a lot of background info but its not so bad.

Michael Baker is really boring and way too into little unimportant history details instead of teaching an English class. He doesn't give you your tests and papers back for weeks so you never know what your grade is.  He's never in his office hours so you can't get help.  Avoid his class unless you like to be bored and frustrated.

Michael is awesome. He's hard if you don't go to class though. But if you do go, he literally tells you everything he wants on the tests. If you just listen to what he says, you will get a good grade on the exams. Also, the papers are super easy, and again he tells you what he wants. He also gives good feedback if you didn't do so well.
You have to go to class, but he obviously has a strong sense of his time period. He cares about teaching and sends you feedback after response papers.

Definately get into this english 110. Talked to so many others. this is the easiest/most beneficial. Only homework is 3 papers. You get to redo 1. Grades them hard,but you're allowed to email them to her and shell tell you exactly what she wants beforehand. watched movies and actually learned a little. Shes interesting

Easy A! Let's you regrade essays and all you do is watch movies. Like the other person said, discussion days will want to make you end your life, but other than that its all movie watching.  I've talked to lots of other students who took 110.01, and no one's class comes even close to being as easy as this one.

Easiest class I have ever taken. Discussion days may drive you to boredum induced suicidal thoughts, but nearly every other class you watch a movie so it's not all bad. Easy A, and she allows rewrites for new grades. She's a bit oblivious though. She once thought the sound was broken on a movie because she didn't realize it was fast forwarding...

Easiest class you will ever take. You don't even read anything, its all movies. Class is really boring though. You write 3 papers, which are all relatively short. She is a little stange, but if you want an easy A take her class, she wants to give you an A!
She was by far the easiest teacher ive had in college so far. Easy A!

Milligan was a decent english professor. The class itself is extremely boring and will make you want to shoot yourself; however, she grades extremely easy on papers and is one of the nicest teachers I have worked with. I would recommend signing up for her section. She is very laid back overall and will help you out if you need assistance.
Easy class. Very nice and helpful as an instructor. Very opinionated, but that just makes things interesting ;)
Wonderful, easy class.  We watched movies and talked about them.  Milligan is super nice and very willing to help.
Fun teacher. Very easy though.

kind of a pointless class we watched 6 movies, discussed them, and wrote three papers.  that was it.  she said if you were there on the last day of class you received 100% for attendance, which was 5 % of the grade. i got a b+ with basically no work.

Very opinionated and grades that way too.  I am an English major and did not enjoy changing my papers to fit her opinions.  However, it's very nice to be able to rewrite your papers after getting feedback.  Easy A

Take her class on folklore for your 2nd english requirement.  AWESOME class.  the final paper is a little lengthy for no aparent reason, but it is more than made up for by the cool information and fun classes.  easy class/grading as long as to do the work required of you (which isnt much) :)
awesome prof.  Let's you rewrite your papers if you don't like your grade and she regrades them.
Easiest class ever
Class was super easy, and really interesting. I really liked it
This class was so interesting.  She really knew what she was talking about, and made you look at things from a different perspective.  She also makes it really easy to get a good grade.
easy class, we watched sci fi movies rather than reading stupid books.  Shes great
Really great teacher. Not too difficult, interested in what she taught. There wasn't too much work in the class either.
Best teacher ever! I learned so much.

In this class we read current authors and they came in to discuss their works. Lee's teaching style was warm, loose and insightful. He knows his writing and he KNOWS literature. He's a warm man who does not waste words. I recommend him highly, especially for English Majors focusing in Creative Writing.

If you're serious about writing, you'll be well served to at least listen to what he has to say. He can be harsh, but his feedback is genuine. Most of his feedback comes through class discussion-- don't expect extensive notes or comments on your manuscript. I found him to be a warm, funny guy with a profound understanding of how story works.
Lee K's class is insightful and probably the best thing I ever did for my writing.
I think he still cares.  Go figure.
Brilliant and witty and amusing. You'll work hard, but you'll enjoy it
good guy
Great class, he was insightful, funny and very knowlegeable.
I find him a very good prof he is interesting and seems to bring the subject alive in a wonderful manner

Makes you comfortable in a workshop, very talented, very interesting take on looking at/dissecting different story concepts/constructs. Fun to have in a classroom period. Looked forward to this class all quarter- I'm not a class-goer typically. Reminded me of why I want to become a writer. Amazing handling of language, even in speech.
No Comments
No Comments

A brilliant writer and editor and funny guy.  As a teacher, though, he's typical for OSU English:  doesn't teach so much as judge what you do.  His comments were often insightful, even if he plays favorites in the classroom.
The best teacher I've ever had.
Good guy, sweet as hell.
Rob is a very helpful instructor. he inspired my life.Plus, he is also the hottest teacher in the english department
I liked Rob. He tries to make the class as non-boring as possible and really tries to help students.
A generally easy class. She gives great feedback on assignments. Creative and analytical thinking is rewarded.
She makes the class fun and easy.
Learned a lot. She is a very understanding teacher and is willing to help you in every way she can.  Take her if you have the chance!  You will learn a lot.
DONT LEAVE US!!!!
Ann is an awesome teacher.  She really helped me improve my writing!  I would recommend her to anyone who needs to take this class.  She also has the coolest shoe collection!

Really easy class with not much work required. Ann is so cute and extremely nice- willing to help with whatever. She also bought us pizza twice this quarter =) The group project in place of a long paper was a bonus.
Made english class enjoyable for once, im an engineering major and loved this class.  anne is funny and helpful and hot hot hot. take this class.

Ann loves the philosophy and teachings of Derrida...that in itself is wonderful. She is extremely intelligent, loves dogs in jackets, and the Pittsburgh Steelers. I dont think i could have found a better teacher.
She was definitely one of my favorites.  Shes funny and she likes rap.

Miss Godfrey is such an awesome professor.  She is intelligent beyond belief, and she is really good at what she does.  From her I learned so much and I had a great time doing it.  If I could take her again, I would.  Her appearance is secondary to her intelligence and teaching ability, but I must say she is HOT and wears the cutest outfits!!
Ann is so nice and truly loves what she does.  Even when she tripped the one time, she laughed about it and we all bonded. Plus her outfits are very cute...defintely take this class!!!
Pretty good teacher. Doesn't like if you fall asleep a lot, but pretty nice. She reminds me of Nancy from the show Weeds, which is awesome.
Actually made a class about Shakespeare somewhat interesting, which is hard to do. I would recommend her as a teacher to anyone.
Good teacher, young and very attactive
Great teacher. Easy to understand. Nice to look at.
Lectures are mandatory and a little boring but she tries her best to make it fun.
Very interested in material.  Makes class fun and casual. Extremely helpful- you can tell she wants her students to do well. Highly recommend her!!!!!!!!

Professor Eric was undoubtedly the greatest person alive on the Ohio State campus. Between teaching his students, tripping on acid in large empty fields surrounded only by dead horses, and trying single-handedly to overthrow Bush's campaign to get re-elected, i learned a lot from this guy. Thanks Professor Eric!
Eric is probably my favorite instructor that I've had so far.

He is definately a tough grader, but if you make an effort to meet with him for help it is a very beneficial class.  He takes interest when his students take interest, so if you do the assignments and take his class seriously you will do fine.  I learned a lot from his class!
he helped me whenever i asked him to.
You get out what you put in. He is there for people who make the effort and I find him to be clear in his instruction, but then I LISTEN.
He is a very hard grader and is not clear about what he wants for the final draft.  He is also not available when he says he will be.  On his priority list, students definitely come last.

Hands down the best professor I've had at Ohio State. Didn't just push me to be a better writer, but encouraged me to take more of an interest in the subject. I'm now developing the final paper I wrote for this class into my thesis. So disappointed that he's left OSU.

Awesome class! Rhetoric of pop music... totally interesting and Aaron never lost the class's attention for a second. Knew what he was talking about. Great guy and definitely the best TA to get for this course.

Political rhetoric, whatever the hell that is! good guy, kept things interesting, made me a better writer. Hard to figure out what he wants, but is actually a really easy grader. Once you figure it out, the class is cake w/ very few assignments.
awesome guy...easy grader...helpful...sooooo hot!
very easy class, good instructor

She is now teaching at FSU in Tallahassee, and I agree with what is said here. She is a great teacher and easy to relate to. She can come off as slightly abrasive, so really getting to know her isn't very easy. Easy to talk to, fun, interesting, overall good class.
Likes to teach. She's very nice and can be pretty funny. Really cute, too
Very nice, she's also a cutie.

She's very kind, and makes some funny jokes.  She is young and can relate to students easily.  Also, she is very good at what she does.  Take her advice on papers because it will truly make you a better writer.  Only one problem--she tends to make her classes work a little harder than the other 110 classes.
Participate, participate, participate and the class will be a great experience.
She's awesome. Just complete the assignments, and you'll do fine.
So helpful.  Great and engaging class.  She actually knows who we are in class - it was a nice change.

She assigns a lot of reading and wants a lot of in-class discussion. I felt that though the readings were relevant to the class, some were much too dry and dense. There are quite a few writing assignments and she provides prompt and thorough feedback on your writing. She's pretty good about responding to emails too.
her grading scale will kill any and all of your papers and assignments, but you can get away with not reading the books assigned. dont even bother buying half the books, its a waste of money.

Dr. O'Leary was the best professor I've had all four years of college.  She is excellent at guiding discussion without being overbearing with her own opinions, and she knows how to make Renaissance lit interesting to a modern audience.  She's also really funny, a fair grader, and an interesting person.  I wish she had stayed at OSU!

I had her for 3 different courses this year and she is the epitome of what an instructor should be: helpful, clear in directions, comical, maintains a good rapport, fair, yet critical grader, and someone who truly enjoys teaching. The best compliment I can give is that I feel as if Ohio State has lost one of its best professors to Xavier ...

She was the best professor that I had in the English Department. I wish i could have had her for more classes. She was very knowledgeable about Shakespeare and made the class very excited about it as well
Insightful and brilliant.  Best class I took this semester, possibly in college thus far.  Challenging and thought-provoking.  Do all the reading because she gives pop quizzes.

I am an international 3.9 student.Before I take this class, I really worried about it. Because English writing seems difficult to me. If I could not get an A, I think that will be fine, because I have enjoyed the class and the course is not as difficult as I thought. Nice teacher and helpful!
attendence required and you have to read the book. laid back in class tho and helpful. shows different things to make class interesting.
Very disorganized, came late to every class and didn't teach anything, just had the class do all the talking. I didn't pay thousands of dollars for professors like him.
interesting material. weird guy. easy class.
A really great prof, sometimes he gets off track and gets confused but is very helpful and uses texts that help to raise very interesting questions.  Oh, and he has amazing blue eyes!

he knew how to make class fun and it was a really relaxed atmosphere. his grading is very fair but is also very willing to extend deadlines if need be. has a sense of humor and let the class lead discussion most days. you dont have to buy text books but you do have to prints the readings off carmen. plus hes beautiful

Pat is the bomb! We read cool stories, he's fun to talk to, he's encouraging, he's CUTE!, he's laid back, he is not too uptight when it comes to sticking to the syllabus. He just kind of went with the flow which was especially helpful at first since most of the class didn't seem to know what to think of the material (Ishmael reed, don delillo&more!

Ok this guy was nice and didnt grade too hard but everything was very very disorganized!!! He did not know how to explain things well but did his best. You wont fail if you take this class, but if your the type of person who likes to know when things are due ahead of time you might wanna avoid him. Everything you read is online, no textbook!!!!

While a syllabus was provided with a warning of subjectivity to change, no agenda was ever used during class, and assignments due dates were frequently changed. awesome TA. we just kind of hung out in class and talked with him. cute, witty, smart, cool and helpful. fair grader. AND he brought us donuts one day! you definitely want pat carr as your teacher!!!
cool dude

Damn sexy.
Awesome prof...and sexy!
Good class...enjoyable for the most part...he always makes the class interesting and he's funny to look at (in a good way)
Ditto on above --smart and hot. And a good dresser!! Too bad he left UT... one the best film profs!
He doesn't mess around... never took attendance, but you paid for it when you skipped lecture. Very fair, though... And he loves cinema, and that comes through. And he's HOT!

I had this class early in the morning, and it was hard to stay awake... and he gets really mad if you sleep, which is understandable I guess.  I thought there was A LOT of work for a hundred level class.  I heard the other 110 classes were not nearly as hard...  He really emphasizes a lot of class participation.
This class is hard:( But he does have you turn in rough drafts and then you revisions that are sometimes helpful

Runs his class kind of strict, but he's actually a cool guy if you talk to him (office hours). He knows stuff about everything. I had a whole conversation with him about goth music (our class was on gothic), and he doesn't look like he'd know his goth music.
Challenges you to do your best.  Although I hated the class, he told me that my writing during the quarter improved.  He is very tough but fair.
Tough, but effective. I learned a lot. A good teacher for those who want to improve writing.
He is really nice and really knowledgeable. He tries to make things fun as well, which is nice.
Great teacher. Very helpful. I loved this class. It was very interesting. The teacher was great at stirring interesting dialogue.

He is an extremely nice guy. I'm not going to criticize him as a teacher, but shakespeare isnt my specialty. The only reason why im struggling in the class is b/c i have a hard time staying focused on a specific subject for a whole quarter. In my opinion shakespeare is very boring. great teacher very helpful, if you ever need a lit credit i would take him.

One of the best!

Wonderful professor!  She has a great passion for her field and you can see it through her enthusiasm.     I'd recommend her to anyone.  As long as you come to class and participate you should be just fine!

I really enjoyed what we read in class, but the technical aspects of the class were frustrating. I had been scared away from all my poetry classes previous to taking Merrin's. Nice. Genuinely cares about all of her students and truly loves to teach. Unbelievably knowledgeable about poetry, pick her brain if you have the chance. She is a stickler on attendance, so show up. She wasn't terribly difficult, but her reachability was awful.
